Best Sushi place in this area. Without a doubt.I have had one bad experience of food poisoning but that's a risk you take when you decide to eat something raw.

We wanted to get some sashimi to celebrate my wife's promotion, and since we were going to be in the area anyway for some errands, figured we'd stop by here!Started out with the beef and broccoli to help fill us up a bit, as with our paleo diet, no rice with our sushi makes it hard to feel full... and it's pricey to keep eating more sashimi.Beef Broccoli: Â Nice sauce, good flavor, very tender beef, and well crafted overall. Â Not an overabundance of food, but just right if you get it with the rice.Sashimi Deluxe (x2): Â Three pieces of tuna, salmon, super white tuna, snapper, halibut, and two pieces of yellowtail. Â This is going to be hard to explain... all the fish were not fishy (as in spoiled or bad), but at the same time, it didn't taste fishy enough (it lacked the correct flavor). Â If you've ever tasted truly fresh salmon or tuna, you'll know that while it doesn't smelly or taste bad, there's definitely a certain flavor to the fish... and it was missing in all of them except the yellowtail, and the super white tuna. Â My best guess? Â The other fish were frozen for too long of a period and the flavor was lost in the defrosting process...Verdict: Â It's a nice place, excellent friendly service, and the sashimi is A-OK overall. Â Yellowtail and super white tuna stand out as good, but the others just lacked the flavor with true fresh fish. Â Since it's not that close to us, we won't likely be back, but it's worth checking out if you're in need of a sushi fix and you're in the area!

I completely recommend Kyoto Sushi if you're in the area and jonesing for good sushi. Â It's part of a strip mall so it's easy to overlook, but trust me when I say it's a hidden gem.Came by here on a whim around 11:30 am on a Saturday just as they opened. Â They were vacuuming and still getting prepared so I felt a bit awkward but I was too hungry and in the mood for sushi to care about the ambiance upon entering. Â We were the only customers there of course so we were cared for and served promptly. Â I'm assuming it's a lot nicer at night for dinner. Â I ordered calamari and tempura for an appetizer, or at least I thought I did but when we got it I found tempura calamari. Â It was a cute mistake and it ended up not being half bad so I didn't mind, haha.We ordered three chef special rolls: Â Pink Lady, Spider Roll, and Spicy Girl. Â Every single one was delicious. Â All three of the dishes were also very filling. Â My mom and I couldn't finish everything off. Â Sadly, we didn't have enough space for dessert so I can't comment about that but I definitely will when we come back for dinner sometime because the fried bananas sound great. Â I also eyed their drink list and some of the sake and wines sound yummy too. Â I think I've found a new go-to sushi restaurant. Â We used to go to Dao if we wanted a sushi fix since it's so close by, but this place has quality food for a considerably lower price.

My boyfriend took me here this weekend after shopping in Oak Brook. He had been here before and said that the food was good. I trust him so I agreed to his suggestion -- I am usually leery of sushi spots in the suburbs for some reason. Â I guess I always assume they don't have a quick turnover rate.The server was super friendly and quite attentive...but then again the restaurant was literally empty.The spicy hamachi roll had tempura crumbs in it and was slightly fishy tasting. Â The shrimp tempura roll was tasty, as was the tuna + avocado roll. Edamame and miso were standard.The prices are very fair!I am always happy to know there are sushi places in the suburbs that I am not afraid to patronize. Â I would definitely come back to Kyoto!

First time going here and it was okay. The only thing I actually recommend is the strawberry mochi ice cream, it was rly good. Their egg drop soup was overcooked and kinda salty. The shrimp fried rice was cooked well but also just salty, couldn't taste anything but the salt. The lobster tempura roll is okay.

Visiting family in Chicago and craving sushi so decided to come by here. It was quiet, ambiance was romantic so I imagine it would be a good place to have a date. We were a group of 4 and seated pretty quickly. The restaurant was not very busy so I was wary if my fellow yelpers steered me wrong. We ordered the hot sexy mama, pink lady, yellowtail & jalapeÃ±o, and yellowtail nigiri. All were good, I've had better in Vegas but for the suburbs of Chicago - not bad. Prices were a little pricey (specialty rolls are $11+). Overall, good place but if I were in the area I would come back. Would I go out of my way to get there? Probably not. Worth a try.

Super-delicious, super-close and reasonably priced -- hooray for sushi!The fabulous Ms Aimee M met me here for a sushi expedition and I am pleased to say it was a success.Service was attentive and friendly, the food was fresh and delightful, and the atmosphere is cozy and comfortable.We ordered:- edamame- 2 super white tuna, 2 red snapper- California roll- Mexican roll (tuna, salmon, avocado, jalapeno, fish egg & cilantro with hot mayo)- Spicy Girl roll (tempura shrimp & cucumber topped with spicy tuna & tempura)- a glass each of sake- tempura fried red bean ice creamLotta food, right? And yet, it did not empty my wallet! It was pretty much all delicious -- the Mexican roll was probably the most out-of-the-ordinary and had great flavors, but even the California roll managed to be special. Â The white tuna completely melted in my mouth, and the snapper tasted like... the ocean. Not "fishy," just fresh and with a subtle but distinct taste.Aimee and I have yet more sushi frontiers to explore, but if anyone wants to take me to Kyoto... I'd be thrilled to go back.

I've driven past Kyoto a zillion times and finally decided to give it a go. I am happy to report that Kyoto delivers some solid sushi and am kicking myself for not trying it long ago.You might have driven past this sushi bar also and just never noticed it. It's tucked away in a strip mall next to Best Buy. This unassuming little restaurant offers up some tasty and quite affordable sushi. The menu is also not full of rolls smothered in some mayo-y type sauce of stuffed with cream cheese. Yea!We rolled in on a Friday night around 8:30 and had our pick of the tables. Maybe we missed the dinner rush or maybe this place is still somewhat under the radar. We browsed the menu and ordered up four pieces (two toro, 2 white tuna) and a handful of rolls (spicy tuna, catepillar, flaming snow, crazy).Everything we had was Â pretty good. My favs were the crazy roll and the spicy tuna (always a solid choice in my book). The pieces were fresh and the presentation on everything was quite nice. The place was not exactly hopping so no complaints as far as service went. I will definitely dine at Kyoto again.

If you're here before 9:30pm, you'll get a table. Bartenders are friendly and attentive. Patrons are friendly enough. Most that wind up on the dance floor are hilarious to watch. The dance floor is not nearly as crowded as the Features side and in my opinion, they play better music. Last time my husband and I went, we sat, had a drink and people watched and chatted for 2 hours and had a great time.

Club Mamalu is kind of the like the red headed step child of the Features-Frankie's Blue Room-Club Mamalu trifecta. It's where folks go when the line to Features is too long, or when they want to grab an empty table. I feel like Club Mamalu has the potential to be a cool swanky spot, but the mood is kind of killed with the TVs, lack of seating (since they got rid of the booths), and overpriced drinks.That being said, there are definitely some pros which is why they are A-OK in my book.PROS:- Live music on Friday nights!- Super chill atmosphere where you can be guaranteed a seat if you get there before 9:30.- Friendly service.- No cover, even when there is a band.- Decent food (same as Features).ADDITIONAL CONS:- $8 for a small vodka tonic.- Typically hosts an older crowd.Moral of the story... go for the live music! Or if you want to stay out of the cold :)

The line for Features was way too long, so instead we came here. Kinda funny because they are two seperate bars, but once inside you can go in and out of either place. So skip the line at Features and just come here instead...mucho quicker!! The service was meh...the bartender uses the jigger to measure out any hard liquor and makes sures to fill your cup oh with about 90 percent mixer...so don't waste your money. I thought it was strange that one bottle of bud light cost about 4 bucks, but if you get the 40oz its the same price.The music was meh as well...it didn't pick up till the end of the night. The plus side is there is ample seating. The down side it was sweltering in there! The last time I was in a bar that hot and sweaty with hardly any people ...oh wait never!! Couldn't they just turn on the A/C???Over all conclusion....not worth the money. If you do go, stick to the Features side.

I want to love this place. I just feel that the owners of the 3 bars put the least amount of effort in this one. This place should be on its own and given the attention it deserves. Usually people will go through here to get into Features because people don't want to wait in Feature's line. An older crowd tends to hang out here because of the 80s and 90s music. I love that music and they have a great playlist when I go through. It isn't as loud as Features, so you can actually talk to one another here too. The only problem I see with this place is how small it is. It can be difficult to walk through when people are crowding the bar. Not only that but the dance floor is a bit small and cluttered by the walkway to the bathroom and the door to get into Features. If they had a bigger location I feel this place would be a lot more popular and visited.

I've been to Club Mamalu a few times mostly because of Features being too crowded. It's own by the same people as Features so not only do they have the same drink specials and pricing and the same staff, but you can go between Club Mamalu and Features as much as you want all night long. The music in here is different that the club like music you tend to hear in Features which is nice. You tend to get more oldies in here. As inside of Features the drinks are good and the price is right. Club mamalu is usually less crowded than features and has more places to sit which is nice as well. Overall if your a fan of the Downtown Naperville scene you could do a lot worse than Club Mamlu and Features.

I had a really great time here. Â It's so rare that I get to go to a bar that plays such fun '80s and '90s music. Â We didn't drink - except for a round of overpriced shots - we just danced for hours. Â The crowd was a little older in the '80s side of the bar, maybe people in their 30s and 40s. Â It was perfect for a girl's night out, when all you want to do is dance awkwardly to great old music.

It's been awhile sense I've been here. I used to go here to see The Michael Heaton Band. Now, I just usually see him play solo at O'Brien's in Batavia. It's a small place and the drinks are a little pricey but that's Naperville. The suburban bars with Chicago City prices. Mainly it's a fun place to see a band and kick back.

I recently moved to Lockport with my girlfriend and heard amazing things about Godfathers. Decided to give it a try and HOLY CRAP. This place blows all other sandwich places out of the water. Got the Lieutenant and was amazed at not only the quality of meat and bread that they used but also at how delicious it was. They don't use mayo and mustard like other sandwich places and honestly I don't think it needed any of that anyway. Just meat, cheese, lettuce, tomato and a little oil to top it all off. If you're looking for a great sub at a reasonable price you should go in and try them out. I promise you won't regret it. Customer for life.

We ordered pizza on special buy one get one half off and the beef and cheese. Â The pizza was okay but i found the crust really tasteless. Â The sauce and cheese were just average. Â I would order again for the value but I would not go out of my way to get this pizza. Â The beef was terrible it was small bland and hardly any cheese. Â We tried it after reading a great review on it. Â Maybe this was an off day but our beef was terrible. Â The sub sandwiches and calzones looked really good here. Â I may try that next time.

Just had the best beef sandwich ever! Juicy, overflowing with meat and perfectly melted cheese....definitely the best in town. Always forget about this place when picking up lunch but after that beef sandwich....I will not forget!

I really really like this place, Â so this review is based off my experience today. Â The service I had was completely bs. Â I usually pick up my food, but today I needed it delivered (which won't happen again), I call and get "Godfathers, hold on," and she sets the phone on the counter for 5 minutes until I hang up. Â I call back at least three times and get the voicemail. Â Wait about 20 minutes and finally she answers with the same crappy attitude. Â My one sandwich gets here and my total comes to 8$ and some change, Â I give the guy a 20$ and ask for 8$ back which is extremely generous since the place is less than 5 blocks from my house. Â And he responds with I only have 6$. Â Who delivers and doesn't keep change? Â I just paid 14$ for an 8 inch sandwich. Â And the sandwich was good, just not 14$ good.
Love this place, but they took out the the fountain soda. I miss it. The service is fast and they are always nice. Give them a tip when they prepare your food. They deserve it.

An old gas station converted in a great little Godfather themed sandwich shop. I've been back many times. I definitely recommend trying the meatball, the American, and the underboss. All great sandwiches. I'm giving 4 stars because the pizza is bland, and while my wife digs their french fries, they are not my favorite.

Stopped in for the first time today after passing by many times. So happy we did! Don't let the facade fool you! Great meatball and lieutenant sandwiches! Love that it is a small family owned business we need more of these and less chain restaurants around here!

This place could be great, but there are some things that just aren't on point like it needs to be in the food industry. Â My garlic bread I got with my dish was burnt one time. Â Another time I asked for pizza by the slice and they went to warm it up and left it in too long and burnt the crust. Â The pizza sauce and the subs are pretty solid, but the lack of a little TLC for your orders is enough to make me go to Mangia much more often.
Good Calzone. They need to open past 9pm on a Saturday night, come on guys 9pm on a Saturday. Really?

Fantastic.I came here expecting 8 Heads in a Duffel Bag Joe Pesci and got Casino De Niro. Â I mean wow, just blown away. Â You wouldn't think that this unassuming place (which despite their good effort still looks like a gas station) would have one of the best Italian subs this Yelper has had in quite some time.I had the underboss, and it did not disappoint. Â The sandwich was as perfectly crafted as the Sistine Chapel with the perfect ratio of meat to cheese to toppings to oil to I'm salivating now just thinking about it. Â There were a minimum of six other sandwiches that I NEED to try and a few others that caught my interest. Â They have hot sandwiches too, not just the awesome deli ones.There are also some good looking sides/salads. Â I had a broccoli pasta salad that was simple yet tasty. Â But there were a couple others that looked just as good.There were a couple cannolis there, but literally a couple. Â Two wrapped together in plastic wrap. Â I didn't get one, but if they have better packaging next time I'm there I won't be stopped.The only thing to note of this place is that you have to pull into the right side of the building when you pull into the parking lot. Â You can't park in from and they don't have it blocked off. Â Depending on the time of day it can be a pain to pull around to the other , Proper, side of the building as you can't pull through. Â But that is a minor complaint once you get this food in your face.
Great sandwiches. Pizza is decent. Staff isn't that friendly but worth dealing with for the sandwiches

The subs are great because the meat is fresh and bread is great. The staff is super friendly and I love the family owned atmosphere. Small little place but big sized sandwiches at awesome price!You have me as long as I live in Lockport!

Had the Chicken Parmigian and my husband had a italian beef. Â If you are looking for food that lacks flavor this is the place to be. Â My plate was a fried piece of chicken drowned in tomatoe sauce from a can. Â The beef was nothing to go back for either.
Everything I had has been good so far. Call ahead because most of the stuff is made from scratch

Pie is good. Calzone good. Service is sub par, call in order for delivery, say delivery guy not show. Ok I'll pick it up.get there one guy cookin two people doin nothin delivery van parked outside. Ur service is crap. Anytime I go in there people workin want to be somewhere else. Put on gameface its not that hard. Get off ur ass stop reading an facebooking an do ur job. I dont think the owner knos whats goin on. Spend some time in ur restaurant fix whats wrong kick ur workers in the ass. This place has been sliding downhill.

Sandwiches are much better than stefannelis up the road, but service is awful. They rarely answer the phone, are often handling Uhaul transactions while you wait, and aren't always there when their schedule says they are. Like right now. Sign says open but no one is home. Could be doing way better if they'd commit. Sauce is a sour marinara, tastes from a can but meatballs are good.

The pizza is great. Nice and thin and a robust flavor to the sauce. They do not skimp on the cheese. The pepperoni is super thin and sausage is extremely flavorful. Sausage sandwiches are the same, home made, just like the big meatballs. Most dissapointing garlic bread from an Italian joint. And the pasta is from a box or bag, but the pizza and meat products are where it's at. The salad is just with ice berg so its blah, but their house dressing is good. I have not tried the cold subs, but I definately will eventually.

Been here many times they have never disappointed me. My son loves the huge calzone's, I love the chicken parm and the breaded steak sandwiches. Favorite sub is the Godfather and the Pepper and Egg sandwich is pretty dang good too. I remember when this place was called Genco Deli or something like that, must be the same owners because the menu didn't change much after the name change. Also had the mostaccoli dinner which was very good and an amazing value for only $20, it was enough food for at least 6 people, came with meatballs and salad and bread. Give this place a try if you're ever in Lockport on Rt. 171, you won't be disappointed.

Went there for a quick bit and was surprised at the quality of the food and the sauce! Â Had the pork tenderloin sandwich, chicken parmigiana sandwich and a slice of pizza. Â I would say the prices for the sandwiches were great and the taste was beyond good for the lockport/lemont/new lenox area. Â The pizza slice was large and good tasting too, but I thought that was a little over-priced.We are all definitively going back. Â There is an area to eat in there with a tv to watch, but we carried out.

I have been here half a dozen times and I get the same thing every time. A roast beef and giardiniera calzone with garlic. It is awesome, the best calzone I have ever had. The deli sandwiches look really good and I will try them some time. The restaurant is a little bit out of the way but it is worth the trip.
I had lunch brought to me from this place. I had The Underboss sub. All I have to say is Holy Shit was it amazing. I will be back. This is the shortest review I've ever made!!

Wow! I love this place ! Best combo ever! I eat this every time I come though town. I have been getting the same combo for years very consistent. The staff is always very friendly. I highly recommend this place.

Love this place. The sandwiches are amazing and Gina is super nice the whole crew in fact are awesome. Always delicious food. I have yet to try something I didn't like. They will make just about anything for u. Love the prosciutto and roast beef subs.
Great food. Â I couldn't decide so I ordered a six inch Italian beef and a six inch under father. Â Both excellent . Â Gina was friendly too!
Food is awesome, price is right & the selection vast. Best food in Lockport.

Sorry, but I don't get it. This place is a joke, & the food is just horrible. What's with the name? Wasn't it called something else? Anyway my stomach still hurts, & that was 2 weeks ago. Give it up, capiche!
I still keep coming here and I am still addicted! Â I also tried the Italian grilled cheese and loved it! Â Still need to try the pizza!

This place seems to be kinda off the beaten path for me so I tend to forget that they are in town. The pizza itself is good, but just doesn't stand out enough to visit just for that. The menu, and website both say that they deliver, however since they've been open I've called for delivery at least 4 different times months apart and have been told every time that they are not delivering. If they did deliver we'd probably order the pizza more often. I have to say I'm not sure if that is still the case since I no longer even attempt to place a delivery order. The subs are the real winner here. They are always fresh, amazing, and authentic. Definitely the best I've had. The subs themselves are worth the visit. The prices are very decent especially considering the portions are huge.

Their website needs to be a little bit more up to date but this is hands down the best place to get a bite to eat in Lockport. Servings are generous, the food quality is very high, and the owners are just down to earth nice people.
The food is alright - just make sure you call before you stop by. I've driven there more than once to discover it's closed on the middle of a Sunday or something.

Just ate at this wonderful sushi joint located inside of the HMart. Â My girlfriend and I split a Caterpillar and a Dragon Crunch roll. Â The price was perfectly reasonable, and the food was delicious. Â They even gave us some consume soup that was divine! Â My only regret is not finding this place until the week before we move to Colorado. Â Next time we visit family, I am totally stopping back to try some Ramen!

The owners are really kind here. I order sushi all the time and it is extremely fresh. I also recommend the sashimi salad. The owners are extremely kind and bring the food right to your table.. Service is always quick.. My mom loves the chicken/beef teriyaki for $895 and the chicken katsu.

Wow , I am a sushi fan big time and as far as i concerned having inexpensive lunch in a food court with a very fresh ingredients is a 5 star award for food court restaurant .. This is not a fancy place but it never meant to be . so 5 stars for a lunch option in this neighbourhood ..
I ate sushi here and got horrible diarrhea. I think not. Nasty af.

Yes, it's the food court in H-Mart so I didn't expect too much from there. Just for a quick bite in between weekend errands. However, I didn't expect they'd serve instant noodle either. Being a big fan of Japanese ramen, I was excited to see they had ramen special. I asked what's in the dish and was told some veggies, fish cake, and dumplings. They no longer offer the egg in the soup (which was in the picture on the wall) because of some "allergy issue". Asked what flavor base and was answered beef. All sounded okay. But when the noodle arrived, it's easy to tell from the look and smell that it's instant noodle. Surly it was, after a bite and a sip of the soup. Two mini dumplings were the frozen type you could buy from H-Mart.My kid got the teriyaki chicken bento box. Chicken was on the tough side. Two fried dumplings were the same kind in my noodle soup. Sushi was not fresh. Even the pickled ginger was not as crunchy as it's supposed to be.So disappointed. Basically the same disappointment from a few times I tried H-Mart food court at its different store locations. Wish H-Mart could have better food court choices like Mitsuwa.

A little overpriced for the amount of food and this is comparing to the sushi I used to get at the H-Mart in Niles (which should be a fair comparison). Â I paid $7.99 plus tax for a combo of california and spicy tuna maki but it was only about 10 pieces total. Â I was still hungry after I ate it. However, everything was very fresh and hand-rolled upon me placing my order, so that was nice. I will probably not go out of my way for this again though.

I know.... I know.... It's kinda dirty. It's in a food court. A food court in a smelly grocery store. I can't help myself though. As much as I try, I can't help but like their yaki soba. I'll order the sushi if I'm craving it, but it's pretty mediocre. --This is a food court after all. My kids love coming here. They're the ones who drag me here. First we eat and then we buy our stash of gummies and kaki no tane Â . --it's as good as it gets for an 8 yr old. ;)

I got the chicken teriyaki bento box. chicken was a bit on the dry side but still edible. Tasted like it was drowning in the teriyaki sauce. The nigiri was great and I couldn't get enough of it. The rice was also good along with the California rolls. The meal also came with a small cup of miso soup. it was around 9 dollars and I would say it was worth the price due to the fact I was full until dinner time.

I didn't set my expectations very high for Sushihana since it's in the food court and everything.. I've gotta say, it's not bad! I actually liked the caterpillar roll and I tasted the teriyaki chicken which turned to be okay as well. The miso soup was tasteless. The roll would fall apart every now and then but it wasn't bothersome.For a quick bite, this place is pretty good.
The food is amazing. The sushi is really good especially the Captain Crunch roll. And the owner is really nice and the price is affordable.

Oh Super H-Mart food court, so dirty yet so pretty good.Sushihana is the Japanese restaurant in the food court, and it's solid. I've only had the Katsu box, but it offers a great sampling and even the kids like it! For 9 bones, I get a California roll, two pieces of katsu chicken, some rice, some miso soup, some coleslaw kinda stuff, and two itty bitty baby fried potsticker-type thingies.Before you ask....YES, I am very goodly schooled in Japanese cuisine.The biggest drawback is, of course, the fact that you have to eat it there. That place is gross and dirty, but suck it up. The thingies are worth it.

I didn't expect can get nice Japanese foods in food court but the quality is really better than expectations. Ordered Teriyaki Bento (Salmon) come with 5 pcs of sushi & a bot of water price is about 12 dollars. Really worth it!

My family had the seafood udon. The soup is clear with a prawn, sliced seafood, and clam for a little under $10. Value wise, it is slightly high but very delicious. This place is part of the Korean, Japanese, Chinese restaurants square in H Mart. I recommend you come try this place before going around others if you crave a light healthy meal. Enjoy!
This is a great little quick grab a bite spot at the market food court, but the sushi is good, the boxes are ok too... and the people are very nice.
While waiting 45 minutes for Kimchihana, we ordered sushi from Sushihana. The food was good quality and service was quick. I would recommend trying.

I was doing some grocery shopping and decided to grab a meal at the food court. Â I've eaten at the HMart food court places (Korean, Chinese) Â a few times and today was the first time eating at the Japanese joint, Sushihana.Since, I wasn't fine dining at a reputable Sushi restaurant, I wasn't too up or down in my expectation, but overall, I was pleased to walk away with some raw fish craving for $8.95. Â Not bad at all.I ordered a Japanese-Korean dish called Hwedubbob (Korean Chirashi), which rice topped with fresh greens, sliced Asian pears, fish eggs, generous portions of sashimi, and red spicy sauced called gochoojang. Â I was surprised to receive such a big portion for this price and the dish was quite tasty (see pic).I would recommend Sushihana for grabbing a quick meal or taking out a meal to go after your shopping at HMart!

Since my usual hwe dub bap place is under new management and doesn't serve it anymore. I decided to try this place. It's not bad, but I don't think it's as good as the asia supermarket sushi place. I'm probably bias towards it though since I went there for years.As for the food, the fish is pretty good, and the portion size is pretty big for me. There isn't as much flavor as other hwe dub bap I've had before, so I had to put a lot of the red sauce on top.

This place is good the sushi is reasonably priced nothing special but good he use to serve a slice of pineapple with his sushi as a garnish yum !!!!!!! Sushi and fresh pineapple Â the best but now no pineapple bummer !!!!! BRING BACK THE PINEAPPLE Â !!!!!!!!!!!!!Reviewed by the Naperville~ Food Dude ~
The dishes I have had are great. It's convince and perfect when you don't want to cook!

Madeleine's is located in the same place as a previous "cook-and-carry" dinner, but in my opinion, much better! Madeleine ("Mad") is an enthusiastic experienced chef and focuses on fresh ingredients. While she has a featured menu (Madwhatsfordinner.com) she also has daily specials. We tried the Turkey Cutlets and the Cabernet Beef. The Turkey Cutlets were generous portions of turkey, sweet potatoes, thin stalks of asparagus and a sauce for the cutlets ($11) The Cabernet Beef, marinated chunks of beef (tasting like sauerbraten almost!) came with barley/mushrooms and asparagus ($11). I loved this dish and my hubby loved his turkey cutlets. The dishes quickly reheat in a microwave and are packaged in compostable containers. Some may get two meals out of one dish--but I ate every bit of the Beef! Each dish comes with a dessert of three French madeleines (cookies).I would definitely recommend Madeleine's. Call ahead and order or stop in. Mad is open to suggestions and also does catering. She is definitely an asset to Lisle's food scene!
Very good food. Recipes I would never take time make for myself. And convenient!!!

Tuesday you can get a taco platter for $5.99----that's two tacos, rice and beans for $5.99.For the price, I honestly didn't expect too much. Hog dog, this food was OFF THE CHARTS fantastic!!!!!! Super fast and friendly service too. Nice interior. All-around fantastic!This place deserves more than 5 stars.It was my first time there, but I can tell you, those tacos, in my opinion, were the best I think I have EVER had!!!!!!!! Will I return? Does the sun come up every day (usually)???Try it---you will love it!

Great breakfast place! They offer free mimosas with your meal too! They have live bands at night, but I feel their breakfast is best.New update: manhattans now has giant bloody Mary's with bacon, cheese, shrimp, meats, cucumber, olive, and so much more! They are absolutely fabulous! Best Bloody Mary in the area!

Holy smokes put your stereotypes behind you and try this place. Â They have a new patio and with our weather, it gets a five star rating. Â I've lived here for over 10 years and had Never tried this place but it's definitely worth a try at least. Â The stroganoff was amazing, great salads and very good appetizers. Â Even the bathroom was very clean! Â  Stop in and check the place out. Â Awesome music lineup for the older crowd but it's an excellent place

i've had pretty good meals at manhattan's, but yesterday's was over the top. their chicken scallopini is absolutely the best i've ever had, and i've had a lot of it in my life. i will never order anything else there. To Die For.

My friend and I took a quick lunch break at Manhattan on a random Wednesday. We came in around noon and it was not that packed. We got seated right away and was told about the lunch specials. There are two menus for the lunch specials: one that changes and is around $8-10 and the other one is in the back of the main menu and it was $6.99.I got the pulled pork sandwich with fries while my friend got the veggie quesdilla. While waiting for food, the waitress brought out two rolls for us to munch on. I enjoyed my pulled pork sandwich and was really stuffed and couldn't finish my food. My friend enjoyed her quesadilla, too.Overall, great service, and decent pricing. Nice little restaurant in Wheaton for you locals to check out.

Sat outside last night on a beautiful evening. Server was super attentive, food was great, prices were very reasonable. I noticed they had a really well thought out senior menu too ( for my dad). When we left the band was jamming and several couples were dancing the night away!!Looking forward to going back!

Well, it's been awhile, but I did go back with my husband recently to catch his friends' band. Our waitress, Danielle, could have been better, though. I told her twice I just wanted water to drink and when she brought out our food I still didn't have my water even though my husband had already been brought his beer. It didn't even dawn on her I was sitting there without anything to drink until my husband brought it to her attention!Every time she stopped by she was in a huge hurry to leave even though we saw her chatting it up with at least one other table. We still tipped her 15% because we aren't monsters, but we usually tip 20%. If I didn't know better, I'd say she didn't like us (or at least me since she seemed quick to bring whatever my husband wanted). I just got this hostile vibe from her.In any case, the food was ok (I had the Door County Melt and my husband had a burger) so we'd probably come back, but I really hope we don't get Danielle!

This was my first time back in about six years due to poor service the previous time. I have to say, I am thrilled I came back because it was such a delight! The outdoor patio has the most comfortable chairs and it's a good sized area so you don't feel cramped. Our waitress, Karen, is what really made our experience so wonderful! She was so pleasant to talk to and very caring about our experience! I ordered the ribeye steak, medium rare, and unfortunately it came out medium and when I asked Karen about it she immediately took it back and had a brand new, medium rare steak, within ten minutes back to me. I cannot recommend Manhattan's and, even more so, Karen to others! Thank you Karen for a great experience and we cannot wait to come back!

The food was okay. The best part of the experience was the waitress--she was amazing. The food, however, was so-so...nothing great. I probably won't go back. I ordered the fried shrimp and it just didn't taste right---they tasted raw. My mother in law ordered their soup of the day which I believe was beef vegetable and she sent it back because it did not have any flavor---she also ordered the beef stroganoff and said it did not have any flavor. My girlfriend had ordered the salmon pesto and she loved it!If I do return it would probably be to sit out on their patio. The waitress said it is very nice out there to relax and have some drinks.
Manhattans always great food & atmosphere. Â Sat at the new beautiful outdoor patio tonight!

What a wonderful meal. We had been here about 6 years ago and had a bad service experience and Â am just back for the first time. Our steaks were outstanding and the only thing that was better than that was our waitress Karen. So friendly and accommodating. We will be coming back again and requesting Karen for sure!

Ask for Sue when you dine here, she provided us with fast, friendly & excellent service! I l had a good breakfast today, a ham (off the bone) & cheddar cheese omelette with fresh cut hash browns & rye toast. My measure for a restaurant is, would I dine here again. The answer is Yes.

Extremely limited vegetarian menu - you can get the nachos, spinach artichoke dip, or the vegetable pasta (with oil or with marinara). Â The egg/pepper sandwich on their on-line menu doesn't appear on the actual menu.That said, they were extremely accommodating, and there are items you can modify (chicken/portabella panini, hold the chicken, etc.) to easily come up with a couple of other vegetarian options. Â I ordered the nachos over a baked potato instead of over corn chips and the waitress didn't even blink. We had a group of 12-14 people with separate checks, and she was willing to combine some of them so I could use a coupon (which I hadn't mentioned when ordering), in addition to dealing with my custom nachos and wanting a larger glass for my drink (IBC and Jagermeister - what a good idea!). Â She kept everyone's water glasses filled too.The bread/butter (real butter) brought out while you wait is tasty if bland (it's white bread, nice crust); they'll bring more if you ask.I can't give them more than 3 stars because there's so little I can eat here, but they have many redeeming features, and if you like steak or pot roast, it's probably a great place.
Awesome food, friendly staff. Breakfast is my favorite thing to eat there. They make very good drinks also, would definitely recommend this restaurant to friends

I love Manhattan's. Â They have great food and bands. Â I love their burgers, salads, quesadillas, and pasta dishes. Â They also have a nice lunch menu with specials of the day. Â Very nice staff too.

4 of us just had a remarkable dinner. The prime rib was great, cook perfect. Saganaki was very good, we all left full, oh by the way, tonight may 6th the new outdoor dining area opened, very nice we enjoyed it, come see for yourself. Been going for years

Certainly acceptable food for reasonable coin.We had Shrimp de Jonghe and Chopped Steak. The portions were moderate, side of veggies and clam chowder all went together to stuff our guys, nicely.We will repeat this offense.

I don't live very far, but somehow I've only been here once. And I'm not quite sure why that hasn't changed cuz the one meal I had here was pretty amazing.Swordfish is my absolute favorite, so when I saw it on the specials I obviously had to try it. They also had paired it with a strawberry salsa-ish deal. Amazing. Plus, I still got a baked potato and some kinda rice deal. It was a lot of food!I will probably try to make a point to get out there again, and secretly hope they will have the same special even though that would mean I wouldn't try something else on their menu...

If you want homemade everything you need to go here. The salad dressing is homemade. Delicious. Mashed potatoes homemade..delicious.. Steak is way better than I expected. They have jack daniels sauce similar to TGIF and its delicious. The owner is amazing. She let my coworker and myself in the resturaunt an hour before thwy opened simply because we walked in from the cold and we were hungry. Great service. Great atmosphere. They even carry one of my favprite beer bramds LAGUNITAS. I watched the Bulls game in the dining area. Its kinda casual kinda classy.. I truly loved this place and I cant wait to try more items.

I go here with my folks for the fish fry when I am in town. I am not into fish fry but they have a wide menu. Â Had the best salad ever this past Friday and had to mention it. Â The Ellis Island Salad - no idea why it is called that. Slightly seasoned chicken chunks, a lot of fresh avocado slices, great greens and a variety of veggies. Honey mustard on the side. It was huge in a cool irregularly sided bowl. I took more than half home and the honey mustard came too in its own container. The greens held up very well the next day. Good assortment of local beers too.
Love Their fresh cut hash browns and mimosas too. Very friendly atmosphere . Huge breakfast portions too.

Mmmanhattan's is just the place to go for a tasty, moderately priced meal (the dinner specials really are!) and then enjoy some (classic oldies covers on our 2 visits) live music. The full service bar and nostalgic favorites kept everyone in the mood to dance, the only problem was finding enough room on the smallish dance floor. But, all in all a very enjoyable evening - we'll return soon.

This was probably my husband and my third visit to Manhattan's. Â We had such a great experience, I wanted to make sure that I reviewed it. Â The hostess asked if we wanted to be seated near the TVs because a football game was on. Â We said no, so we were seated in a booth up in a quieter area. Â Service was excellent. Â She was obviously an experienced server. Â Our soft drinks were delivered quickly. Â I liked the extra large size glasses. Â Even with that, our server offered to refill our drinks when our glasses were about half empty.My husband had the pot roast dinner and I had the pot roast sandwich. Â Both meals were delicious. Â I especially loved the warm bread with butter that came out with our soup and salad. Â We both left stuffed and satisfied.We don't live nearby so it will be a special trip out here but we'll come back soon.
Always excellent good food good service good prices bring the family for breakfast on a weekend you won't be disappointed

My Fiance and I eat at Manhattans at least once a month. The lighting and atmosphere in here is perfect. If you are looking for a fancy occasion, or just to go out and have a few drinks I highly recommend it. The Calamari is one of our favorite appetizers it is so good! Last time I was here I ordered the Prime Rib that was on special last Saturday the 9th. It was an amazing melt in your mouth delicious Prime Rib. Her parents also ordered the all you can Eat Ribs and the Scallops and both of those dishes were excellent too. The beer I ordered on draft was two hearted ale and it was really fresh tasting. Every time we are here the Beer is good and the food is top notch for the price you can not beat it. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking to get a good meal. If you ever get a chance to Meet Sindy the owner you will see she is a passionate business owner and really cares about her customers that eat there. Also I would recommend asking for Stefanie as a Server We have had her 2 other times while we were here Â before and she was on top of our order for us and never let us go with out a drink the Customer Service provided is one of the best you will see. This time we had another server but she also was Exceptional you really can not go wrong with service here. Even sitting at the bar you will find the Bar Tender is really friendly and outgoing.
Good food at a good price. I would HIGHLY recommend the spinach and Parmesan dip! They also have 3 slot machines for those who are feeling lucky.

Cindy,Cindy,Cindy, What have you done?--new cook? It's been Â while since my last visit but this used to be my weekly go-to place for delicious fried chicken---the only place I actually ate the skin because the batter was so tasty .What a disappointment Â last night!! ---overlooked, basically flavorless batter with a rancid oil undercurrent & dry tasteless coleslaw(again a big change from prior meals). The whole meal went in the garbage --- too far to drive back to return.JoAnna G

Bad food, bad service and dirty. Upon entering the building, there is an overwhelming odor. The building has noticeable wear and surfaces don't look clean. Service was incredibly slow and inattentive; it took nearly 10 minutes just to have our drink orders taken.

I went here because they were having a trivia night (I got my ass kicked) so the missus and I decided to eat there too. Â It's another place I really wanted to like but just couldn't. Â I like the decide and atmosphere, but the food is really lacking. Â It's not horrible, but it's so bland.I never, ever put salt on anything. This was the first place ever I had to salt my food. Â We Â had the following:Saganaki- it was the appetizer they touted as a customer favorite. Â I've had better, I've had worse.Mushroom soup- this came with my meal. It was ok. You could almost taste the thickener in it though and really bland.Chicken Marsala-my dinner. Â All in all ok, but the chicken was a little tough, and again.....bland. Â It came with frozen green beans that were fine.The missus had a pot roast sandwich. Â It was the smallest thing I ever saw, like kids menu small. Â It was dry and you guessed it, full of flavor....no I'm kidding it was bland too.All in all the bill was something like 66 bucks for 2 meals and 4 drinks (one was pop). Â Definitely not worth the price.I'm sure we'll be back for trivia and drinks since we enjoy the place, but we'll stop and eat somewhere else first.
Wow! Â Consistently excellent food and entertainment. Â  Everything I have ordered has been the best I've had anywhere. Â Come check it out.

So I only write a review when I am extremely satisfied, or extremely dissatisfied. On this instance my visit wasn't the best. Every time I have eaten here I have ordered some type of pasta, and every time i didn't end up liking the sauce. I tried the sante fe pasta on special the other night and it was too spicy for my taste.Our waitress was BEYOND SLOW. I waited a good 10 minutes before I received a to go box that I asked for. Then she proceeded to wait another 15 minutes to give us our check. She forgot my friends drink, but didn't end up charging for it since it took her so long to bring it, which was nice of her.I enjoy the atmosphere of the place and i'm sure I'll be back eventually to give it another try
Family and I went there for dinner, should of went somewhere else good was bland and was cold.

Went on a Friday to have the fish fry. Â While we were waiting for a table we had a drink at the bar. Â  I noted a few things here: both bartenders took dirty plates from customers and never washed there hands after doing so, both scooped ice using a glass!, both consistently grabbed clean classes from the inside before making someones drinks, one was eating behind the bar while making drinks!, Â and they both, after touching their hair and faces grabbed straws and fruit barehanded and put them into drinks! In the time we sat there, about 30 minutes, neither one washed their hands even once!! Â Anyone with a basic knowledge on how viruses and bacteria get transferred to customers would know this is a huge no no! Â This is a good illness outbreak waiting to happen! Â The fish fry was ok but nothing to right home about. Â Service was good. Â Overall, this place caters to the over 50 grows. Â To top it off, I found a fly in my water after drinking half of it! Gross!! We will not be coming back here!

These folks know how to make a burger. The food is priced correctly and you can eat out here without blowing the budget. Quality of the entrÃ©s varies a bit, but I have not had any bad food here. The service is good on the front end but could be tuned up a bit as the meal progresses. For example, a promise Â of bread that never materialized. Pretty mature crowd, so I fit right in!

Very friendly family owned by local Wheaton resident. Owner runs the business hands onand is on a first name basis with many customers. Food is very good value with many good specials. Lots of TV's for sports, but not a sports bar. The fried chicken special on Sundays is terrific. Staff is experienced and friendly.

Absolutely divine Apricot Chicken! The pumpkin soup was absolutely perfect, I wish I had the recipe. Husband had French onion soup and steak sandwich. Â He devoured every bit, so I think he liked it! Â  Â Friendly service, inviting atmosphere, comfortable surroundings, overall a great place! Saw many people dining alone at the bar, so you know the place had got to be comfortable and inviting! Â  Haven't been here in many years, I don't even recognize the place. Â Love the updated layout and decor. Food is definitely much better than I remember. Â The portions are huge, I had to take half of it home, including dessert. Terrific wine list, something for every budget. I'm so glad I came back! Â Will definitely return many more times and tell friends about it.

Ordered the nachos without olives. When the nachos arrived they of course had lots of olives. After informing the waitress she took the dish to the kitchen and removed the olives by hand and returned a cold plate of nachos. The rest was flavorless. We will not be returning.

We went on a Saturday during the Weekend Breakfast menu. I ordered the Dupage County Benedict (which is essentially a standard eggs benedict) and my wife ordered the Herbed Asparagus omelette. The benedict was fairly bland, with the Hollandaise sauce lacking zip. My wife liked the asparagus omelette, saying they used more asparagus than most others she's had. Plus it had cream cheese in it, which makes it a hard recipe to mess up.The beer selection is better than average, although with the popularity of craft brews these days, it's hard to find a bad beer menu. The look of the place is OK, dark, old school. There was a little bit of an odd smell to the place, not totally off-putting but odd.

I went here for lunch on a weekday afternoon. There were a good amount of people here as well, but that didn't affect service.Ordered a burger and a turkey reuben. Both were very good! Lunchtime service was under 10 mins. Host and waitress were very attentive to drinks and such.The decor inside seemed to be relatively new. I am definitely going to go back and try something new. They have a ton of specials and it seems on the sign outside that they always have some sort of event/all you can eat going on (Not good for the nation's obesity crisis, but oh well...)It's a decent option in the area compared to the full out grease fest you get at VT across the street and the butter burgers next door.

This was my 3rd attempt at this place for dinner. Â The last 2 times were so-so with food and experience. Â A lot of people I know really seem to enjoy this place, and I still haven't seen why. Â So, this LAST time (because I will never return again), my best friend and I decided to give it one more shot. Â Though we were seated promptly, it took about 4 minutes for someone to even come and greet us at the table. Â After we got our "greeting",( which she never said Hello, or what her name was..), we decided to order some martini's. Â *sidenote-we were sitting in the bar area* Â It then took and I kid you not, 10 MIN to receive our drinks. Â TEN MINUTES!! Â There was only one other booth filled besides us and 2 gentlemen at the bar. Â I think the bartender was too concerned to eat his dinner then to tend to his guests. Â Finally receiving our drinks, we put our food order in. Â I ordered a filet cooked medium plus, and a garden salad. Â My friend ordered a chicken wrap and a cup of soup. Â Pretty simple right? Â WRONG!! Â It took ANOTHER 10 MINUTES to get our soup and salad, and when the soup was delivered, there was some dried food on the spoon. Â Now, our waitress didn't stop back to check on us, so I took it among myself to ask the "oh so busy" bartender for a new spoon. Â  Of course no apology or anything, just plopped the new spoon on the table and I said politely "thank you so much", which he proceeded to roll his eyes and walk away. Â Now I have my timer on my phone going ( I forgot to mention that earlier), so these times are NOT exaggerated, I restarted my timer after we got our soup and salad. Â The time it took to receive our entree...Ready for this...25MIN!! Â At this point we are so angry, we didn't even want to eat, but our bellies were rumbling because we have now been sitting here for about an hour! Â Now, of course my filet came out wrong, had to have it re-fired, and the waitress told me the horseradish sauce was my sour cream for the potato, but you know, minor details. Â UGH. Â I will never understand why everyone loves this place so much. Â I don't get it. Â So, unless you are over 50 and look like you have money, you might get treated with respect. Â If you are in your 30s trying to enjoy a nice dinner, I might recommend Outback or Olive Garden.

Manhattan's is one of our favorite places to go that has a relaxed atmosphere for Sunday breakfast or a weekend night for dinner and dancing. The food isn't exceptional, but it's good and the service has always been warm and friendly. My only suggestion is to add more healthy friendly items to the menu to accommodate those on special diets. Sugar-free syrup would be great!

My sisters had salad and loved them, my other sister has the catfish and loved it, I had the chicken-fried steak and was very disappointed. Very thin, dry and tasteless. The corn was over cooked and the mashed potatoes were just plain. They did honor the 10% yelp coupon though!

Saturday afternoon while driving around we decided to try this place. Overall it was average. We tried the wings, BLT, fries, and onion rings. Wings bad. Didn't bother to finish the last 2 wings. BLT very good. Fries (steak fries) and onion rings and were good.Like I mentioned, it was average. We didn't leave thinking "I really wished we went somewhere else" or on the flip side "We are coming back" - somewhere in the middle.

We ate here late on a Sunday. Ordered the chicken quesadillas for an appetizer. They were delicious and loaded! I had French onion soup and the door county chicken salad for dinner. The soup was sooo salty! I wish the bread in it had been a little crispier too. No complaints on the salad. Hubby had the porkchops. He enjoyed them but said the veggies that came with them were way overcooked. Table side bread was burnt on the bottom.Service was good, nice atmosphere. We'll be back to try other things on the menu!

I would like to give this place a positive review because I like writing about happy experiences. Â However, I was overwhelmed with exactly what I wanted to write about in terms of a bad Easter Brunch experience.First off, the spacial function for this event was UNfunctional. Â They had sat our party of 11 in the corner length wise and the hostess let me know that we could separate our table to better get in and out for the buffet. Â okay...then when our party was complete, we set off to the buffet. Â that was a line out the door and around the galley style bar. Â Anyone belly up at the bar could not leave, the servers could not access the service bar and I felt very uncomfotable and unsteady with a plate of food I was trying to dish up as we moo'ed thru the line. Â They definitely could have come up with a better system.The line began behind the hostess stand with desserts then filtered on past the bar to 1st up, fried chicken.after that was a buffet setting full of eggs. Â that looked green. Â if there was a green eggs and ham theme, I wouldn't have known because the carving station was last. Â I was relieved when I saw the gal come thru with fresh eggs. Â but she dumped them on top of the old eggs. Â the same thing happened with the crumbled dry bacon that was dumped on top of old very crumpled very dry bacon.same thing with the pancakes.By the time I finished thru the line I couldn't help but be green with the thoughts of contamination. I helped myself to 2 pieces of french toast and some 3/4 slice of bacon. Â I skipped over the carving station because of the push and pull of the line. Â I was hungry and figured perhaps I could go back when the line wasn't so full. on Easter. prolly wishful thinking on my part.Right next to our table was a fabulous soup and salad table. thank gawd! Â the creamy chicken dumpling soup satisfied and the salad was good. Â I even saw the waiter bring more soup in a new pot, not just dump new on top of old. Â That was the saving grace. Â Thankfully my father in law payed the bill but I still felt as though I should ask for something considering the one piece (2 halves) of french toast that I ate was like crewing on concrete. Â I was hoping to pay for soup/salad combo instead of the full buffet price of almost $20. Â I would have happily paid and tipped for what I ate... love you Daddy!We had 2 servers and their service was friendly and fast. Holidays can be a pain for us all. Â We decided as a family that next year, perhaps we'll go out to eat on Easter Saturday instead. Â that buffet was no good for anyone. Â I should also mention that no one in our party of 11 went back for seconds.

8-22-14 just had dinner here nice menus good food fair prices. Very crowded everyone in the place was 55 or older. the only thing I did not like was the strong urine / bathroom smell in the entire restaurant Â it was bad.

Pot roast sandwich was pretty good. A little salty and fries were cooked in oil past it's prime so a lot if various flavors lingered. Â The place looks like it's been going since the early 80s and they haven't changed the scenery, actually kind of funny that this is the kind of place you can bring grandma and she would want to come back, not much of a young crowd but that's not always a bad thing.

I ordered the flaming burger that includes a thin slice of saganaki on top. Â I couldn't resist adding a saganaki burger to the Great Burger Hunt list. Â The saganaki is flamed at the table per the usual ritual. Â  Unfortunately, the saganaki didn't add anything to the burger and was just too salty. Â Don't get me wrong, I really like saganaki but it just didn't work on a burger. Â Although I ordered the burger medium, it arrived well done (translation - dry). Â The fries were Burger King like in that they have that strange coating that makes them crunchy but not very tasty. Â Had the fries been better I probably would have been less annoyed that the burger was overcooked. Â My gf got a salad that came in an attractive bowl but had such a small base that it almost tipped over everytime she took a bite. Â The complimentary bread was very good and the service attentive without being annoying. Â We sat in the bar area and noticed plenty of HD tv's.Sadly the Groupon was not enough to make us repeat customers.

I went here a couple of weeks ago on a Sunday evening for dinner. I was disappointed in our server - which probably influenced my rating. She was extremely rude from the beginning. When she came up to us - she said "Well, I guess I'm your server." It was down hill from there.We sat in the bar area, and there was a man who was loudly dropping the f-bomb in his conversation with his friend - extremely annoying. He did end up leaving when our food came - so that was a relief.As far as the food (I had the Angel Hair Chicken dinner), it was a very large portion - but had no flavor. Â I felt it needed some spices or even a little salt and pepper.In general - we had a bad experience with our server and the food was so-so. Â We will not be back anytime soon, but I know we should give it another try - it may have just been a bad night.

I like this place, which is weird because I am still 40 years away from the senior menu. Â I am trying to say Manhattan's general crowd is retirees, but maybe that's why it is fun. Â The people, diners included are very kind and warm people.The menu is fairly wide in selection, something for pretty much anyone. Â I have had a few different dishes across the board and everything is quite good. Â The prices are on par with the style, but nothing you'll be too overwhelmed either way with.They do have wonderful daily deals however on both food and drink, check their website beforehand and you can get a really good meal at a more than generous price. Â They also have great coupons that come in the coupon mailers every week that make for a great weekday retreat.The remodel is nice, the bar area I think is nicer than the eating area which reminds me a little of a Baker's Square restaurant.Service is very attentive, you'll never have to flag someone down for a refill or napkins. Â The young girls serving seem to slack behind the older waitresses, but I see that everywhere and would rather always have the nice older woman than the 20 something girl who thinks she's hotter than she is.Honestly, Manhattan's is a place I really enjoy, and do look forward to going back. Â Both the bar and restaurant are nice for a bite or a drink, don't be afraid to give it a shot.

Went twice in one week -- once as a larger group, once as a group of four.The shrimp in the shrimp cocktail is flavor-less; the toast in the bruschetta is soggy. Otherwise, the apps were decent. The saganaki app was interesting, but not sure what to eat it on ... we used some of the bread. The bread is awesome -- comes to the table nicely warm and crispy.The ribeye steak was pretty good, cooked a near-perfect medium-rare. The big salads are really big. Pasta dishes are fair-sized as well, and apparently are pretty decent.Not sure what people are talking about as far as the senior crowd here ... the group get-together was around 7 PM on a weekday, the 4-top was a Thursday evening, 8 PM or so I think, and on neither occasion did the place seem to be particularly senioritised.

The best hambergers yet...The rest of the menue is great as well. The value is there and if you are over 60, you get extra value. They also send you coupons for what is already very resonable priced. You can also listen to music some nights and the staff is friendly and very attentive. Love the variety in their menue.Food is fresh and well cooked. Their corn beef was so tender and their fruit plate is fresh and sweet. Would not go any other place for hambers. Thank you Manhattan!
Skip it if you are under 60. Â Slow service and mediocre food.

Such a friendly place and great service. Awesome food. Jaime thanks for a memorable time; you were an awesome waitress. Say hello to Jen for us! See you again soon. Thousand Island dressing was awesome too!

We eat here frequently for lunch and occasionally for dinner. Â Their sandwiches are decent, onions straws delicious, and rolls excellent for lunch. Â I've had various fish dishes for dinner and liked having the option of baked sweet potato with it. Â Lasagna dinner special is the best around.Biggest complaint is the odd shaped dinnerware which is hard to eat off.We aren't drinkers & sometimes the older bar crowd can be obnoxious both at lunch & dinner.

Used to love this place, best saginaki in town. However I went with my wife tonight and arrived at 5:30. Now keep in mind we had an appointment an hour and a half later, ordered drinks and saginaki right away. Ten min later she comes back with it yet no drinks. Drinks show up 5 or ten later, after forty min I ask what's up. She says a few more. Ten later I say much more and it needs to be in a to go container. When it finally shows she ask if we need anything else and I say yes the check and the to go containers. No tip left and I need to find a new place.

have been plenty of times and I agree with others the service is spotty. I've noticed service is different if a certain manager is on the floor or not. The soup is always good and the daily specials is a hit or miss.The other night I ordered the daily surf and turf special with steak and fried shrimp. Our food was taking FOREVER and when my food finally came out it was a lobster tail instead of shrimp. If I were a fan of lobster I would of kept it. My waitress realized she put the wrong order in and would find out the price difference. Told her that I would just like my shrimp instead. She contacted one of the managers and they told her that since its a $20 price difference. I figured after the long wait for the food and the food coming out wrong, they would of just kept the lobster on the table. They took the lobster back and got my shrimp. I know it was a big price difference but what was gonna happen to it anyway? If they took it back and made the waitress pay for it...i'm not sure I just think that's just bogus.

This decor of this place reminds of a Bennigans.It's cute and warm though. They have a bar in the center with TVs and overall I felt the place was clean.The staff was very friendly and attentive.The food though was nothing special. I had the baked mostacolli. It was alright. Not good but not bad. The garlic bread had a strange taste to it though, I wouldn't recommend it.I had a cup of soup as well. The soup was flavorful but had sort of an odds and ends feel to it. All the ingredients were cut in different sizes so it seemed like they just kind dumped extras from the kitchen into a creamy broth.My lunch actually came with bread served on a board (think Outback). When they brought it out I couldn't help but smile. It was pretty much a typical small, crusty dinner roll, on a board, with a big serrated knife poked into it. It was cute.

Been here twice b4, service & food was good those times. Was there this past saturday, horrible service. Complained to manager & got my drinks comped. When we were leaving all hell broke lose. My wife asked for a to go box & Jen (our waitress) said that there wasnt enough food on the plate to put in a box. Our bill was $100 for the night, we tipped $20. Jen said that we were cheapskates under her breath, my wife said exscuse me? And she said we were Fucking cheap. Really? Needless to say we complained to management, paid our bill, she lost her job & we'll never go back there.
Minestrone was excellent as was the ravioli. Atmosphere was friendly and welcoming.
Service is fantastic, food is delicious, not stingy with portions of food or alcohol. Homemade deserts are the best around.
The food is ONLY MIDDLE OF THE ROAD. Ive gone there for the music on a friday or saturday evening. Mostly older folks (like me, lol) and older music. Â Can have fun if you roll with it.

Loved this place!!! I have only been once but I will become a regular. I had the Manhattan Burger (with a fried egg on it!) and it was HUGE! I couldn't finish it all but it was worth $9.99. The fries are to die for. Sat in the bar area and it had a nice vibe. Waitress was very attentive. I can't wait to go back!!!!!

Ok so I'm going to be honest, in the past I never really cared much for the food here. Last night my family decided though to go back and have us give it another try. First thing to note is they are doing a remodel so half the restaurant is closed and the dinning room is very crowded. We got put at a table in the middle and kept getting bumped by the servers as they waited on other tables. I'm not factoring this into my star rating however as I feel this is just because the other half of the restaurant is closed for remodeling. So my reason for going was to get the Saganacki burger... Yes I know it should include a trip to the doctors office or at least a free shock to get my heart going again. While I must admit I never liked the burgers here in the past I found this one to be excellent. My burger was cooked perfectly and had a gregarious portion of Saganacki on top. It was also flamed table side which is always great. Surprisingly the person at the table next to us still had there hair with hot tight the seating was last night :) Over all I enjoyed my dinner and look forward to going back and getting that burger again.

A good Bar/Grill Restaurant in Carol Stream. Â Interior looks great, a lot nicer than I remember. The bar is now separate so dining can be a quiet experience.Haven't been to this restaurant in a few years. Had a coupon on a fundraising card. Â Monday night - must be Sr. night. Â A wide variety on the menu. Nice waitress, but then comes the plastic water glasses, and plastic plates, and silverware with no spoons - o.k. we are in a Bar/Grill and not a real restaurant. Â A wide variety of Beers, and knowledgable staff. Â  Apparently their weekend entertainment is a big draw to their bar business. I told our waitress my husband was allergic to onions, we ordered appetizer of stuffed asigo mushrooms, and the chopped onions on top were easily removed. Â Very tasty. His soup arrived - chicken tortilla and it had onions in it. He told the waitress, she came back and instead of bringing the asparagas cream soup she let us know she talked to the chef and onions are in that too, so she gave him a salad instead - good on her part. Â He ordered a chicken pasta dish, no onions, and I ordered the Filet Marsala medium rare. I should of stuck wit Bar/Grill food... my mistake. Â  The dish was very tasty but not marsala, it was a generic brown gravy sause with mushrooms. Â The meat was tender and cooked to order. Â The sauted veggie mix was too oily for my tastes. Â His chicken dish was excellent and brought some home because of the large portion. Â I did not want potato so I asked for pasta instead. She brought a side of fettichini alfredo. It was FANTASTIC - the best part of the meal - creamy, no garlic, just wonderful! Â Ashley was attentive, quick with refills, checking that all was o.k. but not rushed or hovering. Â The place was clean, but could use the spring cleaning to get the edges of carpet dust against the pillars that the vacumn obviously doesn't pick up. Â Overall a nice place with good service and good food, reasonable in price for todays market. Stick with the sandwiches and specials.

Not my favorite place, but I'll go back every once in awhile.Portions are generous and service is fine. Â The ice tea is really strong and the Chicken Fried Steak (and the gravy) were blah - however I am bias having lived in the south for sometime.Overall, I'd go back , but I'm not rushing back.

My aunt had a groupon for this restaurant and we decided to try it for dinner yesterday. I ordered the mushroom ravioli and wasn't impressed. I've had better at the Olive Garden. My aunt ordered a burger & onion rings. They overcooked the burger but the rings were really good. I also found it kind of funny that the plates & salad bowls were made of plastic. Seems kind of cheap to me. I would not go back there, but after the groupon discount our bill came to $10.02 which was not a bad deal at all.

I was there last night for my pre-birthday celebration with my brother who lives in Wheaton along with wonderful partner and my husband. Â I loved their food. Â Started with the Saganaki (no one had it before except for me) and we all loved it, along with some nachos - which were good! Â I had the stuffed Salmon with spinish and dried tomatoes - Very very good! Â My husband had the half slab of ribs, which were also very good. Â Let's just say we all loved the food. Â As for the service -Excellent, we had the best waitress ever, go good that we all made comments on her excellent service. Â I only wish I could remember her name. Â When she heard that we were there for my birthday, she brought me a delish sundae. Â And the highlight of the night was that they had entertainment - A Motown review! Â The Moods! Â Got a card for future partys. Â We live in Burbank but we would take the ride to Carol Stream for Manhattan's. Â What a great night! Â Great Dinner, Great Service, Great Music and Dancing! Â Thank you Manhattan's for a great start to my 55th birthday!

A 3.5 rating. Â We've been three times or so and the food and home made soups are very good but the service is spotty. Â The smoking area can be overwhelming too. Â We always ask to be seated in the front, furthest away from that area.If you live in the Western burbs, watch that crappy "Mr. Coupon" packet, Manhattan's (not Manhatten, spelled incorrectly above) puts out a buy one/get one so you can try it on the cheap.Be kind; take your extra coupons with you and leave them about. Â We heard an older couple near us order two fried chicken meals (the special) and we just happened to have a buy one/get one coupon for that specific item. Â We offered it to them and made their day. Â Sometimes we just leave the coupons we won't use in a visible place in/near the restaurant. Â Not littering, just playing it forward, people.

Love the restaurant as I've been there at least 20 times over the past 3 years and only have had one bad experience.Best fish fry I've ever had in my life, its all you can eat on Wednesday and Friday's. Â I've branched away from the fish and have not been dissappointed; everything was better than a "good" rating. Â Mixed drinks have been hit or miss, pretty good beer selection. Â Daily all you can eat specials but this really doesnt detract from the place.Sometimes the "Cheer's"-ish crowd at the bar can be a real pain the a$$! Â Rude and obnoxious about the things they want on the TV amongst other things.I love the service staff as its almost an adventure when you go as they are a pretty diverse (in personality) bunch, some quirky. Â I really enjoy the conversations.
Very good for the price. Â The soup of the day is usually great!!!

I really enjoyed the ribs on one of their "All you care to eat" evenings. Generous portions on sides and other food, definitely will be back.Wife complains that the tea is a bit too strong for her and she didn't care for the gravy on her chicken fried steak, but curiously she still managed to put away the whole plate - not a small feat for a small girl!

Burgers are out of this world, half pound juicy burgers that melt in your mouth. Â The chicken fingers and the french onion soup both rock. Â We go mostly for these three things, and believe me they are worth it. Â I agree with the other reviewer about the obnoxious cheersish crowd... sometimes you feel like you are in an old man's living room, but it's worth it for the food!
All I have to say about this place is SUPER S-L-O-W service, and have given it more than a few shots at this place...never again. The one star is for the bands that come through here on the weekends.

There is nothing special about the food here normal every day restaurant food it's good and it comes out fast but the service is great. Â The servers are always really nice and even stop by our tables to chat even when we are not in their section. Â Same people always go there at lunchtime it's kind of got that cheers type of atmosphere there. Â They also have a nice selection of low carb/cal foods if your on a diet.

The all-you-care-to-eat selections are pretty solid. There is a good amount of selection on the menu. The buy-one-get-one-free coupon does require two drinks, so you're not saving a ton. Still, I can't say I've ever seen a child in the restaurant and it caters to an older crowd. Some of the reviews here are a bit misleading. This is a little more expensive than some places, but you're paying for a quality meal. It's one of the better places to eat in the whole area.

Went into Flip's this past Monday (we had a gift card but also spent some extra money) and we must say, the service was A+. Â Food was great (much of it is also reasonably priced compared to some of their competitors) and the employees were just extra friendly.5 stars and thank you.

I really enjoyed this place. I got the gyro combo which comes with freshly cut onions, tomatoes, and tzatiki sauce. The gyros are typical Kronos but are cooked crispy. The fries were so so but could have been cooked longer. We also tried the saganaki bites which are fried. These are worth checking out as are the Greek fries which are fries drizzled with olive oil, oregano, and feta cheese.This place recently got a drive through which makes it convenient. They also have a large assortment of shakes to choose from, but I have not tried any of them.

Date of my visit: 21-August-2016Time of my visit: AfternoonI have been coming to this place for awhile. Â I finally got around to review this place.Today, I ordered Gyro Burger and a Hot Dog. Â Let me start by saying, the Gyro Burger was to die for!!! Â It was unbelievingly delicious!!! Â It was just perfect!!! Â The combo of gyro meat and beef was amazing!!! Â A must try!!!A+!

Two stars for the hot dog and fries. Â I've had it four or five times now and not sure why I keep ordering it. Â It's consistently mediocre. Â A limp, skinless Vienna wiener nestled in a plain, tasteless bun. Â "Everything" includes mustard, relish, onions, two tomato slices and a couple of sport peppers. Â Of all of the mentioned accoutrements, the sport peppers have the most flavor. Â This is just an average hot dog on its best day.The fries are starch tablets with no flavor.Other menu items at Flip's are actually pretty good like the gyros. Â Steer clear of the hot dogs.

Food tasted decent and the woman at the cash register was super friendly. I spent $15 on a gyro, fries, and a Greek salad. After I sat down I went back up to the middle aged guy that was preparing the food and asked for hot sauce. He told me it was 50 cents...really??? For some sauce??? After I spent $15 on lunch? I pulled out a $20 bill and had no change. The guy looked at me like I had a third eye and wanted me to break a 20 for some hot sauce. No thanx! The also charge for drink refills. No need to nickel and dime your customers!The older man grabbed mail from the mailman and handled food right after without washing his hands.Get rid of the silly charges for sauce and wash your hands!

This a really good lunch option for the Glen Ellyn/ Wheaton area. My work buddies and I go there on lunch break, and we all order the gyro. Man, the meat is phenomenal. They keep thing simple by not overdoing the sauce or veggies, just a giant pile of meat!

I came here for the Gyros and was very pleased with what I got! I ordered the #6 meal, which comes with a large plate of gyros on a pita, along with a generous helping of fries and a drink.The gyros were good and the fries were just how I like them (hot and fresh)! Very friendly staff as well. Will definitely have no problem coming back for the gyros here!Did try the saganaki squares, but was not overly impressed...I'm just used to flaming saganaki so I have overly high standards. Some people may love these, I'm just spoiled. They do taste good, but I like my cheese more melted, that's all.I found this place by typing in "best gyros" in Yelp as my boyfriend and I were driving around....this is the top place that came up! Definitely happy with the find :)

Read JPP review below and I will second that, he was just to generous. Â Only difference is I got the combo and the Italian sausage was the only thing that saved the homemade beef to add any flavor. Â I hadn't eaten here since the 70's. Â I think going away from Scala's beef was a way to control food cost but it just doesn't taste how I remember it.Food both fries and combo came out SUPER hot so little chance of any foodborne illness here. Â I wanted to try the saganaki squares but wasn't that hungry. Â Plus an abundance of salt on fries kept me from eating many as my sodium levels probably went through the roof. Â The air conditioning is clearly failing as it was over 80 degrees inside on a 89 degree day.Very nice people here and I want to like them more. Â At least they are getting an award from Vienna next week. Â Maybe I should have just gotten a dog.So my area rankings still have Portillo's #1 and Little Joe's in Countryside a close second.

I was looking for a reasonably priced restaurant that wasn't going to cost me an arm and leg. I was tired of the nearby KFC and McDonalds. Of course I read the reviews online before I came. I was concerned because the restaurant was crowded and I only had 30 minutes to get my food. The line moved pretty fast, and the workers has their stuff together and in order.
