Welcome to the second non-chain restaurant in the Naperville area I will actually be glad to spend my money at! This place blows my mind; a complete hidden gem.From the outside, this place is nothing special and barely noticeable. I think this is what also makes this place great. You walk in, the ambiance is cozy and chic. It's not too big but not too small. My friend and I were promptly seated and offered drinks. Our waitress was awesome and funny.I ordered two things I don't quite remember the names of (see pictures) but I was so impressed by the portion and the quality. Even though there was larger portions, they don't skimp on the veggies or meat. It's loaded with deliciousness! Oh, and just like everyone says, the avacado rolls are to die for. Literally, die for them. They're amazing.Oh and something else to mention, they have free Jazz music the first Friday of the month! How cool is that?!I foresee myself making this place my new go to carry out Thai place. It's awesome, and I can't wait until I can go again.

This is my favorite casual restaurant in Chicagoland. The staff are fantastic, and we always strike up fun conversations with the servers. The portion sizes are incredible for every dish, the food consistently prepared perfectly, and delivered with a big smile. It's a great place to bring a crowd. Literally every guest we've taken with us to eat here has fallen in love with it.Best Pad Thai in America. Seriously.

Dine in on Sunday, place was absolutely empty, surprisingly for a Thai place nobody we've seen working there was Asian...Anyway, we've ordered soup and 2 dishes, it took forever for the food to arrive, soup that was a coconut milk and lime grass with chicken was tasty, my coco-chicken was very good, wife didn't care her beef strings that suppose to come in on bed of chili peppers but had no spice or much of any pepper in it at all. Portions are fair, about right, service while attentive didn't know much about menu.

This place is no joke. Have only had take out but every time it has been stellar. Pad Woon Sen has the most flavorful sauce I have ever had with that dish anywhere, I love it!!! The basil fried rice has a nice peppery bite but is balanced by the savory flavors cooked into the rice. My wife ordered the pepper steak tonight and I tried it and it was quite honestly the best pepper steak I have ever had. I love Thai food, this place takes Thai food and elevates the flavor beyond what I have had in recent years. Also the avocado roll appetizer is also amazing. The crunchiness of the fried roll gives way to a burst of deliciousness!!! I was highly impressed by those. From all I have tried here I would say the theme that comes across is balance. In all their dishes, not one flavor overpowers another, they just meld together and are bright enough to complement one another without stealing the show. Seriously impressed! Their TomYom soup is also phenomenal. I ordered it extra spicy the last time I had a head cold and again the flavors were perfect together and pronounced enough I could still taste it despite my cold.I will be a repeat customer and recommend to everyone!

Absolutely wonderful first experience here on a Sunday night. Â Both hubby and I had Tom Kha Kai soup with chicken, then he had the panang curry (which I sampled as well--amazing!) and I splurged on the bankok duck. Â It's a huge portion--we could have easily shared--and well worth the price. Â Nice, clean restaurant; server acted a bit oddly, but nothing major/did not detract from experience. Â Will return for sure!
I go here at least once a week. Â I get things THAI hot and they deliver. Â Wonderful spice and flavors. Â Service is very good.

Excellent food. We are vegetarians and this places offered a lot of choices. We ordered vegetable rolls, Panagng vegetables and Drunken noodles. Everything was delicious. We also ordered Mango sticky rice for dessert which I did not care for much. Overall good experience. We will be back again.

I had a work victory to celebrate, and my husband decided thai food would be a good way to end the evening. The restaurant we initially intended on eating at was closing soon, so we yelped it up & found Montri Thai.Located in a large strip mall in Winfield, IL it looks pretty simple on the outside. Once you get inside, however, it almost feels like you are at a restaurant near a tourist spot with soft music playing in the background.We went on a Friday evening around 8:30pm, and the restaurant was on the empty side. We were seated promptly and given menus to look over.I almost always order the Pad Kee Mao (spicy flat rice noodles) when I first visit a Thai spot. My husband ordered a curry dish (Coconut Yellow Curry?). My food overall was pretty decent. A little greasy for my taste, but definitely not overly oily to the point where I can't enjoy my food. The curry dish was delicious!Our server was friendly and pleasant which enhanced our experience a bit more.We look forward to trying out some of the other dishes Montri Thai has to offer soon.
Absolutely the best Thai food my wife and I ever ate!! You need to try this place!! The duck is amazing!

Overall, it was good food. Crab Ragoons & Thai egg rolls were made fresh & had good flavor. Pad Thai was good, & the Oyster Beef was as well. One of the better Thai places I've been to outside of Chicago.
Great place with reasonable prices. Â I highly recommend the Pad Thai or Lard Nar.
Delicious! I had the chicken fried rice and spring rolls for appetizers. I am definitely coming back here.

WOW! is what I can start off with. This place is amazing. The prices are desent and the food was delicious. The server was soo nice I would definitely take the drive out to eat here again. The food all tasted fresh and the sauses that come with the appetizers that they say they make in house is really good and tasty. Â I would so recommed this place to anyone wanting to eat thia food.
Very good food, great service! Â We started with the fried shrimp, very tasty! Â Spring rolls were just as good.

The avocado egg rolls were awesome. Â The 5 star chicken had great flavor but the chicken was over cooked. My husband loved his noodle dish. Â Service was slow but we weren't in a hurry so we were okay with that. We would go back.
Amazing little spot I would've never found without the help of yelp!!! My girlfriend and I shared the tofu yellow curry dish and the vegetable pad tsi yew (sp)Very delicious and satisfying!!
Third visit and this place is 3 for 3 for me. Â Very good service and I love the spicy catfish. Also great Tom ka gai soup and satay. Aces.
Everyone enjoyed their meal and we will definitely be coming back. I highly suggest the Tom Yum soup it was great!

Avocado rolls (plus the sauce that comes with) were so good! I would come back just for those. The Thai fried rice and chicken satay were also good, but pretty standard for what you'd get at many other Thai restaurants in the area. Reasonably priced and the portions are a good size as well.

You can't go wrong at Montri Thai. The service is always attentive and friendly. Â The food is always fresh and delicious. Â Their lunch specials are a crazy good deal - for a couple bucks more than a meal at McD's (under 10 bucks), you can enjoy a tasty meal including soup & appetizer. Â  Â I like their crab rangoons and spring rolls a lot, and usually get the spicy basil chicken for my meal. Â DELICIOUS! Â  I believe they have live music occasionally on friday nights but I've only been here for lunch.

First time here, and wow! Â Went in for lunch and ordered pad thai and cashew chicken. Â The soup was yummy and spring rolls and egg rolls. Â We ordered the infamous avocado spring rolls, which were just okay. Â Nothing special. Â I probably would have preferred regular shrimp spring rolls. Â Overall, everything had a lot of flavor and I couldn't stop eating until there was nothing left. Â Would love to go back and try something more adventurous like curry or something different.So far, so good.
Food is average. Not bad but not the best I've ever had. It's close to work and others rave about it.

I had high hopes for this restaurant because of all the great reviewed. Â And I supposed you can't please everyone's taste buds and unfortunately, my taste buds were not a fan. Â Everything else was great, and I would certainly come back to try other dishes. Â The dÃ©cor is modern and nice. Â The service is fast and friendly. Â The owner even came over at the end of our meal to ask how everything was and solicit any feedback we may have. Â He also mentioned that they will have a live Jazz band one Friday a month starting in a couple of months.Thai Iceed Tea $3 - This was very good, not too sweet at all (in fact, I could go a tad sweeter).Tom Kha Kai $5 - Thai coconut milk soup with your choice of chicken or vegetable cooked with lemongrass, bell pepper, mushroom and lime leave. Â This was a tasty soup, but what threw me off were the pieces of green bell peppers. Â I love veggies, but this is one of my least favorite vegetables. Â I've never had that in a Tom Kha before.Lard Nar with Tofu $9 - Big flat rice noodle with Broccoli and Collard Greens in garlic gravy. Â They made this with a very strange twist - the noodles were crispy and the sauce was watery. Â Maybe this is the fusion part. Â I was expecting the normal soft wide rice noodles with thick sauce and didn't particularly enjoy this variation. Â Also, I didn't see any collard greens.Spicy Catfish $14 - Deep fried crispy catfish with red curry paste in coconut milk, topped with a touch of crispy basil leave. Â My favorite dish of the night and it was delicious.There were plenty of food, which we took home as leftovers. Â I was particularly touched that even though we only had a tablespoonful of rice left, they had packed us more rice to go with our leftovers.

This place is wonderful and I'm grateful it's close as well! We ordered the chicken pot stickers, they came fried with a sweet dipping sauce. Hubs ordered the cashew chicken, he said it was pretty good, average. I had the Pad Kheemao, it was advertised as spicy but I was fibbed to. I enjoyed the fatty flat noodles! Overall, we were pleased :-)
Super good food. Lovely live band on Friday. Reasonably priced. Nice atmosphere. Definitely will come back again when I'm in the area!

Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!Finally, great Thai close to home! I have been dying for some great Thai food ever since I ate at Banana Leaf in Dallas and remembered just how great Thai food could be. (amazingly the owner there looked Thai, but had a thick Cajun accent)Seriously, we eat Thai food a couple of times a month and have been making do with food that is just OK and creeping up in price. Many of these Thai places don't even serve much seafood... What's up with that?Montri Thai has a full menu with all the right stuff. We started with the Avocado rolls and Chicken Satay... followed by Pad See Ew with Beef, Tofu Thai Fried Rice, Thai Orange Chicken and Panang Curry.Everything was delicious! The Panang Curry is a real treat and the Satay is the best that I've had in a long time (looking forward to trying the pork satay) I can't wait to get back there to try the whole red snapper and some of the other seafood dishes.Now there is more to eat in Warrenville than just Two Brothers.Good prices, a nice room, decent wine list, friendly service and great food... an awesome formula for success. Now if only they could work on their Cajun accents
Visiting family in the area, decided to use Yelp to determine where to go for dinner in Warrenville. Wow, could not have made a better decision. Food was great, as where the drinks. Great experience.

Excellent service here. Most of my neighbors opt for carry out but the interior and dining room is exquisite. I order the Crab Rangoon often and it is much better than other Thai places I have been to.The pad Thai is very good here, along with many of their curry dishes.
Fresh food, beautiful presentation. Rama chicken was a new dish for me, and it was delicious.
I have been here several times. Â Very good! Â Nice staff. Â The widows in front can get really bright, so the curtain can become an issue when dining.

Just moving to this neighborhood, and my husband and I went to this restaurant after reading all these positive reviews. However, I was so disappointed with the food and service here. I ordered Tom yum and pad see Wei. Unlike all the Tom yum I tasted before, it is too sweet and not really spicy. My husband ordered Panang curry, and this is the only dish he eat every time when we go to a Thai restaurant, but it is too salty. I think I just order some common dishes that you can find almost in every Thai restaurant. But this time is the worst.

In our family we debate about the best Thai food in the area. We love Thai and it often. I honesty think that Montri has the best Thai in the area. At Montri Thai, we love the Grilled Spicy Beef as an appetizer. You can't go wrong with the Basil Fried Rice and the Spicy Chicken with Basil Leaves. The staff is always friendly and very attentive.

After moving back to the area from Providence RI (shout out to Apsara! Super yummy Asian place), I needed a new go-to.Hands down, this is it. Whether it's break ups, work stress, or something else, their cocktails are excellent (both in liquor content and price) and their Rama Chicken makes everything temporarily better. The Rama Tofu isn't bad either. It's large enough that if you pick at your food and have a liquid dinner when stressed, the food still tastes good microwaved the next day.It's true, hardly anybody dines in. Which makes it perfect to talk to the servers. My favorite is on maternity leave but I've since become Facebook friends with her. Yes, this place is that amazing.Everyone else's reviews are true: great avocado rolls, good curry, good prices.

I ordered chicken satay appetizzer and had the Bangkok duck. The portion sizes were very large. The Bangkok duck was a half a fried duck on a bed of fried rice. Even the appetizzer had large pieces of chicken.Taste was pretty good. The duck was fried and some was hard to eat since the breading or whatnot was extremely tough.The prices are about average for dinner and not too expensive. I think my appetizzer was around $6 and my entree was around $18.Service was fine with no issues.Overall, a good place where I'd come back.

Came here for the first time because my coworker invited me for lunch since we both love thai food. Â Although I was craving the panang curry bc of its great reviews, I got the curry fried rice. This came on their lunch special with soup and an egg roll, a great deal!The curry fried rice was delicious! Not much to it but it was full of flavor and a good amount of food for a lunch portion. Definitely will be coming here again to try all the other curry dishes.
Good and tasty food at a reasonable price. Good for dinner and their staffs are nice too.

I went to Montri with a large group recently and the overall reviews from everyone were mixed. Â What I know is, whatever food I tried was good so I'm going to give Montri the benefit of the doubt here. Â Really the two major issues were that the service was really slow. Â We waited a LONG time just to get our appetizers like avocado rolls and soup. Â That was excessive, but again maybe the issue was the size of our group, 8 adults and 6 kids. Â The other issue my friends complained about was the sweetness of the food. Â Many entrees came out quite sweet, which wasn't ideal.I tried a couple of things. Â First off, the avocado rolls were great. Â Almost like a Tex/Mex-Asian fusion thing going on. Â Really nice. Â On the other hand, the Tom Kha soup was... not what I expected. Â Not that it was bad, but it just didn't taste like the Tom Kha soup I have almost everywhere else. Â I'm all for unique flavors, but this just seemed like a whole different kind of soup. Â Really, the soup was my only complaint. Â The red curry was great and the Pad Kee Mao was good. Â I think we could and should have upped the spice levels on everything we ordered. Â Adding in the hot sauce provided the heat we needed.I would recommend Montri. Â I would come back and give them another shot in terms of the service assuming part of the issues were just due to our group size. Â We'll hope for a better experience next time.

Very cool little place. Â If you had any question about it - the service is TOP NOTCH!We arrived hoping to finish dinner by the closing time we thought was 9 (actually 10) on a Friday. Â The place wasn't too full, but the decor and setup is very clean and modern while still being comfy. Â We took a bit of extra time to order since we wanted to scan the whole menu to see what they had to offer, and the waitress was extremely polite and not bugging us, but attentive none the less.We ordered some Thai Tea that really stuck to your gums. Â The very good flavor hung around in your mouth if you let it. Â Then we decided on some Tom Kha Kai which came in a plenty large enough bowl to share (but not too large as to leave you groaning). Â The flavor was very good but there was an interesting aspect - bell peppers. Â It wasn't bad, but it was unfamiliar for the dish (as well as a couple of others). Â Probably just something to get used to.We also had the Pad See Eiw which was delicious, but the noodles may have been fried too much (unless they started with a different wide noodle than I'm used to) as they were a bit too hard to cut with a fork and or spoon. Â We commented to the waiter and he said he would tell the chef and thanked us for our opinion. Â The dish also had broccoli instead of collard greens, but the flavor was great either way.The other dish we ordered was the spicy catfish. Â It was a very good mixture of red curry and coconut milk with a spice that I thought I was going to need to spice up at first, but set in to the perfect cruise to spice town.When the waiter went to wrap up our food he noticed that we did not have much rice and, without asking, packed a nice, full extra container for us to take. Â Awesome!I really liked the lounge-style oldies that were playing the whole time we were there (Beatles, Doors, Steely Dan, etc) and the waiter also noted that they will be featuring live jazz once a month (2nd Friday?) and possibly more often if it is popular. Â Cool stuff!

I really like this place and every time I go here I say to myself why did I wait so long to come back. Â To start I absolutely love the Duck Basil Salad with fresh Mango pieces and the sauce is phenomenal!! Â Everything here is so fresh and I always leave here feeling like my taste buds were delighted and I really ate a good healthy meal.I have tried so many things on this menu and I have never been disappointed and will be back soon.

Whenever we had guests in Warrenville and we wanted to take them to out to eat nearby, this was one of our go to places. Compared to the food quality of most other places in Warrenville this place is a godsend. Even if they were surrounded with better competition, their food is well made and reliably tastes good. I was always happy with what I ordered and greedily finished my leftovers at home.

I lived in Thailand for a while so I am a bit biased as to what good Thai food is. Montri Thai does it's best to bring Thai food to the states and it succeeds. Their curry in particular is fantastic. I also like how they have Jazz nights the first Friday of every month. It adds that extra cool factor that makes this place even better.

This was my first visit here and it was outstanding. Â The service was very good the food was great. Â I had the Vietnamese Rolls and they were great with the spicy peanut sauce. Â I had the Tom Yum soup and it too was very good, not too spicy and not to boring. Â For my main course the Pad Kee Mao and it was also over the top.So knock your selves out..

I'm really confused about all the good reviews about this place. I have been to Thailand, know the food and even speak it. We ordered some very basic carry out and it was mediocre at best. The pad Thai was tasteless as was the fried rice. Real Thai food uses fish sauce. Especially in pad Thai and fried rice. I don't understand Thai restaurants owned by Thai people that have lousy food, especially to a culture where food is so important. This did not have that Thai flavor. Crab Rangoon (which isn't Thai but who cares) was ok. I normally get joy Yees but they are temporarily closed. I will not order from here again. If you're reading this and are Thai, the food is "juhd cheep-hai"! Which in Thai means bland as hell. Skip it
Great value for a delicious meal. Service was very friendly & timely. Nice decor for a strip mall location. We'll be back!

When it comes to Thai food I am very picky about how it tastes, I have to tell you that Montri Thai is one of my favorite Americanized Thai restaurant. The food is great, the staffs are super friendly and their drinks are good. I'm from the city but every time I go visit my friends in Warrenville, I often stop by to grab some bites here.

My husband and I got delivery from this place late on a Friday after moving in to our new house. The food was fantastic! The drive went to the wrong address, but everything still came very hot, which was great because we don't have a microwave yet :). The portions were much larger than I expected. We had a dish with wide flat rice noodles and they tasted like they were homemade, although I don't know for sure. Everything was delicious. I ordered kind of at random and was extremely pleased with everything. I am very happy to be living a quarter mile from this restaurant :)

Writing this review after trying other thai food places in Naperville. Montri Thai stands a class above local thai restaurants.Been here for around 5 times now. We usually order PadKeeMao, Pad thai, Panang curry and the Basil Fried rice. They have a good sausy taste to the PadKee Mao, and the portions they serve are more than enough every time.The fried rice have a good flavor and taste.

This place has very good Thai food. The red curry chicken was really delicious & perfect for a cold day! So smooth like a lobster bisque. My hubby had appetizers for dinner- the crispy crab rangoons w/ an excellent sauce- a must order! The chicken satay had large pieces of chicken & the spicy beef salad was super spicy & good. We are definitely coming back to try more things & enjoy jazz night on 1st Fridays.Update- We visited again for Jazz night. Our waitress was really nice & let us stay to listen to the band. No rushing you out which was great. We tried the shrimp cargot w/ green curry & coconut milk. It was delish! Also tried the spicy basil chicken could have been spicier, but it was good.

This review was intended for Reserve 22, Glen Ellyn, and posted here in error.We visited Reserve 22, at Village Links, on a Fri nite in May '15. The place was already very busy at 7, not so much with golfers coming off the links, but with diners who made "22" their target for the evening. A loud boisterous crowd filled the dining room, the large bar, and most of the terrace. Video screens covered sports of the day.Service was very attentive, and there was plenty of staff to handle the large crowd as well as keep problems down and service up."22" is not the usual clubhouse dining. A long list of craft and specialty beers, and wines, are offered. They do have typical soup/salad/sandwich menus, but also an interesting list of small plates and sides, from $3 to about $15. A limited list of plate dinners ran mostly below $20. We had chicken linguini w/artichokes and bistro steak w/truffle/parmigiana fries. The steak was no filet but was well prepared and nicely dressed with a savory, slightly tangy sauce. The fries were to die for! I devoured the whole mountain of them. The chicken pasta, a large serving, was very good and included several dried tomato slices. Sides are extra.The noisy crowd diminished about 9PM and management went to great efforts to move the band, and pull out some tables, for those who stayed for the entertainment and dancing until 11.While not gourmet dining (3*), and the noise is not our thing, prices are modest, Â the food offerings are creative, the mood is up-beat, and service very attentive (management gets a 5*). A good value and fun place. Res. recommended.

My boyfriend and I decided to try this place out based on other yelp reviews. Ordered the avocado lovers roll as an appetizer which was pretty good.. Like a crispy spring roll filled with guac served with a dipping sauce.For our entrees we had the panang curry with chicken and tofu and the green curry with chicken. Both were flavorful and delicious!! Some of the best I've had in the Chicagoland area. The green curry was creamy coconutty goodness with thinly sliced bamboo shoots, peas, and peppers. Both dishes also had just the right amount of heat to balance out the sweet and creamy. So so good.We were stuffed but had to try out the mango sticky rice for dessert since everything else we had ordered was so authentic and tasty. I'm glad we did because it didn't disappoint! Left happy and stuffed.

I love Thai food. I had been only frequenting Bangkok in Naperville, but ventured outside my comfort zone to this gem.Their pad Thai is the best in the area. Hands down. Their avocado rolls are amazing good. Creamy and crunchy and worth the order. We even had potstickers which were good, though, a bit doughy for my taste.Friendly service, beautiful space.Go! Eat! Be transported to overeating land!

I really like this Thai restaurant. The waitress was really nice, and cared to check that the spice level was perfect. The spice level was perfect. The ingredients are fresh and the food is delicious. I feel like driving there now and getting some crab rangoons and pad ke mao.
The lunch specials are a great deal and come with soup and an appetizer. The service is friendly and attentive. I'm not sure why this place isn't packed with customers at lunch.

Well since I've been looking to try a Thai place in my neighborhood, and this place was new with lots of positive reviews...I thought I'd give them a try.It started first with us walking in...and not be acknowledged. no sign saying to seat yourself, or wait to be seated. We had to go and find someone to ask.We placed our order and asked for 2 sodas. Â  We waited and waited. 15 minutes passed and the waitress never brought our drinks, or even stopped by. 20 minutes passes and nothing. Â  The restaurant wasn't even that busy. It seemed that almost everybody was waiting for food. Even people for carry out waited much longer than what seemed necessary. Â  After 30 minutes with no visit from the waitress, no comment that they might have been short-handed, or anything...we finally just walked out and left. Prior to walking out, I noticed a couple behind us almost walked out as well.If you have all night to wait for dinner...this might be the place for you. Â  The only positive thing worth mentioning is the place has a nice decor. If I could give zero stars for this place, I would, but they get one by default.

Its been 5 months, a few times a month, and can I say "I love montri!". Â They are very consistent and so yummy. Â Here's our Favorites: Â seafood panang - yummy creamy red curry with seafood, cashew chicken -super delicious! Â we also ALWAYS get the calamari and now I just tried the vegetable tempura -I liked it a lot. Â Ive tried all the red curries and two months ago I got seafood the seafood panang, never trying anything else again - its a winner! Â its always take-out for us.

Delicious food, great service and lovely ambiance!The Avocado Lovers Roll were just amazing and the Panang Curry was too good!We went on Friday night and they had some live music too! It was bit loud maybe bcoz the place is small.But overall experience was good! Would recommend and definitely come back.

This place was a pleasant surprise. Nestled off Rt. 59 in a strip mall, we walked past it going to the hardware store and decided to give it a try. My husband is gluten and dairy free, so I sold him on the rice noodles and peanut oil in Thai food.We have been back twice and loved everything we have tried. I adore the mango lobster roll appetizers, which are spring rolls with a peanut sauce you can spoon on yourself. I've had the baby corn and peapod and trio delight entrees and they were both delicious. My partner had pad thai chicken and some kind of coconut curry with shrimp and pineapple that he raved about. The Jasmine iced tea is refreshing and light, too.The banana dessert reminded me of overcooked oatmeal, but there is so much delicious food, I can skip dessert. :) I will definitely be going back often and we noticed they do a brisk carryout business, so we are looking forward to having a new carryout place that is on my way home from work.

After hearing the glowing reviews on this place coupled with the fact that I have found no good thai in the western suburbs, I decided to roll the dice. Called in a pick-up order and was bringing food back to some friends who own a nearby business. Upon arriving, I liked the interior and the people were friendly, but when I got the food back, I was shocked to see what was being portrayed as thai food. Got a few noodle dishes and a bunch of apps. NONE was good and none was remotely close to authentic. One step up from food court sweet and sour chicken at the mall really. Ask for spicy, and you get a 1/2 cup of red pepper flakes thrown in at the end type of crap - and the crazy thing is that people like this junk. Needness to say, I'm still looking for the elusive (and even edible) suburban thai food.

There used to be another Thai restaurant (Ariya) in this space that was only so-so, and so when we got to this location (flying blind after reading the excellent reviews here at yelp), my friend insisted that we'd been there before, but I said no (I'd written no review for Montri, after all!)At any rate, we went in to dine. Yelp, I hate to be the dissenter but I fear that I must say that Montri is carrying on Ariya's mediocre tradition.Why? Due to pretty much everything we ordered. For an appetizer we split the Blue Sea Crispy Rolls. For a dish that claimed to contain a combo of lobster, crab, shrimp, and scallop along with carrot, cabbage and bean threads, I have to say that the seafood was almost undetectable. The taste wasn't bad for what it was, but what it was was pretty much a deep-fried veggie roll.For our entrees he ordered the sweet almond beef and I got the mussaman curry with chicken. Mine came in a large ceramic cauldron, a heady broth of coconut milk bobbing with potatoes and chunks of pineapple; I fished around with the serving spoon to locate the chicken I'd ordered until we realized that it had been made with tofu.(Servers: this is what an ordering pad is for!! There is no shame in using one!!)I snared the waitress before she got into the back, and she took it away and apparently they remade the whole dish, because my friend finished his whole meal before mine came back. It ended up being okay, but in the end I should have tried something else initially (had I known).His dish was alright but as he said, only serviceable.There were a number of interesting sounding dishes on the menu (nutty chicken, coco chicken) and a plethora of seafood dishes (including the hilariously named (Hotty Seafood), but after this experience I'll return to the safety of Le Siam further south on 59.

I was a fan of Ariya because of it's freshness and service. Montri has yet to dissapoint. I do go at lunch a lot and the 5 star dish is wonderful. I recently went back and tried the spicy basil chicken- WOW. Excellent job! The starter egg drop soup was much different than expected and was delicious.I really appreciate a restaurant that makes things fresh and care about what they serve. Montri is small and quaint and makes it's food a nice presentation which I appreciate, and you can taste the freshness. Try it, you'll like it.If you support restaurants like this less and less cookie cutter chain restaurants will appear!

I'm usually skeptical of good thai food out in the suburbs as I have a city kid bias but this place was excellent!The menu selection was extensive (not just your typical pad thai etc.)The mango lobster roll appetizers were great but keep in mind they are spring rolls. Â For some reason I was anticipating something more like an egg roll but that was my own fault for not reading the description well enough.The food had good flavor and the ingredients tasted fresh.Restaurant itself is clean and decorated nicely.

I finally tried a different Thai place for the very first time! (I normally go to Tusk Thai in Batavia) So I work in Warrenville and came across this place online when searching for a nearby Thai restaurant. I stuck to what I know best which is why I ordered Thai fried rice with chicken. The chicken was very flavorful and delicious! Definitely exceeded my expectations! Now the rice on the other hand didn't. I'm not sure what ingredient they used too much of but the taste reminded me a lot of the $1 Michelina's boxed frozen fried rice which I do not like. Price for my order was about $10 and it was a good size portion if only I had liked the flavor more. I just admit I was a tad bit disappointed that it was not as good as my favorite Thai restaurant.

HOW you guys can even give FIVE stars ? This is a Thai restaurant and all Thai flavor sucks. I decided to give a shot because of the reviews but I was so mad with every single dish. It is the worst Thai restaurant ever. They can even cook a simple curry normally! Even the Tom yum soap! Do you think people don't know Thai food! You can buy the Thai curry from a Asian supermarket it is way much better than this! When I walked into the restaurant I'm glad Â because the waitress are Thai people but when I eat I got so confused. WHAT THE HL is dat! I have been Thailand and I eat a lot Thai food in U.S. But this is so bad can you Thai guys try yourself? HOW you can sell this and it is not cheap. At least you guys should give some real Thai rice because it is famous and normal in Thai food; HOWEVER! The rice is so sticky and slagging I'm sure it is the same rice like super cheap Asian fast food rice. Well, anyone who give 5 stars I hope you guys enjoy. Im would be glad my review could help someone or maybe just one person who gonna try this restaurant. If you think I'm wrong go Assi market or Amazone to get the can curry, drop some beef, bell pepper, and coco milk, then try their curry . You will see.

Awesome dinner tonight. Â Our first time at this place. We had shrimp cargot (a must try), Â spring roll, avocado lovers roll (another must try), pot stickers, pad thai woonsen, pad lard na. Â Everthing was very fresh and delicious. Â We also heard that they have live jazz performance first Friday each Month. Â We will be going back to check that out.
Have gone twice in the last two weeks and both times the food was great. Â I would defiantly recommend andbe back again.
The lobster and shrimp dish is fabulous!Soft shell crab app is perfect!Service was perfect!Cocktails were tasty!We will be regulars.

Excellent restaurant! Love their pot stickers, pad Thai and Panang curry. Everything was delicious! Great service too! I highly recommend it. Â I would love to try their lunch to get a variety but I have my favorites so I tend to order the same things...

Truly some of the best Thai food in the area. Unassuming location but don't let that fool you. They do not skimp on the flavor. Try the Panang Curry it's the best around. Good lunch specials also. Can't go wrong here.
Wow this place has the best chicken pot stickers and Thier red curry is awesome even tho it had apply yes apples surprised twas still gud.
Good service, nice environment. The food was okay, but not as good as I had hoped for. Never experienced chunks of pineapple in a Massaman curry before!?You could do worse for Thai in the area.

Love this place! Tried for the first time on a recommendation from a friend and we were blown away at the flavors and quality of the food. We will be back....don't let the fact it is in a strip mall dissuade you. It was absolutely wonderful!

Who would have thought you would find awesome Thai in a strip mall in Warrenville? Â I have never had a bad item here. Â The Pad Thai is the best I've had and comes with generous chunks of chicken, beef, or tofu. Â The pot stickers and steamed shumai are a great way to start a meal there. They have an awesome weekday lunch special where you get an entree, an appetizer, and a soup for less than $10. The decor is lacking and somewhat dated and the liquor selection is nothing to write home about, but you come here for the awesome food first.
Food is good. Restaurant service was horrible the last time. Delivery the last few times has given much smaller portion sizes for the same price. I will not be returning.

So, we just got takeout from them tonight.I'm still impressed. I do think next time we'll dine in. Tastes much better without the car ride. Nothing beats hot out of the kitchen crab rangoons.We had the avocado rolls again. I think that is my favorite thing here!The rangoons were good again.I tried the chicken satay, and it was good, but again, not my thing. Just the flavoring of it wasn't to my liking. But it's good. Again, I hope this makes sense. Just because I didn't like it doesn't mean you won't. All I could taste was the marinade, not the chicken. not how I like it. It was heavily flavored. There's the word I want. the peanut sauce that goes with was pretty tasty.Hubby had the tom kha. He was happy with it. And now he has satay for lunch.Our order was ready in a timely manner. And it tasted good. :) I'm a happy customer. And I'm full.And I have more avocado rolls and rangoon for tomorrow!

I was looking forward to the food here due to all the reviews, but was disappointed. The food is just okay, nothing special. Soups were too sweet, pad thai and fried rice were just okay too, won't come back.

Fantastic soup. The egg roll and ginger chicken were phenomenal with plenty 'o fresh ginger. Â Relaxing and quiet for a nice break from your day. Â Very funny Asian Madonna music adds to the feel in some quirky way. Â 7.95 lunch special well worth it.
Went there with a group had great experience food was great the best Thai food in Naperville area server gr8 pleasantWill go back again

Best Thai food I've found around the suburbs. Â I have not been disappointed in a dish yet! Â I recommend the Thai fried rice, any basil dish, Coco Chicken, Avocado rolls, Egg rolls, Spring Rolls, and their dipping sauces are delicious! Â Only iffy dish we've come across was the dry duck my boyfriend once ordered. Â I would give it a try again though, might have been an off night.

The food was good and the price for the lunch special is unbeatable. 7.99 gets you a small cup of soup, 2 small spring rolls, and a plate of your choice for the main meal. Â I chose the pad kai sei (not sure how to properly spell it). Â I asked for it to be spicy and it came out about a 5 on an American scale (prolly a 1 on the Thai scale). Â It was very good, my only complaint would be that it was on the cold side. There were a few parts of the plate where it was room temperature. Â That is why I am giving it 4 stars instead of 5.
Solid lunch spot. Â I really enjoyed my food off the lunch menu both times I have eaten here. Â Prices are affordable and service is friendly. Â I recommend!

So far this is the best Thai restaurant... I live in Indiana and haven't find any good Thai restaurant there... Their chicken Satay and VIETNAMESE shrimp spring rolls are really delicious .... If you are a seafood lover try their sea bass, it's the best...

Great Avocado lovers spring rolls! Â My wife had Â Ginger Chicken which she loved and I had the Five Star chicken which was delicious and loaded with chicken and veggies. The sauce was very tasty on both entrees.The service was very friendly and helped us within a couple minutes after we sat down. The interior is very clean and the booth was cozy for us. Â We will definitely go back!
The Angel Wings were very excellent.. I would get it again. The employees were very nice.

We found our new Thai favorite, which used to be Le Siam but this is a better value (by usingrestaurant.com), is closer to our house and still very tasty. Â Had chicken satay, chicken pot sticker, fried tofu, chicken panang curry, beef soup, shrimp fried rice, garlic chicken. The chicken satay was more chicken than usual Thai places...I loved it had more meat but my wife thought Le Siams was tastier. The garlic chicken and shrimp fried rice were very tasty as well. My daughter loved the pot stickers because they were a little crispy on the bottom and the meat was still tender in the middle. Â The beef soup was just ok to us but one thing that impressed me was they actually had a lot of beef in it that wasn't fatty. Â Finally the panang curry was very tasty as well. Â Hopefully our next visit is consistently good!

Great thai restaurant. Â Just wish it was a little closer to home. Â I have enjoyed their Pad thai, 5 star chicken, and shrimp, egg rolls, and garlic chicken. Â All of the entrees were tasty.Will return for sure.

I was blown away by how delicious everything was! We had avocado spring rolls, the shrimp appetizer, Thai Time and the curried catfish. It was very inexpensive for both Â the quality of the dish and the atmosphere. The waitress was friendly and helpful.You need to eat their avocado egg rolls. Every day.

My favorite restaurant in Warrenville! Fantastic food that is made with fresh ingredients that always seems to be cooked just right. Not a huge ambiance place, but it helps make for affordable food that is high quality. Staff and service is down home, natural, authentic, and high-touch! I've sent many neighbors here.
Great food and excellent serviceNice for parties and business meetingsGreat wine selection.

We have been coming to Coopers Hawk since they opened and we have witnessed the degradation of service across the board at each of the locations Burr Ridge, Orland, and Oak Lawn . Â  And while we love the wine it is our feeling that service is really starting to SUCK at the restaurants!We may leave the wine club, Â  They are now at their last strike!Go somewhere else!Greg Torrez

Cooper's hawk has finally got it right! I'm beyond happy with the service I received from Rebecca today. She was extremely pleasant and although she had WAY TOO MANY TABLES to attend to, she managed well. People were nagging her from all over the place and she never once seemed bothered.I mentioned previously how great Tom was, and I'm pleased to see that another great sever exists at this location.Keep it up CH! Happy to be a wine club member!

This place rocks socks...The food is good and the wine is even better! I had the peach and white sangria and they were both so doggone delicious! I ordered the chicken cesear chicken sandwich and it was good, different, but good. Don't let the name throw you off. I will be back, especially for their $7 wine tasting that goes on everyday and last until like 10pm. I noticed upon first walking in how live the front wine tasting area was and see why. That's a great deal and I hear they really pour nice too. I also like how you can sample any wine before purchasing it or ordering it so if you're undecided on a wine, just ask them for a sample.

Wow! The first word that comes to mind. From being able to order online to service to food - loved it! We ordered for pick up and got 2 kids pastas which each come with a side, a drink, and a chocolate covered strawberry! Then we had the chicken chorizo burger. All was very tasty. Upon entering the place is huge which is deceiving because it doesn't look that way outside. I was taken care of promptly and even asked if I wanted some wine while I waited for my food. The waitress forgot to give me my drinks when I left and called me right away to deliver them to me in the car. I saw a couple sampling wine from the dozens on the wall too which was cool. Decor was fancy and beautiful. There are many shops next door too so it can be a day outing with a stop here. I would come back and highly recommend.

Yummmm! I love all Coopers but this location was pretty great. If you're a wine lover the wine club is a must. It's about 20.00 a month and you get a free bottle of wine per month. We started off at the bar getting samples of wine per the wine club membership. You can imagine how wasted/tipsy you get towards the end when you're about to sit at your table. The bartenders were hilarious and super friendly. Maybe that was just the wine talking but it did the trick.Staff was friendly when we sat down. We were tend to throughout the entire dinner which is a must in my book if you've seen my previous reviews. I got the salmon which was about 21.00 or so. Super delicious. We also got the medallions medium rare. I am no where near a blood lover and I really prefer my steak not to moo. Howeverrrrrr Coopers got me like whoa and I'm slowly going from well done, medium well, medium, to now medium rare all because of their steak. It's like hell has frozen over but I am a believer. It was perfectly juicy and not super under cooked. Very succulent and practically like butter.We had the cheesecake and some type of chocolate balls(ha) for dessert. Holy f! So flame so fire aka really frickin delicious. Cheesecake was like you could just taste the fresh milk, butter, cream, everythinnggggg sex in my mouth j swear. The chocolate balls were amazeballs literally and figuratively.Fairly pricey but you're getting what you pay for in quality.

We had such a wonderful time. My daughter and I had a mom and me lunch with mother/daughter friends that were also visiting Chicagoland. Our server was great and we joined the wine club. The food was fabulous and we enjoyed two flights. One white and one sparkling.

My wife and I celebrated our anniversary here and we had a great time. Â  Our waiter was Awesome Â and the food was really good. Â Great taste and nice size portions. Â The wine we had was pretty good as well.

Stopped by while in Burr Ridge. I arrived during happy hour and just wanted a place to get something quick and have a drink.Pro - Awesome service from Orlin. The food was great as well. Wedge Salad & Drunken Shrimp were pretty good. Good ambiance. I did mention Orlin was great, right.Con - We sat at the high table and the seats were not comfortable.

Ohhh geeez, I really tried to like this location. The food is so bland! Â The Trio of Medallions was an ok dish. Â The steak itself was great, however, the mash potatoes were nasty. Â I'm thinking they were from a box because they were stiff, not creamy and taste absolutely horrible. Â Okay, the other two I had two week prior was the Gnocchi Chicken Pasta (see pic). Â It is a nice picture, but the WORST tasting pasta ever. Â I actually took a couple bites and did not eat the rest. UGH! Â The lettuce wraps were okay, nothing special, however, it was the only thing I really liked here other than the steak.Now on to the drinks... The only reason I am giving this place 3 stars, is the service and the drink menu. Â I did not like the Coopers Hawk Bellini, but the Peach Sangria knocked it out of the park. Â That was happiness in a big glass. Â Also, the plum wine and the passion fruit wine was great! Â I know.. Plum right? I promise you, it - does - not taste like Plum. Â I do not like Plums, but this wine was delicious. Â If you drink enough, maybe you'll enjoy the food haha!Wait... I almost forgot!! The CrÃ¨me Brulee, how dare I forget this. Â As you know, this is my favorite dessert and they did a great job at it. Â However, honestly, how could you mess up CrÃ¨me Brulee? Enjoy :)

Service, food, and dining experience overall were absolutely excellent. Â We just had one slight hiccup when we first were checking in, but besides that everything was great.Came with a group on a Friday night and it was packed (be sure to make a reservation!!). Â They helped the waiting process by passing out samples of one of their wines by the door. Â It was definitely a warm welcome.So our little hiccup happened just at the beginning, we had a 6pm reservation and were waiting on some of our party still (20 minutes later), we were going to be a pretty big group they wouldn't let us sit until half of our party was there, and then when we were waiting, even though we had half of the party, they were a little antsy to seat us as they had an 8pm reservation for the big table. Â It worked out because the 8pm ended up canceling, but it's not cool to refuse to seat us when we could have at least gotten started with some appetizers, and then turn around and complain about us not being seated because our whole party wasn't there. Â OK RANT OVER.So the servers definitely made up for it, one was training, which may have accounted for the slightly slower service (again, why so slow if you were trying to get us out? Â OK RANT REALLY OVER THIS TIME). Â They have a pretty varied menu, and a quite a few different types of wines to choose from. Â They do wine flights and sangria flights (although it's not on the menu). Â Their wines are really good, and this is coming from someone who doesn't really like wine.The food is also exceptional, Crab Cake bites appetizer, Burrata Prosciutto & Arugula bruschetta, Cooper's Hawk Calamari, get them all. Â They are all delicious. Â For the main dish I had Dana's Parmesan-crusted Chicken. Â Although the portion was pretty generous it was so delicious I ate the whole thing.We rolled out of there pretty satisfied. Â It's a great place with good wine and good food. Â If you're a wine-drinker, enjoy their food, and go there often enough, their wine club is also a great deal.

Since I work in the neighborhood, Cooper's Hawk is pretty unavoidable. Â It's always the first suggestion for after work drinks and snacks and it's very apparent why that is.I have never had food here that I did not like. Â Granted, I'm vegetarian, so I'm very limited in what I can eat here because this is a restaurant (like so many) that like to put meat into everything. Â My favorite appetizer that I have eaten here is the Thai Lettuce Wraps. Â I will admit- I enjoy building my own food. Â So, I liked that they serve everything deconstructed and you can build your own wraps. Â But I thought that the sauce on those wraps was delicious. Â I could drink it, it was so good. Â I've also enjoyed the Mediterranean Plate which is good. Â I also like some of their flat bread options- the roasted vegetable & goat cheese is very good, as is the caprese.I really like the flatbread & salad/ soup & salad combinations. Â Last time that I came to Cooper's Hawk, I ordered the ceasar pesto & lobster bisque and that combination was divine. Â The salad had so much flavor and the bisque was so creamy with just the right amount of lobster (aka not a whole lot). Â I think this will be my go-to dish from here on out.I also have many coworkers who do the wine club. Â I have a few of their wines. Â I like the sparkling almond wine, but I can only drink it on certain occasions because I do not like sweet wine all that much. Â I have had their Sauvignon Blanc which I very much enjoyed. Â I also really liked their cabernet. Â So, I feel like their wines hit all the bases (red, white, sweet).The staff have always been friendly. Â But if you can, make a reservation because this is a hot spot and it's hard to get in at certain times. Â But definitely worth a try!

I've been to several locations, and this is by far my favorite Cooper's Hawk. The wait staff is always friendly, and the interior is the nicest of all their locations. They have a lovely private room you can rent for events that is decorated with wine barrels, and floor to ceiling glass windows. You can't go wrong if you order one of the following:- roasted vegetable goat cheese flatbread-chicken madeira-cilantro ranch chicken sandwich-bbq ranch chicken salad-blackened bleu steak salad (my personal fav! tangy vinaigrette balanced out with feta cheese and bleu cheese dressing)You really can't go wrong with any of their wines either. For a small price you can sample some wines as you wait for your table, or afterwards to pick out a bottle to bring home with you. As a wine club member, the one bottle a month membership is really worth the price (especially if you plan on sharing the membership with someone). I split it with my fiance and for $9 a month per person, you usually get a bottle that costs around $30 regularly. They also have food promotions and other specials available to members monthly.

I'm not a big wine drinker, but I was impressed with their incredibly large selection of wine (by the glass, flight, and/or bottle) and their menu for many tastes. Â I came here with my family to celebrate a birthday for lunch. Â I was happy that they seemed to know how to accommodate a group because they had options ready to present for wines for the table and appetizers that are easy to share. Â We ordered all of the above and then ordered off-menu for our individual entrees.The menu is large and has meat entrees, burgers, sandwiches, seafood - something for every eater. Â I enjoyed my veggie burger since you can get ANY of their burgers subbed with a house-made veggie patty. Â I enjoyed my spicy burger with an egg on top of my veggie patty. Â Yum. Â The fried jalapeno pieces were delish and the burger really was spicy, which was excellent. Â Others in my group seemed to really enjoy the food that they got so everyone was happy. Â All in all, a satisfying dining experience.The servers are happy to make recommendations for wines to try, wines that pair well with certain menu items, etc. Â There's also cheese and charcuterie boards for those who are just interested in a light meal with their wine flight. Â Parking can be a bit tricky to find since this Cooper's Hawk is in the downtown Burr Ridge shopping center area. Â There's some angled parking right out front but larger lots are further down the road.

First time here and came to check it out for Burr Ridge restaurant week. Â Had a super nice waitress and the location was pretty solid but food is mediocre at best. Â Apps were solid, main courses were disappointing. Â Had the burger and I usually like mine medium-rare so I requested it but was told they can only be made well done. Â Tasted like rubber. Â Wife ordered some Parmesan crusted chicken that tasted like they forget salt. Â Dessert was uneventful. Service was super slow.

I came to this Cooper's Hawk for a work meeting. The event space was adequate, however, there was no way to show a electronic presentation in the room we were in, so we were forced to use large poster boards.The service was not the best. We were a medium sized group (about 20 people) and we were deserted for most of the meal. Everyone had to order all their drinks quickly all at once, for fear of never being asked again.There were two food options for our group, a meat or a chicken. I ordered the Dana's Parmesan-Crusted Chicken. The chicken was good, but it's definitely nothing I would order again. It was served with green beans and a rich potato dish.The wine was tasty, but much of it was too sweet for me to be tempted to buy a bottle on my way out.All in all, there was really nothing special to bring me back and there were some disappointing parts (likely due to being part of a larger group).

This could have definitely be a bad review due to the fact the girls at the front took our number and said they would text us when our table was ready and that never happened. While waiting we hungout and did the wine tasting and had such a great time with Dan (I could be wrong on his name) but he was great. Thank you for turning a possibly negative experience into a positive one!
Other than of course what their known for (wine) this place is not all that when it comes to food. Â The appetizer portions were huge but when the food is mediocre an extra serving doesn't matter.

Cooper's Hawk Winery and Restaurant is such a great place for so many reasons. Here you can find a pretty good selection of wine, wine gifts and delicious food to cater to all palates.If you are inclined to have a bottle of wine at dinner and enjoy having a selection of reasonably priced wine at your home, the wine club is worth looking into. For a set price each month, you receive 1-2bottles of wine and depending on the package, free monthly wine tastings. You can take your accrued wine home with you or you can enjoy it while eating at the restaurant or bar without a corkage fee. If you are unlikely to visit monthly, it is still great. The bottles accumulate and you can pick them up anytime. That said, I have gone on a hiatus and picked up 8 bottles. I have a friend who used a year's worth of wine for her rehearsal dinner. You also incur points which equate to dollars you can spend when dining.Now that I am through raving about their wine club membership, I can tell you about the amazing menu options. I love their drunken shrimp, southern grilled shrimp and polenta and the bannoche pie. I can also say I have not tried a menu item that I did not enjoy.I have had the pleasure of dining at this location twice within the last month and it is my preferred location and one I plan to visit regularly going forward.

Food was amazing. Unfortunately, the service didn't meet expectations. We mentioned a special occasion 3 times to our server. And the wine steward...21st birthday). Not only was our daughter not carded, but the occasion was never recognized.At the end of our dinner, a waitress clearing tables dragged a chair across the entire dining floor making an extraordinarily loud noise, disrupting all dining conversations. Very rude!

I heard such great things about this place. Â I was very disappointed. Â I had the Chicken Madeira, a dish I regularly get at Cheesecake factory. Â Pro: I enjoyed the wine paired with my meal. Â Con: my meal was salty, like ocean-salty. Â I couldn't even do it. Â My husband got a chicken sandwich that was dry (sans any condiments).

Me, my sister and best friend ate at Coopers hawk yesterday and our server was Joshua. He was so pleasant, greeted us with a beautiful smile. Always came to check on us to make sure we we were ok, and food was delivered hot to us. When we return, I'll love to be seated at his section. We will be returning..

I recently went to Cooper's Hawk Winery and Restaurant is on a Wednesday evening with some girlfriends. We decided to try the tasting while we were there. I really enjoyed the wine tasting our host was this really nice girl by the name of Shelby. She already knew one of girlfriends because she signed her up to be a wine club member. However I was really impressed that she actually remembers her and you would have thought that they were really close friends. While we were tasting Shelby was telling me about the wine member benefits and I must say it really is worth it to be a member.When we used my friends member card she was able to get two free tastings and also get a deal on the chocolate covered strawberries we also order. We also were able to use her member card towards our bill which allowed us to have the price cut dramatically. Â At this location they had a pretty good selection of wine, wine gifts and delicious food to cater to all palates. We were seated as soon as our tasting was finished, Shelby had told them to add us to their list so we wouldn't have to wait which was perfect.For dinner I ordered the sweet red/ romance red bottle of wine at dinner. I ordered the SPINACH & CHEESE CANNELLONI WITH SHRIMP which was a pasta. The pasta was really good. The portions are a really great size, my friend and I shared our pasta so that we both could if we liked it. I am not sure what pasta she had but that was also very good. We all were pleased with our food.Although they do not have a location in Dallas, When I come home to Chicago I plan to visit regularly going forward.
Wine tasting! Perfect place for it. Join their wine club and you get two free wine tastings a month. The restaurant is quiet and the ambiance is nice. My favorite is ahi Tuna, delicious!

But we had the BEST service ever. I wish I remembered our waiter's name. He had a really big personality and was so helpful, kind, and attentive. 10 stars for our fabulous waiter.The food was meh. I ordered some pork belly sandwich and it was not edible. The pork was ALL FAT. I ended up getting it switched for a roasted veggie flatbread. But that was just average.

Great lunch option at Brookfield Square. Â All the food was amazing and the mimosas were mad good. Â It's not terribly loud in the dining area, which is nice if you're trying to chat with others (was there with my grandma). Â Our waitress was super attentive and sweet.

The Ice Wine was amazing. The Nightjiar was pretty good. Those are for anyone who loves sweet dessert wines. The White Sangria was also pretty good. I loved the fact that it only costs $7 for 8 1 oz pours of wine. Darius was amazing! So nice! I loved the atmosphere and the chocolates especially the chocolate strawberries. Overall, great time.

Never have I waited for over two hours in the middle of the day. Nor have I ever been given the excuse of a Cub's game and construction as a reason to misquote a seating time by over half an hour, essentially unapologetically. I must say I'm not only disappointed but angry and will likely not patronize the Burr Ridge location for some time, if ever again. In addition, I'm considering not renewing my monthly wine membership. Is this an organization we really want to be a part of? Not so sure. What I am sure of is, the hostess desk needs to be staffed with the most friendly and positive people in the building. If they change anything expeditiously, it should be never let a staff member tell a customer "I don't know what to tell you, we're running behind, you'll be seated". The waitress Emily and the manager were very helpful and apologetic for how we were treated but the bad taste remains on how poorly we were treated by the hostess crew.

I do love the wine and food butttt the problem is they are TOO popular.Wednesday night at 8:30 and it`s an hour and a half wait for a table. Friday night asked for reservation for 9 and nothing for TWO hours!! Thats nuts !!. Â  Â  Â  Â  Â buh bye !!Too many excellent area restaurants along the way for me to wait an hour and a half or two

I live nearby and frequently go here. The food is very "American" but they have different influences (French, Latin, Asian flavors). The decor is a little dark, they have huge wine barrels throughout the restaurant. The service here is always great and they are accommodating. They often have coupons for complimentary wine tastings; It's for two people. Fun for a date night before or after dinner or while you're waiting for your carry out order. We really liked the fruity cranberry wine and prosecco. We have tried at least half of the items on the menu and my favorite is the BBQ ranch chicken salad and the gnocchi carbonara. It's convenient that they now offer online restaurant reservations and online ordering for carry-out. My only gripe is they often update the menu and some of my favorite dishes disappear. But luckily, everything I have tried there has been good.
First timer, the atmosphere is nice, but out bartender Ann's was not very accomondating. She kind of over looked us, standing right in front of her

My wife and I and 6 other friends ate at the restaurant on 2/13/16. After seeing the menu and seeing how much wine they had, one would expect many things to be great but it was not. The server did not bring bread to the table until we received our meal (really after we asked for it).I ordered the JalapeÃ±o Burger medium but received it somewhere between rare and medium rare... and the server explained to me that the temperature of the burger is indeed medium and I am wrong for complaining the this cow was still moving. Anyways she finally bring me another burger at what she called medium well buy indeed it was just medium as I asked for in the first place. However this 2nd burger was smaller than the first. So instead of correcting my order, I received a junior happy meal burger for $14
Our waiter Tom was awesome he did everything to make a perfect lunch. I do have to say he has been one of the best waiters I've had in months. Â  The wine is always good and my salad was very nice.

Ha what can I say. Wow tonight was the most horrible experience at Cooper's. Â My first visit. We started with wine tasting. After we were seated at our table. The waitress (Barbara) Â took our order. Â She only asked once how we were doing. She would pass by our table (didn't ask if we need anything). We had to flag her down each time we needed service. Poor customer service tonight. Mixed up my friend's reward card. She had to wait 1/2 hour to clear up the confusion to get her bottle of wine. Salad was delivered 15 minutes after meal. Manager (Ken) accommodated us with wine tasting and free appetizers. Not worth a return visit for us. So sad that this restaurant did not give genuine costumer service. Little effort means a lot. By the way I hear other location offers better service.Visitor from California
Love the appetizers! Service is ok. Dinner was average.Great location!

Great location, fabulous wine choices, and good food. We joined the wine club and we love it... The wine tasting is fun and the staff is great, they let you substitute from the list if you want to try something different. And we always get a couple chocolate covered strawberries and truffles to go along with the wine. Always look forward to coming here!

I love the decor here! Immediately upon walking in, you can browse all their wine accessories and try their wine tasting ($7). They have a variety of sweets (chocolate covered strawberries and truffles) if you're just grabbing wine at the bar. I highly recommend their Ahi tuna tacos. The quality of the fish is amazing and the portion is very filling. Check out their life balance menu. The portions are still very generous and each dish is under 600 cals! Enjoy:)

This is the third Cooper's Hawk location I've been to (Orland Park is the closest to me, and I've been to the Naperville location once).We tried this one out since it's the closest location to my office. We came on really snowy/crappy day so it wasn't overly busy until we were leaving around 6:30-7pm. First we did the wine tasting and the guy doing our tasting (forgot his name) was so knowledgeable about each wine we were trying. We've done several tastings at the Orland location, and they just fill up the glasses and move on to the next guest. This was a nice a touch! I also opted in for the Wine Club since we go to Cooper's Hawk so often.Our dinner was good, as expected. I got the Parmesan chicken, which is a spin on the more traditional style (no noodles, no heavy sauce), which I liked. My friend got the ahi tuna which is her go-to. We also ALWAYS get the cheese platter. Always, always. We love it, and we love the little sign that comes with it telling you about the cheeses you're eating. They ran out of the pepper jelly though and we weren't that big of a fan of the one they replaced it with.Our server was great! She knew we weren't in a rush to go back out and drive in the snowy / rain/ slush that had fallen upon us so she didn't pressure us to leave quickly at all.Of course the wine is awesome as always. I'm a sweet wine drinker because I'm not a big fan of traditional wine, and their cranberry, plum, raspberry, passion fruit, and cranberry mixed with sparkling almond wine are my absolute favorites.If you are a fan of wine, definitely try out Cooper's Hawk. They have something for everyone!

I have never been to a wine tasting at Coopers Hawk before but my friend said that it was a must try and I have to say, she was right. We had the best person (shout out to Carmen) helping is at the counter. The wine tasting is 8 different wines - you can try & if you don't like one they switch it out for you. If you're a part of the wine club you get a wine tasting for two every month. We really had a fantastic time.After our tasting, we decided to stay & have some appetizers. We ordered the egg rolls, flat bread & pork belly tostadas. Might I suggest the pork belly tostadas? Yesss! get them, they were delicious.The service was a little slow at the table but the server was nice.All in all it was a great trip to Coopers Hawk!

After hearing about this place for a loooooong time, we decided to go for dinner for our 6th wedding anniversary. Â I'm a big wine drinker, my husband doesn't drink at all, boo.We had a reservation for 7 and got there a little early. Â The tasting area was packed, maybe it felt more that way because it was a cramped space. Â We were seated at like 6:45. Â They send you a text message when your table is ready. Â I like that way better than those stupid vibrating light up buzzer things.I had been eyeballing the menu for three or four days prior to our arrival so I already knew what I was going to order: the gnocchi with roasted butternut squash. Â Oh and a white wine flight of course. Â No appetizers because I think only one was vegetarian and I'm not a fan of lettuce wraps of any variety. Â Ew.There was a note on the little piece of paper they left on our table that it was our anniversary but we didn't get anything special like some others mentioned that they did. Â I didn't expect anything, but it's always fun when it happens.Husband ordered the churrasco grilled steak which he loved. Â He also raved about his parmesan fries. Â He didn't even ask for steak sauce or ketchup.As for the wine... the chardonnay was the best. Â It was all good but the one I cared for the least was the Cooper's Hawk White. Â It was almost too sweet for me. Â I had to put a couple ice cubes in it to kind of water it down. Â I drank it all though, of course. Â The glasses definitely held a generous amount. Â I've had some flights before that had half of what I was given.We got dessert which was the banoffee pie or something like that. Â As the menu describes, it's graham cracker crust (they had me at that), bananas, toffee filling topped with whipped cream. Â That was goooooooood. Â We split it. Â I'm not a huge dessert person in my aging ways, but an exception was made for this evening.And of course, I ended up signing up for the wine club. Â One bottle a month variety of white and red. Â I was a little tipsy from my wine flight so I sat there and stared at the brochure for like 20 minutes trying to read it, but not really comprehending what it said so I'm not exactly sure how it works, but hopefully I figure it out soon. Â I assume I'll get an email or something to tell me to go pick up my bottle.I'd like it even more if my husband would have a damn glass of wine with me but that isn't going to ever happen so I guess it'll be just me indulging in the fruits of their winemaking labor.

I had the house salad, Â cheese tasting, drunken shrimp, and filet mignon along with the blueberry wine. The complimentary pretzel bread was amazing. More restaurants should have this.The cheese tasting was a great experience. It came with 5 different cheeses and the cranberry jalapeÃ±o spread was delicious. Purchased a jar to take home. I wasn't so thrilled about the drunken shrimp- it was good, but nothing to rave about. Loved the house dressing, the wine, and the filet Mignon.If you eat a lot like me, be ready to spend your pretty pennies. My tab was $~80.The service was phenomenal.

I came here for my first time with my boyfriend for our anniversary. We came on a Thursday night, and we were seated right away. The waitress we had was very friendly & very attentive to us, which is definitely a plus we got great service.We ordered the Asian pork belly tostadas for an appetizer which were absolutely delicious. A different taste, but a good different. My boyfriend got the jambalaya, which he was very pleased with because jambalaya is his favorite dish to eat. And I ordered the trio of medallions than were also very delicious.I would have given them 5 stars, but I asked for a medium cook on the medallions and it was medium well more than anything. One of the medallions didn't even have any pink left at all in it. I'll definitely be returning though.
Cannot go wrong here! Excellent service, and a fabulous bottle of wine. We are thinking of joining the wine club!!! so many people were raving about it. Will be back!

Love their PRETZEL BREAD and silky smooth butter, a treat before meal and Paired well with my jasmine green tea. This place has very nice ambience and friendly staff. Their lunch service was quick and efficient. We ordered a crab cake bits and it came in no time. Our waitress Taylor always checked on us and made sure we were taken care of. Their entrÃ©e were delicious as well. My friend's Soy Ginger Salmon was just done right with the right texture and taste. The wasabi meshed potato was heavenly good. My chicken dish was not bad too though I wasn't a big fan of the side veggie, which was on the sour side. Overall, we had a good time with good meal and good companies at a comfortable ambience.

First time at Cooper's Hawk and I can't wait to go back! Boyfriend and I did wine tasting - wine was great and ended up joining wine club. Staff is fantastic and so helpful. We had the flatbread appetizer - delicious! I had the turkey and brie sandwich -amazing. He had the chicken madeira-wonderful!

This is a great place to go for a date night or grab an app at the bar area. Â From the steaks, risotto short ribs and dana's chicken I have never had a bad meal here. Â The only things I don't like and keeps this from being a five star review is that they not only eliminated the sampler platter, but they changed the calamari to have a sweet chili sauce on it now. Â I prefer a more traditional calamari. Â The wait staff I had was very attentive, refreshed drinks promptly and gave a great overall experience.

Love Cooper's Hawk so much we joined their wine club. We always have great service here and the food is always great. The only downside that drives me crazy is that when you walk in, you walk into the wine tasting area which is always jam packed and you have to push your way to the dining area. Perhaps the wine tasting area would have been better in a separate area. Wonderful gluten free menu for those that cannot have gluten.

Management reached out to me after my previous review and truly attempted to make everything right. I have since been back with my mom and BF and the service has improved! I'm so grateful because I enjoy spending time here. It even convinced me to become a wine club member. The food and wine continue to be amazing!

My friend is a Wine Club member, so she selected Cooper's Hawk for a weeknight evening wine tasting and dinner. This was my first tasting ever (I'm far from a wine connoisseur), so I wasn't exactly sure what to expect. Before going, I asked a friend, who previously lived in Napa, what to expect at a tasting. He told me that I would be able to just taste a few sips of wines or spit. However, this tasting had a lot more wine than I anticipated. You get eight "tastings" which are really glasses filled almost a third with wine. Wow! I selected the variety tasting, though all sweet wine was also an option. For someone who hasn't tried a lot of wine I like, I was impressed by how tasty some of the selections were. Due to the volume of wine, I recommend doing a tasting first, then settling into a long dinner if you're driving home. My only complaints were that the bar was pretty small, so I kept bumping into the guy next to me (there also weren't chairs). There were people waiting behind us to taste also. Although service was generally really friendly and competent (there were several people taking care of us), I wasn't a fan that one bartender tried to convince me to join the Wine Club multiple times throughout the tasting. Overall it was a fantastic experience, totally a steal for $7, and I will return!Next up was dinner. We are both vegetarians and there were plenty of options from which to choose. We both decided on the black bean burger to ensure we ate something substantial enough to soak up the wine. Service was cordial and efficient. We enjoyed a delicious pretzel bread and butter while waiting for our food. Luckily, the wait wasn't long at all. My black bean burger was very thick and big. The fries were great, too! Even though the entree was good, the pretzel bread was so delicious that I'm still salivating over it now.I had a really positive experience here and I'm definitely a fan. I will for sure be back to try another tasting and more menu items!
Food was good. Noise level was unbearable. Too many tables, Â I felt like I was playing twister to get to the table

I'm a wine club member so I'm always here. I prefer this location opposed to others. I never really dine in but I had Â $65 in coupons so I decided to try a meal. I haven't found a dish to rave over here yet. This time I tried the short ribs risotto. I told the server no cheese and it seems they left the cheese in anyway. I'll never try that again. I'm not to hopeful that I'll find a dish here that wows me unfortunately. Guess I'll stick to their wine it NEVER disappoints me!
Very loud atmosphere, but the food never disappoints. As always the wine list is always perfect, with many choices,
I love Coopershawk in OakLawn, the chefs prepare everything to perfection, especially the fish. The wine is awesome . The pistachio encrusted grouper is memorable.

Went there last night with my boyfriend for a wine tasting. We are apart of the wine of the month club so we get two free tastings a month. The wine club is a great investment, I think everyone should definitely consider joining. I'm writing this review bc we had such a great server last night for our tasting. Brandon was very attentive, very knowledgable, and very honest. He took us through the tasting with great suggestions and great descriptions of the wine. Definitely will be going back to that location.

Went here on a Saturday night with a 6:00 reservationHad to wait about 10 minutes for our tableTaylor was our server and she was Great !Had the shrimp & potstickers for appetizersWhile we all had the salmon from the life balance menu + a bottle of Pinot NoirThis was our 3rd time here & we were Very Satisfied !We'll return on our next Chicago visit
Wonderful selection of drinks and food. Friendly staff and nice environment. Â Loved the live music, too.
Great drinks awesome food and very good atmosphere. Seating can be long so come prepared to wait especially later on in the evening.

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE Cooper's Hawk!!! This happens to be one of my favorite locations. I can't say enough good things about this place. The food is outstanding and their Sangria is to die for!!! This place can get pretty crowded at night, so I suggest making a reservation!

Go for the wine and food! Don't go thinking you will get decent service. 2 bad service experiences, both of which the Manager took care of! Wine pick up is fine for me in the future.... Plenty of restaurants in Burr Ridge. Â Did I mention how I love Eddie Merlot's? Great wine, food, attention, AND best of all COMMENDABLE service!!
