Â While I'm on the downsides, their draft beer list is on a rotating screen and the person at the counter taking the order had no clue what beers were being offered.Outside of that the food and beer selection was pretty fantastic. I ended up getting the BLAT. Â It had tons of crisp bacon, nice toasted brioche bread and creamy avocado. Â All things considered it is a nice location and one I would likely return to.

Used to be one of my favorite places,then they took the ONE thing I get off the menu.Whoever thought removing the 24 hour steak salad from the menu should be fired, tarred and feathered. Seriously, I am so angry about that I will never set foot in that place again.

Spent $35 on very subpar food- I don't mind paying for quality and maybe cause I got my food to go that I was sorely disappointed . Got the Buddha bowl and no ginger peanut sauce...instead they gave me a yellow mustard- mayo sauce X 2. Hangar steak salad for $14 was literally like an appetizer and sadly not great. And finally the Â kids grilled cheese was painfully bad- I mean how do you really mess up grilled cheese?? Waitress was very friendly though.I currently live in Chicago and now I'm reminded why the burbs get a bad wrap.

The Standard Market Grill is perfect for people like my husband and myself who enjoy grocery shopping dates! Â The food is always cooked well and tastes amazing and as a review that caught my eye said, "get the sweet potato fries!" Â They are amazing.The atmosphere matches the feel of the grocery store and is clean and updated.The service is very nice. Â Although you order up front and sit down to wait for your food, the rest of the experience is like a full service dining establishment. Â The staff is friendly and very helpful.This is a perfect place for meeting friends for lunch or taking the kids out to eat before restocking your refrigerator!

The manager of the Standard Market Grill on Sunday, January 17 was absolutely fantastic when it came to addressing food allergies and cross contamination concerns. I have not experienced such great customer service at the Grill before.He was extremely knowledgeable and really went out of his way to ensure our food was both gluten and dairy free!The food options are great, and I definitely recommend the "Kale Slaw" as a side. The Buddha Bowl is also amazing, and can easily be made gluten free friendly.

Food rocks. 5 Stars! Service not so much. 3 Stars.Can't take phone orders properly and the high school staff running the registers can't communicate.The male and female general managers get it. I understand they can't do everything but hire and train the rest crew.

The waitress accidentally threw away my Togo box and I told the manager. Said next time I came in I could get a free meal.When I came in for my free meal, standard also covered my boyfriends meal.Top notch quality service!!

My girlfriend and I came here for their opening and the food was delicious and service was friendly. It was nice to see that nothing has changed since my last visit, their four farmers salad was delicious (and healthy!)

Things have gone down hill at the Standard Market Grill since they opened. While the food is still fairly tasty, lately we have been either rushed through dinner (servers attempting to pick up our plates while we're still eating) or have waited more than 45 for ONLY half of our table's orders to arrive (while the other half's order was lost! ~ this was last Saturday, 1/23/2016).It's going to be a while before we come by again. We'll stick with the Cube in back.

I love standard market! Everything is so fresh and clean, it's the only stop to go for your proteins! They also have also have a fantastic wine section. I've yet to go to there restaurant and I most likely won't nothing against it I just prefer to shop there. They have a lot of great healthy options too

We went here specifically for the restaurant. Sure, the grocery store is nice as well, but the restaurant really takes the cake. The grocery store prices have niche items, so if I needed a specific ingredient and couldn't find it at a specialty store closer to me, I could probably look here. But, kind of out of my budget right now. The restaurant fits nicely within our budget, though. They have cucumber water and watermelon water, so that's free also.My husband ordered a chicken sandwich with chicken, cheese, and bacon. He orders a sandwich no other way. He liked it. He also had a bowl of chicken tortilla soup. He said it was good, but it was literally just chicken and tortilla chips. Usually there is some corn, tomatoes, beans, etc. in the soup, but not in this one. It was more of a chicken chili. Also, it came with tortilla chips on top..and a dinner roll...and packaged oyster crackers..so carb heaven.I ordered the veggie burger and I can confirm that it is not just a Morningstar or Boca burger patty. I asked and they do make them daily. Granted, I'm sure that's a given, but it seems like most restaurants just use frozen patties. Anyway, it was delicious and I would order it again. Maybe without the BBQ sauce (I'm just not a super BBQ fan). I did like the buttermilk garlic, though.And the fries...oh. the fries. Delicious. Freshly made and really, really good. If you're trying to be healthy and order a salad, good for you. The fries are worth it.Only downside is the seating. There needs to be a wall separating the ordering line from the booths. Otherwise, we had people watching us the entire time we ate. And maybe a better system for seating people. There were people walking in and saving tables so that by the time we ordered, there was only one table open.This is definitely a place to which we will return.

I love this place! Clean, modern interior with lots of fresh dining options. They also have a good selection of beer and wine. We had brunch on this visit. Loved the fact that they asked if we wanted our dishes split for sharing. We ordered the Belgian waffle and breakfast burrito. Both were fresh and delicious. Also love the water which they infuse with fruit. The only thing that confuses me about this place is why it's never packed. We will continue to come back!

I don't think we will come here again.The food was overpriced.The windows were smeary.My wine glass was dirty.The protocol was confusing, do we tip the guy who brings out food when we stood in line to order it?Ridiculous amount of loud, poorly behaved children in every seating space. I don't mind kids, but screaming kids make the dining experience less enjoyable.
Had their cajun fish sandwich- delicious! Even the half sandwich leftover eaten cold the next day tasted great. I'm also a fan of their kale slaw: well-seasoned with a perfect kick of spicy.

Have tried this a few times, but prefer the Westmont location over this one.Bad service, dirty tables everywhere, and served the wrong thing on two consecutive visits. They just don't have it together.
I love the healthy choices! Food options are wonderful and delicious. My personal favorite is the Buddha bowl! Can be a bit pricey! And service isn't the best.
Sweet potato fries are amazing!!! Love that you can buy alcohol from the store and drink it at the restaurant. Customer service is always great and food is fast and delicious.

I love the standard market. My husband and I would drive to westmont (45 min drive) before this location opened up. We love there quality of food. We always get our fresh fruit and veggies here. It's a guarantee fresh, local (meats) and full of flavor. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for quality freshness! The employees are helpful and nice as well.

Oh my Lord, was this place awesome! The grocery store alone is tremendous, but my lunch at the Grill took me over the top. We had the grass fed burger with white cheddar cheese, tomato bacon jam, kale slaw, and red onion on a pretzel roll. I ordered it medium and it came out light pink in the middle and juicy. The jam was quite strong, but I liked how the raw onion cut the flavor. And you can't go wrong with a pretzel roll.I also had the mustard honey chicken sandwich. Pretzel batard, grilled chicken, Monterey Jack cheese, roasted red pepper, bacon, avocado, Bibb lettuce, red onion, mustard-honey. Everything just came together perfectly. I'd order it again for sure.And the sides are great. The market side salad as these soft cornbread croutons. There is no crouton anywhere near as good as these. And it's true, get the sweet potato fries. Incredibly thick, nicely seasoned, and a good honey-mustard dipping sauce. I want some chicken fingers for that mustard!!!The Arnold Pomer was a really good drink; it's basically an Arnold Palmer with pomegranate juice. Very refreshing and refills are free. And there are no salt and pepper shakers. They give you a grinder that has coarse salt on one end and peppercorns on the other. You grind either side, so both the salt and pepper are as fresh as can be. Awesome. And the service was really good, everybody was very friendly.For a casual place, the ingredients are top notch and the menu is unique and creative while being approachable. Definitely will return.

Ordered on grubhub for pickup, went to standard market to pick up my order and mistakenly they gave my order to someone else. So they said they would make me a new one... no big deal. Then I hear the manager yell "we just lost out on $12!" Whatever so I waited about 15 mins and all these other people are getting their orders, when one of the cashiers saw I was still waiting. She went up and asked what was going on with my salad... they clearly forgot about it. They finally made it and the cashier was very apologetic and she seemed to be the only one who wanted to help me out. But no drink while I wait or cookie to leave with. Anyways I leave, start eating my salad and it's missing ingredients, this is the second time they have forgot to put avocado in my salad! I get this salad at least once a week and it's usually good. For $12 it should be made right every time! Not sure what happened but standard market grill is not as good as they use to be.

Very busy. So busy that the family in line in front of us walked away when the cashier warned of a 20-30 minute wait on food. The food was above-average. My pizza with goat cheese and mushrooms was decent, but barely warm. Proof that the kitchen was overwhelmed and rushing food. My daughter had the chicken Buddha bowl which she loved. The food runners were running and the environment waschaotic. Expected better, but maybe it was an off day for them.

I can't say enough good things about Standard Market Grill. Â We were there for a party and unfortunately I snagged my pants on a nail sticking out of a booth. Â Standard Market paid for the repairs to my pants, and even showed up at the tailor personally when they wouldn't take a credit card over the phone.The Super 7 with grilled salmon was excellent, and I was impressed with the craft beer selection on tap. Â I'll definitely be back to walk through the market area, which definitely looks to give Whole Foods or Mariano's some stiff competition.Well done Standard Market.
Very good! Easy atmosphere with really inspired dishes. I had the Crunch Salad and it was a great vegetarian selection, with so much flavor. My husband had the chicken cuban and loved it.
So many options! The food is top notch. Great beverage/brew selections. Tired of the grill...cool just hit the cube.I little pricey but who cares.It's only money.

This review is JUST for the restaurant. Check out my seperate review for the grocery portion.Came here for lunch. It is the type of place where you order at the register but then have a server from there on out. Brock and I split the mushroom/goat cheese pizza (AHH goat cheese!!) and the blue cheese steak sandwich. We were lucky enough to find a seat on the patio where we waited with our pager-thingy. The neat thing is that the pager has a gps of some sort so your server can tell where you sit and bring your food to you. We even moved seats once and he figured it out!Our food was brought quickly and was delish! The pizza was larger than I expected, definitley sharing size, and the sandwich was average size. The pizza was a kind-of cross between a flatbread and a regular pizza, kind of rustic, with perfect crust. The steak sandwich was cooked well, rare, and was of average tenderness. It still got stuck in between your teeth as rare steak typically does. The star of the sandwich though was the blue cheese aioli. It was not too pungent but you certainly knew it was there. I am not a HUGE blue cheese fan but this was balanced perfectly. The sandwich was paired with fries which were average if you ask me, I don't know what other Yelpers are raving about there.The service was excellent as was the value. Our freshly squeezed lemonade even came with refills which NEVER EVER happens. Our server was attentive but not overbearing and came with warm chocolate chip cookie chunks to accompany our check.The patio is small so the seating is a little tight but I love eating outdoors. I'll be returning if i'm in the neighborhood.

This is our "go to" default restaurant for our date nights, and it doesn't disappoint.It is a really casual, chill, and warm atmosphere that serves GREAT food. The service is good. No memorable, but good. Especially since the menu options are on display on the wall and over the cash register. That's what makes it more casual than it could be, but if it is attached to a grocery store in the 'burbs, what would you expect? No Maitre D' in this place, and that's OK.Starting with the appetizers, I always order the chicken tortilla soup. It is VERY heart, full of generous pulled chicken pieces. It has a 'bite' to it, like they added a spice that doesn't make it burn on the way down, but defintely reminds you of it's heat potential with a spicy aftertaste.MMMMM....Each time I indent to oder a cup, I default to the bowl size and end of waxing it off. Minus the tortilla strips added to the meal, it's one of the healthier meal choices you can make in this place, especially if you are among for a gluten-free meal. Here is the bonus: If you don't finish your soup and take some home in a doggy bag, Day old soup is the BEST!Order the sweet potato fries over the regular fries...You can't get good fried at many restaurants in the area, but a generous portion of well seasoned sweet potato fries are far and few between. One side of this is too much for one person - definitely sharing size.The kale slaw is an interesting version of their original cole slaw. I enjoyed both. When I am nutrient-conscious, I'll order the kale. It's a bit tangier. When I don't give to farts on what goes into my body, and I want a calorie rich meal, enter the coleslaw...it is very tasty.Believe it or not, you can make a complete meal with the appetizers alone. That's how a control my portion size and $ when dining.The grass-fed burger is really good. It's well cooked and worth paying the premium for a burger in this establishment. I'll put it on the same level as Ted's Montana restaurant. Thats says a lot about the quality of the food. Trust me...I am a man who 'knows his meat'.....wait, that didn't sound right....The asian chicken salad is HUGE and tasty. Huge and crappy is never good. Huge and memorable - always better. They don't drench the salad in dressing, which is what i personally prefer. The portion size is a full entree itself, and maybe shareable (depends who you are with, I guess).Being on/off on a paleo diet, this restaurant is paleo friendly. For those gluten-free crossfit gym rats out there,

We havent had a bad meal at this place. The staff is always friendly, and the specials are always interesting. Ive had their burgers, sandwiches, and breakfast so far, all have been good. They make a decent arnold palmer, and I have yet to try their smoothies, but I have seen them and they LOOK really good.
Standard Market Grill has great burgers. Â After you eat, check out the store. Â I am normally in the Westmont Standard Market, but it was fun to check out Naperville.
Great store with awesome! Â They sever the best salads and turkey burgers in their cafÃ©. Â Love it.
The best food around!!! I love to order at the front and the flavored water.Pizzas are to die for and the hamburgers so juicy. Good job. Keep doing like that!!

The best of the Standard Market Grills in the area. The staff is the best of the best. Extremely professional and courteous and so good at what they do. And they do it well. I have been to the Westmont Standard Market Grill. The Naperville location is superior in food and the quality of service. I don't eat anywhere else in the Chicago 'burbs.

I love this place.I try not to go too often, because it is on the expensive side, but it is a great if you are shopping for a special occasion or something out of the ordinary.They have a great selection of meats, including lots of preseasoned/marinated options.They also have a really impressive coffee selection.The wine bar is a nice place to relax for a bit after an afternoon of running errands. You can even buy a bottle in the store and drink it there with no cork fee.

Extremely overpriced. Â All of it. Â There's nothing here that you likely can't find at Trader Joe's.Or Whole Foods, if you have no soul.The grill is OK, again due to the pricing. Â My wife and I paid $60 for two entrees, a few sides, and a few drinks. Â Not great. Â Food quality was good, but due to the pricing alone, it makes it seem less than great.

I am a regular at standard market and I absolutely LOVE there meals for 2 so I have been waiting to come to the grill. I ordered the pesto chicken sandwich, it was really good. My fiancÃ© ordered the Cuban chicken sandwich, which he enjoyed as well. My moscow mule was off though, very lemony. It just didn't seem right.Our service was a little less then average. We sat at the bar so we were up close to all of the action. It was very busy, but just sitting next to two working the bar we didn't get asked about drinks for about 10 minutes. Being at the bar, and I n front of all of the workers in the 45 minutes we were there we witnessed 3 meals being refunded.My over all impression was that yes it was busy, however I feel like I saw lots of confusion with workers. I think if it was more like an average restaurant where you sit down and order (which I was very surprised when I realized you ordered at the counter) then the workers would be less confused and wouldn't wander around the entire place with found searching for the right table.

So, delicious food in a casual and comfortable environment. Love that. They have a sunny outdoor patio which is where we dined on our first visit, but the inside is nice, clean and modern as well. My friend and I shared a pizza with goat cheese, spinach, red peppers and olives and we both loved it. We also had the four farmers salad which was full of fresh and tasty ingredients, but that didn't get finished because we were distracted by their amazing french fries. Hand cut, with some skin left on, and the right amount of salt. Not greasy either. Just perfect. I had a $5 margarita because it was on special. Drink prices were a little high given how casual the restaurant is and the location, IMO. Â My husband said he really enjoyed his sandwich and that he would totally come back here. I responded with "we could've come here so much sooner if you hadn't kept shutting it down!" We'll def be back.

Have you ever seen a pretty grocery store?!?! If not then this is it. I have never seen a grocery store that actually looks pretty when you first walk in but we shall see how long that lasts since I went there right when they opened... Its actually kind of a small store considering the way the building looks but it also has a restaurant/grill attached. Anyway you can kind of expect whole food prices when you walk through the door, but in my opinion better products. This place doesn't try to shove everything in your face like other places nor do they overstuff there sleeves. Also the cafe place is really nice. Kind of small but they make an amazing matcha latte and chai tea... I didn't get the chance to try the coffee yet but I'm sure I will be back to do so....I think I need to go back to form a better opinion of this place but overall I do like it

Yesterday was my second visit here and I liked it even more than the first. Â I had the Four Farmers salad. Â YUM! Â I can't say I've ever had a salad with hazelnuts and dates in it. Â It was so so so good! Â If you like the sweeter tasting salads that have goat cheese, avocado, fruit and nuts, this is your salad. Â They mix the dressing into the salad perfectly! Â I was thinking about it all day today and wondering when I will get my next Four Farmers salad. Good portion size, too! Â Well worth the $12. Â I felt it was more of a value than the sandwich I got there the first time.I enjoy this restaurant. Â It's clean, contemporary. Â I like the bar area that overlooks the open kitchen area.I like the flavored water stations that you can help yourself to.They will bring you little samples of their chocolate cookie bars. Â Mine were hot out of the oven and really good.Until next time Standard Market Grill...

Went for lunch, and its pretty good. Its a bit more expensive than I'd usually go for, but it is really yummy. I had the 24 hour steak and it was pretty great. I don't think I would have ordered it if someone else was paying since it was a $14 sub sandwich.
awesome little market. They even have a bar where you can drink the wine you bought in the food. TVs to watch the game. And excellent seafood
Wonderful place. An expensive but I like be there. Good energy. Â The employees are wonderful. Â Thank you all

My friend and I choose this as our go-to place for a relaxing atmosphere and tasty meal. We both order the grilled cheese with sweet potato fries ($9) and we love, love, love it! Menu hack: If you don't want bacon on your grilled cheese, ask for the kids grilled cheese with sweet potato fries. Basically the same size and costs only $7!

I get the chicken Buddha bowl here and I love it so much that I have a hard time trying anything else from the menu - the veggies always taste fresh, the chicken is always tender and flavorful, and the sauce is incredible. It's basically the perfect meal, for me.The price is right, too, since it's about $12 (with tax) for the chicken Buddha bowl, and you get a large portion that's presumably made with higher quality ingredients than most places use.I *really* don't like that they don't provide nutritional information. I looked everywhere I could think to look, and still have no idea how many calories, how much sodium, etc. is in their food. I'm not a crazy health nut or anything, but I like to know... and I'm sure there are lots of health conscious types that would also appreciate that information.

The food is delicious with generous portions! Â Only weird thing is how much of a tip do I leave?I've also ordered online & picked up. Â This works smoothly! Â Their turkey burgers are fabulous! Â I eat gf and they now offer a gf bun (which was tasty!)

Went here for Sunday brunch. Service was poor. Women taking orders at front were rude and unfriendly. One of the worst cups of coffee I've had in recent memory. I got the early riser pizza, which was ok, except the over easy egg that comes on top, was sunny side up with lots of clear gooey membrane floating and jiggling around. Gross

Love this place although it does get really busy durning lunch hour - I usually call my order in for take out and bypass the waiting line. But if I go end up eating there I recommend skipping ordering a drink and going with their infused water - yummy. The menu is great and food is always well prepared...

Standard Market is the Apple store of grocery stores. It's expensive and only sells select items but it's a great experience overall. My only complaint is that sometimes the staff is not as knowledgeable about current sales as they should be and I often have to wait while someone goes and confirms the price. This also reflects poorly on their inventory system. All in all, I love it and am there a few times a week.

Best food across the suburbs! City vibe. My fav place for breakfast (pourover coffee), lunch (budda bowl), game night (roadhouse burger and beer), and dinner (steak!!)... Exceptional service. Manager is on top of everything!! Just a great time every time we come out... We drag all our friends here! Price tag is friendly for all as well...

Got takeout for dinner tonight. Chicken was delicious. Somewhat dry but still good. The mashed potatoes tasted like they were from a box. My sister got the salmon. She was upset because it barely had any flavor. I tried it also and she was right. The rice had the same flavor as chlorinated pool water. The salmon was dry also. I'm not sure why this happened. I had high standards after hearing about them from friends but this was unfortunate.

Both the market grill and cube restaurant in the back have great food. I have been there a few times know and have never had a bad experience. My favorite is the farmers pizza they also have good sushi. Another great thing about this place they have a very large selection of craft beers. If your lucky on Tuesdays they get there shipment of three floyds!! Does not last long... So get there early I have been there a few times for lunch on Tuesdays by noon not much is left.
Really a 4.25-4.5, what can I say, great menu, many options for an omnivore like myself and vegetarian like my wife. Decent beer and wine list. I love coming here.

You must go to the cube! Not only is the food and wine AMAZING but Luke, their wine specialist, is beyond helpful and kind. If you're going to the cube you must ask him for a recommendation. We've been here many times and have never been disappointed. 5 stars all around!!

My wife and I have been to the Standard Market Grill almost 20 times since we moved to Naperville in June. It is fantastic. Best sweet potato fries anywhere. Generous portions. Delicous food. We also love the flavored water we can get at our leisure. They have done pineapple, cantaloupe, cucumber, and berries. They are all terrific.The other amazing gem here is their coffee shop. We are coffee snobs and this is the best in Naperville. Try the pumpkin latte and you will not regret it.

The Buddha Bowl with perfectly seared tuna. A bounty of veggies, brown rice. Not too saucy, flavorful without being salty. Hubby has the spin class salad-really enjoyed it! Only thing I would say is that I would have liked another ounce or two on my tuna portion.

The last 2 times we called ahead to order place an order it was not ready when we arrived. The second time I had to wait 20 minutes longer than i was told on the phone. When we got the food home the sweet potato fries were stringy and burned. Disappointing....The food is excellent. We order or eat in at least once a week. The BBQ chicken sandwich on the pretzel roll is fantastic. Chicken tortilla soup is great and make sure you try the sweet potato fries. I have never had a bad meal here. Tip - sit at the bar and order and skip the lines when it is busy.

We love the food here but every time we order food for pick up they always mess something up or forget to put something in the bag. I wish I was exaggerating when I say always but it truly is every time. If you order food be sure to double check. I believe it is a systems issue bc this happens to us at both the westmont and Naperville location. The sweet potato fries used to be one of our favorite staples but they must have changed how they make them bc now they are soggy and not as good quality.I went there Sunday bc I enjoy this chia teas. My husband brought me my drink. It tastes like dirty dish water and was disgusting. I brought it back and complained about how wrong it tasted. The girl behind the counter said she could make me a new one but it would take a few minutes to make the chia. We were in a hurry so I had to get the receipt to make the return. I'm concerned that it wasn't made right in the first place bc the chia wasn't brewed and she just threw something together hoping it wouldn't be noticed. I'm very disappointed.

The four farmers salad is the best salad in the town of Naperville. Which may not mean much to many people, but it's a damn good salad so just get it. I almost 75% certain that the champagne vinaigrette dressing is poured down onto Earth via a spout from the heavens.

We have now been to the Standard Market Grill for both lunch and brunch. The food quality has always been great! The service is friendly, but can be a bit slow. I do wish they would expand the brunch menu a bit, maybe add a french toast or pancake option, maybe some options of customizing the breakfast burrito? The lunch menu is extensive and varied.Overall, great addition to the area!

Standard Market has lots of options, for health & convenience.It's hasGrocery MarketCateringThe Grill (restaurant)Cheese & Wine (with a bar)DeliThis is a Chef driven business so everything seems to be pretty top choice^_^ almost everything is top quality with almost no artificial preservatives/additives. Prices are similar to a Whole Foods, so it may seem a bit pricey but this day and age we end up having to pay a little more for REAL food as opposed to over processed, mass consumer items. I'm the kind of person who tries to save money where I can, but when it comes to what I put into my body I will pay a little more to put good stuff into it.Not to mention it tastes better ;))*gluten free options available in grocery store & at restaurantPs the sweet potato fries are amazing & my BF worships the bacon hahaha :)~Sandwhiches we tried we delicious! We had the *24 steak & BLAT (with Swiss cheese & egg added). The steak was perfectly done so you didn't have to rip at it through your sandwich. The Swiss cheese on my BLAT went perfectly with the fried egg (I added both of those).Enjoy!^_^ Cheers

Yum. We frequent the grill, food is really good especially the burgers and chicken sandwiches. I will have to try the infamous Buddha bowl as the yelp fam keeps raving about it. I was introduced to Angry Orchard ale (aka Angry Bird because I accidentally called it that on more then one occasion) here and have been addicted ever since. Service is good and food comes out pretty fast. Great casual environment and I really enjoy sitting out in the area where the fireplace is. As other reviewers stated it is on the pricier side, however you can get a good meal here.

Let me pre-face this by saying, I am a huge fan of Standard Market Grill and have eaten many a meal here. Now when I walked into this fine establishment on this fine day and observed the fine menu board rich with options, I was blinded by my previous experience. I ordered the Brunch Burger, a delicacy by my standards, and my amigo ordered the Brisket Grilled Cheese. I had been resting in the booth with my good friend when after an extended period of time my friend had his meal and I was still waiting for my glorious sandwich. I had to go say something to the server and finally I had the beloved burger in front me. Considering the quality of food served here, I had high hopes that have never been disappointed before. You would think frying an egg is a simple task, but it seems the chefs that day had it out for my immune system (as in salmonella, which is rampant uncooked eggs). As for my friends brisket grilled cheese, it was less than satisfactory. He considers himself a connoisseur of brisket having eaten and enjoyed it for many years (he's pretty old but that's just between you and me). As I enjoyed my bacon and burger (minus the egg) I periodically looked over at him taking large slices of fat off of his grilled cheese. While I am no professor of brisket according to him this is one of the worst sins possible in meats. Over half of the brisket were large pieces of fat. With the combination of the poor service, and the lackluster elements of the food, Standard Market Grill was not up to standard

This restaurant is great. I love their Asian chicken salad -- full of tasty vegetables and lots of chicken. Everything I've tried, I've enjoyed. My kids love the fruit - infused water and the complimentary cookie bites at the end of the meal.

Standard Market Grill has a clean, bright, spacious and modern feel to it - very trendy! Â :)I ordered the Mediterranean Salad and it was one of the top three salads I have ever had - absolutely delicious! Â It comes with grilled salmon, balsamic dressing, field greens, Campari tomatoes, focaccia croutons, cucumber, feta, and Kalamata olives. Â The salmon was perfectly seasoned and cooked - tender and not overdone. Â The dressing was sweet and had the right amount of bite from the balsamic vinegar. Â Everything tasted fresh and was cut in small pieces for dainty eating. Â I could not put my fork down, lol.I also enjoyed the flavored waters - not sure what was in mine, haha. Â Maybe labels might be helpful?... Â ;)I thought the service seemed accommodating and friendly - I requested my salad without olives and my order was accurate.This is a perfect place for a "date" or a great place to take clients for a casual business lunch... Â I'm impressed!

The food here is really good. I love how many options they have. A salad with dates?? Â It was the Four Farmers salad. Sign me up. I know it's a salad but if your going to eat one at least let it be flavorful and this definitely was. Their prices are a little pricey considering what your getting. Â I don't mind paying a little more for quality. This is a type of place you eat at from time to time to enjoy. Not just to grab a quick bite to eat.

Had The Smith burger today over at The Cube with a great beer from SOB. They have now worked out the bugs for delivery from SMG. My food arrived promptly on a real plate with real flatware. The patty was nice and juicy and only slightly too well done. Cheese was nicely melted uniformly over the whole burger. A big improvement in presentation from last time. Fries were crispier, it seems that they are starting to hit their stride now. Very good experience at SMG/ TC today!

I love Standard Grill! Their menu is varied and offers several tasty options for vegetarians (as well as omnivores, obviously). I love the VGBG burger, which has an amazing texture and is topped with delicious gruyere cheese, bbq sauce and buttermilk garlic sauce. The sweet potato fries make an excellent accompaniment- they are thick and lightly salted, served with a yummy honey mustard dipping sauce.The service here is always friendly and helpful and they are really good at refilling your drink and even offering a refill to go, which is a nice touch! The little cookie bar samples after the meal don't hurt, either.

Like the store, the Grill be $$$. And frankly, for what I paid for a Buddha Bowl with tuna, I would have done better to get some sushi (at a sushi place). It just wasn't great. The seating area is nice, though; makes you mostly forget that you're in a grocery store. And the service checks up on you, so even though you order at a counter it feels more like a restaurant in that sense as well. The menu is big, and I have eaten at the location in Westmont with varied success before, so I'd be willing to give it another shot since it's convenient to me, but know that you're paying for a "real" meal in a place that is still after all attached to a supermarket.

Love this place! Â We first ate here right when it opened, and there were some growing pains. Â Now this is one of our first places to eat. Â Bar seating is great, with personalized service. Â Great turkey burger and thin-crust pizzas. Â Don't miss the chocolate cookie for dessert.

Where to begin. I've been to the Grill several times for a lunch and I absolutely love when I dine in. The food is amazing. I've always had a burger and haven't gone wrong yet. The music is great - like they are playing my favorite Pandora station. They also have an amazing water bar. And to top things off the server brings over a warm cookie bar. I love this place. The only downside is, every time I order my food to go it is never quite as good as when I dine in.One major thing - please bring back the original kale topping on the burgers. It was fantastic. The most recent burger I had, had a different topping (not as great).

This is not a super market, it is a market. It is a market with a grill/restaurant attached. Â  A very very high priced market, actually overpriced in many areas. Â But it has some interesting options. Â The "dinner for two" appears to be a good deal coming in at around $18.00, including a salad, entree, vegetable/starch and dessert. Â everything I put my hands on was expensive to me... unnecessarily so in many instances. Â I think the market caters to a different kind of ego that could care less about how much something costs. Â That's okay, just turns me off. Obviously the meat counter is phenomenal, but I can do better at Caputo's. The cheese and wine selection is large and varied, top of the line. Â The Grill is a nice option for lunch. Â It has an attractive bar, replete with a lot of craft beers. Â They make a good steak sandwich, and the fries are great. Â That's all I had so far along with an excellent craft beer. Â They try to take very very good care of you but customer service is sketchy, which is surprising. Â It's a nice experience, and I will go back just out of curiosity, or to pick up dinner for two. Â I would definitely do lunch at the Grill again. Â Not much more to say, but I will probably do another review at a later date...maybe my opinion will change. Â Do they have a Red Box?

I've eaten here a couple times, and they've always done a good job. The gluten free pizza is great, and decently priced too! I figure, coming out under $10 for a meal that feeds both me and my toddler is a win.Service is pretty good too. My only complaint would be that the lighting at night is pretty dim.Overall a nice place to grab lunch (especially when shopping next door takes too long!).

I come here quite often with my dad and the food is always excellent but the service is usually hit or miss. This past time we went we just happened to have sat in and area where we received amazing service. Our servers name was Kent and he was marvelous. When I asked for extra napkins he was back in two seconds. When we asked for boxes, same thing. And it was pretty packed. My dad and I felt as if we were his first priority at all times. He was fantastic. After leaving him a tip for his excellence, we went on to tell him and his manager how great he was. Every time we go back we will ask where Kent's section is:)

This is an upscale market with a wide selection of vegetables, grains, meats, cheeses, and wine! They even have their own bakery with pastries, cakes, and gelato. They also have a fresh juice bar for those of you who are looking for a fresh healthy juice. If only this place wasn't so expensive!!!

Can't wait to get back - amazing cafe (awesome coffee and good management) and surprisingly good restaurant - needless to mention a good grocery store.We had rice bowl - veggie, a steak dinner and both were fresh and good.Basically a huge fan of the coffee bar which is the reason I keep going there. Â Will provide a bigger review once I get back.Hoping the experience is the same.
Prices are kind of high but so worth it. The food is great- love their salads and burgers! Cocktails are yummy too. Portions are huge so you get your money's worth!
Oh my freaking God!!!!!! This place is the bomb freaking digity. I ordered some sort of salad with salmon. The salmon tasted like butter, and the salad was very fresh.

Besides the fact that it's pricey (which was expected) this place is awesome. They have unique everything and it's all delicious. The restaurant or "Grill" has a herb chicken dinner my boyfriend and I had for dinner and it was to die for.

Naperville has needed a place like this for a long time. Great food, great bar, great service. I had ordered online for takeout and my order was ready 10 minutes later when I arrived but I decided to eat at the bar anyway. Im glad I did because the bartender was very friendly, very knowledgeable and overall seemed like he knew wtf he was doing. My food itself needs no hyperbole or explanation. When I got up to leave he even gave me a chocolate chip cookie, compliments of the house. Like I said, great food, great bar, great service.

Really great food. We enjoyed the the salad and the burgers. The dining room was lovely. Â They really paid attention to the details. Loved the free flavored water. The prices were just a little high. The store was lovely.

Polite, clean and a nice selection for lunch. Â A tad pricey but taking a look at the decor and amount of staff on hand explains it. Â Everything was tasty but there was too much dressing on my salad and not enough toppings. Â Overall the service kept me from giving them a "Meh."

Was in the area and decided last minute to check out this place! We were pleasantly surprised at the price and the quality of food! I ordered the cuban chicken sandwich and the green envy juice which were both so delicious and they make sure to stuff the sandwich with lots of meat! My boyfriend got the tuna sandwich and his brother ordered the chicken/tofu buddha bowl! Both were very fresh and flavorful! If I went back I would definitely order the buddha bowl.
This is the new hidden gem in Naperville. Outstanding service and food. Great menu along with friendly service make this place truly enjoyable. I highly recommend you give it a shot!

I have been to this store four times now so I thought a review was in order. Â Very nice store, clean and well organized, amazing meat counter. Â Those are the only positives I can comment on. Â My main issue with this store is the employees. Â They are not helpful or attentive. Â They do not smile. Â They do not speak. Â I would even go so far as to say they act like they do not want to be there, period. Â Speaking from someone who has 17 years of retail under their belt, customer service should be their #1 priority. Â After my 4th trip there and another negative experience, I will not be returning. Â I was so excited for the opening of this store too. Â I will continue to shop at my favorite store on the corner of 75th and 59 where the employees are knowledgeable and welcoming.

Fresh produce, great selection of Meat, Cheeses and seafood. Â This is the new standard! Â Great bar area to grab a beer or glass a wine then finish your shopping. Â I have eaten at both areas, the cube and the main restaurant all meals have been great thus far'

I love the atmosphere, the convenience, the alcoholic beverage options, and the food is pretty good too, I think... My first visit I was blown away at the flavors of the Buddha bowl. It was SO good, but my second time ordering it, I was severely underwhelmed. I am skeptical of their consistency, but will have to try it out at least once more to know for sure. My husband also order burger on our first visit, and while the coleslaw was amazing, the burger was just okay and was kind of dry. It had all the right flavors, but the smaller size and dryness really made me not want to ever order a $14 small dry burger.

Absolutely love, love, love this place! I have been to the Westmont location several times and I was so excited for the Naperville location to open since I live right there. I have eaten at the Grill probably a dozen times. Their salads are all awesome as well as everything else they serve. The decor is very Caliifornia style which I love. The grocery store is great, too. Sure it may be a little pricey, but what store isn't nowadays? Their cheese selection is great as well as their craft beers. I can't speak highly enough about this place. You definitely need to check it out!
For what it is...5 stars. Â Very good, inexpensive Mexican food and open late enough for that later evening crave. Â Very friendly service as well.

First time coming here and I was pleasantly surprised. Â The restaurant itself is clean and has ample seating. Â The young woman who took my order was pleasant and cheerful. Â I ordered a steak burrito with sour cream and it was amazing! Â The burrito was large and the steak had a great flavor. Â It was especially good eaten with their green hot sauce (salsa verde). Â To top it off, if you eat in the restaurant chips and salsa are free. Â The chips were heartier and more authentic than what you would get at Chipotle. Â I also had their horchata (rice drink), which was tasty and included free refills. Â I definitely plan on coming back again soon.

Great for late night mexican!! Loved the enchiladas!! Authentic, and while not a sit down restaurant, the staff does go table side to bring salsa and check on ya!! Will definitely be back next time I'm in town!

This place is awesome. I love their chorizo tacos. Prices are on par with most other Mexican restaurants. They are open late on the weekends which is great if your looking for food late. They give you chips and salsa when you eat there and they refill your drinks. The suizo burritos are definitely another great choice. If you don't want to break the bank but want some good Mexican food them come here.

los taps is the best place to have a classic hangout with your closest friends. the staff here is like family and my friend group and i (3-15 people depending) choose los over anything else every wednesday night. perfect place for late night hang outs and late night cravings. celebrated my surprise 19th birthday party here and i wouldn't have wanted it any other place! atmosphere is chill and inviting and most of all... food is AMAZING. bottomless chips and salsa with the best horchata around. food is affordable and soooooo good. love los. love life.

We just found our new favorite Mexican restaurant in Naperville. The food is awesome, the service is excellent and the prices are very reasonable. Order at the counter and when you sit at your table they serve you with chips and salsa. The chips are very light and the salsa was perfect. We have the chorizo burrito which was loaded with meat and all the feelings. The tacos are phenomenal. It's a fast food restaurant with a sit-down restaurant feel. We will be back and make this our regular spot.

Kind of disappointing. We came here expecting more, but it didn't materialize. I had the fajitas, but not much taste here. The rice was undercooked and the beans were just OK. Â Even my Coke Zero tasted a little off tonight.My coworker had the ground beef enchiladas, which were fine until they cooled down.The one plus was the salsa was flavorful and spicy!!!Not sure if we caught them on a bad night or ordered the wrong thing. It got pretty busy after we sat down, so they must be doing something right!
Thank god this place exists. Moved here from CA two years ago and haven't had decent Mexican food often but this reaches my standard, if not exceeds it.
Very good food AND friendly service. Â Food comes out very quickly, so an excellent place for a weekday lunch. Â Looking forward to visiting again.
I love this place. The food is good and well priced and the service is always good.I usually get the chicken platter and have never been disappointed.

Got a steak burrito from this place. Â It certainly had a "mystery meat" quality to it, because I had to spit out 2 bones during the course of my meal. Â Plus, the meat was pretty oily. Â It also didn't help that there was a handwritten sign on the window with the word "Birria" on it, which is a stew traditionally made from goat or mutton (sheep). Â So I know there are weird meats in the kitchen.On top of that, while the cashier was friendly, the cooks glared at me when I walked in and when I was paying. Â I prefer to have my food made by someone who doesn't have an imaginary grudge against me or the world.Needless to say, I was thinking about heading to the toilet to puke it all back up when I was done with my meal. Â I will not be returning.That said, I've always liked the location on Ogden near Naper Blvd in Lisle. Â I know the older manager guy with the bad eye takes his work very seriously and makes a good burrito. Â I even called to complain once because I thought it was not meaty enough and he told me to come back for one on the house.

Love this place! They have authentic Mexican food which can be hard to find in Naperville. Most places are chain restaurants or Indian cuisine. If you're looking for tasty Mexican food that's open late, check this place out. Lomo tacos are amazing here.
Great Mexican food, great service, and reasonable prices. Complimentary chips and salsa when you dine in.
Food is not consistent all the timeThe tomato salsa have to much salt the meats are blend .The one on lisle is the best

Been Â a loyal customer to Los Burritos in Naperville since they opened. However, it's going down hill within the last couple months. There steak is now tough and I believe a low grade of beef, it isn't the same place I would go weekly to and enjoy lunch or dinner. I have called and received Â the run around regarding my concerns to talk to a manager or owner regarding the lack of quality of there food . Don't know if I'd ever go back , luckily in this area we have chooses of several Mexican restaurants to patronize .
My whole family eats here at least once a week. We love that it's so close to home and haven't had a disappointing meal yet.
Amazing steak burrito for a cheap price, opened late, will always be a returning customer!

I was really excited to try this place, as I've heard the food was good from friends. Unfortunately, it didn't live up to the hype. My chorizo burrito was inedible & covered in oil. My friends experienced the same issue Â with their chicken and steak burritos as well. The Â employees were very nice and the service was quick. I'll give this place another shot later on, but for now, I'm not impressed.

This time thought I'd stop by after A long day at work to pick up some dinner, on my way to an appointment. I drive up to the drive-through speaker and ask her if they have a certain type of entrÃ©e which is not listed on their menu. Only to be treated so rudely he buy some young drive-through attendant. Â I place my order reluctantly and drove off instead .....why subject myself to such awful service with a bad attitude and then give them my hard earned money? I don't think so. No problem... Went down the street to Las Palmas restaurant and got the best Mole enchiladas not to mention GREAT & very polite service. Â Not the way to treat your customers little girl.

Brand new location just opened in December 2014! Very nice inside and the employees are great as well. LOVE their food.....authentic and reasonably priced. Â Even have chipotle salsa which was delicious and haven't seen it at any other location that they have yet. Â You order to eat in, to go or call it in. They even have a drive thru which makes it the best location yet

I am very happy they opened this location which is very close to my house. The staff is very friendly and they do a great job with drive through service. The menu board for drive through is in an odd spot behind the building in the alley but they move it fast. The chorizo burrito is my favorite and the al pastor tacos or tortas are a great choice as well. The hot salsa is delicious and the chips are a decent complement to them. Not a fan of the guacamole as its rather bland.
I'm happy with this location. The customer service is very friendly and hospitable. The food is also delicious :)
Amazing place their steak burrito is authentic and beats chipotle by a landslide. Will recommend this place to anyone. Friendly staff. I love their drive through and they provide quick service
i love los burritos!!! their steak tacos are my fav!!!! my boyfriend and i go there at least once a week.
The steak burrito is amazing. Â The waiters are soo friendly and treat you like family especially when they are slow. Try the sopes too they are amazing!

Great burritos, and complimentary chips and salsa when dining in. I like the beef burrito, and my wife likes the chicken. Â  We sometimes go to the Lisle location as well, but this location makes the burritos a little wetter/saucier which I think is better. Â  My wife really loves the coffee, they make it with some cinnamon in it. It's a casual place, and excellent value.
The price is right! Food are perfect! Coffee are just right! Place is by the river! Breakfast by the river!

Great spot. No frills breakfast in a great setting - right on the Fox. One of the most extensive and affordable breakfast menus in the area - and, to my husband's absolute, utter delight - a Belgian waffle combo! I had the Bacado crepes - bacon, avocado, eggs, in delicious crepes with salsa on the side - so fresh, so good - so different!This place is good for kids - lots of room, and they were very accommodating with our 2 year-old. We will DEFINITELY be back :)

For me to give 5 stars for a breakfast spot says something. Their location is beautiful, you just have to see it for yourself. Their food was outstanding, top quality, and the coffee was strong; I had several cups which is rare for me when eating out. And the service...the service was perfection, and can only be compared to the personal attention you get at Aris Kitchen. The prices were amazingly fair, and surprisingly low for the location (Overpriced everything in Naperville needs to take note of this). This place has my highest recommendation.

There is nothing negative about this place, nothing crazy overwhelming either though.The food was tasty, simple and delivered quickly. The coffee was hot and kept coming.The view is also a HUGE bonus while eating.

What a great place to enjoy breakfast or lunch right next to the river! We got to try their famous French toast and omelette. Not only was the food amazing but the prices are very reasonable. Our total tab was only $20 for two people and we got two entrÃ©es coffee & soda. Our server was very friendly and very patient with us while we asked her questions about the establishment and food. It is a hard place to find and you could miss it if you drive by it so try this place out and you won't regret it and try to get a seat outside and enjoy the view of the river!

I'm surprised this place is highly rated. Had lunch here today and I was not impressed. I had the chicken sandwich which was just okay. It wasn't awful but it wasn't anything spectacular. My fries tasted like frozen fries that were popped in the oven. They were cold in the center.The place itself was pretty dirty. Lots of cobwebs...maybe it was decor for Halloween. The waitress was nice but not very attentive. I asked for extra napkins for the table and she only brought me one. There were four of us at the table. Should I have just split the napkin?I would not come back to this place. The lack of cleanliness was a turnoff.
Our go-to for brunch. Â Great place. Â The WoW French Toast is the bomb. Â Could use more staff in the peak periods, but solid spot in Batavia.
Food was average and the service was poor. One of the wait staff was maning the cash register. Long wait for service before and during breakfast.
Nice meal, great service!

Very impressed with their breakfast menu! We called ahead to see if they could handle a table of 17 runners. Upon our arrival, our table was set up waiting for us. The menu offered lots of options. The food was serves prompt and hot...delicious!! Staff was attentive and perfect! The location is on the Fox River; excellent view. This is a hidden gem!

Family owned and simple breakfast that has exceed my expectations more often than not. Â They'll even create items off menu. Â You can never beat a place that puts so much care into their customers. Â The cost is an added bonus. Â I love their breakfast burritos and salsa.

This place is dependable for serving good, nothing over the top, food. Â It has an awesome patio that looks out onto the Fox River which is nice and relaxing. It's shaded so its not overly hot in the summer time. Costs are very reasonable too. Please support this locally owned business!

One of the best breakfast places in the area. Â Nothing too fancy or pretentious, just affordable, home made food with great service. Â Portions are not over the top, which is great to see since so much food goes to waste. Â The coffee is decent as well, which is a plus for a diner-type establishment. Â Try the pancakes (they have so many options!), the pumpkin french toast or the omelets. Â Everything is so good!

Andre's is a great place for lunch. Â  Their porch is nice and a pretty quiet place by the river. Â  Their San Fran chicken salad melt is one of the tastiest sandwiches I've ever had. Â I ate it the first time I went and haven't ordered anything else since.

This is one of my favorite places to eat in Batavia for breakfast. Â It's family owned and the wife is the cutest thing ever. Â Her kids help her wait and are always pleasant. Â I take every outsider here when we are looking for a breakfast/brunch option. Â In warmer weather their porch is perfect. Â It overlooks the Fox River and the bike path. Â  They have great Spanish/Mexican influenced breakfast staples. Â My absolute favorite are the Enchilada Breakfast Crepes. Â Their Mexican omelets and eggs benedict are delicious too. Â Portion sizes are hefty for the small price tag. Â Their hash-browns are a must as well. Â They always come out super crispy which is how I like them.I have not had anything off their lunch/dinner menu, but everything I have tried for breakfast exceeds my expectations. Â It is also great to support small, family businesses in Batavia.

No no no. Its not good nothing here is really worth having a restaurant. Another bad Batavia restaurant.Its just nothing Â .. . you know there are places in the world that can make eggs bacon and hash browns really good...just not here...

We love eating at Andres! The food is always fresh and the servings are very big. Â This is a no-frills place where you can get a great meal and even sit outside on the porch overlooking the Fox River. Â We bring our kids here and they always make a fuss over them. The wait staff is super friendly and very accommodating. Â I would recommend this restaurant highly.
Well, there was lipstick on my girlfriends coffee mug, and a bit of lettuce in mine. Wish there wasn't a wait at Daddio's
Great family run restaurant with great service , friendly staff and delicious food for can't beat prices .

What a great spot. Â I wish more Batavia residents would support this place. The owners are very friendly and deserve so much success. Â  The food Is very good and reasonably priced. Â Will continue to come back.

This is a fav breakfast and lunch spot in the family. Â Great food, good prices, and a nice view out the windows onto the Fox River. Â They have a large menu to suit a variety of tastes. Â They have a lot in the way of vegetables and fruits in the menu items, which is greatly appreciated. Â One of us almost always orders something with avocado, and another fav is choosing one of their home-made breads made as french toast - most recently it was their banana bread french toast, with fresh sliced bananas and pecans over the top, with sausage links, and eggs for eight bucks...tough to beat that quality or price around here. Â A family runs Andres', and we're always remembered even if months go by. Â They have a shared lot behind a bank in downtown Batavia.

AWFUL! Â The place is far from charming, but old and run down. The food was horrible. Not made with fresh ingredients; the mushrooms still had that tin-can taste and the cheese tasted more like an edible oil product. Â The wait for a table was long and the time to get the food was way longer. Â Way overrated. Came home hungry!

My husband and I have breakfasted here four times over the past several years. We have never had a bad experience, either with the food or the service. Every time I go here, I wonder when or if this restaurant is going to get "discovered." We've never seen it crowded, especially when compared to other breakfast places in the area. On a recent visit, we were the only patrons in the restaurant. We are, admittedly, early morning people, but it was a Saturday morning and the restaurant was entirely empty. I prefer to lend my support to locally-owned businesses and wish that more people would tend to the few remaining locally-owned businesses in the area. I'd like to see this place thrive.

We enjoyed sitting outside on a beautiful warm day. All 4 of us ordered something different and all of us thought our food was delicious. Loved being by the river and enjoyed the quiet atmosphere. I am not from the area and looked on yelp for a place to eat. We were happy with our choice and will eat there again if we are in Batavia ,Il. The wait staff was pleasant and the service was good.
Great place to enjoy breakfast with wonderful views of the Fox River. Options to eat inside or outside on second story deck. Recommend the Down South omelette
Excellent food and really great people running the restaurant! Very nice family business. Highly suggest eating here.

The people that work there are sooo nice! The food is awesome and everything is fresh! They put a nice spin on all there dishes. Every time I go its delish! It's also nice it's right off the Fox River. Really nice view.
Cute place, very friendly staff, and Great food with great prices! They have a beautiful seating area facing the river. Very relaxing!

I LOVE this place! The owners are so great, and the food is amazing! My fav is the veggie quesadilla with the chicken tortilla soup-soooo good. The food is fresh, the service is good, and it is fun to sit by the windows or outdoors to watch the river. A must go if you are in the area!

The food is awful, not fresh, served with hair and the waitstaff was argumentative and not helpful.My husband and I went there this past Friday, other than the two of us there was one other table. Â My husband and I always pass this place on our bike ride along the fox river and have been wanting to try it so we finally had the chance. Â I don't know what the inside looks like since we walked straight onto the deck and were seated. Â The deck was nice and I thought we were going to have an enjoyable breakfast... I was wrong!It all started when I asked for a tomato juice with a lemon and was served a glass of tomato juice that tasted like a tin can and a lemon that looked like it was sitting on the counter for two days (dry and old). Â It was 10am so it was an old, old lemon slice not sliced that morning for certain. Â  I told the waitress the juice did not taste right and instead of asking if I wanted something else I was told she just opened the can and it was fresh, and that it is fine. Â  Needless to say I said I would be fine with water.When I went to order I asked if the bacon was made fresh and was told "that all the people love their bacon" Â I asked again if it was made fresh or if it was bought premade and just heated and was told "yes". Â I skipped the bacon and just asked for two eggs, hash browns, and toast.As my breakfast was served I took one bite of my hash browns and when I went for a second bite a short black hair was in the hash browns. Â I put it to the side and planned to skip the hash browns and just eat the eggs and toast. Â I wasn't going to say anything given I had just complained about the juice and lemon and didn't want to be difficult. BUT As I cut into the eggs and placed it on my fork the egg turned upside down and on the backside of the egg was two more short black hairs. Â At this time I had enough and brought it to the wait staffs attention. Â I was met with an argumentative response with her telling me they were not hair that they were potato's. Â I told her I know what hair looks like andI also cook and know what a potato looks like. Â She insisted that they were not hairs and that the cook wears a hair net! Â It was crazy! Â  She then backed off her explanation that they were potato's but still insisted they weren't hairs. Â I told her since she can't tell me what they are, and they are not food, I don't want the entree. Â After many times of her telling me they weren't hairs she asked if I wanted another order. Â I told her I would not.My husband was afraid to eat his dish but didn't want to cause more issues so ate. Â He said his dish was not a good dish to judge the place on because it was a healthy egg beaters breakfast sandwich was very tasteless and dry but he attributes that to it being healthy.I would never go back!

Happy with this location too! Â Burgers, grilled chicken, and sweet potato fries are my favorites. Â They also serve a few beers on tap. Â My go to burger is the bleu cheese with a 1/2 pound burger cooked to order, bleu cheese, bacon jam, arugula, on a brioche bun. Â Yum!A bonus, this location is actually not in the gas station. Â It's next to it!

What a nice, clean restaurant. Excellent customer service and my food was delicious. I stopped in after collecting coupon after coupon from the Cougars games. This location just recently opened up and it's the nearest to me. I got gas at the gas station, checked out the liquor store and then bought my lunch.The menu has apps, sides, wings,burgers, sandwiches and salads. My coupon was buy a main and make it a meal for free. After much thought taking in the menu, I settled on the BLT. It has avocado on it, which caught my eye. I got it on wheat bread, which they toasted just right and plenty of fresh lettuce and tomato plus a gentle amount of mayo, the avocado and the main star of the sandwich, the bacon! It was perfectly done, just thick enough and in between crispy and chewy. The sandwich was top notch. I chose tater tots as my side, who doesn't love tater tots!?!?!? These were crunchy and potatoey. Yum! Finally, I got a diet coke. It rivals McDonald's quality. It came from a small version of those computerized soda machines, and it had the exact amount of carbonation needed for a quality pop.I loved my experience. I will go back, I just hope I can try something new, but the BLT is calling my name.

I have never had slower servicein.my.life. They also screwed up the order (over charged) and then our order was bumped behind three guests who ordered later than us. We were offered no discount or refund. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME COMING HERE!!!

This was a great place to dine! Clean, good service, great food. I had the bacon burger (medium well), my fiancÃ© had the Blue Cheese Burger (medium well) and my brother had the Glazed Burger (medium well). They were all cooked wonderfully! We also had an order of mozzarella sticks and chili cheese tater tots which were delicious. I'm so happy we have a new burger spot in the area! The fiancÃ© also enjoyed the Laguanitas "sucks"...he said it was really good! We'll definitely be back and hope others enjoy as well!

I noticed this St Charles location opened recently, but I wanted to wait for some reviews before stopping by. The reviews of the Aurora location impressed me and once I saw a positive review posted for this location, I decided to give Urban Counter a try.It is located right next to the BP gas station at Bricher & IL Route 38. I'm sure at some point I will combine feeding me and feeding my car into one trip.I'm a simple basic kind of guy and I like the style of this place. Not fancy or pretentious. Functional sort of industrial-looking furniture. Could see the grill from the counter. I made a take-out order, and it took maybe 5-6 minutes from placing my order to it being ready. I didn't time it. Yes, it took longer than McDonald's/BK/Wendy's, but I got a better product that was made-to-order and wasn't thrown together. Worth the wait.For my first visit, I went with the Bacon Burger and a regular-sized order of fries. The burger was very good. The thick half-pound patty comes with bacon, barbecue sauce, onion rings, cheddar, and roasted jalapenos. As I was eating it, I had forgotten about the jalapenos and was wondering where the spicy kick came from. They were a nice touch. Better than the raw pickled jalapenos you might get on a burger elsewhere. Sauce was good, onion rings were good. The bacon didn't overwhelm the burger. The flavors were balanced. The burger was well-constructed. I was worried such a big burger might fall apart and be a mess to eat, but it all stayed together right down to the last bite.There were two things I liked about the hand-cut fries. They were lightly salted with a larger-grained salt. So many places oversalt their fries so badly that my tongue feels assaulted. Not with these fries. They were a nice change. I also liked that the fries weren't limp and greasy. One Italian beef place I used to go to sells hand-cut fries that are so greasy and go totally limp if you don't eat them in 5 minutes. Urban Counter's fries were still nice and crispy after a 10-minute car ride.I've been wanting a place where I can grab a good burger for lunch that's a step up from the usual fast food places, offers good value, and has the kind of ambiance/convenience I like. I think Urban Counter is it, and I look forward to trying the rest of the menu.
We have eaten at the other locations and this one is just as good. Love the turkey burger, their buns are delish and fresh. Salads are also fresh and cold every time. Big fan.

The interior is very nice and reminds you of being in the city. The behind the counter could use some help. The sweet potato fries are mushy ( like the Fryer fat wasn't hot enough) and some were so dried out that they seemed burned. The Choc shake was like wipped milk with chocolate, not creamy thick.Not sure why the cup for the milkshake said " Pride" on it. Are they owned by the Pride wine store next door or did they just run out of plastic cups? The people at the register seem tired and the people at the grill frustrated. The burgers are good.The biggest problem is that they close at 7pm on Friday and Saturday nights! When we were there Saturday 3 people walked in a couple minutes after 7 because no one locked the door, and they told them sorry they were closed! This place won't last unless they get a clue!Hope they doBarbV

We got the east coast and west coast dogs and split a large tater tot. I was happy to see they had some different dogs ( my husband and I will drive many miles for a fun one) My west coast dog had roasted jalapeÃ±o relish. It was a little hot for me but I'm not great with a lot of heat. My problem was that the buns were wet on the outside. Nothing can wreck a dog faster than an inferior bun. We'll be back. There are a lot of tempting ideas in their menu board and I wouldn't write them off from one visit.

Food is good and provides a nice alternative to the usual fast food joints. The craft beers on tap push this from a 3 to a 4 for me. Decent choices. This location is new so they're still working out the bugs in their service. But the place is clean and the food is good. One suggestion: add more chocolate to your shakes and malts. Don't skimp there!

I would definitely recommend Urban Counter. Â The food was freshly made. Â My friend had a medley of mini-burgers that she said were very tasty. Â I had a turkey burger that was loaded with fresh lettuce, onion, tomato, swiss cheese, and honey mustard sauce. Â Delicious and very filling. Â Hot, fresh-cut french fries were a hit, too. Â The restaurant was very clean, including the bathroom (very important). Â The staff was very friendly. Â I will be back.
Great menu for lunch, reasonably priced, good food!We waited a bit for our food, but I think they are still working out some kinks (plus they make it fresh). Definitely worth a return visit.

I was in the area for a wedding, so went off of Yelp reviews to find a good place for breakfast. Great atmosphere and fantastic food! I had the special for the day which was huevos rancheros and they were awesome!It's an open space so a little loud but that has never bothered me.Super nice wait staff- they gave me extra mints and they have the good melt in your mouth dinner mints :)

Egg harbor has several locations....my favorite being the one in Geneva. Â It's one of my favorite breakfast places.Lots of good options on the menu and everything tastes good.You can't go wrong with the cinnamon swirl French toast, or the door county melt sandwich.

The service gets 5 stars, because we walked in on a busy Saturday they told us it would be about 15 minutes and we were sat in about 5 minutes. Â The waiter, despite the noise level which was very loud and his accent which sometimes was hard to understand was still awesome. Â I ordered the meat skillet, it was really good, the wife ordered the waffles, which I tasted and it was pretty good. Â My skillet game with a muffin which was toasted but limp and soggy. Â Also, the jam they serve with it was kind of runny, Â Wish they would have some other bread choices other than muffins, such as wheat toast or biscuits.
My sister in law took me here often during my cancer treatment and I loved it. It was always packed but good prices for good food. My favorite is the chicken avocado sandwich.
Egg Harbor Cafe was great. The service was excellent and the food delicious.
Try the eggs Benedict when the thick cut bacon! It was exceptional!The Georgia Grits were awesome too, from a girl raised in the south.

Okay I have it 5 stars because of sentimental reasons. Â I used to go to the Hinsdale location as a kid 25 years ago. Â This location has great breakfast and I love the potatoes with green onions. Â The service was average as they were very busy. Â The waiter seemed a bit green, maybe 16-17. Â The bus staff hustled and the place flips fast. Â It may give you the impression of being rushed. Â This should be a 4 star review but you will like it and maybe become attached to it as I have.

If you're looking for a quaint, clean, home-away-from-home breakfast hot spot, you need to check out this place! I have been to other locations in the area and this location was top-notch as well! The service was fast and friendly and the food was delicious -- the perfect amount!Try the Matty's Meat Skillet. Bacon, ham, sausage on their potatoes? Absolutely fantastic!!

My friend and I tried this place for brunch on a Tuesday morning and we were so pleased! We easily found street parking but there is a parking garage down the street if you don't mind walking a little bit. We got seated right away and were told of the specials.I ordered a grapefruit juice with the San Antonio skillet, sunny side up. My friend got the orange juice with the special skillet (it had red bell pepper and yams?). We also shared a pancake that was free with check in on yelp!I thoroughly enjoyed my skillet. Everything was yummy about it. I really liked the English muffin that came with the skillet. It was perfectly toasted and the blueberry sauce that came with it was fresh and delicious. My grapefruit juice had pulp and tasted very fresh. The pancake was fluffy and I put the remaining blueberry sauce on the pancake. It was a huge portion and I still had about half leftover, which makes a delicious lunch!Overall, service was excellent and for the value, it is totally worth it. A little over $30 for brunch for two! I will definitely come back since I only live 5 minutes away.

Arrived at 1:15 on Saturday with wife, daughter and sister in law in the mood for breakfast. Â We ordered skillets as well as an apple French toast special. Â My wife's and sister in laws skillets came out wrong and mine was terrible. Â The potatoes were hard as rocks and inedible. Â My turkey bacon was cold and soggy. Â The French toast was luke warm and we could barely cut. Â Needless to say we were very disappointed. Â We have gone to various egg harbors including this one over the years. Â However, after this experience we will not be going back with so many breakfast options out there. Â I believe the problem stemmed from them closing in 40 minutes and all the food was old from the morning.

I stopped in while waiting for the train. Everyone was so nice, even though this was my first visit I was treated like a regular. I had a customized to-go order and it was ready in 5 minutes. I ordered egg whites with cheddar cheese and an English muffin. They added a flavorful jam and butter on the side. It was exactly as ordered and the jam made it perfect. I will have to come back and eat in.

Great food, friendly staff, and a great indoor/outdoor atmosphere. Â I love that they have range-free eggs, organic ketchup, and very tasty coffee. Â They leave the pot of coffee right on the table so that you don't have to keep adding the creamer at odd times because the wait staff tips it off. Â That always bugs me. Â The food is the best in town for breakfast and lunch. Â Hands down! Â Oh, and they love nice dogs and have a doggy menu. Â My dog loves to go there and has a really great time there too! Â A must visit!

Love this place. Â Come here every Sunday. Â The food is always fresh and they switch up the menu on a regular basis to keep things interesting. Â  My only complaint- why is it always so cold in here? Â Especially in spring and summer. Â Perhaps the staff does not realize since they are running around, however it is very uncomfortable for us. Bring a sweater and ask for a table instead of a booth as they are super uncomfortable.

We have come here for breakfast a couple of times now on Sundays because it is close to the barber shop my husband uses. Every time we are left feeling full and happy! The servers are all very nice, and quick. Everything we have tried has been delicious and very fresh. If you are planning to go on Sunday, there is less chance of a wait if you get there before 9. We have always had good luck getting seated right away.

Found this place by accident and has become my favorite place to go for breakfast. The food is always fresh and the coffee is delicious. My kids love it! Very friendly staff. Good food with good prices!
Meet friends here often and we always had wonderful food and fantastic service at this location.

Loved it! The ambiance was adorable, the service was wonderful and the food was amazing. It's hard to find good gluten free options. I will definitely be back! Definitely try the grits. They're full of cheesy and bacon goodness.
Sooo good!! I'm new to the area & finally have found an amazing breakfast/brunch spot. My omlet was amazing & the service & atmosphere was as well. I will definitely go back!!
Awesome service and food quality was excellent!! Â and I got a Free Pancake!!

Hello, my name is Katie and I am addicted to breakfast foods. Egg Harbor feeds this addiction more than I like to admit, especially with a toddler and infant now in tow. A family friendly atmosphere with quick service and an expansive menu makes everyone happy! It does get busy on the weekends but the waits goes quickly and certainly isn't bad when you can wait in beautiful weather outside.The usual breakfast items are available as well as amped up versions depending on your mood. Plain whole wheat pancakes, blueberry, pumpkin, Boston cream?!? Each season brings new delights!My personal favorites include the Sir Dugan Frittata, you can't go wrong with bacon and eggs, or Cassie's Crepes, an enticing crepe bursting with fresh avocado, mushrooms, egg, and cheese served with creamy poppyseed dressing- amazing!The kids menu is also expansive.
