Our little guy loves the pancakes, waffles, and sausage. It also come with a drink. The coloring sheets and children's books make the short wait for food even more manageable.Be sure to check the specials board when you walk in or ask your server. From Mom's leftover Thanksgiving skillet to cornbread french toast, a hidden delight might be coming your way!

We were visiting friends in Downer's Grove and wanted a brunch place to hang out before heading home. This place totally fit the bill and satisfied my craving for a good brunch.First off, they have an option for turkey sausage and turkey bacon which is HUGE because I don't eat pork. The turkey options were actually well seasoned and delicious as well.I started with the flavored coffee - cinnamon hazelnut. Wow. Yum.I had the cheese grits with eggs. Eggs were cooked perfectly. Grits cooked well - LOTS of cheese on top and the other toppings, jalapeÃ±os, turkey bacon, onions - so flavorful.My husband had the oatmeal with berries - again, great texture.This place is really great for brunch. If I lived near Downers, I would totally go back. I wold love to try some of the pancake or french toast dishes - which sounded like dessert but looked great.

I ate at the Egg Harbor CafÃ© for the first time on 5/2/15. Â I was there with two friends, both which have been before.I ordered the Lobster Scrambler, which comes with potatoes and English muffin. Â The dish was delicious ... however next time I go I will try something else. Â All the menu items look like they are delightful. Â I will for sure be a return customer and bring my husband and other friends with me.

Come to this cafe right now because their Red Velvet French Toast is ridiculously tasty! What is even more impressive is service and they offer coffee station while you wait for a seat, visit, or just want another cup. Great job Egg Harbor!

Great service and pretty decent food! I loved the coffee and flavored creamers (yum).My only suggestion is for them to sautÃ© the peppers and onions before putting them in the egg dishes.. My omelette was a little bland... But my potatoes was excellent!!! I will def be back, when I'm in the area!

I would prefer to give this delightful restaurant 4.5 stars, but the reason I'm rounding up is because of the fantastic service. Our server was extremely pleasant and welcoming, and very attentive throughout our breakfast.We sat outside in the patio seating early on a Sunday morning. The sunny morning helped, but it's a beautiful place to sit and enjoy breakfast. I also really like how they leave a sizable pitcher of water (with a lid, of course!) out on the table. This gave us more than enough water to drink throughout the meal and lessened the need for staff to come out and refill anything.The reason it would be 4.5 and not 5 for me is because the least exciting part of my visit was the food. I ordered a meaty skillet, but the taste of the skillet was rather dry and overwhelmed by the onions cooked with the meat. I think the onions are a necessary part of the dish, but I was hoping for the egg and meat to dominate the flavor. I will try different items on return visits, hoping to find a go-to dish. The English muffin served with the skillet was very good.My girlfriend was pleased with her order of the special French toast, and said her coffee was also delicious.Overall, the service is absolutely top notch, and the ambience is great. Go sit outside on a sunny day and enjoy the weather and good food!

The multiple Benedict options are always great, and the service is wonderful. Â It's a great location as well, especially sitting outside. Â We recently moved into Downers, and it's become a weekly spot for us.

Service is great and speedy, place is clean, kid/family friendly. A convenient place to go for breakfast in downtown Downers. I have gone twice so far and both dishes I ordered were just okay. I have tried the chilaquiles which I was not impressed with. I also have ordered the veggie skillet which is full of yummy veggies and if you like sweet potatoes then you will love it. The portions are much smaller than other breakfast places....which is good for your calorie count, but makes you rethink the price. Still I know that I will be visiting this place again soon....so hopefully I find something I really like.

Two stars because they actually have gluten free bread, but this is is a very, very mediocre diner. The service was awful. We were there on a busy day, Veteran's Day, but it wasn't packed. There was a very short wait. Main thing is that not all items I ordered made it to the table and what I ordered as an appetizer was not brought out until my entire meal was ready and served. We had two different waitresses. It was annoying. If ever at this mall again I will eat here because they offer gluten free options, but that is about the only reason I will continue to go. Salad was wilted. Dressings were pre-made from a bottle. Sandwich was bland. Meh.

After a negative EHC experience in Naperville a few years back, I decided to give this location a chance. So glad I did! We have become regulars at a few locations, but this one is the best. The food never disappoints and the service is great. This was especially important to me as it was the problem that I had in Naperville. My daughters love the few extra mints they always seem to provide.

We've been coming here for years. Â Found my new favorite dish today: Veggie Power Skillet -- delicious! It was a layer of sweet potatoes, zucchini, broccoli and black beans topped with cheese and 2 fried eggs. Â I will order this again! Â Service was great and our food came very quickly. Â We arrived an hour before closing and had no wait --late lunch is a good time to go.
Great - delicious, reasonably priced, good service and some interesting menu options make this a terrific choice for breakfast if you're in the area. Â Good coffee too!

I have recently went vegan and am visiting Chicago for a few day from California. Egg Harbor isn't vegan of course but the waitress was very sweet and apologized for the minimal options they had, which I can say definitely was not expected (apologies for lack of vegan catering at non-vegan places so far are not the norm) Â . I told her I would be happy with their potatoes and a side of fruit and I truly was. Their potatoes were great, I added some pepper, ketchup and hot sauce and was completely satisfied. So service and definitely a couple tasty options at least are available. Thank you for wonderful service.

The first thing I would like to comment on would be our server, Caroline Sivik. She was so dedicated to bring us quality service, along with her colleagues. The fact that she resembles Julia Roberts only enhances her excellent personality.We were seated immediately upon entering the restaurant. Literally, within seconds, Caroline was at our table taking orders for beverages. There were so many items available, I almost changed my usual iced tea selection, but reneged on alternatives. Then, she returned a few moments later, taking our orders for food.We had spent a very stressful morning waiting for my son to get out of surgery, so once he was in his room resting somewhat comfortably, we left his bedside and chose to dine at Egg Harbor Cafe.Four of us in our party were very pleased with what was served. The drinks were refilled continuously, and cold beverages got little carafes left on our table.All of us enjoyed what we ordered to eat, but the customer service really blew us away with how they were involved with our dining experience. Not only did the manager make several appearances, but Caroline, our server, was top-notch! I liked the fact that she gave us take-out cups for our beverages, so that we could enjoy refreshments long after leaving the facility.I personally look forward to returning here again, in the very near future.

Breakfast places really don't merit 5 stars. So I rate them on a scale to 4 stars. Egg Harbor, while yes, a chain, is very good. Â With breakfast food, frequently it's simply good or not good because it's simple.However, they serve Intelligentsia coffee, and the Heinz Ketchup that has no corn-syrup. Â That in and of itself makes them a fabulous place to go to!
My sister and I go here regularly - I love the Black Current Ice Tea, and the Poppyseed Salad Dressing!

So this is where all the old men from Omega went to. i was worried they all died when Omega closed.Its been so many years since I went to Egg harbor I had NO idea they were a chain now.It was a very nice time- unlimited coffee in cute cups and they let us sit for hours on a weekday morning and play Â the "normal / not normal" game where you name someone everyone knows at the table ( but who isn't there) and you all chime in if they are sane or not.I had the french toast which was good but a bit different as the bread was thinner than what I was used to.

Best breakfast place around, quick, friendly service. If you get fruit instead of has browns, the fruit cup is actually good and not an afterthought like it is at many places. They have delicious sweet options that almost get me to stray from bacon and eggs but I never have. They also have ice water on your table which is awesome. Also, if you want a coffee to go, no charge. This place is great.
The customer service is amazing, smiles all around and not the fake ones. And to make it all the better the food is incredible. Any hot beverage here is delicious!

The service and staff are great. Â Friendly, welcoming and efficient. Â The coffee is very good. Â I had the garden omelette which comes with English ufc in and potatoes. Â The omelette is spinach, mushrooms and tomato on top. Â Meal for 2 with 2 coffees was $21...very good for the money.
I highly recommend this place for breakfast and lunch great food and an even better staff love everything here have not had one bad meal and everyone is so nice! Great prices as well !

Yum. I love brunch with a fiery passion, and Egg Harbor does not disappoint. They serve unlimited coffee, and will even set you up with a to go cup when you're on your way out. I love their gluten-free and healthy options...they even have Paleo pancakes! The service here is excellent - the staff are very cheerful. I did not feel rushed at all. Yum again.Although I don't live in the area, their commuter menu sounds like a great idea...you can call ahead and within five minutes, a to-go breakfast will be waiting for you. Delish.

I can only give this place 1 star due to poor management. Â I received a gift card to this resturant through my employer who gave them out to myself and the 30 other staff members. Â The manager was unable to run my card due to THEM switching companies they use for their gift cards. Â She told me she would check it out later and call me with the amount and mail a new card out. I had to call a few times to get in touch with someone then received a very unprofessional voice-mail saying " there's no money on your card you tried to use sorry bye." This to me says they don't want to take the time to get in touch with the old card issuer and issue a new one and mail it out. I know for a fact there is money on the card because my other Co workers have used theirs. This was not my fault and an ussue on their end because of their new system. I drove all the way out to downers grove from mokena to try this place out and I sadly won't return or recommend to friends who live in the DG area.
Friendly great service. Fresh excellent food and to go cups for beverages. Â What eke do you need?
Great breakfast place with good prices for food compared to usual breakfast place.... The strawberry orange juice is very good and the waiters and waitresses are excellent

Dead cock roach on our table and they did nothing about it. We are professional people and didn't want to create a scene, and we thought for sure they'd lop a small percentage off the bill or give us a complimentary dessert or something. Yet, alas, no. The phoney waitress quickly gave us our bill and ran off, and guess what, she got stiffed by us. Zero tip. We paid the bill and left with no fanfare and have vowed never to dine here again. Don't get me wrong, I lived in the city of Chicago for 22 years and cock roaches are a common thing, but it's the principle of the matter. Obviously, they don't value their customers very much here and that's probably true for their employees, too. The people operating this location are real losers.
Yum!!! Top notch! Gluten free pancakes are insane outta this world.

First time I went to Egg Harbor CafÃ© was with my mum when I was waiting to catch a train and we stumbled upon it near the station. I am so glad we stopped in because this is one of the coziest and most pleasant places I've ever enjoyed breakfast. Open between 6:30-2, the food was delicious and there are some lovely original dishes of good quality. Prices are good, dÃ©cor is charming (rooster theme), staff is very nice, and during the summer the outdoor seating is pleasant. There is also a small classic grocery store across the street that is a nice stop to make after breakfast before you run to catch your train!

I have previously confessed to a fondness for EHC, I can't help it, I just have a crush on this chain.I get consistently good food at these establishments but I always seem to order the same thing no matter which location I frequent. Â I get the combo with a mini skillet and banana nut bread french toast that comes with fruit salad. Â YUM! Â Add some fresh oj and a couple of mugs of coffee and I am one happy Egg Harbor devotee.However, I have always wondered. Â If you go to the town of Egg Harbor, is there an Egg Harbor?
So delicious! So many egg dishes to choose from. Great service. I highly recommend the strawberry orange juice.
Cute place but the menu does not have enough variety for me for lunch. Breakfast section of menu is much larger. Service is good.

This is one of our usual stops for breakfast in the weekend.The staff here is extremely nice and pleasant. Always very helpful and no matter how busy they are, you never feel rushed.My 5 yr old daughter LOVES this place. They have a fantastic kids menu and she gets a rubber duck when were leaving. All a kid can ask for.The food is consistently very good. Great variety of choices in the menu. I always get the down home which is biscuits and gravy. The only issue I have us that the portions are not very big for the price your paying but it won't stop me from going regularly.

Waitress was super nice and helpful. She answered all our questions.They custom made an omelette for me as it wasn't on the menu. Some places are not willing to do this.When food came out, it was delicious! My iced tea came in a glass jar with a handle. Very cute!I really enjoyed this place and will be coming back. Nice atmosphere.

I will admit I have known about this location for quite some time. I am mad at myself for taking such a long time to finally dine in. Immediately upon entering the door I was greeted, no waiting, no lines the host was friendly. Â I love the fact the server leaves the water craft and coffee on the table, I am in total control of my refills. Oh and great up sell on your caramel coffee of the day mister server, your energy sold me on it.I ordered the ulitmate skillet with ham, mushrooms, onions, green peppers, tomato.Topped with just the appropiate amount of jack and cheddar cheese. This all rested on a bed of seasoned harbor potatoes....superb!!!Most breakfast places ask you if you would like Toast or Pancakes with your skillet. I was impressed that my server read my mind and suggested the English Muffin. Oh yeah bring it! The english muffin came buttered and with a side of jelly for dipping. That's right I said dipping, none of that on the table and peal back condiment jelly. It was fresh.Quick service with a dynamite vibe is why I will be back more often. Oh and if you don't like eggs with your skillet, fresh fruit may be substituted.

Had brunch for four at the DG location today for the first time. Â It wasn't awful, but pretty close. Â Servers were sweet, but clearly overwhelmed. Â Food was blah...quiche was super salty, lukewarm and served with plain salad greens--odd. Â Eggs Benedict was lukewarm and accompanying hash browns were lukewarm and soggy. Â Our extra order of pancakes was forgotten, then brought to the table but not the correct pancakes. Â It seems like Egg Harbor has gone the easy route and no longer prepares fresh food--they must just be heating up food made elsewhere. Â Last item of note--those wooden benches might be the most uncomfortable seats ever. Â The slats dig into your backside in an awful way for this normal sized person. Â Please add some padded cushions!

The service is exceptional... Our server Paul was super pleasant, the host, Jessica was awesomely friendly and funny as well! The presentation is very nice, the menu is extensive, the quality is superb, and overall this was an amazing breakfast experience. Will come back here and you should too!!!

When I lived in the area, it was an absolute treat coming here! Â I'm super picky about breakfast foods and breakfast restaurants, but Egg Harbor Cafe is great! Â I've had a different dish every time I've come here (and I hate most breakfast foods!!), and I've loved it every time. Â Fresh, delicious food and a super clean and cozy atmosphere. Â Love, love, love!
Best breakfast spot in town, I recommend the skillet! Â We are here at least once a weekend!

I've been to four different Egg Harbor locations and I find them pretty much the same. Parking for this location is a bit tricky since it is in the heart of downtown Downers Grove, but the village parking garage is nearby if you can't find a parking space on the street. The train station is across the street, so if you arrived by train. Voila!An Egg Harbor Cafe is not the place to relax and have a quiet chat when it's busy. (Aren't they always busy?) The tables are close together, there are large groups, families with small children, and staff with carpet sweepers right at your feet. The tables are small for the number of people and amount of food crammed onto them. I wouldn't call the seating comfortable.So why go here? Well sometimes you want a breakfast that really should be classified as dessert. Or sometimes you want a breakfast made up of the five major food groups: meat, meat, meat, eggs, and cheese. Or sometimes you're like me and you want Cassie's Crepes; a strange but delicious combo of crepes filled with scrambled eggs, avocado, mushrooms, cheese & topped with poppyseed dressing. Most people seem to find something here they like. Most of my friends and family can agree on Egg Harbor when they can't agree on other places to eat. And, this is big, the coffee is decent ... and it keeps coming.If it were dinnertime I'd hate a place like this, but despite the clatter, chatter, and crowding this place works for me for breakfast out. It's a solid choice. We especially like to meet friends here after visiting the Farmers Market on summer Saturday mornings.

I was corralled by my bosses to this goofy diner with the kitschy but smile-inducing decor of roosters and chickens everywhere. I usually do not each much for breakfast on a work weekday morning, so I went for a simple cinnamon roll which was fine. Not as overly sweet as a Cinnabon so that's probably a good thing. The menu looks loaded with some good choices so maybe I will have to come back to Egg Harbor Cafe for lunch.

This place is less than a mile from my home and I absolutely love it for breakfast. Â The main thing that always brings me back is the service. Every server I've ever had is prompt, friendly, and very attentive. Â They bring water right away, bring you your own carafe of coffee, and they are prompt to refill any drink. Â They have a great variety on the menu and they bring the food quickly. Â All the food is really good too. Â The decor of the restaurant is really quaint and cute.The only drawback is they can sometimes get really croweded for brunch time on the weekends, but you just have to plan ahead for that. Â I usually call before I leave home to see how long the wait will be.

The hidden Egg Harbor cafe. Â Tucked off a street that doesn't exist!This Egg Harbor Cafe is off of Mochel (a brand new street east of new Arcadia on the Green building, which in turn is just south of the Metra station downtown downers grove).Head east on Curtis (one way) and you will see Mochel on the left. Â The Egg Harbor cafe is at the corner of Burlington and Mochel.My wife and I tried this place out on a Friday Morning. Â I appreciated the decent selection of Mexican inspired breakfast dishes (like Chiliquilies, Huevos Rancheros, and a Mexican skillet). Â I ended up ordering a Mexican my wife went with a combo plate (pancake, egg, sausage).The food was pretty good, though not amazing - basically another chain breakfast restaurant. Â The service, food, and restaurant reminded me of a LePeep's variation. Â I like LePeeps (and as such Egg Harbor) but not enough to drive out of my wife. Â I will take a nice long drive to Bongo Room - but not Egg Harbor.The only "really" bad part of our experience was our waitress. Â With almost no one in the restaurant (Friday AM not a busy day) she just wasn't there for us.I give it a 3/5 - nothing special, but nothing bad!

When the waitress asked me after two bites of food in a canned voice "did everything come out looking and tasting good"? I had to laugh - to myself of course. I would never laugh at the waitress. They must be on a mission to provide excellent customer service. Well it worked. The food came out fast and the service was friendly.I had chilaquilles. The portion was huge..for me anyway. I only ate half because tortilla chips cooked in salsa gets super soggy really fast. I got it with chicken (never found it with chicken in a Mexican restaurant). The chicken looked and tasted like the precooked strips you buy in the grocery store that are supposed to save you time. They swear it was a fresh made chicken breast that was sliced up in the kitchen. Hmmmm.
My waitress Brook was so sweet just like the restaurant atmosphere. I didn't have to wait for a table on Sunday morning. Â The food was amazing with great prices. I will definitely be back soon.

My boyfriend and I went here for brunch on Sunday and I was very disappointed in my meal. My boyfriend got the Pumpkin Pancake Combo and his pancakes were delicious! (I would give his meal 3 stars.) I ordered the Mango French Toast (which was one of the specials of the day) and it was terrible. The mango wasn't ripe! The small pieces of mango were sour and crunchy, not sweet and soft as one would expect. The french toast also came with a mascarpone topping that had melted and was runny. I'm disappointed that Egg Harbor CafÃ© featured the Mango French Toast as a Special of the Day. While our service was good and our server was nice, I go to restaurants for the food. On this visit, my food was not good.

We found this location purely by accident. Â And yes, it does really have outdoor seating because we sat there.It is located one block east of Main and had we not walked past it, we most likely would not have found it. Â Out of the way and off the beaten path.Food, as always, was good and service is quick.
Simple review....Great food, Great service. Â A must visit while in Downers Grove. Their breakfast burrito is phenomenal.

Great selection and very good quality. I would choose Egg Harbor over Kristina's and Lemon Tree for breakfast. Although they could do a little better on coffee which I usually bring in from Starbucks.I like that they have ice water with lemon on the table and coffee to go by the front door.

They have a coconut coffee on special - must try if you are a fan of coconut! I know I am! I usually get the Eggs Benedict here and they are good. I've also tried a Berry French Toast that was once on special and it was delicious!

Im not too much a fan of getting breakfast outside of the diner atmosphere but I gave in the other day and we decided to try this place out. It reminded me of one of my friends houses that was decorated with bunnies because she was obsessed with them - except for this time it was eggs and chickens. That along with the mason jar glasses got me off on the wrong foot almost immediately.The saving grace was once again the food. Somehow the places with the worst decor or annoying music or bad service always has good food. This place was no different albeit the staff was super friendly and the music wasn't noticeable.I had the handler which had bacon ham eggs cheese on a pretzel rolls. It was just about as perfect as could be. We also tried the veggie skillet and the Mexican omelette. The over easy eggs were overdone but it wasn't for me so why am i complaining. The only other things that I could see that were keeping it from getting another star is that the portions weren't the usual huge - i need to take half of this home - portions im used to.Apart from being only a tad more expensive than the usual diner price for me and the portions - especially the potatoes - it was a good solid breakfast place with a huge menu that could accommodate anyone's cravings and breakfast/brunch/lunch needs.

Located just south of the Metra station, Egg Harbor is the perfect breakfast spot for commuters who don't want to skip the most important meal of the day. And if you stop here, it just might be the tastiest meal of the day too!Service is top notch--I was seated and served right away, and my server got me started off right with coffee and time to look over the extensive menu.I went with a simple, straightforward choice because I was on a budget: two eggs served with an English muffin and Harbor potatoes, a mere $5. The food arrived in record time, tasted amazing, and got my busy day off to a great start. My server checked on my regularly to make sure I had everything I needed, and my coffee mug was never less than half full.I will definitely be back, and next time I hope to try a skillet or other appetizing items on the menu.

The coffee here is SOOOOoooOOOooooOOOooOOO Good! I always bring coffee home and I've even gone so far as to ordering it (from their website) for other people in my family. Try it out, every flavor is bold and full. AND the food is D-Lish! The eggs are always cooked perfectly.
Very extensive menu and well executed plates.

One of my favorite "breakfast food" type places. Â Good food, made with fresh quality ingredients along with excellent and friendly service at a very reasonable price point, makes for the right combination in my book. Â While they have all of the base breakfast foods covered they also have offerings that go well beyond the base. Â They also do a nice job catering to vegetarian's, GF eaters and dieters. Â Today I enjoyed the Athenian Omelet along with their very nice harbor potatoes, a dish I have had before and look to enjoy again the next time I visit!
my favorite breakfast place.

Great breakfast place. I love the atmosphere, The decoration is nice and the staff is very friendly. Their menu is very good and they have some different kinds of breakfast choices and their seasonal entrees are great. On the weekend they are crazy busy, you may have to wait a while but once you are seated the wait on food isn't all that long. I love this place and I think it's better than most of the breakfast places around here.

I have been to other Egg Harbors and did not like them, but this location is great. Food is awesome ad the staff are very friendly and offer quick service. Only negative is its a bit pricey. However, that has not deterred us from returning almost weekly :)

Love going here with my friends on the weekend. Â Although it's quite busy and even busier on Sundays after those good people go to something called "church" I still love it. Â The food is so good and everything on the menu looks, smells and even reads like I want to shovel it on my mouth. Â I am obsessed with their homemade preserves and love all the different healthy options they give. Â The service is always top notch and food comes out pretty quickly. Â Highly suggest if you're in the area.

I just went to this location for the first time last Sunday, but have been to several other Egg Harbor locations. Â I am a fan of Egg Harbor in general -I would KILL to have one closer to the City. I have never had a bad breakfast and our meal at this location was fine.I ordered the Cinnamon Roll French Toast Combo - their famous cinnamon roll French toast drizzled with glaze, dusted with powdered sugar and served with a choice of meat and two eggs any style. Â LOVED it!Before our meals arrived, we also ordered a cinnamon roll for the table as a breakfast "appetizer". OINK Â The waitress told me they are not homemade on the premises, but they were good nonetheless.My friends had the scramblers which were delicious. And god bless them for serving Intelligentsia coffee! Made my whole day.

Good food at a great price!! First of all I am a total breakfast person so I love the fact when I can find a nice local breakfast spot that serves quality food and great coffee at a moderate price, that is not your traditional Denny's or Ihop.I always have the create your own skillet because being a vegetarian it gives me a chance to have my veggies to kick start my day off right. The place is always clean, Service is always timely and coffee isn't watered down. I also suppose the decor is also pretty unique i do often wonder how many chicken or egg pictures and figures are actually in that place. Oh yea love the coffee mugs, bought two of them!!

I love the Downers Grove Egg Harbor Cafe! The food is always hot, fresh and yummy! I also love the staff here. They are so friendly and always make you feel special. You always get greeted when you come in and are thanked and told to have a great day when you are leaving. I love when a business makes you feel appreciated!

This location has gone down hill. Â The food and service quality is not what you expect from this restaurant. Â With a business in downtown Downers Grove, we have been a regular Â lunch customer. Â We normally order take out. Â We have not been happy with the food we order, and will no longer waste our money. Â Our most recent order was today, and it was terrible!!! Â  The salad was soggy with water in the bottom of the container. Â We ordered a hot pasta chicken salad. Â This salad did not even have the pasta. Â  Â When we called to advise them, they could care less. My husband and I frequent the Yorktown location, every Sunday morning, and I have recently reviewed that location. Â What A difference!! Â We will continue to go to the Yorktown location, and enjoy the wonderful food and service. Â This location has just lost our business.

I'm one of those people who loves coffee, but only if it has a yum yum flavor attached to it. Â That's why I love this place. Â They don't serve watery bland cheap coffee. Â They give you the good stuff. Â The crack of coffee.When I was there, they had caramel flavored coffeecrackliciousness Â and even offered to add whipped cream to it. Â Now, that's pretty sweet. Â And they give you a carafe of it for more refills. Â Now that's awesome and a half. Â Oh, and some real cream to boot.And when you leave, they have coffee to go on the way out, for that extra insane caffeine boost. Â Just in case you didn't get enough. Â That's what I'm talking about.Food is pretty consistent and has a nice variety. Â I had the lemon bread french toast with two eggs and bacon for $8.00. Â And man, it was GOOD. Â Now the lemon bread was kind of sweet, but it was still damn good. Â I left full and happy.They give you enough food, but not too much. Â And it has a hint of health to it (if you want it to).And how cool that they give you a mint before you leave. Â I mean-- no big deal, but still nice.
Came here once so far with my grandfather. Â Very tasty. Â Very busy, about a 10 minute wait for a table with a party of 3 (though we came at 10 AM on a Sunday). Â Looking forward to try again!

I'm not a huge breakfast person so I normally don't care about the dedicated breakfast/lunch places that close around 2-3pm. But I LOVE Egg Harbor Cafe. The food is delicious. It just seems fresher and more wholesome than standards breakfast places. Not so heavy and greasy. I loooove the Farmers Market Benedict. The staff is also very friendly and I personally like the decor (for a breakfast place) - very down home country kitchen. We usually go on weekend mornings between 10am - 12pm and the place is always packed so there is usually a little bit of a wait. But once you sit down the service is fast.
Chorizo skillet! Mmm! delicioso!

I was very impressed with Egg Harbor. I understand there are several, but we were staying in this area and wanted a good breakfast spot. This place was close to where we were going and had some good reviews.Boy, did we ever luck out. This was a really nice space and having a pitcher of ice water waiting on every table was a nice touch. The food was very tasty, not greasy at all, the prices were reasonable and the service was great. Your problem will be deciding what to order.

Popeye crepe and our server Deanna undoubtedly made my breakfast-lunch, no joke, amazing. She is a gem in this downers grove egg harbor. I want to take her to my restaurant and clone her. Thank you Deanna you made my hang over more enjoyable.

Egg Harbor is the best breakfast place in Downers Grove. Â Great, friendly service and good food. Â I've never tried anything that I didn't like. Â I usually order The Sampler: French toast with strawberries, eggs, and meat (I ask for potatoes instead of meat). Â The coffee is good too. Â And the buttermints that they give you with your check are good too. Â I only wish they were open for dinner!

There is a new manager at this EHC and she kindly offered me and my husband the opportunity to come back and try their EHC one more time. We went this morning and had the best waitress. It was about 10:30a by the time we sat down, so she had already had a long and busy morning, but she was just nice and pleasant. My husband had his usual, pancakes, with sausage links and eggs over easy and it looks like the portions have been restored back to their original sizes. I went out on a limb and had a Firecracker Omlette (with a few adjustments) and I thought it was very good. My favorite part was that they had Pumpkin Spice coffee as their flavored coffee of the day, and it was SO good. I kind of have a problem with indulging in Pumpking before September, but I couldn't pass it up when I heard that's what they were brewing. Overall, we had a really nice experience. My 7 month old daughter had her first taste of pancake today too and I think she was a fan.

I live right by Egg Harbor and have been there several times. The first couple of times I went, I had good experiences, but the last two times have been disappointing. I typically order skillets and my husband will order pancakes or french toast. Generally the service is good but the last two times the food has been below average. The breakfast potatoes were either undercooked or hard as a rock and the cheese wasn't melted. In their defense, they did comp us a free meal next visit.

This is a glutenous place. The portions are out of control and the menu is way too big. It is a good facility for a large family to eat together, however not my choice. The restraunt was packed both times, waiting times out the door. Thus it is a popular spot, however not for me. I want vegetarian choices as well.

We stopped in with our young kids on a busy Saturday morning on our way to the farmers market, and we will be back. Â The food is great - something for everyone. Â My husband is a bacon fanatic and loved it. Â I had a relatively healthy scrambler and enjoyed it, too. Â The coffee was good and the to-go cup at the end made it even better.

I was so excited when the franchised restaurant came to Downtown Downers Grove! Â At first I said where? They had to build a new street just to frame this great restaurant. Â Service is great the cater to families with small children to make them so welcome. Â Which then makes is easy to service adults as we are children at heart!But their food and I usually have pancakes and hard to change to lunch food although their soups and sandwiches are also excellent and very delicious. Â But try the Pumpkin- or blueberries- or blackberries and banana pancakes you will have a taste of heaven! Â And you won't ever order them at any other restaurant you will be totally spoiled.This franchise makes sure that which ever one you go to....will not disappoint you. Â The only difference is the difference of size of seating and distance from home.

Have been to the Downers Grove Egg Harbor just the one time; over all the food was quite good but a bit pricey. Â We were there for lunch and I had the soup and sandwich. Â My one complaint...oh lordy, the seating is sooo uncomfortable! Â We sat at a booth that had bench type seats, and I think I still have the slat marks on my tushie! Â Please owners, do something about that!

Came here with my some colleagues after work on Friday and it was a nice place to just kick back and have a drink. Â It is a bit of a dive bar, which I love so it worked. Â The drink prices were good. Â Can't comment on the food since I didn't eat, but the people I was with enjoyed their grub. Â Will definitely come back. Â Can't beat the drink prices (hello $2.50 PBR, $5 craft beers) and the chill atmosphere.

I'm a fan of this type of place...not a dive bar, not a sports bar, not a restaurant...just a chill out spot to grab some food & beer, preferably with outdoor seating! Â We came here on the second nicest weather of the day so far... around 4:30/5pm on a Saturday. Â I've driven past this place many times, there was something about it I just had to check out! Â There was plenty of indoor & outdoor seating when we arrived, of course we chose to sit outside to enjoy the weather (and beer!)They had drink & food specials on a Saturday, which is always nice! Â My friend & I ordered the pretzel sticks for an appetizer, a bucket of Miller Lites ($10 on special) and our dinners... the food was all very decent, and so was the service. Â They have a good menu here! Â We definitely plan to come back here again!!!They have trivia, live music, and all kinds of things going on here... so if you're looking for a place to hangout away from the hustle & bustle, this is a great find!
All I have to say was there was a mouse on the floor at the end of the night.I had a great time before that but I would never come back to this place.

I went to watch a UFC fight not too long ago. It was standing room only. The Service wasn't bad considering that the place was overcrowded. I don't drink, so I was drinking water and buying rounds for my friends. This guy bumps into me, so I turn around and apologized even though he bumped into me. The guy starts muttering something under his breath and mean mugging me, so I asked, if there was a problem. The guy tells me that he is the owner and that I can leave. I told him that I was spending a significant amount of money in his place despite only drinking water, but I was glad to leave, if he was the owner. He was really kind of aggressive and I assume it was either beer or his affliction shirt making him act that way. Honestly, I would never go back to this place. My friends and I closed our tab, tipped 20% to the bartender and left. I won't be back.

This place is delicious and the food is really good.I originally had a 5 star review, but the last time we were there the waitress completely ignored our table the whole time. Literally stayed on the tables near the bar and never went down the row to the ones with the windows. Never got refills of drinks, took over 15 minutes to flag her down. Watched her goof around and fold napkins. It was a big disappointment.

This was my second or third time here! Here again for the BlackHawks play off game. Â The place is packed. They have a very large parking lot so if the front is full, behind is also an option.The bar is more of a dive bar but still very nice. Not gross or cheap in any way. Â Lots of TVs around the bar. Â The bar is large. A full circle where people can sit on all sides. Â They also have 20-30 bar tables so you have that option as well.The service is good, our service Sarah was really friendly and helped me choose between 3 items on the menu I was stuck between.I highly recommend the taco salad, jalapeÃ±o poppers and the turkey panini!! My girlfriend also ordered cheese curds and they were Delish!The menu prices are not expensive and the drink specials are awesome.

Very good service and delicious food. It was very enjoyable to be outside on a sunny day and have the best burger ever !!! I liked the place a lot, it's simple and also very nice when it comes to be outside on a patio :))) I'll go back for sure ;)

had to grab something quick with my co worker. Â Service is fine. Â giant drink cups too. Â the food was just ok. Â the club my co worker got was huge. Â and looked good. Â I may be back, when I am ready to eat unhealthy. Â Not the place for salad.

Had take out from this place and I was thoroughly impressed with how delicious everything was. Their burger was wayyyy better than anything I've ever had from DMK. Place seemed pretty cozy on the inside, will probably done in someday with the wifey.

For what it is and what they are going for, JT's is a pretty solid bar. Wings are good, decent burger. They have $3 Rolling Rocks as well as my fav craft beers like Anti Hero and Dogfish.Decent bourbon and scotch selection to top it off.There's nothing pretentious about JT's. They don't claim to be Glen Prairie so it'd be unfair to hold them to the same standards. For what they are trying to achieve, a nice neighborhood sports bar, they achieve it and well.Bartenders and staff are friendly as well. I can't remember names well but the 2 girls are sweethearts! Also our first time there some locals let us try some delicious brownies his mom made for one of the girls birthdays. Like I said friendly staff and people.We are new to the area and could tell most of the patrons were regulars, but nobody made us feel unwelcome. I've been back a few times and will continue to support them when I can.
Wow. Wings. Pool. Just the greatest owners. Couldn't say anything bad. Top ten forsure.
Very sweet server, prompt service on a super busy night! The live band was great, played the classics and my margarita was nice and tasty! Thanks guys!

Place is crowded .. Not to clean .. Beer prices is okay but the bartenders are not to attentive .. They like to talk too much with regular customers .. I was seating in the bar for 10 mins before they got my order .. The bartender is just talking to other customers .. Not the best place to hang around

Fantastic place to drink and eat while watching some sports especially during the Blackhawks. Would recommend anyone in the area to stop by to check it out the owners are hands on almost every day. Keep up the great service.

"I wanted to love this place, but..." you've heard that a thousand times already, right? Â You wanted to love someplace, but you walked out disappointed. Â Well, now it's my turn.I wanted to love JT's Porch, because a friend of mine raved about their wings. Â Five of us met up here on a Monday night, for their 50 cent wings, and while it was busy it wasn't overcrowded or too loud. Â I don't like traditional wings, so I ordered the boneless (not included in the 50 cent special). Â They are definitely big, but I didn't particularly like either sauce I tried. Â I tried the Buffalo and Spicy Garlic, and there wasn't much differentiation between the two. Â Neither sauce was anything greater than ordinary. Â The cheese curds were just okay.The beer list is decent, there is a variety of draft beer and bottles to make everyone happy. Â There's also a full bar for cocktails, and on Monday night there was some kind of $4 cocktail special.We sat down immediately, but it took our waitress awhile to acknowledge us and take drink orders. Â The service that night, overall, was bad. Â She forgot our drinks, and our food took forever to arrive at the table. Â When we got our food, everything (appetizers and all) came at once, and one of the orders was wrong. Â At the end of the night, she gave us our checks and said, "you might want to check those. Â They could be wrong. Â But they should be right." Â Ugh. Â Not my job, chick! Â So I can't say I was surprised that our check was wrong, and we were billed twice for our wings.This might be one of those places that you just love if you're from the neighborhood. Â It's probably not a place I'd visit again though.

Stopped in for lunch and was pleasantly surprised. Â Nice local hot spot. Â Servers were very friendly and they had a great rapport with the customers, it was apparent their were a lot regulars which was also a good sign. Â We had burgers - they were great!!!! Â They have a wheel spin which allows for a free meal if you guess the number it will land on. Â Nice little find.
We visit this place regularly and I would definitely recommend. Â The food is pretty solid and there is usually a good craft brew list. The severs are good for the most part. Â Prices are reasonable.
Cute spot with awesome food. Â This place is always busy no matter the time or day, so it's always a good time. Â I love their burgers and they have the best Mai Tais!!!
Wow, what a pleasant surprise! Â Excellent pub food!

Went here on a Thursday for a Sporcle hosted Friends Trivia night. The place was packed! We got to the bar about 15-20 minutes before the trivia was supposed to start and every table was claimed. The bar is a little smaller and probably only had 10-15 high tops. Luckily my sister spotted a group that were finishing up their meal and wasn't going to stick around for the trivia. We swooped in and got a seat!The menu is simple and your standard offerings of bar food. Our waitress was really nice but obviously slammed, so taking our order took a long time, but again, it wasn't her fault, and we weren't in any rush.We decided to just share a feast of appetizers. We got boneless BBQ and hot jalapeno wings, cajun and chipotle ranch fries, mozz sticks, and pretzels with cheese. We were so healthy...Wings - big meaty pieces with a good crunch. The BBQ wings were a little on the sweet side, but delicious. The hot jalapeno were not hot at all, which was disappointing, but had great flavor.Fries - The cajun fries were hotter than the wings. Great seasoning, not overly salty and you get a boat load of them. The chipotle ranch fries were milder and was full of flavor. They have about 6 different fry options all coated in a dry rub. Not sure if they are hand cut fries or frozen to fryer but they were pretty good.Mozz Sticks - Delicious. You get 10! Usually places will only give you 4-6 but there was an abudence of this gooey cheesy god like food. Cooked well and the marinara dipping sauce was full of flavor.Pretzels - meh. Tasted like they were the frozen to microwave. Very stale and in comparison to the portions of the other food, not that much. Cheese sauce was too thick and lacked any flavor.This place had $10 domestic buckets and we went through 4.All in all it was surprisingly cheap. 5 people, all that food, and 4 buckets... only $80 bucks.We really want to come back and check it out on a non-trivia night!
Food is excellent! Â  Nice walk out patio and smokers area in front. Â  Kind of quaint place, Â has live music.
Nice laid back place. Great bar food and beer list. Nothing fancy but a nice bar to hang out at. Bands play there with no cover.

Was here for MNF. Great drink specials and 50cent wings. I got the BBQ, hot and spicy garlic. They came out at a fairly reasonable time. Good size wings with a good amount if meat. Sauce was ok, nothing special.They had the sound on for the first game but not the second which is when the jukebox went on. Pretty much all metal and or heavy rock. I don't mind either but it got to me after a while.Would go back again on a weekend to see how it is.Our sever was Amelia who was great, which is why I gave it a 4 star rating.

Rating: 2.6Short description: Standard bar with some food choices.Pluses: Â Burger was okay. Â It was quick at least.Negatives: Limited beer selection. Service was a bit off for me, even though I was sitting at the bar. Â Granted, I was just one person and the bartender was more interested in talking to the 4 drunk people.Recommendations: Skip it. Â Though I didn't try the wings, which is apparently a strong suit.Edit: I've been advised to give it 2, but i'll stick with 3 for hope that their wings make up the difference for someone out there.

This place is amazing. Service kinda lacks. Went there for lunch a couple times on Friday and they were busy. Only had 1 server on.. waited for a while for our food. But the FOOD IS ALWAYS GREAT! Def. a great lunch spot.

Their ATM machine stole $103 from me yesterday. Filing a complaint with my bank. Machine dispensed no cash, but it debited my account. Screen went from "Authorizing" to "Please insert card" with no cash dispensed.Update:Owner Jeremy responded to my Facebook post on their page today. We spoke by phone later in the day. A tech showed up, verified the issue, and Jeremy called me back early this evening, letting me know the ATM company would be reversing the charges.Update 11/20/2013:No credit received, had to take this up with my bank as a dispute. JT's has lost my business and that of my coworkers and our out-of-town guests.

JT's is my go-to place for wings in the Chicagoland area. Me and my boyfriend are wing enthusiast and are on a hunt for the best. We have probably been to 30 restaurants that claim to have great wings, and JT's is hands down the winner.Spicy garlic sauce is delicious. A little spicy, a hint of sweet, and a good amount of garlic. Wings are huge and meaty with just the right amount of breading. I can't speak for any of the other food (because I'm always too full from eating only 5 wings)Bloody Mary's are good. Some pretty good beers available. Service has always been good enough for me.But the wings... Ohhhh those wings...
Love these burgers. Great portions! Friday night live karaoke is a blast!

Most ladies opt for classy bars with bouncers, overpriced drinks, tight dresses, and ridiculous cover charges. Not this one. I love me some dive bars. JT's is definitely a dive bar, but it's a bit more well-known in the west 'burbs than a typical hole-in-the-wall. Cheap beer, average bar drinks and food, pool tables, indoor/outdoor seating, bands, a diverse crowd, and good cheer. It is what it is. While I wouldn't put JT's at the top of my list for a place to go, it does rank as one of my top last-resort places (if that makes any sense).

Stopped in here with a couple of friends for a late dinner. Â If you're from VP, you'll know what I mean when I say it has a Caps-like feel to it. Â Very cozy, relaxed atmosphere up in this Sports bar. Â And a pretty amazing craft beer list, might I add!!My friend and I ended up getting the Not Your Father's Root Beer Brew (10% alc.) which is made in Wauconda at Small Town Brewery. Â DEEEEE-lish! Â Love the beer list...did I say that already?! =]On to the food...we ordered cheese curds, fried mushrooms, wings (spicy garlic and buffalo) and burgers (saloon and one with guacamole). Â Those burgers...wow! Â So impressive! Â You could tell that everything was fresh and it was cooked perfectly...and not to mention...JUICY!! Â So so so good! Â The curds and mushrooms were up there with some of the best I've had, too. Â The only thing that we felt needed a little work was the wings. Â They were nice size and cooked properly, but the sauce was just too thick and sauce-y and there was way too much of it on the plate. Â If it were thinned out a bit and they had a lighter hand in serving it, it would have been much better. Â Next time I will just opt for the dry rubbed wings instead, problem solved! =]This is a nice little bar with good service and really good food! Â See you again soon, JTP!

What I love about Jt's is its laid back atmosphere and their wings are amazing for a reasonable price and the bartenders are really nice especially Daniela and Sarah. The only trouble we had was one time my boyfriend's pizza was burnt but the manager made another one for him. This our regular hang out place and me and my friends totally recommends Jt's.

This place is pretty decent. Cheap beer, bar food, Big Buck Hunter, NAKED PHOTOHUNT! Def a dive, burgers are pretty awesome (even for chicks who don't get that excited about burgers), and the antlered animals drop like flies when I shoot them down with my plastic orange gun. Well, it's not really my gun. I have to share it.Here's a tip: if you ride a horse to the bar, they have 2 hitching posts up front. Score!
Went again, service was again poor and slow. Gave an extra star for the band and prices.

JT's is excellent and their bar food selection (think wings) and dinner specials (GREAT fish entrees) put them way above the norm. Â Ambiance is like almost every other sports bar, but their food and their array of constantly changing on-tap beers is outstanding.For instance, their parmesan tilapia and fish tacos are delicious, and the tilapia comes with Roasted Potatoes & Asparagus... what other sports bar has a menu like that? Â Don't expect a quiet dining experience, all the tables are high tops... no booths..but who really wants that in a sports bar? Â Wait staff is excellent, very attentive and always willing to let you try the lastest beer before you order a glass.Its worth a trip just to watch a Hawks game and try the wings and craft beer, and how many other bars still have swinging saloon doors at the entry???

JT's Porch used to be one of my favorite local places to grab some food. Â USED TO BE. Â The new owners have changed the recipe for the burgers and they are garbage now. Â  My whole meal was borderline horrible. Â The burger had no flavor, was smaller than they used to be, and was overcooked. Â Same with my girlfriends burger. Â Dry and overcooked. Â The "fresh cut fries" were a nightmare of a different kind. Â How they managed to make them stale is beyond me, but both of our fries were unsalted and tasted like they were cooked, then sat out for a while then put back in the fryer. Â GARBAGE! Â We also got the nacho's. Â We added steak to those, the nachos were very underwhelming, but the steak was tasty and excellent. Â I had a horrendous experience with the calamari the other day too, severely overcooked and unbelievably salty, like insanely salty. Â I didn't write a review that day because a kitchen can have a bad Â day. Â I realize that. Â But after today, and the change in the burgers. Â THE PEOPLE NEED TO KNOW. Â They used to have AMAZING wings. Â They still might. Â I will go back to try those, but I'm advising everyone I know that JT's porch is not what it used to be.
The food is great and the drinks are reasonably priced. It would be 5 stars but it is unreasonably loud. Like you can't hear yourself think loud.

We wanted a burger and beer place close to 355 to meet some friends. Â J.T.'s hit the spot. Â Great service, food and drinks. Â Our group had the chicken pot pie soup, wings, burgers , quesadillas everything was awesome. Â We look forward to meeting back there next month.

Visited for the 1st time last week for the game (da bears). Â Well, the place was PACKED...no place to sit and that's when this nice person invited my BFF and I to share hers. Â (Sorry, forgot ur name but I'm sure u remember ours Ms. Anna Nicole Smith wanna be) lol.I bought our NEW FOUND FRIEND a beer, Â ordered the chili cheese fries...Mmmmmm.I hear all the food is great, but can't be a judge of that just yet.The drink specials were off the hook, the owner was very attentive to his guests and out waitress was a doll. Even the people there were nice. Â Its seems everyone knows everyone. NICE.I will return and hope I can get my own table. Â But if not, I will accept an invite to share.

GROSS. I felt dirty here. My husband and I live in Lombard so we went out for a quick bite and beer on Sunday night. We sat outside and when we looked at the windows with the huge light up beer signs, we noticed the windows were covered with 1,000's of bugs. It was disgusting. You cant sit outside because they swarm you. Inside is a biker bar. Servers look like they just rolled out of bed. Food was bad bar food. Cheese curds were hard, crappy cheese and generic deep fried breading. Whoever said they were good has obviously never had a real one.

The wings are the BEST!!!! Â We stopped in for a small snack after visiting a local garden center. Â We just wanted appetizers and a drink. Â Walked into a very crowded bar on Memorial Day (wasn't anyone invited to a BBq?). Â Apparently a large travelling baseball team had just arrived. Â Of course, male coaches didn't notify the pub that they had a large group coming in. Â Thus only 1 waitress to serve every table. Â  JENNA was the best. Â She didn't miss a step in service. Â And for food, like I said the WINGS are the worthy of a trip. Â Thank you Jenna!!

I'm a bit skeptical but one of my very good friends swears by this place... and their undying devotion to having UFC games on tv all the damn time.The crowd is really different... ranging from older guys in classic rock bands to 22 year olds that get all fancied up for a night out at JT's.I enjoyed the few games of pool that I played, the classic rock cover band that was on sounded great, AND to top it off I ran into my friends and I like any opportunity to spend some QT (quality time) with my lovely gals, Barb and Jenny.

I have a strict rule about JT's Porch. NEVER EVER EVER visit on the weekends.Typically more of a last-call bar for me, JT's is close to home (walking distance), and an over all friendly place....Sunday night through Thursday. Fridays and Saturdays, on the contrary are loaded up with D-bags and tools.It's like a complete 180 from the weeknight bliss with the chill tunes, the space to walk, and the quality service. Step foot in this place Friday or Saturday night and be prepared not to move, and to hopefully find a place out of the way enough to avoid the Jersey Shore wannabes.Other than that, here are the things I like about JT's. The wings-holy deliciousness, the wings. We've been ordering these since I was a kid, because mom loved them too. The red wing sauce is soooo good. (I'm pretty sure I figured out the secret recipe, so if you're interested...let me know, I'll hook you up). The food in general is pretty decent.Daniella has remembered me and my vodka soda since the first time I came in many years ago...and even if I'm only there once ever 4 months, she has never forgotten. I Â *heart* her for that.

I have been going to JT's even before it was JT's. The building has housed numerous bars/restaurants over the past 30 years. The owner of Â JT's re-opened one of the locations in the Halftime Sports Bars franchise.So much for the history. Let's talk about the two favorite items that I go there for. The wings and the burgers. The wings are the best I have ever had. They are a different type of wings than your usual wing drenched in buffalo wing sauce. These wings are dry rubbed and they are the biggest wings around. 10 wings are more than enough for a meal.The heat comes from the amount of cayenne pepper they put in the dry rub. The hottest wings are red in color there is so much cayenne.The burgers are very large, juicy and flavorful. They are the same burgers they had at Halftime except for where they are cooked. Halftime would cook them on a grill right behind the bar. JT's cooks them in the kitchen. You can get either fries or home made chips. Both are very good.The large u-shaped bar is in the middle of the place with tables on two sides. The clientele range from the young 20's to the 50's depending on the time of day. This place is definitely not a place for families to go to. There is a nice patio also. If you want to try any of their food but do not want to eat in, they do have carry out service.They have a band each Saturday night.So if you want to go to a place with great food, non-yuppie type bar this is it.

Servers are always attentive and nice. Wings are the best around. Â Other food is good as well. Â Drinks are reasonably priced. Â There is a pool table, dart boards, and Golden Tee. Â Bunch of tv's to watch games. Â Live bands on weekends. Â This is a great local hangout.

My new favorite pub in the entire Western Suburbs!We stopped by here on Monday - Labor Day, as we happened to be in area at a min-golf place down the road and found it on help - and we loved the place!It's got a great pub/saloon type of feel to it, which is casual and relaxing.We ordered the cheese curds - amazing!I had a burger, and it's now my new favorite burger in the area!!! I've a huge fan of burgers to begin with, but this is now my local fav. The meat is hand packed and portioned well at 8 oz, cooked perfectly, and came out perfect with awesome melted cheese on top, the bun itself was perfectly soft and delicious too!My wife ordered the blackened chicken panini, and while it was OK, she said she probably wouldn't order it again. I tried it, and I thought it was ok, but was really expecting to taste a little bit more of the 'blackened' part, as it didn't seem to have as much flavor as I expected.We ordered soft drinks, and they are served in nice large cups, which the waitresses kept full for us.All in all, we decided it's our new favorite place now, and can't wait to drop back by with the family and friends in tow!

If you live or work in the West burbs, this is an A-OK place for catching a game (plenty of flatscreens), playing pool, and boozing with your friends while you enjoy mediocre but ultimately satisfying bar food.There's a nice mix of people here, from the early twenties crowd to the mid-thirties post-work crowd to couples in their 50s. There is MAYBE some flirting potential, but don't count on it.Tragically, they do not have a dessert menu.

This was a localrestaurant.comfind and since those are in short supply, I took a chance on coming here for a dinner.I'm not a big drinker, so I usually shy away from the bar/grill scene for several reasons. Drunk people get loud. Sports on multiple big TV's annoy me. Too much grease. Burgers that taste like cardboard. None of these things make for a pleasant dining experience for me. So I was kind of expecting bad food and a bad time.Was very pleasantly surprised to be disappointed here, if that makes sense.Started with the cheese fries. I have not had cheese fries this good in ages. Green onions, bacon bits, ohhhh nom nom nom. I had a bacon cheeseburger that was too big for me to finish. Did you read that? TOO BIG FOR ME (ME!!) TO FINISH! My dining companion had the steak quesadilla and said that it was excellent.Server told us that even though the gift certificate stipulated that alcohol could not be included in the $35 minimum purchase, they allowed it to be. It was a rare moment that I WISHED I was more of a drinker.Drunk people were loud. Sports were playing on multiple, big TV's.And I didn't give a damn...

I've been circling this place cautiously for the past 2 years - oddly curious but never bringing myself to go there. Well, I should have sucked it up and gone in much sooner. It's a decent bar with decent food, lots of TVs, a pool table, and great drink prices ($5 for a 22oz pour of Bell's Oberon). Â We split the cheese curds (yum), the husband had the burger ("better than Alfie's" down the road), and I had the veggie quesadilla (HUGE portion and tasty too). Our waitress was sweet if a little spacey.For a Sunday night it was fairly crowded and I could see how it would be PACKED on a Friday, Saturday, or game day. Â There was a mix of people - young early 20 somethings, us 30's people, and older. The decor is somewhere between western (huge photo of Clint Eastwood by the pool table) and sports bar, but it was comfortable. We enjoyed ourselves and I hope to go back soon. It beats out chain restaurants/bars by a mile, and the prices were reasonable too.
Great place to chill!!! Their burgers are AWESOME and the staff is super friendly. Prices are decent and they always have some kind of special going on. Best bar around the area by far!!!

I think this place use to be a pondersa resteraunt. it is better off going back to that as this place is pretty bad. The service was slow and the look was awful. It is a typical DuPage County bar with a small beer selection especially compared to the city. The location and vibe of this place is just bad too.
Was on Chicago for business and came across this awesome place. Great BBQ western burger and fries. Plus got to watch a Bears game there. Was welcomed for being a outsider.

What a fun evening we had! From the great beer selection, to the perfectly (yes, I said perfectly) cooked burgers, JT's was a perfect selection for an early dinner two days before Thanksgiving. We got a seat immediately, our waitress, Amy was friendly and attentive and took such good care of us. The food as I said was great, even I really liked the burgers. Cole Slaw was fresh, fries crispy....drinks were icy cold. All together we had a great dinner, and plan on coming back soon!

Great service. Â Wait staff are very attentive. Â Never an empty drink. Â Great burgers, taco salad, nachos, and wings. Â Make sure when you get a salad ask for romaine lettuce, otherwise you get iceberg (yulk).The only thing I don't like is that they have live bands play and they're waaaay too loud. Â I usually try to leave before they start to play on Fridays and Saturdays.

This place is a pretty decent local spot. The beer choices are actually pretty decent and the food is great, as great as wings, burgers, and sandwiches can possibly be. The staff is friendly and treat most people like they've been there before. A very casual joint thats great for a post-work drink or 10. I wouldn't make a special trip, but if you're near by, there arent any better near by.
Picked up some food from here to go. I loved the wings, large wings, with mostly a dry seasoning. I really liked them. They were crispy and tasty and you get a lot for your money!

Cool bar with an interesting mix of business man/biker going on- at least on a Sunday afternoon when I was there. The food was very good- a bit slow but hey at least they were making it fresh and it was very crowded so no worries there.The wings are really awesome. They are very unique and I would recommend any wing lover try these out.

I love this place, especially the fried cheese curds! Also, they have 22oz obergon and you cant beat that! Im usually up here wednesday nights when I get off work, the bartenders are fun, the food is good, and I always have a good time

I love this place. Â Groove Sauce Band played Saturday night and they were fab. Â It's a bit of a dive, but always love the eclectic crowd. Â Great priced, well mixed cocktails, and the food is very decent for this type of place. Especially like the Paninis. Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  And the Â best part...shooting pool with my buds!

First time visit. Â Service was excellent, beer was freezing cold, prices were cheap, wings were just OK. Â After reading the other reviews, I should have gotten a burger. Â Music was loud, grunge rock so if you are into that, its a good place to be. Â Iffy as to a return visit.

I live in Lakeview, but work in Lombard. Â I'd rather not spend anymore time in Lombard that I have to. Â However, J.T. Porch has given me a few reasons to stay in Lombard a little longer than I usually do. Â It's a blue collar environment and have yet to find any stuck up and stuffy people there. Â I spend most of the time out on "the porch" on the side.Typical bar food, the servers are great and cheap pits of beer. Â  Unlike most other places I've been to with a side deck, the servers don't forget about you! Â I've seen them step out and take a look to see if we needed anything else.Thanks for supporting our baseball team, also!

I met friends here on my cross-country trip in 10/10. Great food, pretty waitresses, cheap beer, not a huge bar and everyone seemed to know eachother, or at least not be hostile towards one another. Will return when I return to Chicagoland

We go to see our pal Mighty Joe sing here, and it's always a great time. The last time we stopped by we were late and the owner actually carried a small table over to us and made sure we had a couple of chairs. That's customer service! The drinks are good and the servers are attentive. It's got a great atmosphere and we love this place altho we have yet to even try the food!

we just went there last night for the $3 burger night. Â they also had $3.25 stella's on draft. Â seems like they have a lot of specials all week. Â we will definately be back. Â had a lot of POS (beer advertising) which i created so that was even cooler!!
1st time visit last week. Tuesday specials are epic. $3 burgers $3 imported drafts = Wow!

The crowd at JT's is eclectic to say the least. No matter who you are, you are welcome here. Depending on the night, it is generally busy, if not packed. The drinks are excellent, and not too over priced. However, the food is just okay, and consists of your typical bar selection. The people, both patrons and employees, are nice.
Love this place! Go for $3 burgers on Tuesdays, they are fantastic!

Don't be scared off by the wacky Old West facade or the swinging saloon doors or the heavily lacquered bar tables or the strong aroma of beer or the noisy pool players or the disappointing jukebox, this place has excellent bar food, particularly the burgers and the chili. Â I would highly recommend to all unless cowboys make you nervous in the same way that clowns make my kids nervous or midgets make me nervous. Â Footnote: Budweiser is horrible.

I really like JT's. A friend and I first went there the summer of 2008. We had a get together with about 20 people and the manager was very agreeable to accommodating the group. There was a Blue's Band that night and we had a great time -- with no cover. Since then she and I go back to JT's at least once a month. I've taken a lot of family and friends there for lunch and dinner. The staff is friendly. The place is clean and everyone is really friendly. The food is very reasonably priced, nice portions, and very good. In the summer there is an outdoor patio area and although 'smokers' sit outside it's still nice to hang and sip a beer out there. The name says it all - it's a porch, a saloon, and an eatery. Some weekend's it's a great place to see bands. Call to find out who is playing. NEGATIVES - only 2: first their website is not always updated with current band information, and the other is that there are a lot of TV's that are always on - even when bands play. I for one don't want to watch rodeo animals at all - let alone while I'm eating food. (Eric, please --- no more rodeo rough riding crap.... please not that!)
i love this place! :) Great food, great service, great music, awesome sports bar!

I agree with the other reviews... mostly blue collar and biker types here which makes the place as close to a city neighborhood joint as it gets out here. This is one of our usual lunch joints... they have great burgers and Quesadillas. I've been here at night many times to check out bands or games... loaded with new Plasmas all over the place. They also offer some buffet type specials during half time for the Bears games. The staff is very friendly and get the orders right the first time. They have drink specials all the time... that kicks ass! So stop by and have a burger and a beer and spin the wheel to try to get half off your tab...

I've seen this place a million times but I've never stepped foot in it. The other night I was really in the mood to see the UFC fights and a lot of places don't want to cover the fights so I called JT's and the guy on the phone said they do and he also told me about the revised times, which i had no clue about. Sounded good enough so my girlfriend and I went there to grab a table. The front of the place is kinda scary, you can't see whats inside and the couple of people outside smoking just kinda stared at us as we walked in but once inside we got a table, the waitress was awesome (Amy) and she took care of us like we were the only people there, even though the house was full. I expected a rowdy crowd but it wasn't like that at all. Some guys and girls in work attire out for a burger, some softball teams that must of just got done playing, a handful of 20 somethings and some 30 somethings etc. The drinks are priced right, the place is casual, the bouncer wasn't full of himself, the owner was cool and actually came and talked to us here and there etc. We even decided on getting food, staying well past the fights, called some more friends to come join us and had a great night there. In the end (with ribs i might add!) we spent something like 45 bucks. Not bad at all. I'd go back without worry about whats beyond the doors this time lol.

I like this place. People are cool and the food and drinks are great and not overpriced. Service is practically perfect! Very attentive servers who check on you and make sure you have what you need when you need it. Pretty supreb for a little bar. I like to come in and watch NBA games and just chill out with some drinks, a few friends and some of their killer Nachos. Their Nachos rock and I have also had their burgers which are awesome. Cool place to kick back for a few hours.

this is a good local dive bar, it also stays open late, so it's a good stop off after the regular places close. Â the crowd is pretty much blue collar, but they are all pretty friendly. Â the bar service is really good too. Â overall, i'd say it's a good place to go if you feel like slumming it that night.ps-they serve their chicken wings with the sauce on the side, i do not recommend them.

Their house special pizza is so delicious and delightful!!!Delivery was exceptional!! Amazing cheese and sauces make the pizza!!! Can't wait to order again!!!Really great customer service too, when you call to order. Just all around great pizza in town!!!!!

Ordered 2 pizzas for delivery on a Saturday night. Â The woman who answered the phone seemed very hurried but got the order correct so it's all good. Â Our pizza was delivered about 40 minutes after ordering. We ordered a thin family sausage and pepperoni and a medium margarita pizza. Â Both pizzas had lots of cheese and were very hot. Â They were a little pricey but I'd order from Rocco's again.
Great pizza made by great people from the old country! Stop in for some awesome pizza and hospitality.
This is our favorite pizza joint in Naperville! We've probably tried 10 different places around the area and this one is at the top of our list.

As a self proclaimed pizza addict, Rocco's is right up there with the best for pizza in Naperville. I love the crust on their stuffed pizza because sometimes I find the crust to be hard, especially if you reheat it but Rocco's is always the perfect crisp and soft on the inside. The double dough is also another favorite crust of mine. The employees are very friendly and I've been there enough times they know who I am which is always nice. The only thing I don't like about Rocco's is that when you order via phone, they never tell you the price, that's my only complaint.
Wow! Â Really good pizza - we've tried thin crust(loaded with cheese and toppings), double crust pepperoni and cheese and sausage stuffed. Â All excellent!
My husband and I order from here because the pizza is actually really good - but the customer service is pretty much non-existent.
My family has been getting pizza here for 18 years and won't go anywhere else. Such a tradition in my family and Rocco's never disappoints. I will be a customer for life
Bla nothing special. Ok in a pinch.
I love Roccos pizza! Their thin crust is my go to pizza. They are reasonable priced and have good coupons. I have never waited any longer than 15 when ordering carry-out.

We have been ordering from Rocco's for about 3 years. We like the crust and the toppings are always plentiful. We used to order cheese and sausage but a few months ago we decided to try something different and ordered the "hot Italian". Loved it! This is our new favorite. So the other night we took it a step farther and ordered the " stuffed hot Italian". Terrific!
They pile on the cheese here! This is our go to pizza joint in Naperville for thin crust and double dough pizza. If you liked Beggars Pizza on the Southside, this place is a great replacement.

Tried Rocco's based on the Yelp reviews. Â I was disappointed. We love seeking out great pizza places. Â As an East coast, 1st generation Italian, I get slightly picky even though it was a last minute decision to order a pizza for the kids. Â Anyhow, my kids were ok with food. Â However, if I'm gonna suffer through the gluten pains later in the evening, I want the pie to be worth it. Â Unfortunately not the case here. Â My biggest peeves?1. Seemingly unseasoned dough (read:no salt)2. Chewy thin crust. Â That's not crusty to me.3. Bland toppings. Â Again, unseasoned tomato sauce.These are small fixes in my unworthy, yet humble, opinion. Â I wanna love a place named Rocco's.I'll try again.

I am in love!! This was my first experience and the whole family loved it! We've tried three different pizza places trying to find one we could all agree on but to no avail. Enter Rocco's and Bam--smiles all around!Other stuff:The staff: Small staff and busy. They weren't rude but they weren't jolly either. I get it and wasn't bothered!The pizza: Cheese was thick but not greasy. Thin crust was chewy but needed to stand up to the cheese and mild sauce. It didn't need a lot of seasoning. Quality cheese was used! Delish!!!

Found a coupon with no expires date(similar to the one in the Yelp website they posted). I called and ask them if they would honor that "buy a Family size get a free mid cheese" offer. Reply was "OK, Just bring the coupon." Â When we came to pick up the pizza, they were very rude and said this coupon was from 15 years ago and very mad. My kid was so afraid and wanted to leave right away. End up we bought some pizza bread from the Menu with tip, total $30 and got out from there.The quality of the pizza went much down hill from before, exactly like the other reviewer said:1. Â Unseasoned dough2. Chewy thin crust3. Bland toppings.There are much better choices in the area!

Well when we first pulled up I saw two men sitting out front yelling stuff in Italian so I knew the place was legit! Our pizza was done in 20 min which is so great. The pizza was really good. We got a basic thin crust, pepperoni and sausage pizza. Wished it had a little more tomato sauce on it, but otherwise great pizza and we'll be back! Definitely a place to carry out or deliver.

While I really liked their pizza, hubby thought it was way too cheesy and even took some of it off.... How dare he?!?? So if you love your pizza cheesy as hell, Rocco's is for you... If ur like my husband, then this not for u. We got their thin crust, and well, just a warning- it's not very thin lol. It wasn't crispy either. Which again, I was fine with, but hubby likes super thin and crispy- so not for him.
