But alas, I ended up giving 4 stars cuz when he is out of town, I will be ordering from here again ;)I would like to see them set up online ordering, cuz the guy who took my order didn't repeat my order back to me and didn't even tell me the price and hung up very abruptly. I had to call back and ask how much the bill would be :/
My favorite go too place for delivery. Â Cheap and better than Pizza Hut.
Margherita pizza with fresh garlic & basil is delicious. Â The Special and Hot Italian are great too. Good sauce & great crust - beats locals Pieroni's, Little Italian, Lou Malnati's, and Giordano's.

No nonsense pizza place in Naperville. This little whole in the wall place is actually really good. The prices are very fair for what you pay and the food quality is good. The location is great if you are out and about (right off of Washington and Gartner) and the staff is always friendly. I'd definitely order from Rocco's again.

Awesome pizza! I was first introduced to Rocco's when I started dating my fiancÃ© Mary. There cheese on thin crust pizza is by far the best I've ever had. It's the only pizza I can honestly say I carve from time to time. The only reason I won't give Rocco's 5 stars is due to football season. There normally open at 4:00 on Sunday... Why not noon during football season? All I want is to enjoy Rocco's while watching the Bears.

BEST PIZZA! Â We've been getting pizza from Rocco's for years (before the current owner even had the place) and it is our family's favorite.Every party we've had where we served Rocco's resulted in 2-3 new friends that commented on how good it is-- and requested it for future parties!The only time I've ever received a mediocre pizza from Rocco's was a couple times on a Friday or Saturday night when they're super-busy and cranking them out as fast as possible. Â Even their mediocre pizzas are better than some other places normal pizzas.Plus, you get a ticket with each pizza box and when you collect 15, you get a free pizza.My review is based on their thin crust pizzas. We've never had the stuffed.Rocco's is awesome.

I'm not going to lie...it's good pizza. Pizza is my all time favorite thing to eat so naturally I have to try every new pizza place I find.We ordered a large 14" half pineapple&canadian bacon and half sausage. The crust was just crispy enough, but not hard. The sauce wasn't overly sweet. Cheese...let's talk about the cheese. That thing was loaded up with cheese. Ooooh, so good.Definitely recommend. The customer service is lacking a bit but the pizza is good.
I like Rocco's -- a solid pick for when you need big thin pizzas for a party or family dinner night. Reasonable prices and great coupon deals

average pizza.....poor beef sandwich.....good spaghetti.......gyros were ok but had no tzatziki sauce....either they forgot it or they don't serve them with it?how anyone could rave about this place with 5 star reviews is beyond me.
My husband & I love Rocco's! We go about twice a month. It's just good, honest Italian goodness.We prefer the pan style pizza vs the stuffed, but have yet to have anything but a great experience!

Ordered delivery tonight to try something different. The middle of the pizza was completely raw. The sauce and cheese was flavorful but if a pizza place can't get their temps right what's the point? Maybe they just specialize in thin crust - we ordered the double.

They make a very good thin crust. That's my go to pie. Extra thin with a nice crisp outer crust. I had a problem once and Fred set things right. That says a lot about a place. Everyone can have a bad night.

Had pizza here on about 6 different occasions. Pizza is slightly better than average. Traditional crust is better than the double dough which was very bland. They are generous with cheese and topping which is a plus. Delivery is always on time. Some of their specialty pizzas lack flavor stuck with the traditional toppings and you'll be fine.

Walked in, grab a slice to goWalked out with a delicious and deliciously huge slice of pizza, for 2.75 in no time flat.Let's check with the panel of experts....... It seem the consensus is WAAAHOOOOOOO

Several misleading reviews on this joint. Â I gave this place a shot on my way westward from O'Hare. Â No reason to stop here folks. Â Thin crust is soft like bread. Â Not enough sauce on this pie. Â Though they do throw on a good amount of cheese. Â If they had a better balance I could say it was at least mediocre. Â Unfortunately, this place does not come correct. Â Try someplace else for pizza. Â There's just no reason for bad pizza to exist this close to the Chi.

Got a quick slice with sausage to go for $2.75. Â WOW! Â From the dough, sauce and cheese, all the ingredients tasted very top notch! Â The dough was kinda thick, but soft and delicate and the same time. Â Sauce tasted fresh and had a good flavor and the cheese wasn't overwhelming like what most pizzerias do to mask the flavor of the dough and sauce.This place doesn't mess around!

Rocco's is one of my favorite places to order pizza from.Personally I think its an amazing deal considering how good it is. I love how this place always has the pizza ready when they say its going to be ready. At other pizza places I sometimes have to wait around a few extra minutes, but that rarely happens at Rocco's. They seem to be very organized!The price is very reasonable and the pizza tastes amazing! Rocco's rocks!
Best thin crust pizza in Naperville and they also have an exceptional delivery service and the best prices around. Highly recommended!
Great thin crust pizza! Hands down best thin in Naperville!

I used to go here as a kid. My family ate Rocco's pizza every friday night. It was amazing. My family quit eating here a little after Rocco sold the place because the pizza changed a little bit. But I just moved back from chicago and wanted to try different pizzas and thought of Rocco's. Figured why not give it a chance? I placed an order and honestly the pizza is just mediocre now. The cheese is good, but the crust was really hard and dry and the sauce was a little off. I wouldn't say the pizza is bad, but it isn't as good as other local spots. I really still miss the old Rocco's recipe.

ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE PIZZA! I called and ordered for delivery at 11:45am for mozzerella sticks and a medium sausage/pepperoni pizza. Â The driver first delivers the food to the BACK door (where there is no doorbell) - I only knew it was mine because I went out the back door to throw stuff away. Â I first opened the mozz sticks and they were overcooked, lukewarm at best and did not taste good. Â So I figured the pizza would be better....wrong again! Â I opened the pizza and took a bite...again COLD pizza and I had to try to nuke it in the oven. Â After i took it out of the oven, it didn't look appetizing. Â Never again will I give my money to this crappy place!

We have been looking around for a new pizza place, since our local place closed last year. Â So, tonight, tried Rocco... Â  ordered a medium stuffed pizza, as that is what we miss most from our old location. Â Went and picked up. Â Was ready exactly at the time mentioned. Â Driving home, it smelled burnt. Â When we got home and opened the box - yup - the entire upper/outer crust was burnt black. Â Interestingly, the bottom was just fine. Â Not sure how you burn the top crust, and the bottom is fine. Â Anwway, the pizza was just ok. Â It seems that no one knows how to make a "stuffed" pizza, and just pours more pizza sauce on top.

This is delicious pizza! From walking in a grabbing a slice of the sausage to ordering for delivery. Although I haven't tried it, I doubt their stuffed pizza is as good as Giordano's, Gino's, etc. but the thin and thick crust is the best around. 5+ stars.

My family and I have been using Rocco's as our default take-out pizza place for many years. Â The crust is nice and crispy and the toppings are plentiful and taste fresh. Â I don't crave it in the same way I crave Home Run Inn (aka...all the time), but it's good pizza and not super-expensive.

I love this place for brunch. Â I really, really love this place for brunch. Good coffee? Check. Â Fresh squeezed juice? Â Check. Â Efficient service? Â Check. Â Long waits on weekends? Check.This place is always packed, and for good reason. They have a really extensive menu of both breakfast and lunch items. Â In the 20+ times I have eaten here, I've probably done lunch once because the breakfast is just so darn good. Â  They have a massive menu with a plethora of choices, and I've never had a mediocre dish.So why the 4 stars? Â The wait is just long most Sundays. Â It's an average of 30-45 most Sundays, but I'm willing to wait because the food and service are just that good.
In the area decided to try :Slow serviceMediocre foodFound a hair in my food which I know happens but still sickened!

After a late night out on Saturday, I was ready for a heavy breakfast this past Sunday morning. Â My buddy took myself and four others to Butterfield's Pancake House to help us start our recovery. Â When we got there a little after 10:00 we were told it would be a 25 minute wait which was highly disappointing. Â We begrudgingly sat down and literally less than 2 minutes later they were calling my name. Â Apparently they had a table that they totally forgot about and were able to seat us immediately. Â This may have been the best thing that happened to us all day.The breakfast menu was one of the biggest I've ever seen. Â It had literally every breakfast item I could imagine and it was all reasonably priced. Â I ordered the South of the Border Frittata which seemed to pack the most bang for my buck with 4 eggs and a side of pancakes or cornbread at $9.99. Â The frittata was good, and fed me all day; but the cornbread was awesome. Â I honestly don't even know if it was homemade or not, and maybe it was a result of the activities from the night before, but for some reason that cornbread just tasted amazing.Everything was quick and the service was friendly. Â The next time I'm in the area, I'd be happy to return here for another recovery breakfast.

Such a staple brunch place in Naperville! Usually the wait is not horrible (even on a Saturday morning)--maybe 20 minutes tops. What I love is its abundant options of brunch entrees to choose from! I'm always drawn toward the benedicts (smoked salmon is bomb) or the skillets (farmers)! Even if you don't love brunch food, they have plenty of other items on their lunch menu to choose from as well. Service is great and it's always a warm and inviting atmosphere at Butterfields!

Mein Lieblingsrestaurant ist Butterfields in Naperville, IL. Â Es gibt FrÃ_hstÃ_ck und Mittagessen bei diesem Restaurant aber die Leute essen nur FrÃ_hstÃ_ck bei Butterfields. Ich esse immer die "New Mexico Skillet" denn es ist besonders gut. Â NatÃ_rlich empfehle ich der "New Mexico Skillet" aber ich empfehle auch das "Caramelized Banana Steel-Cut Oatmeal" und die Pfannkuchen. Alles ist gut bei Butterfields! Â In dem Restaurant ist das Ambiente verrÃ_ckt-- zu viele Leute! Es ist ein beliebtes Restaurant, besonders am Sonntagmorgen. Â Der Service ist fantastisch denn man bekommt sein Essen schnell. Â Ich mag dieses Restaurant denn es hat gutes Essen und ich habe gute Erinnerungen dort. Ich gehe dort mit meiner Familie wenn ich bin zu Hause in Naperville.

Great expectations being that "pancake house" is the name, however just a normal breakfast joint. Only about 5-6 pancake options I believe but a full menu of other breakfast items nothing too extravagant though

I've been here for breakfast twice, both during non-peak times... during PEAK times it gets a little crazy crowded. Â They have a decent sized menu for lunch/brunch so lots to choose from! Â I'm pretty sure I got the same california scrambler breakfast both times, that's ok though it was good and I guess memorable. Â My last visit with my mom was on a Friday after the morning rush...our server was alright, though she never did come back and ask if we needed anything more or if anything was ok? Â Servers work on tips and they should really at least check back up on their customers eating, especially to see if they want anything else. Â I will still come by here when I'm in the mood for going out for breakfast or brunch as the food is good, and again...plenty to choose from.

Loved it. I had french toast bacon and eggs. Â Let's start w the bacon. Big thick slices, not that dried out junk so many of the chain breakfast joints give you. Best French toast I've had in years. Â Eggs - scrambled w cheese - were just a wee bit runny but tasted fine. Service was quick on an early Wednesday morning and the server was very friendly and fast. Third day in Chicago area this week, third time out for breakfast, easily the best of the bunch.

What's better than brunch? Nothing! You get breakfast and lunch all in one plate so you can save some dough for a bigger dinner tab ;)First time I was here, I had their Nutella French toast which was amazing! What better than eggs all soaked into the bread and the nutty chocolate sauce all over it? Nothing! Pair it with a cup of coffee for a perfect combo.The second time I'm here, I got the corn beef hash skillet. Corn beef without onion and green pepper. No Monterey cheer and light on jack cheese with 2 eggs over easy. Â Omg, break the egg yolk and let it soak all over the hash brown.... Hummmm I'm craving for another one as I type. So fatty so delicious.On the side, it comes with 2 pancakes, the cakes were a little over cooked, but it's extremely buttery. Pour maple syrup all over and slab some strawberry + grape jams for a perfect taste and bite!Tip: this places is packed during brunch hour so may need a little patience in waiting

I've been here a couple times for lunch now and both times the restaurant was pretty busy.Oddly enough, I ordered the same thing both times - the California Chicken Wrap. The first time I got chips as a side and I guess this last visit in I was feeling a little crazy because I switched things up with a little chicken noodle soup action as my side.Both the wrap and soup were good. Nothing spectacular, but okay. The wrap is listed as a "local favorite" and is made up of a soft whole-wheat tortilla filled with grilled chicken breast, chopped romaine lettuce, tomato, avocado, and Monterey Jack cheese. Ranch dressing was served on the side. The ingredients were fresh and the wrap was satisfying, just nothing special. It was super messy to eat and it kept falling a part. Maybe it wasn't wrapped properly? Or maybe overstuffed? Who knows. I also wish that the ranch was just included in the wrap mixture, because dipping it on the side was quite difficult.The chicken noodle soup follows suit in that it was good, but nothing special. Could have been your regular old canned soup for all I know. We were set up with a pitcher of lemon water at the table, which is always ideal. I asked if they had iced green tea, but that was a no-go.Our waitress was very nice and efficient. The menu is pretty big and includes breakfast and lunch items. I think next time I'm there I'll have to give breakfast a go!

Used to be better. Coffee is acidic and bitter tasting. Omelette were dry the last two times we were there.Tables are way too close together.The manager is Rude. He frequently stands right near the front door to the restaurant smoking. I have personally witnessed him throwing lit cigarette butts onto the sidewalk or parking lot and then he spits. From there he goes back in and picks up menus to hand to arriving customers. Â Gross!

Love this place! Try the banana nut waffle. It's amazing! But you'll need to ask them to cook it dark so that it's crispy (you may need to tell them to burn it because they'll bring it to you light anyways)... Also, dip in syrup as you eat it so that you maintain the crispness. And the fresh orange juice is the best!

Again service not good. Super slow. Â French Toast and waffles were great. We got the farmers skillet which was okay. It was better last time. The biscuits and corn bread were terrible. Stay away from these two items.

I'm definitely not the person you ask when looking for a good breakfast joint. I like breakfast, but mostly just the fried potato and carbs. I just can't get into the rest. It also probably hurts my credibility when I tell you I'm a vegetarian.Needless to say, a friend insisted on treating us to lunch and so we obliged. We had four kids and two adults. The kids pretty much all ordered the Mickey Mouse pancake which was pretty cute and they all seems happy. I ordered a side of the sweet potato hash and something carbohydrate (told you I'm chill about breakfast). Everyone liked the food. No one complained. We left happy and full.Would we go back? Sure. If we happen to be in the company of breakfast-lover friends. Until then, I'll sleep in a little later and grab a granola bar on the way out the door, saving the real dining out for lunch and dinner when I'm a little more awake.

This place has got so much better with waiting times. That use to be my only complaint. Food is great, always a hostess ready to seat me when I walk in. Service is great, even with being as busy as they are. Going on a Sunday morning/afternoon is a huge mistake. You will wait 30-45 minutes, but will definitely Â enjoy yourself.

I've never eaten lunch here so I can only comment on the breakfast but it never fails to be delicious! I've ordered several things including pancakes, waffles, and omelets. Most recently, I got the New Mexico skillet with bacon instead of chorizo and it was excellent. The food came out fast and piping hot. The waitress was insanely friendly and checked in numerous times to refill our drinks and to ask how the food was. It can get a bit crazy on the weekends and their is usually a wait. However, the restaurant has a lot of seating so it's not typically more than 20 minutes. Lots of families come here so if kids aren't your scene I would skip it. Overall, really great food and nice people.

I work nearby so I keep coming back for breakfast to go. I don't know why. Convenience? Â I would have left off reviewing and leaving negative feedback but I just can't let it go. There's always something subpar with my order. I've completely given up getting the hashbrowns as they are always way undercooked and raw. With a smattering of browning...on the outside. Inside potatoes...raw and uncooked. The one time I asked for them to be cooked more thoroughly, they just came almost burnt to a crisp outside but still raw and uncooked in the middle. That's it. No more hashbrowns even though I love them. Not from here. Anyhow, pancakes have usually been pretty dry. Today those were the saving grace. Fluffy and warm and yummy. But the eggs. Shudder. Gross and watery or greasy. Maybe from the cheese added but it didn't seem like cheese residue. And scrambled eggs shouldn't have slimy residue all around the edges. Just yucky. Â  The final straw for me that will have me not coming back anymore to give further chances for disappointment was the fruit. How can you mess up fruit, you ask? Â Well, have all the strawberries and grapes be so soft that they are almost mushy. **hands clapping and brushing off crumbs** I'm done. Oh, and all this at ridiculously high prices. No.
Awesome, unique and perfectly casual but cool interior. Wedding soup was the real deal, best I ever had. Good breakfast, nice welcoming and efficient service. Not cheap but well worth it.

The restaurant was more empty than full during lunch time on a week day. Â I really, really wanted an omelet for lunch, and I was happy to see that it wasn't too busy so I knew I'd be able to go back to work in a reasonable amount of time. Â Some of my co-workers have thought about going here, but they surely won't get a recommendation from me.I was seated quickly, and the waitress came to take my order. Â I only wanted water to drink, but needed a minute to check out the menu.I quickly decided that I wanted the Bacon, Date, & Goat Cheese omelet. Â How phenomenal does that sound? Â I looked up, looked around, and I didn't see her anywhere.I saw her walk past my table twice. Â She stopped to deliver the check to the table behind me, set up a high chair at another table, walked into the kitchen area and stared into space. Â We even made eye contact, and even though it seemed like she was avoiding me, I thought she was going to come to my table.15 minutes later, I got up and walked out. Â I was hungry and had limited time.When I was walking out, I saw her sitting on a chair by the register and chatting with another waitress.This is the third time this has happened to me in less than two months. Â Do I stink?

This is your standard neighborhood diner. It's clean and the servers are pleasant. Fast service too.I came for breakfast. Â Scrambled eggs with sausage patties on the side. The patties were very dry. I'd go for the links next time.They kept the coffee filled and it was great. Great servers.I'll definitely try them again.

Service was quick and efficient, and my breakfast was delish! I had the veggie hash and loved every bite. We were seated immediately, even on a busy morning, and the menu selection did not disappoint. Anyone can find something they will love here and the local feel is very casual and perfect for a relaxing bite. I would come back!

This place has really lost its footing as one of the premier breakfast restaurants in the area... The grits are too thick, the pancakes taste like unseasoned dough and I believe the bacon is uncured and pre-cooked too far in advance.I've been looking forward to getting back here and trying to great food I once had but unfortunately I feel as though it's over for me and Butterfields.

I really am not a fan of Butterfields. I'm only giving it 2 stars because my husband enjoyed his dish and the pancakes were ok. I had the bacon and onion skillet. The hash brown and onion were very undercooked. Also there were a bunch of miscellaneous ingredients in my dish. I kept finding pieces of mushroom, tomato, and peppers. My son ordered an apple juice which I assumed would come in a kids cup. Instead the waitress brought a $4 large glass. Seriously. $4 for apple juice! Blah. I really hope we don't make our way back here again.

My husband and I met up with friends for "brunch" last Saturday and we had a pretty average time. Ok, friends were great, but the restaurant itself was average.We showed up and waited for our friends for about half an hour. The waitress seemed displeased with this. Sure, we weren't delighted either, but it wasn't our fault. I politely ordered coffee and she kept the refills coming.The food came out pretty quickly after we ordered. I ordered the hazelnut, nutella and banana french toast. The french toast by itself was nearly $9.25. For 2 full slices of bread with half a banana and a sprinkling of nutella, that is crazy. I could see it being close to $10 if it included hash browns or sausage or eggs or something. But for the french toast alone, ridiculous. Frankly, the cheapest thing on the menu was eggs. 2 eggs by itself was $5.25. Um..wtf. The markup is crazy. Everyone else at the table ordered something similar to mine (aka some variation of french toast) and it was all the same price. My coffee was $2.95 which I still think was a little high seeing as each cup was about enough for 3 gulps.It was nearing 3 pm when we left (and incidentally, when they close). Our waitress brought us the bill and told us "we're closed. If you want to keep talking, you'll have to leave". Um. Ok. There's nicer ways to boot people out. There were several other families still sitting in the restaurant, but we were asked to leave.It's not like we were causing a ruckus, just 2 polite quiet couples out for a brunch, albeit a late brunch. With so many other great restaurants in the area, I don't think we will be back.

We live in St. Louis but my daughter and I were in Naperville on my Birthday (June 5,2016).The service at Butterfield's was excellent! Â The food was very good - pancakes were a little thin on consistency, but still good. Â My daughter had a skillet, a friend had an egg white omelet and another had sausage and risotto. Â Everyone was well pleased.The restaurant was clean as were the restrooms. Â I recommend them wholeheartedly.Enjoy!

Good, but not amazing. Â There were four people in my party and we ordered a wide variety of items.The regular pancakes were good...the multi-grain pancakes were dry and flavorless. Â The link sausage was delicious. Â The cheese grits were nothing to write home about.Service was good and coffee cups stayed full.It was a good experience, but not a place that I would drive out of my way to seek out.
Pancakes were phenomenal!! Best I've ever tasted. I also had the California skillet and that was amazing as well! Service sucked but the food was the bomb.
Sometimes a long wait, but always worth it. They have the single best hangover skillet imaginable. they are always busy for a reason- really good food. Favorite breakfast place ever

This is my go-to breakfast place in the area. Â They have an extensive menu, and something for everyone. Â Awesome egg dishes, pancakes, waffles, crepes and some more creative options to please the foodies. Â I love love love the cheese grits and the fresh squeezed orange juice! Â I have found them to be very consistent, but once in a great while the service can be a bit slow. Â However, that doesn't stop me from coming back :-)

An ordinary breakfast house. Â Naperville is not Scottsdale and this restaurant is nothing like the Butterfields in Scottsdale. Â While visiting family in the Chicago area, decided to take them for breakfast at this restaurant. Â What a letdown having been used to the Scottsdale location!!! Â Menu is not in the same league.

My wife and I love this place for our Saturday/Sunday breakfast/brunch. We only order breakfast food here.Crepes are fantastic and so is the strawberry mascarpone French toast. But I can never just order one entrÃ©e. I order crepes or the French toast plus either eggs Benedict or a skillet of some type.I love Dunkin' Donuts coffee, but the coffee here is a competitor to Dunkin.Service has always been very good. Even when the place gets super busy. But the best thing I like about Butterfields is that my food is out and on the table no more than 10 minutes after I order. Regardless of the restaurant is packed with a 30-40 minute wait, or you walk in and sit down.My favorite spot and have been her countless times with my wife.
Great place for a quick meeting or with your family. Â Not too expensive food is good coffee is good for a squeezed orange juice down home feel good food and friendly service.

A great place to have a little family breakfast/brunch... they're so accommodating to the little ones - PLENTY of low tables and high chairs, little sippy cups, Mickey Mouse pancakes, crayons... woo hoo... the nephews were ACTUALLY ENTERTAINED!!!The food was great - pancakes and a skillet - no complaints here!

Really good! They had a great variety of choices with breakfast and lunch. I had a buffalo chicken sandwich and it was very hot, but really good. The homemade chips were also very crispy and perfectly salted. Service was just the right speed and our waitress was friendly but not overly eager.

This place was the best best breakfast I have ever had. Seriously. Fresh squeezed oj, Denver omelette with goats cheese and mushrooms, and two buttermilk pancakes. I'm not much of a pancake person but these are delicious. Large portions. You should definitely eat here.

Food was pretty good. Â Reason for 3 stars...We walked on and it smelled of freshly burned toast. Â During breakfast, the cooks burned something else and the smell was very overpowering.Sat in booth by windows and the ledge was very dirty and is in desperate of cleaning.

Well let me begin by saying that this place is huge and the service is awfully poor. We sat here for almost 20 mins one blonde server passed by us three times forth time I asked her if there will be anybody coming here we need menu so we could order he had such absurd expression on her face that words can't explain. So we finally got lucky got the menu than there wS this young server number 7 she came took our order with not too much of a delay we were served the food I couldnot imagine how bland everything was Mexican burrito was made for toddlers. And panini had more artichoke than chicken so it was way to sour for my taste. Bill was almost served few mins after they put food on our table We end up consuming some food nobody came around and i was in need of some box so I could pack the leftovers l I. Vain went up there asking for a box I was given a box but very rudely. Bottom line is I am never coming back to this place ever again.
Great food excellent service all you would want in a breakfast restaurant. The spinach feta omelet was awesome

Meh. It's okay. I have been here half a dozen times. It's much like Egg Harbor but with a more extensive menu.It's honestly nothing special. At least nothing beyond nostalgia. It certainly has that going for it. The pancakes are not from scratch. Nothing I've had has really stood out. Well, nothing besides the fresh orange juice. Â --that stuff I could drink all day!Stay far away from the New Mexico Skillet. --it is one greasy mess of a skillet. The cornbread they feel they are famous for is over mixed, causing it to be too dense. --Mix only until incorporated! The other skillets are okay. Nothing has been bad (um, except for the New Mexico); it's just nothing I get excited about either.I go because my kids beg for it on Saturday mornings and I don't have the heart to say "no". Â Sleeping in on Saturdays during the winter and then schlepping out to breakfast is a family tradition. With the proximity and the fact that I can avoid downtown parking, I'll still continue to go. They win by default.But someone needs to direct me to a great breakfast place. A place that I don't choose because it's the "lesser of evils".

Good food when you have a taste for breakfast. But where on earth is the allergy menu? I can't find it anywhere online. This is important.Last time I was there I was also shortchanged by a dollar. The girl who rung me out must have been new.

Scrambled eggs were amazingly good.Hash browns were historically bad as if they were burnt and then aged under the stove for weeks prior to serving. Tap water tasted like a mixture of lemon pledge and toilet water.The pancakes were the definition of average.

I've been in the neighborhood before and I've seen this place but would never go in. Â But since we were in the area again looking for breakfast, based on the yelp reviews, we decided to give this place a try. Â I'm glad we did.We ordered the corned beef hash skillet, strawberry crepes, carmelized banana steel cut oatmeal and veggie hash--made with brussel sprout leaves and other root vegetables. It was delicious. Â The oatmeal was very creative.Our waitress was very old school and the place was loud and noisy. The food was great and we will definitely be back when in the area. Also, there is some outdoor seating. Nice place.

Went in for brunch around noon, so after the big rush. Place was half-full, and we (table for two) were seated in the back, in the raised seating area. Was ignored for ten minutes before a server came by to take our orders. Drinks we ordered (orange juice and a coke) didn't arrive until after, when our food was brought, we were asked "was there anything else you needed?". Food was average, not worth what they charge with service like this. Waitress never apologized for forgetting the drink order, only checked in for a refill on drinks when we had to flag her down. When we went to pay, cashier wouldn't even look at me, too busy on her phone. Didn't ask how everything was... just poor service.This place used to be a consistent 4/5... now, I have to give it a 1/5. So sad.

"It's marvelous" says my father. We got in on a Sunday morning with no wait. Food is delicious and came out very quickly. Even though they were busy, we got in and out in less than 40 minutes. Only downside is it's pretty noisy. They do have a patio though which is nice. My dad has tried two of their omelets now and loved both. He's had the Denver and the Tuscan Omelet. The egg and cheese quesadilla was also very good. Overall a great place, only downfall is the noise!

Food is always hot and delicious, however, service is always hit and miss. In my opinion, it's not worth a thirty minute wait, there's a lot of better places to go to in the area. Oh, it's also Extremely loud.

Had breakfast here recently with my family. Â The scramblers were really good, as well as the coffee and potatoes. Â Service ... that is the problem. Â It is hit and miss. Â The man that delivered utensils stopped by the table and did not say hello nor good morning, even after we greeted him. Â This is with an empty restaurant; nobody was rushed. Â One cup for coffee was missing, he did not care. Â The waitress was just as rude and unwelcoming. Â If they do not want customers to show up, maybe they should close the place. Â Too bad, since the food was Â very good.

I live in Naperville, and this is a solid go-to for my family. Â I think the price is a little on the high side, but I think the food is off decent to high quality for being a standard pancake house. We've been to other places in the area with cheaper prices where you can notice a drop off.Biggest negatives I have are that the service can sometimes be hit or miss (attentiveness - in my opinion I shouldn't have to wait long at all for refills on a coffee...like, my coffee cup should almost never be empty), and my biggest pet peeve is they have a back area that is secluded from the rest of the restaurant - this is where they'll seat you (9 times out of 10) if you have small children. Â It's when you're back here that I've noticed the service can be neglectful. Â Also, the ambiance/lighting of that area is terrible when compared with the rest of the restaurant.Pros:Food QualitySpeed of ServiceCons:PriceSometimes Service (can be hit/miss)Seating when you're with children

We tried Butterfield's for the first time yesterday...never again. We had a 10:30 reservation, arrived at 10:20 to be on time. We were finally seated at 11:40. We shouldn't have waited, but they lied and kept telling us we were 'next'.It took 15 minutes to get water, another 15 to get a waitress, who took our coffee and food order at the same time. 20 minutes later out came half our food, still no coffee. 15 minutes later the rest of us got to eat. Half our food was burnt. All of the hash browns were burnt, as was all of the toast. Finally got coffee as we were ready to go.Oops, almost forgot to mention, they have open style ceilings, like a warehouse, it's so blasted loud in there, you can't hear your table mates talk.Never again.

This is the breakfast place I keep coming back to. Incredible pancakes, extra thick bacon, and the orange juice is amazing. I even have them cater for an annual event and their catered food is still really good. Love this place.

Love the Dutch baby miniature. Â It takes 20-25 minutes but it's worth the wait. My favorite here. The price is a little higher but it is good. Â Clean restaurant and the staff is nice. Â It gets busy here on weekends. Â Be prepared to wait.

Today was a panini kind of mood day. Plus one thing is for certain I have always liked the coffee refill service at Butterfield's. They are always on top of their game never an empty cup.I noticed on their chalkboard their homemade cream of spinach soup was one of the options. When I dine alone I am usually placed in their 2 seater booth, which I don't mind its cozy and all the condiments are right in front of you. I went forward and ordered a cup of soup and their Ham & Swiss Panini. The fries were crispy and of course I loaded them up with Cholula sauce. Sliced pickles on the side was different and enjoyable compared to most places that give you a spear. The coleslaw is why I removed 1-star. I am more of a creamy coleslaw fan myself however there was no flavor and a thick texture to it. No worries, this did not spoil my mood. Their cream of spinach soup was FANTASTIC!!! I would say the top 5 best I've had in my life.Keep up the great service as always :)

This used to be my favorite restaurant. Today I Waited an hour and 15 minutes in a not crowded restaurant for a German pancake that never came. The people I was sitting with were served breakfast 45 min before I left and still my German pancake was not delivered and no one could explain why. Â spent my entire lunch hour trying to have breakfast and I'm going back to work hungry with no options for the next six hours. Never coming back here again!!!

Eh. I don't get the hype. Maybe it's because I've only been here once and got biscuits and gravy and it was god awful, very little flavor. but I'd rather just drive to fox valley and eat at juicy o's.

This was our first time here. And the food was excellent. My bacon, date, and goat cheese omelette reminded me of Spain. The side of cornbread was actually a warm mini loaf. Plus, there was quality fruit on the side. My husband said his mushroom Swiss burger was flavorful, juicy, thick, and cooked medium as ordered. And our server was attentive and delightful. Too bad we live so far away....

The pancakes were so good!! I wana say better than Cracker Barrel but that might be blasphemy! It had this cake flavor but super tender. I didn't think I was gonna eat them all but I did. I also had a skillet. It was good but way too much going on in one bowl for me (sounded better than it tasted) but the coffee is delicious - again giving DD a fun for the money and like everyone said - the juice is phenomenal. Decided to kick in another star because the service was excellent too'
Amazing food, great service. We came for brunch. The banana waffles, skillet, and pancakes were out of this world. The waitress was very helpful in helping to pick appropriate sizes for the kids.

Good, not quite great. We had scramblers and pancakes. The service was a little utilitarian for my taste, not the friendliest wait staff. They are obviously trained to be super efficient and fast, which is good. But hey weren't very friendly. Overall I would go to butterfields again if I was nearby.

$28.00 breakfast!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!I went here with my son on his day off from school and almost lost my mind that we almost spent $60 on the two of us....ridiculous.Breakfast food is cheap to buy...and it shouldn't be marked up unless it's pastured eggs and all organic...but I"m sure it wasn't.I won't be going back....I'd rather put the money into his college fund.

This would be a four or at least a three star but their current hash browns are terrible and a skillet is my thing. A two star is "Meh, I've experienced better" If you screw up a skillet you're through. I had asked for a bacon and mushroom skillet instead of their bacon/onion option. When she served it up in record time, it looked full of onions, those are taters? I've never seen half inch wide noodle shaped hash browns before. Some of them were 3 or 4" long. I picked a couple out to test and they had the consistency of an uncooked potato, also not very warm. I did something I haven't done in a long time and sent it back. I should of tried a different item but asked to be sure to try and crisp up the taters. I brought half home as usual and will have to reheat upside down to crisp up the potatoes. (see pics) The second skillet was a little better but not too enjoyable.It had been some time since I was here for breakfast, as I used to frequent often when I lived in the area. I still use the same mechanic for 14 years so I may stop in here or Schmaltz when I drop off my vehicle for service. I was in the mood for a skillet today and Schmaltz Jewish Deli is very limited on breakfast items. They probably would of served my needs better and it may be a while before I return here. The super nice waitress did inform me they've been getting a lot of complaints, so they are switching back to old style hash browns.The service was spot on, although I never really got a greeting from a host, (a waiter finally approached me) as I stood there a few minutes before someone asked if I wanted to be seated. A customer actually walked up and asked if I was meeting him here? Apparently people just walk in and stand there waiting for others to join them, so if you come in by yourself you best say something. You would think at 8:30 am there would be a host greeting guests.If memory serves I think that was what turned me off this place. Cashier didn't even ask how my meal was and other than the kind waitress, the owner/manager present didn't even make eye contact and certainly no apology.

Great food and great experience. Had a table of 6 which included wheel chair and 2 kids. The staff was thoughtful to accommodate our needs without any issues (you would think that should be coon in restaurants but is not).We enjoyed steak and eggs, scramblers and French toast with cinnamon apples. Everything was delicious!! Â Thank you!

Butterfield's Pancake House has shown me that I have indeed entered adulthood and can no longer consume the massive portions that I once could in undergrad. Suffice to say that their portions are on the larger side. I got their farmers skillet which included a plethora of meats and vegetables. Although Ive ordered a lot of farmers skillets from other places, my skillet at Butterfields probably had the best proportion of meat to vegetable to cheese to hashbrown proportion Ive ever had, which meant that they did not skimp out on the protein.The friendly service and general atmosphere really give it an inviting feel that allows me to overlook its louder noise level.A tip: if you wanna sample the biscuits and gravy, i suggest ordering the biscuit as your side carb to your main dish (instead of rye bread, cornbread, or what not) and ordering just a side of gravy (its cheaper that way)!

I went at a busy time. The hostess said it would be a half hour wait, Â we got seated in 15 minutes. Waitress was nice and made sure we didn't run out of coffee, Â she always checked on us. We placed our order and was surprised the food came out in a timely manner. The waitress gave us the check but we wanted to still enjoy the coffee, she continued to make sure we didn't run out of it.

I'll take a pint of coffee... and keep 'em comin'!They've got damn good coffee service- that's for sure. My mug was full the entire meal. They must have been refilling it somewhere in between my sipping and blinking because I KNOW I drank a sh*t ton of coffee today, but I only remember seeing our server top it off like twice. They be nimble and they be quick here... and now I'm prepared to not sleep till March.B-field's is a super spacious breakfast, brunch, and lunch spot located about 7 minutes from downtown Naperville. I can appreciate this because downtown Naperville is gat damn cluster cuss during the morning (and afternoon and evening) hours so it's nice to get away from the parking and pedestrian madness of Washington Avenue and its tributaries. Also going for Butterfield's is it's adorbies factor. Cute animal statues and fun ceiling art made to look like giant waffles with butter melting. Very inviting, very clean and spacious yet cozy. They do fill up on the weekends, though. And there will be a wait, so just be prepared for that but they move the line quickly so it isn't a huge deal.The menu is pretty expansive- to the point where I think it's always taken me longer to decide what I want than it does for me to eat it. I like that they offer a variety of health conscious b-fast as well as the standard (and super tasty) artery cloggers. I've been here when I was dying for some fatty food but went with their berry-granola-yogurt thinking I'd be sacrificing flavor in order to be more fit but that wasn't the case at all. Turns out their berry-granola-yogurt combo is made of angel's wings with just a pinch of kitten dreams and not a sacrifice in the least. I've also gotten their artichoke frittata and avocado bacon wrap (sans bacon) which sounded like pure heaven, but in actuality not nearly as good as I remembered the granola dish to be. Also, their guacamole (comes with the avocado bacon wrap) was surprisingly good.For my next visit I'm going to get the spinach and Gruyere crepes.For my next visit after that I'm going to get the portobello benedict.And for my visit after that one I'm going to get the taffy apple french toast.I could probably go on and write out what I plan on getting for my next 7 meals here but I don't want to sway your opinion too much. Head over to Butterfield's and decide for yourself.

We've been dining at Butterfield's for years and used to love It, but they seem to have fallen off on our last few visits. I used to love the has hashbrowns, but they've been consistently overcooked the last few times and service has been sub par. Our servers have been pleasant, but may disappear for awhile. They make all the traditional breakfast items and they used to do it really well. I don't know if we'll give another shot, but hopefully they'll get back on track soon.

After a 6 mile run and an hour long yoga class tipping the dog at lululemon, it was time to feed the beast with Maryum S.She's definitely a regular here since it's been her brunch spot literally every Sunday for the last few years. Â Now I know why she keeps coming back.As soon as I walked in, I saw their industrial sized juicer pouring out freshly squeezed OJ. Â Good sign. Â I was just sitting at the front waiting for Maryum when the host handed me a menu to look. Â No words needed. Â He read my mind.We were seated in large comfy booth and attended to very quickly-no muss no fuss service. Â Love that they had Louisiana hot sauce. Â Sad they didn't carry Coke (RC only) nor alcohol...no blood mary=(I ordered the Corned Beef Hash Skillet ($9.29). Â Amazeballs. Â Buttery crispy hashbrowns topped with corned beef hash then eggs. Â I could only finish half my skillet. Â Portions here are overly generous. Â I chose the cornbread for my side and it's definitely not to be missed. Actual flecks of corn and mild peppers in it for that added kick.*free wifi

We got there at 11:15am they said 10 min wait and we actually got sat after about 5. The server came over pretty promptly and asked for our drink order. Before we finished even telling her she was running off and I had to shout the rest to her as she walked away. She returned with the drinks and we were still looking over the menu. We are visiting and have never been to a butterfields so it took us a few minutes to decide. So we told her to give us two minutes. Well we finished our coffee and still hadn't order the two minutes was more like ten. We ordered and got our food in a decent amount of time but we once again were out of coffee, cream and sugar as well. We then waited a few minutes for her to come back with our toast that was missing and we didn't have any forks. We decided we couldn't wait any longer so I got up and took some from another table near by. I also went to the side stand to ask for cream and sugar. She eventually came and gave more coffee but never asked how our food was. My sister in law totally got the wrong order. We waited about 5 minutes to get our check and we went to the front and asked to have her meal removed and they did. To sum it up the food was not to bad but terrible service. I'm a server myself so I usually give them some leeway but in this case we were just looked over and neglected. Table 61 server one=F

If I had to choose one word to describe Butterfield's, it would be reliable. You know, like that favorite pair of shoes you keep until the sole is gone and the heel breaks off: it's not exciting, it's not unexpected, but it is comforting, and always there.The menu doesn't have anything off the beaten path or unusual sounding, but it does offer a huge selection of delicious breakfast standards. I'm partial to the cheese grits bowl - warm, delectable southern goodness topped with bits of bacon and two perfectly poached eggs. It's heavenly. I've never ordered anything I've hated, though, and Ive tried a lot. The coffee is always hot, the service is quick, the wait times are reasonable, and it's a great old standby to have in the neighborhood.I also really appreciate that they do carryout, for those mornings where I can't bear to look presentable. And they do carryout well - all your breakfast accoutrements (jelly, butter, syrup, etc) come neatly packaged alongside your fresh, hot meal.If you're looking for wild decor and fancy menu options, this will not be your breakfast spot. But if reliable, delicious breakfast is what you're craving, pull up a chair and get to eating. Just save some of those cheese grits for the rest of us.
Love the food and the people. Â Always so friendly and great tasting variety of meals.

The food was super yummy but it was the worst service we've had in a while. We asked several times for a straw and if they don't want to refill your coffee every 5 minutes perhaps they should invest in larger coffee mugs that don't resemble dixie cup portions. Their blueberry pancakes were delicious and my husband order the swedish pancakes which were also great. But our server was incredibly bad, slow and overall unfriendly. Invest in better staff! I would have given it 5 stars but the waitress just was so unpleasant.....ugh.
Just came from here. Our service was pleasantly prompt. Food is still pretty much average. Our waitress was attentive.

Every time I come to Butterfield's it is packed. I was lucky to get a table on a Saturday morning. The service was good and the food also came out fast. The omelettes did not taste any different from other brunch places (I'm not sure how you could mess them up anyway). I've tried the egg white omelette on a previous occasion, but it was too bland in my opinion.The bf liked the cornbread that came on the side and happily devoured it although he was stuffed.

I have passed this breakfast/lunch spot in Naperville for several months and curiosity and hunger found me face to face with it this morning. Â Dining for breakfast seemed like a good idea. Â It was a Saturday morning, around 10am and the parking lot was packed, but we were quickly shown to our seats by a pleasant a courteous staff. Â The first great impression was the coffee, it's not Starbucks but it was hot, strong and well brewed. Â We got real cream and a pitcher of water with lemon appeared on the table. Â So far so good. The menu is very large and has all the usual breakfast items, boasting that they crack eggs to order. Â My daughter had pecan pancakes (minus the bananas), I ordered eggs over easy, sausage links, rye toast and Â the orange juice. Â  I had heard raves about the fresh squeezed orange juice, and it is on display when you come in the front door....an automatic contraption that holds the oranges, splits them, juices them and delivers the juice into a vessel at the bottom. Â You gotta have it, right? Â At $3.79 for a large glass, which I estimate to be 10 ounces, that's a tad pricey. Â But I wanted it! Â Service was prompt. Â The "pecan" pancakes were standard pancakes with pecans strewn over them, no real effort there. Â My eggs were a little runny on the whites, the hash browns were meh, and the sausage links (large country style) were too salty. Â My rye toast was barely toasted, just warm and too soft to qualify as toast. Â But the biggest surprise to my uber critical palate was the orange juice. Â It's delicious, but largely because it is sweetened with sugar. Â No fresh orange juice is that sweet. Â Bet my paycheck they hit it with sugar or simple syrup.... you can taste it. Â I didn't send anything back, I didn't complain because nothing was that bad, just not that great. Â If I ordered eggs again I'd probably try an omellette if they are not brown, skip the over salty sausage in lieu of either bacon or ham, ask for extra dark toast and pass on the potatoes and perhaps try one of the two types of grits (cheese/no cheese) that are on the menu. Â There are Â lots of other options on the menu that could be a lot better than what we chose.I am giving it three stars because nothing was obnoxious, and I might even go back again because the coffee is decent, service was attentive, and pleasant without being cloying and I now know what not to get and how to tailor my order., and there is a lot more on the menu. But there are families giving that oj to their children... might want to skip that and stick to milk, unless that is also sweetened. Â I wish I could sweeten this review, but this is the best I can do. Â I am coming down a bit hard because with tax and tip breakfast was about $33.00, and remember my daughter had pecan pancakes only...no other sides, no meat...so one expects the bar to be set high!

Nice to see the service still stinks here. Walked in on a Sunday morning at 815. There were maybe 10 other tables. We were seated in the way back by 1 other table. We sat there for 10 minutes and were never served. The table that was there before us never got visited either. We walked out. This is only the 3rd time I've been there and each time is 1 star. Surprised this place is in business, especially when their prices are thru the roof.
Can be REALLLLY busy. Best pancakes around. Â Also really good bacon. Â They do breakfast really well but have a huge menu.

Came for breakfast and was sat immediately in the far back of this huge restaurant. Â Probably sat for all of 2 minutes before someone came and brought us water, etc. Â The menu is not only extensive but has some wonderful healthy and unique options. Â I chose the veggie hash and my husband had eggs, pancakes and hash browns. Â The food came out very quickly, the veggie hash was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING and my husband was more then satisfied with his meal. Â The waitress was wonderful, my only regret is that I did not get her name as she deserves a special shout out. Â Will definitely come here again, thanks for great food and exceptional service!

Rating: 2.8Short description: Breakfast place similar to an SGRPluses: They are quick to seat, quick to eat, and quick to pay.Negatives: Service gets a little spotty at lunch, food is about the same as other SGR's,Recommendations: If you want pancakes for lunch, this works great for that.

This review is for lunch. Had the Black 'n Bleu burger with fries. Burger was dry and tasteless. Bun was stale and hard. I asked for another bun which was a bit better, but still seemed old. Came with some coleslaw which was just average. Gave it two stars because the fries were actually fresh and crispy.

This. Is. Breakfast.Fresh Orange Juice, as you can see by the juicer in plain site.Delish cheesy meaty skillets, I got the Farmers (which had broccoli in it).FLUFFY pancakes, double stacked with powdered sugar and maple on the table.And their coffee isn't burnt or weak, with cream served in a tiny pitcher, not out of individual packets.A bit pricey, but honestly, should be, because it is SO GOOD.

Very average!! Went there today and received cold pancakes and canned corn beef Â hash. Â Not even worth my time sending back. Â That was my second and my last time going there!! Â Don't know what all the fuss is about and why so busy?? Maybe cause there the only sit down restaurant in town in that area??

Food is ok, but the service is really poor. The waitress didn't listen carefully and gave us two wrong dishes... I am supposed to order the glass of squeezed orange juice, but she gave me a carafe OJ, and I paid 15 more bucks for it. Need to train waitress to be more patient.

Was visiting Naperville and decided to get some breakfast at Butterfield's. This was our first visit. The best part about our visit was our waitress. I was so impressed with her efficiency and friendliness that I had to ask her name so I could give her a shout-out here. "Jackie" you were awesome! I loved just watching you do your job. We were so lucky that day to get you because you made what could have been an okay experience into an outstanding one. Your attentiveness to our needs was just perfect - not too much without ever forgetting about us. Watching you interact with other customers and staff did my heart good. Thanks for being you!And, a shou-out to the cooks. Our breakfasts were made to perfection. I had the banana bread French toast and it was delicious. My husband's eggs and bacon were perfect. For someone who makes perfect eggs himself, he was quite impressed. Everything came out so quickly, was hot, and was fresh.The only thing that would keep me from coming back here besides the distance to my home, would be the noise level. For some, maybe that is what makes this place fun, but for me, the noise of the kitchen combined with the noise of the chatter in the dining room, was not pleasant. Sound absorbing materials on the ceiling/walls would go a long way to helping this location be better.

Huge fan of Butterfield's. This is a great noisy, busy breakfast spot. Despite the fact that they are always busy, I've never had to wait a long time to be seated, to have a waitress come to the table, or for the food to be prepared. Menu is the standard stuff but they do it well. Kids and families are very welcome as you'd expect at a breakfast spot like this. My kids are always happy to walk out with a balloon and sucker. Small things like that make a difference.If you give it a try, I recommend the strawberry cheesecake french toast.

Butterfields is a place that my husband and I enjoy going to but unfortunately today we didn't have a very good experience. I am not writing this to talk bad as much as I am just wanting the owners to know what happened. So today, Labor Day, it was quite busy but we actually got seated within 5 minutes. No complaints there! We sat and waited for our waitress and when she got to our table she just immediately asked if we wanted coffee and we both replied no. So we order our drinks, they kind of take forever to get to us. When we order our food, farmers skillet with pancakes and 2 eggs with bacon it comes fast but it's honestly not very warm. The pancakes were not good, they were cold and seemed like they had been sitting for a while. My eggs were supposed to be over medium (but to be honest there have only been a couple of times that any restaurant has gotten this right) but they were extremely runny and I wasn't even sure if they were cooked all the way. :( Our hash browns were soo over cooked and our waitress only came back to give us the check! Never asked how our food was, never gave drink refills, never asked if we needed anything else, just "thanks do you need a box". Although we had a less than great experience we will be back to try again, hopefully we'll have good things to say!

Food is good. Â Service plain out sucks! Â Waited 20 minutes for someone to take my order and the place wasn't even 1/2 full. Â No one there seems to care about the customer. Â The servers are busy chit-chatting with other customers rather than taking care of their tables. Â Unreal. Â Might think twice before I go back there again.

Wonderful food and atmosphere. Every Time I go for breakfast there is always a wait but it is definitely worth the wait and the staff are always very nice and charismatic while still getting food out quickly and what seems to be efficiently.
This is the best breakfast place! I have been here multiple times and every time the food is amazing and the staff is friendly.
One suggestion, you gotta go there early on the weekend to avoid the crowds.The food is great and fast ...can't wait to go back to get more pancakes this weekend
Dirty environment (lots of crumbs and grease on table, sticky bottles of condiments). Very rude and poor service. The food was not fresh and greasy. Will definitely not be back.

I and my wife would frequent Butterfields once every 2-3 weeks when we lived in Naperville. Now that we live in St Charles, this was the first time back in the area and decided to stop in for breakfast. There was the typical crowd out front, but it was only a 10min wait.We both ordered a couple of poached eggs to share and side of biscuit and gray. The eggs were done to perfection (and are not $5.35 as noted by another poster- that's if you want toast and hash browns... these were $1.35 each egg. The gravy was OK- tasteful- but one of the biscuits was hard.In reminiscing on our favorites- I ordered my personal fav was the Strawberry cheese stuffed french toast. Hers was the Mexican Burrito. My wife was pleased with hers... Me, not so much. It used to be the strawberry "sauce" was homemade from strawberries. And... there were lots of strawberries stuffed in them.The order I received had about 3 strawberries sliced on top of the french toast... and about a total of two slices of strawberries stuffed. It was sad, I actually opened up the french toast just to see where I could get french toast, cheese and strawberry! For almost $10- Butterfields can do better. I get great Berries from the store during the winter months. The last piece I hated was the use of strawberry "gel" - an artificially flavored gel for overlaying on cheap pies.Can't say how much I was disappointed that my old favorite had changed so much. Needless to say, we won't be back unless I'm just looking for a really good poached egg.

Enjoyed the service, coffee and quick, huge portioned breakfast. Had the Denver omelette and whole grain pancakes. Only complaint was the syrup was cold and tasted like corn syrup despite maple label. Maple is a tree not a flavor.

Wow can I just say that I love Butterfield's. Awesome food, awesome environment, and the service is always amazing. Cannot say enough good things about the service... so attentive! Give Butterfield's a try and be sure to get the freshly squeezed orange juice!
Service: Awesome.Food: Awesome.Prices: Awesome.Ambience: Awesome.Owner/Management: Awesome.Coffee: Awesome.
The service and organization is slooooow. Horrendous and unorganized. Its a shame too, this place used to be better

We were out in good ol' Naperville for a wedding, and I was in need of a serious post-reception breakfast on a Sunday morning. Thanks be to the good Lord for Yelp & my dad's love of technology for finding Butterfield's! We pulled into a parking lot that was filled with cars, and I was a little worried that this was going to be a 3-hour breakfast excursion... however, we walked in, put our name on the list, and 5 minutes later we were seated in a cozy booth.Fresh-squeezed OJ & a Diet Coke (well, the Diet Coke here is actually Diet RC, if that kinda thing bugs you... but I personally enjoy the RC, so whatevs) was ordered to start my morning right. I had the strawberry crepes with a side of cheese grits, and all was delicious. Were the cheese grits made with that fake neon orange cheese? You bet they were, and they were delicious. The parents also enjoyed their meals & all was well with the world. Hangover eradicated, happy & full, I could now go on about my day.I leave off one star because the service is a little spotty... they are just so busy it seems that the waitresses are spread a little thin. When I went to pay I felt like I stood there for an eternity due to people placing to-go orders at the cashier (it would be nice if that was a separate register). Other than that though, I'd happily return to score some more breakfast goodness.The up-side of waiting in line to pay for a while was that I got to watch the OJ machine do it's work, and it was so cute how they let the little kids go up and put the oranges in... I would have rocked that out if I was a 5 year old! (Who am I kidding... I'd rock that out now, too!)

The cheese blitzes were good, there was a little too much cheese for my preference. Â I just squeezed the excess out. Â The strawberry sauce that was given was superb. The buttermilk waffles topped with strawberries and whipped cream were absolute delightful... It was as if I was consuming clouds topped with heavens angels! A must have to say the least! The eggs were perfectly cooked and the hash browns were crisped just enough !

3 stars... they don't have hot sandwiches? You knew that!2 stars... I asked for no tomatoes and got tomatoes? Take them off!3 stars... staff was friendly, store was clean, just typical Jimmy Johns!?5 stars! To try to balance out a decent shop with yuppy assholes who have no idea how to review.

After a 40 minute wait, my sandwich came with 2 ingredients I did not order. I called back to report the issue and the gentleman that answered denied responsibility. Then the manager offered to complete my order again but charge me for the correct sandwich again. Let me just say I'm glad I live in an area with more than one location. Maybe they will have a more service oriented staff. This location won't be getting any business from me.

This Jimmy Johns provided some food to my place of work so I had a chance to try a couple of their offerings. My pick is ham (over turkey).That said, JJs doesn't have any hot sandwiches (purportedly because it would slow down their "freaky fast" service) and I like my melted cheese. So it wouldn't be my first choice for sandwiches. Still, they deliver, and they are convenient to downtown, so it depends on your needs and desires.
This location is terrible. Â  The staff is rude and they can't follow directions. Â I asked for no tomatoes but there was tomatoes on my turkey tom. Â Also they barely put any meat on it.
30 minute wait for delivery at 3:20 pm on a Thursday. Might want to change those commercials.

Pretty standard for a JJs. Â It's really hard to mess up at a place that is so fast that you only interact with the staff for about 30 seconds. Â We got what we ordered, the store was clean, and we were gone!

I order from this Jimmy John's at least once a week because it's so close to my office. Â You'd think it would be tough to mess up an online order, but they seem to manage to screw it up about 50% of the time. Â Either the chips are missing, or the sandwich wasn't made as requested. Â I'm not asking much, it's a sandwich, but seriously if you're not going to bother looking at the online order form, why am I tipping you?

The past three times I have ordered from this location, they've forgotten something - chips, a drink, a sandwich. Â Then, when I've called to have my money refunded, they say they will, but I never get the credit back on my card. Â It isn't worth the hassle to call over and over again to have a few dollars refunded, but what a joke. Â It shouldn't be that hard to get the order right the first time and it shouldn't be that hard to follow up with a refund. Â I'm 100% done with this store and will never be returning.

"Freaky Slow!"The subs I have had from here have always been up to par with the standard Jimmy John's sub. My go-to subs are either the Vito [No onions] and the Vegetarian [I like my meat, but the avocado spread is amazing!].My issue has always been the service at this place, it is just so slow. I don't live far from this Jimmy John's, probably about half a mile. On ultimate lazy days when the weather is cruddy and getting out of bed seems like the worst possible life decision, I used to order delivery from here.Typically my roommate and I would each order one sub. It would seem simple enough. However, they always take FOREVER! For two subs and only being a half mile from the establishment, they always take at least an hour for delivery.I thought the first time was a fluke so I've ordered twice since then, but still always super slow.

Last 2 times I have ordered an unwich Beach Club it as been terrible! Â This time I even asked (in the nicest way possible) if the lettuce is good, She said yes, and I ordered an unwich... Â As they were wrapping the sandwich up I noticed black and white on the lettuce.... I quietly opened the wrap and about vomited right there on the counter. Â It was the worst I have ever seen. Â I asked them to please make me another sandwich on bread.They gave me the worst look, and removed everything off the wrap and placed it on bread. Â Not sure why I should feel bad about wanting a sandwich with out mold on it.She also accepted my money w/ gloves on while she was making the multiple sandwiches I ordered. Â Pretty Nasty!

Weird to see so many negative reviews. Â I live three blocks from here and order once a week for my lunch at home. Â They deliver it within 7 minutes and it's ALWAYS exactly what I ordered. Â The guys are nice and actually run from the car to my door. Â Freaky Fast and Freaky GOOD! My go to sandwich is the Vegetarian!

Absolute WORST operation. Tried to get delivery and they ran out of bread...how is that possible in a sandwich shop. Tried another time for delivery and they had no driver. Â Honor your advertising of Freaky Fast delivery. JJ corporate should shut you down for false advertising.
Fast delivery! But really light on the meat.

This Jimmy John's has been delivering to our home since they opened. Â They now tell us that their corporate office will no longer let them deliver to us because we are outside their "delivery" area. Â  We are 2 miles away. Â Per the corporate office there is no mileage criteria they measure at the business time of the day and anything over 5 minutes is out of their territory. Â Poor customer service.
The food from here is just as awesome as any other Jimmy Johns, but the delivery is horrible. Â I'm talking minimum 45min to get near Naperville North HS. Â Subs so fast you freak.....?
Can't go wrong with the Turkey Tom (#4) or Billy Club (#8).

"Hi, Welcome to Jimmy Johns" - Everyone yells at me...Gosh, I feel so special, like I won something.... but i didn't.So if you can't tell from my pictures, I'm a big guy. Â Not really fatty Mcfatterson, but ya know, genetically big boned. Â I also retain water like a damn, so I'm a little bloated each time you all see me.... Â But I digress...I'm trying to fit into my old jogging shorts from my freshman year in college, and needless to say, I'm on a diet. Â Normally when I go to JJ I get the not so Gargantuian. Â It's big, but I've had bigger. Â (That's what she said..... BURN!!!)Anywho.... Since I've decided to cut back - I'm eating a lot of veggies, and I decided to get the Vegitarian sandwitch this time. Â Man was it ever good! For some reason I fell in amore with the bread this time! Â It's like they went to heaven and stole the all mighty's loaf of bread, and gave it to me!I'd give them 5 stars, but they forgot the avacado spread on my sandwitch so I wont!!!

I never write reviews but this place is horrible. I ordered my sandwich over half an hour ago and I still don't have it. I think it's obnoxious to pay $10+ for a sandwich and than have it take my entire lunch our for it to arrive. I think I'll bring my lunch with me next time I don't have a car.
Fresh made subs delivered quickly. Exactly what you would expect.
Good food including unique vegetarian options and cocktails. Â Service was good too.

This is the worse taco I've ever had. I had the carne asada and it only came with lettuce. They were very small and tasted so bland so I asked for hot sauce. I waited another 15 minutes because they didn't have a bottled hot sauce, they had to make it. Â So by the time I got my habanero sauce, my tacos were cold and tortilla soggy. Â Who serves tacos without sauce?My friend ordered a beer and they brought the wrong one twice.Please note: Â if you order the 6 taco plate, there's a charge of $5.00 for sharing your dish. So If you're full and want to give some to your friends or family, they will charge you $5.00. Â I've never heard of such a thing. I can understand if it's a buffet, but these are 6 tacos with your choice of different meat.

Let me start by saying the food was fantastic and it's because of the slow service and treatment by the staff that I give only two stars. (I considered only one star).So it's Mother's Day and we had reservations for when they opened. It was our first time here and there was only five or six other tables sat. Drinks took a long time to get, ordering food took a long time, and getting extra anything (napkins, condiments, tortillas, etc) took a long time. Nobody made us aware of the day's specials either. I found out they existed after we ate. The food came quickly and tasted awesome! I would say today's crew was made up of inefficient servers/bar staff and/or they were short staffedAgain, the food was fantastic.So it came time to pay. I was short changed on purpose. My "change" was rounded down. Well my receipt said I was still owed a measly 46 cents. It's about the principal. The server acknowledged doing it and said she didn't have 46 cents. so it was rounded down. (So are they just taking everyone's change each shift? That's called stealing.) Two additional staff members scoffed at me and fetched 45 cents from the bar resister and made a snide remark while giving me the change. I tipped well at the table before speaking with them at the front desk on the way out and now I wish I hadn't after this treatment over the stupid 46 cents that was suppose to be mine after paying in the first place. Geez...I've been a bus boy, a host/cashier, a server, and a bartender and never did this to anyone. I was so taken aback that I created a Yelp account to add my 2 cents... the food was really great though.

Felt I needed to update my previous not-so-great review. Â We've been to Aguamiel a couple more times since June. Â We have not experienced any employee morale issues since. Â And the food is outstanding! Â Unique, flavorful and plenty of options.

Someone should have told them it was Cinco De Mayo!! This was a disaster from the get go. The wait...forever, the service....unfortunately WAY below average, the food...my stomach has still not recovered. They are understaffed and the staff they do have is incapable of decent service. It took an unusually long time to get our drinks (not enough people behind the bar) and to get a 2nd one. I did not care for the food....I've had better tacos at restaurants that aren't Mexican specific.I really wanted to like this place.....the chips are good, and so was the mango margarita but thats where it ends for me.

So there are not a lot of Mexican food spots in this area. Â Given this, I feel Aguamiel has an advantage. Â The ambiance is very nice and location is right by the train. Â Kenny is the best part about this place. Â He is very friendly and gives good recommendations. Â The food is average, although I wish I could report better. Â The margaritas were actually solid and not watered down. Â They also have a decent wine list.The salsa they bring is okay. Â The green was bland to me but the red was good. Â The habenero that is available upon request is the standout. Â I've gotten the sampler, which allows you to try a bunch of different things. Â The sopas were my least favorite, despite the fact that I usually love them. Â These were just very bland. Â The taquitos, which I usually find boring, were actually better than average. Â Flautas were okay and the empanades were actually solid. Â We also tried the tacos, which were again good but nothing special. Â I will say I really enjoyed their tamales. Â That was probably the best thing I've had. Â The seafood enchilades were good but again, not a standout. Â For me, I really need a very good salsa for a Mexican restaurant so I hope that this can be improved upon and I can upgrade! Â Overall, good food, good setting and I'll continue to go back and hope some of the dishes can bring up the flavor a bit.

We love Mexican food so we were excited to try Aguamiel. We were a bit disappointed. We arrived on a Thursday night to find the place mostly empty. We sat outside. We ordered some drinks, they were ok not anything special. The chips and salsa were decent. We had queso fundido for an appetizer. It was pretty good, but the cheese was thicker than I'm used to. We split the taco platter - six different types of tacos. A few of the tacos were covered in onions, more onions than meat. The fish taco was probably the best one.The outside area is nice but it's missing something. Some music would give a more festive feel. Clarendon Hills "downtown" doesn't really have much life to it.Next time we're looking for fancy Mexican we'll go back to Cine in Hinsdale.

Aguamiel is where Mexican meets white table cloth...but still at a decent price. Like a restaurant at an upscale resort in Mexico. Enjoy margaritas on their nice patio (or bar side when it's cold out). We love to order the simple stuff most of the time but every now and then splurge on the entrees. Make a good mole, or chiles relleno. I believe they usually have an empanadas special with different fillings each night. And sometimes, you'll catch live mariachi! Much better than the Mexican spots in Downtown La Grange.

If you're looking for delicious Mexican food, this is absolutely a place I would recommend. BUT only for the food. The service is pretty atrocious. Even after reading all the Yelp reviews about the horrible service, I really wanted to have an amazing experience with the staff and yet, it fell short - hence the 3 star review. We were 1 of only 3 parties of people in the entire place on a Thursday night and yet they screwed up our drink order, screwed up our food order, couldn't recommend a tequila (it's a Mexican restaurant, train your servers!!) and never once filled up our water glasses.As for the food it was beyond delicious. The homemade guacamole and salsas were to die for and we could have made a meal out of just those two things alone. My pork shoulder was seasoned so well it didn't even need the delicious sauce that came with it and while I'm not a fan of beans, I couldn't stop eating the ones that accompanied my dish.If you can get set your expectations VERY low on the service front, you won't be disappointed with the food.

Hard to find homemade corn tortillas! So was amazed to smell them when we entered. Â Had enchiladas suizas with chicken. Excellent choice! Â Food was very authentic and our server was great! Â Very impressive! Â  Will definitely return.

Horrendous.Really, don't bother with this place. Meh at best. Food is not good and service very slow. It's Cinco de Mayo today and they're not even "staffed up" appropriately for any sort of crowd.Somebody....please...help Clarendon Hills get a decent restaurant.Time for bed now but I definitely need some Pepto Bismol first. Montezuma has his revenge even in Clarendon Hills.

We're happy we didn't let the negative reviews dissuade us from trying this spot out, especially when we have a colleague of Rick Bayless cooking up less than 5 minutes from our house! We were greeted by a friendly hostess and immediately loved the warm atmosphere. We ordered chicken with verde mole and enchiladas with traditional puebla mole - both were exceptional. Our tequila cocktails were unique and tasty and the service was solid, especially being NYE when you may run into some angry servers. A few negative aspects included: Some high prices on menu items, not all, but the guacamole and carne asada entree seemed very overpriced, the desserts were just ok, and the service wasn't as good as it could have been. Overall, I strongly feel that many of the negative reviews stemmed from diners looking for a TexMex flavor and running into truly authentic favors and being disappointed.
