If you want a wonderful, family friendly, breakfast/brunch occasion, this is the place! Go see Penny!

Amazing !!!!! We have been anxious to try this place. High quality homemade food and great service. I had corned beef hash skillet (homemade) which was excellent with a piece of homemade coffee cake (cinnamon and raspberry). My man had chicken and biscuits and raved about it! Coffee was smooth and delicious. Penny the owner is wonderful and came out to speak with us. Highly recommend this place!!!! We cannot wait to come back and try lunch.
So happy to support a new business with great food and friendly owners!!I had a great sandwich with lean corned beef, a nice cup of coffee and enjoyed meeting Penny.Can't wait to go back!
Delicious breakfast this morning. The homemade coffeecake and busicuits & gravy were to die for! The owner Penny is fantastic and welcoming. Will definitely be returning!

Our group of guys meet there every Friday morning because of the Great food and Service. The homemade jams are something special, the fresh baked coffee cakes are amazing. I would highly recommend The Lucky Penny Diner!

Good food from scratch.. Had the sausage gravy & biscuits w / fried chicken. It was amazing. Husband had blueberry coffee cake and he said he will come back just for that. Â  Happy to see a local business and we will be regulars!!

Hadn't been back to this particular spot in a while, at least since it as last known as Nora's. The crew did a pretty good job. Food was tasty, fruit dish had a good portion of Strawberries and Water Melon which was nice. Pretty quick in and out. Had a Pepsi that tasted a little funky. Service was pretty good, just lost our server for a little bit here and there. We'll go again.

As good as it gets - we loved the homemade coffeecake and JAM - they make numerous flavors each day. Â Welcoming staff and the owner made it a point to come over. Â Wonderful menu - my sister raved about her pancakes and bacon.

This morning I visited Lucky Penny for the first time. I've lived near this location for years and have seen a few restaurants come and go. If my first experience is any indication, I think Lucky Penny is going to be my favorite cafe that's been in this spot.The owner, Penny, served my breakfast, kept my coffee fresh, and chatted with me. Her passion for her work was apparent from the start; I felt very welcome, and I could tell she was excited and proud of her food. It's always so cool to see someone passionate about what they do. I still miss my dearly departed Wicked Good CafÃ©, and this was the first time since then that I've found a place that's as warm and friendly as they were.I had eggs benedict, hash browns, and coffee. The serving size is generous - I need to keep that in mind and order light when I go in so early in the morning. When I get restaurant hash browns, I honestly don't expect much, but these were carefully seasoned; the salt-and-pepper blend made them special. The eggs benedict had strips of ham instead those fried discs that many restaurants use, so they were cooked evenly and were tastier. I think there was some paprika in the sauce; it was yummy.The coffee was a standout. I take two creams and half a sugar in my coffee, so when Penny refilled it partway through my first cup, I thought I would need to add more of both. Instead, it was so smooth and mild that I put away 2 or 2 1/2 cups without having to add any more flavoring. Very impressed with the coffee.It always feels so satisfying to support a local business, and I'm so pleased to have a high-quality one right near my house. Highly recommended.
Stopped by for lunch. Loved the honey muster crispy chicken wrap. Very friendly atmosphere.

Even with the previous reviewer's comment about not being greeted or having anyone take an order, we decided to check it out as usually one bad review doesn't mean that it's a deal breaker. Â I had the biscuits and gravy breakfast with fried chicken and LOVED it. Â My husband had a choose your own skillet and their homemade apple cinnamon coffeecake. Â It was delicious, we can't wait to go back for more amazing food and great hospitality.

Hidden gem! Â You'd never anticipate what's inside from pulling in (or driving down Ogden). Â The food is phenomenal, staff is super friendly, service is quick and the place is immaculate. Â Can't wait to return!

Amazing food. Took my parents there, who are very picky about their food, and they loved it! They went back the next day. Customer service was just as amazing as their food. Everything is homemade and very fresh.
The new owner penny is fantastic. Â The food is top notich. And service is great. I would definitely take the family to this new restaurant. Â Five stars!!!!!!!!

This diner is an improvement over the last restaurant that was here, Nora's. They were really on top of the coffee refills and other drinks, so much that I was a little confused about who our waitress actually was. Given the abundance of staff, the service was a little too slow for my likes. I had an omelette with very fresh ingredients, delicious. The chocolate chip pancakes were over portioned (3 full plate-sized). My daughter thought the music was ahead of it's time with the geriatric crowd. All in all a very mixed experience. I will probably try it again, lunch next time.

Went here for Mother's Day breakfast and really enjoyed it! The food was awesome. Highly recommend the Carnitas Waffle, very delicious. The place is a little hard to spot from the street which I think leads to it not being as busy as it should be with such great food. Please go and visit!
Love this place. Really good food, & great selection of beers. Dive place feel without being a dive. Has outdoor seating when weather is nice, & friendly staff.

The service and personalities here are awesome. You are always welcomed and spoken to politely. Service like this goes a long way.Their beer selection is wonderful and always changing. It's the quintessential neighborhood bar/hangout. Pricing is most fair.

Really like this place, Wels, Ben, the owner, John, but I was there last Sunday in the afternoon and had the worst service. Â I won't mention her name but we were outside on the patio and she hardly ever came out. Young, cute blonde girl but a terrible waitress. My friend finally went inside at one point and he said there was hardly anyone in there but she was talking to someone. I think her boyfriend was there. I will certainly keep coming back but not if she is waiting on me. Too bad that the bar is so small.Barb S.

Not extremely impressed, but I am sure in warm weather with outdoor searing it may be better. Â The place is quaint (wont say small). Â Food options were ok, nothing tooted our horn. Â Although, others around us had some decent looking different dishes.Beer, many to choose from, which is important!Service, good.My food was luke warm, never a good thing with grilled cheese.....Hub says we will give one more try... So means I am in for another spin

This place was fine. Â The food was good, but not outstanding. Â The service was friendly but a little bit slow. Â The price was right. Â We got seated right away on a Friday evening in their outdoor dining space, which was a big plus, but there were a bunch of kids running around and yelling, which sours my opinion of the experience (I know that's not the restaurant's fault).I would say it was an average dining experience... I wouldn't recommend it as a featured dining destination and probably wouldn't go back myself as it's a bit of a drive, but if I lived in Batavia or close by I might.

The Gammon Couch House is modern day "Beatnik" territory.This is a coffee house atmosphere where you snap your fingers as you recite jazz poetry and hope Dave Brubeck is on the radio waves.I try to fit in with the cool cats and often wear my beret, dark shades and a black turtle neck Â and get my "kicks" as I sip the Craft Brew of the day.I'm a local and frequent this Shack just enough to make the scene. I admit that the Craft Beer Choice here is unlimited and ever changing, however how many can actually be tasty? I've tasted everything from effervescent to shades of old bland motor oil and all points in between. Never get attached to a flavor of choice, because it's probably not available on your next visit.I'm not saying this place is a Red Onion, it's just hard to park my "lead sled" in this crazy lot.As I sit at the bar, I start tapping my "Bongos" hoping I don't look too squaresville..."Daddy-O".
Terrible all around. Inside stinks, menu is small and mostly bar food, service was horrible, beer sucked. That's all.

We've been coming here for a few weeks now. And so far, we've liked everything we've tried. Excellent beer selection, tasty Bloody Marys, and the menu is fairly small but what they do, they do well.Service can be a bit slow when they're busy, but everyone has been super friendly. And very sweet to a generally hungry and wanting-food-right-now 7YO, which is a huge bonus. We never feel rushed here.The pizza is cracker thin and crispy. I don't usually like it that way - but it's good here (I tried the Margarita) and I'd order it again. BBQ is on point. Burgers are tasty - and served with a cold beer, all is right with the world.Outdoor and indoor seating - and the outdoor seating is covered. Bonus, because random Chicagoland weather.Definitely one of our new go-to spots. Excited to try their new brunch options next!

Best small place atmosphere and beer.Every week they have the most tasteful beer . Â It's different every week. Â I have drank a few beers that my taste buds did not like , but that is the fun of it. Experiment a little take a chance on it , you must try different beers it's what makes it fun. Â The staff is fun, Talkative, and Â spectacular. Â My only dream wish would be for them to carry reaslieng white wine that is sweet such as St Michele type. ( would make my wife happy). You know what they say happy wife you will have a happy life and a fun time.My biggest concern now is this testimony now will double their business and I will not have a seat to eat or socialize. So. Come on give it a try go for it you will not regret it .

Solid craft beer selection!!!!! Just moved in a block away from this place....definitely an added bonus. Awesome patio section, food is good, staff is really friendly too! I think the lady and I just found our new spot!

My husband and I have been to GCH a few times and we have enjoyed it both times. The front area is a "common area" meaning if there's 2 of you at a 6 person table, there's a chance that 4 more people might end up sitting there.Last time we went, we sat at the bar until our table was ready. The bartender is very knowledgeable and didn't hesitate to let us try several kinds of beers before deciding on what we wanted. He seems like a good hometown bartender.The chili is fantastic, and is definitely something I would order again. We never leave hungry and the prices are great. Gammon Coach House is occasionally onrestaurant.com, which is how we found it in the first place.

I've been to GCH a couple of times now but it's always on a Sunday morning, so I can't comment on their beers, but I'd definitely love to try them.Their Bloody Mary's are fantastic though, and their food is excellent. I've experienced their Grilled Cheese, which has cheese on the outside of the sandwich, too. M built his own pizza on our first visit with bacon, pepperoni, and jalapenos.On our most recent visit, we again got our Bloody Mary's. He decided to build his own omelette with pepper jack and bleu cheese, bacon, and jalapenos. I wasn't in the mood for breakfast, so I ordered the hot dog with everything with tator tots. Our waitress asked me "Everything?" I answered affirmatively, but then she asked about mushrooms and I said "hell no" but in different words and more politely. After she left, I wondered who the hell would put mushrooms on a hot dog? Ewww. I'm pretty sure she was joking around but still....When our food was brought out, I shit you not, all I saw was a mound of toppings. It was awesome! A beautiful quarter pound hot dog with lettuce, pico de gallo, huge pickles sliced round, a beautiful slice of pepper jack cheese, and god knows what else, but it was delicious. It was quite filling paired with the tator tots. M successfully ate every scrap of his breakfast. As I watched his eyes roll into the back of his head, I knew a nap was in his immediate future.I can't comment on the inside, as we've always sat out on the patio, but that's where I prefer to be. As others have said, it's a bit hard to find if you're not familiar with the area, and your first attempt to park can be confusing as well. But once you make your way inside (or sit down on the patio), expect nothing but great food, great drinks, prompt friendly service, and overall a wonderful experience.
This place is something of a hidden gem in Batavia. Â Go for the grilled cheese options. Â Good stuff. Â Nice selection of drat beers on tap as well.

Best burgers in downtown Batavia, hands down. Â Just $5 on Monday, it's a deal you simply cannot beat. Â Pulled chicken sandwich with buffalo sauce? Â Forget dessert just give me two of these. Â Tater tots are pretty standard fare for a restaurant, but they recently had a BBQ Apple Cider sauce mixture on the table that made these absolutely incredible.Awesome beer selection with a lot of local favorites. Â They switch up the selection to make it seasonal, meaning a once-a-month visitor will always have something new to try.Avoid the Batavia Bulldog unless you can pull down a few hundred dollars in bets to finish the thing. Â Hot dog wrapped in bacon deep fried and covered in chili. Â Don't expect to get out of bed the next day, and move your bed to the bathroom. Â A fun dare for your enemies.
Simply awesome food as always!! Fantastic bloodymary's!!! One of my favorites in the Tri-cities area.
Dirty, debris-and junk in the entry way. Over priced on their ale's. Eight dollars for a 10 ounce hail ridiculous

It's Sunday afternoon. We're headed back to Bartlett from the Aurora Premium Outlets. Hunger strikes! Â Gammon Coach House is basically on our way home and so our lunch problem appears to be solved.We entered the somewhat cramped establishment with pretty low expectations. What we experienced was the exact opposite. Success!It was a cold October afternoon, so no one was eating out on the patio. It is a nice additional space for seating though. We had the option of bar seating, a table on the bar side or any one of the six or so tables on the other side. We went to the least crowded area on the other side and made ourselves comfortable.Our server was very sweet. Unnecessary side note: She was a hired server at Jenny McCarthy's Halloween Party in Geneva the night before and couldn't get all of the professional vampire makeup off of herself. She was kind enough to let us know that she wasn't in a car accident or anything like that earlier and that it was just makeup. It made for great conversation with her! Â And we're back to your regularly scheduled review...We started with chips & salsa and onion rings. The salsa was homemade and quite good. The onion rings stole the show! Â Crisp beer batter that wasn't too heavy. Those were delicious!!We tried the chili and the chicken tortilla soup. Both were obviously made fresh and really tasty. My beef? Â The chicken tortilla soup was loaded with cheese...and it didn't say that on the menu. I scooped out what I could and proceeded to eat. No crunchy tortilla strips here. Fresh corn tortilla pieces throughout with chicken breast chunks. Woo hoo!!Around the table were patty melts, a grilled cheese and a burger with fries, tater tots and sweet potato tater tots as the side dishes. Â The burgers were hand packed and served on bakery type buns. Actually all of the bread was bakery quality. The sweet potato tater tots seem to be their own creation while the fries and regular tater tots were your standard frozen variety that weren't exciting. Â I think I read that someone said that you don't come here for the food. I totally disagree. I'd make the effort to come back for the food. I might even order the same meal sans cheese of course!Everyone around the table was pleased with the food. And the beer menu was extensive. We weren't drinking, but there was a nice variety available. The only other complaint was that although we had good attention during the meal, we think we may have been forgotten about in the side room once we were done eating. We had to eventually go ask our server for a box and the check. Not a huge problem, but the layout is not conducive to being able to see everything from one room to the next.I'm sorry that we didn't try a homemade dessert. I should have saved room. Next time? Â Aw yeah!
Checked this out on a recommendation on Yelp. Great food and craft beers. Casual dining. Very friendly service. Would visit again for sure!

great food and good beer selection. Â However, their hot wings only come as spicy hot. Â Evidently, they use the same hot sauce for the mild, so there is really no difference. Â However the waitress was very accommodating in offering a different entree.

Stopped in here while passing through on a work trip. Small, local tavern. Good vibe, decent and inexpensive menu, friendly bartender/server. Satisfying and pleasing if you're interested in "tavern" style dining/drinking. Beer menu should suffice for most anyone.
Love this place! Â Great menu, wide selection of craft beers. Friendly neighborhood pub, perfect for a quick drink on their outdoor deck or a quiet dinner.

Went here based on a recommendation of a friend. Â Since it was close to home & Kelly's last dinner before a business trip, we decided to check it out.Visually, the place isn't much to look at. Â A small bar with a few tables on the inside with outdoor patio. Â Since it was in the upper 60's for March, we dined on the patio. Â Service was excellent but it wasn't overly busy for Monday night at 6.They have 2 menus, one for food & one for beer. Â That'a a good sign in my opinion. Â Let's talk brew frist. Â  Â They had probably 30-40 craft/micro beers to choose from with others on tap. Â Kelly & I ordered a couple beers. Â I tried a new one that sounded good but didn't like it at all. Â I ordered a more familiar beer that I enjoy. Â They were out of it but the waitress brought a sample of a beer on tap that was similar that I enjoyed so I ordered that. Â Nice. Â She Â also removed the bad beer from the bill! Â Kelly enjoyed her beer but we didn't order another since she wanted to get home to prepare for the trip.As for the grub, it's a smaller food menu with your usual bar/American fare. Â Since burger was on special (& the lone guy outside had one that looked great), I ordered that & the sweet tater tots. Â Kelly ordered a corned beef reuben. Â Food came out quickly & was very good. Â My burder was very tasty with a great brioche bun. Â The sweet tater tots were spot on but needed a little salt for my liking. Â Kelly said her reuben was the best one she'd ever had. Â  The check came quickly after we were done & was taken care of in under 5 minutes.All in all, it was a very enjoyable, affordable, unpretentious, Â comfortable dining experience with great service! Â We'll be happy to go back & try some of the other, simpler tastier items the other customers had.

If you don't live in the area or aren't familiar with this area, your GPS might send you on a wild goose chase. Â This place is a little hidden, though it's behind the blue building on the corner near the library. Â The person I was meeting got lost and I followed as my GPS told me to turn and it was THERE, well it wasn't but then I figured I'd pull in where the little stores were and I found it.As for seating, there is a patio, a bar area, and back room. Â The place has great atmosphere! Â The menu is limited which is a good thing because too much to choose from just makes for a complicated meal sometimes ya know?! Â What you get here is craft beer and comfort food - makes for a great lunch!There is a craft beer menu, and the beers come in three sizes. Â If you're unsure of what to order, they will give you a tasting of the beer which was super nice because I have very little knowledge of beer outside my comfort zone.I ordered a patty melt with tater tots - it was a good size, very tasty and not at all greasy as patty melts can be. Â My friend ordered the spaghetti dinner special - it was a good size portion for around $8.I enjoyed this place, and wouldn't mind coming back for another meal!
menu is simple -- but delivers well. especially enjoyed the grilled cheese sandwich with crusted cheese on the outside. great rotating selection of craft brews.

Can't beat the beer selection and the food is top notch. They're specials and soups are delicious. The pizzas are crispy and tasty. The wings are some of the best in town. The pulled pork is one of the best sandwich I've ever had...

Do not judge a book by its cover. Cutesy old house with teas and sandwiches? Nay. Hidden dive-gem of the western suburbs. How can a beer and bar-food enthusiast not totally dig this place?Beer menu = really good. Lots of stuff you can find in most decent beer bars, but a good selection of the finer craft brews. They had Scurry by Off Color Brewing on nitro, which tasted excellent. They also had some brews from Solemn Oath, Deschutes, Lagunitas, Left Hand, Stone, and Three Floyds on draft. There were other good selections available in bottles/cans, like Founders, Oskar Blues, Revolution, Great Lakes, Church Street, and Two Bros. Good to see they support local brews! They had a tap for Penrose hanging on the ceiling, and that place isn't even open yet (soon to be in Geneva, I believe).Anyway, beer was good, right? No Miller Lites or lawnmower beers. Lots of whiskey and bourbon to choose from, and a couple ciders available (not Woodchuck). I think that any craft beer lover would be happy. ALSO, you can get a 6oz beer, if you want to try a few beers instead of drinking one or two large pints. It's a nice option, if you aren't sure what you want a lot of, or if you just are in the variety sort of mood.Food, woah. They have a grilled cheese with CHEESE on the OUTSIDE. It's crisped on the outside of the bread, so don't expect something oozy-gooey on the outside, but don't be dismayed. It's really good and flavorful. We added grilled mushrooms, grilled onions, tomato, and bacon. This thing was overflowing but not gross or messy. Lots of flavor without an obscene amount of cheese. We split that, and then also split the Patty Melt. It was fairly standard...homemade burger patty on toasted, marbled rye, swiss, and grilled onions. The burger was a bit more than medium, but it was juicy, so no complaints. If I had to pick a winner, I'd vote for the grilled cheese, but I'm not sorry I ordered the patty melt.THOSE FRIES THOUGH. They look like boring-@ss fries, but don't be fooled. My husband ordered sweet potato tots and was a sorry sucka. He didn't finish his tots and was picking from my pile of carby, salty french fries. Not too thick, not too thin, with a crunchy outside and fluffy inside. Fried to perfection, and you get a lot. Yummmmm.Cory behind the bar was friendly and knowledgable. Everything was prompt and he checked back on us frequently. He even asked "Does everything taste great?" assuming that the found was excellent (which it was). Glad to see this place and its quality inspires confidence in its employees.I'll be back here. There are other items on the menu that I NEED to try, plus they have rotating specials, like spaghetti, ribs, tacos, etc. Their beer menu is rotating, and its nice to see that they have it posted on their website. Drop in for a plentiful basket of bar food and some local brews.

We always love stopping in for a pint and a meal. The beer selection is always impressive and unique. We've had the pleasure of trying half of the food they offer. I've never had a bad meal, specials included. The beer dinners have been great and well organized. The food here really set's them apart from the other venues in the area. The staff is welcoming and a joy, this place is a jem!

Fabulous bar and restaurant. A bit of a hidden gem that has a wonderful selection of craft beers, full bar, with wine as well. Food is homemade and is full of comfort food that really hits all the warm, flavor notes of a home-cooked cuisine! Â Warm and welcoming customer service that makes me want to return again really soon. Â Give these guys a try, they are very worth the trip!!!
Great place in Batavia. Â We enjoy sitting outside with a unique beer and having the brisket sandwich. Â Excellent option, especially on a nice night!

I love the Coach House. 2 blocks from home, cozy inside, nice patio for warmer weather, but I probably only go once a month, if that. Why you ask? 3 reasons: 1) hard to leave for less than $25 even if you're just having beers, 2) the food is ordinary, and not many options for vegetarians, and 3) the most important, they have one of the all time rudest servers, yet she is there ALL the time. Can't stand her. So much I don't go just in case I have her. One of the only people I don't tip 20%. Otherwise the staff is great.

Average food, slightly below average server experience. Had wings, son had a burger. All in all, may go back for a beer, of which there was a nice selection, but will look elsewhere for food. Can't go higher than 3 stars.

As far as pubs go, this place is just okay. They had a good craft beer selection and offer daily specials. My husband and I both had their signature burgers and weren't too wowed by them, but we did enjoy the tots as a side dish. We probably won't be going back as there are better food options in and around Batavia.

Stopped by this past Saturday night because "The Mrs." wanted to dine al fresco on a nice 70 degree evening in the middle of September. Â (Who wouldn't??!!) Â Luckily, when we showed up, GCH had a few tables available on the decent sized patio at a first come basis.Their menu isn't huge, but they are great at what is on the menu. For an app, we split the Mini Calzones. Â We both LOVED them. Â Little fried cheesy sausage pockets with a red sauce that stands on it's own. Â It reminded my wife of the "PIzza Fritte" back home in CT. Â (Or at least the closest thing to it). Â Regardless, it was great.As for our mains;She had Grilled Chicken with a side salad. Â GC was good, side salad dressing was awesome.I had the Patty Melt with everything. Â OMG! Â Their caramelized onions are superb!Service was solid too!I highly recommend Gammon Coach House whenever in the Bat-a-via area.
Had our first lunch Â as Batavians at the Gammon House. It was a delicious burger. We have been back for some great craft beer and look forward to more date nights for burgers and beer.

This place is tucked away in the south west corner of route 31 and Wilson Street. It is small and dark but they have one of the best beer list in the area. They even let you try a sample of the beer if you're not sure that you'd like it before you buy. the food is very good although I had the ribs the other day and they were just so-so. They were kind of fatty and they are not cooked in a barbecue sauce. We've had other dishes there and had no problems also it is one of the few places that still serves tater tots or sweet potato tots. but definitely a great place to stop by for a beer and a bite. The staff has always been friendly and the food is moderately priced. they even have a patio although looking over the parking lot, available when the weather is nice. Definitely worth a try and a good place to try a different kind of you especially if you are not the Miller Lite or Budweiser type.
Love this bar! The food is good and the beer selection is beyond amazing. My husband and I love to come here and see what new addition they have to the beer menu. Reasonably priced and great service.

Was here last week on a night where the snow would not stop outside. Â We sat inside and looking out of the window it felt like we were sitting inside a nice lodge enjoying great drinks and friends. Â No cell phones not a lot of TVs for distractions. Â Just great beer and a cozy atmosphere. Â Many craft beers to choose from and great owners.On this night we were here a customer was stumbling on his way out. The bartender went outside to check if this patron was driving. He was planning on driving and the owner instead had an employee get in his car and follow the owner who drove the customers car home In a blizzard. That is beyond going the extra mile. Â Happy to have this place close to home. Â Cheers!

Went here looking for a cold beer and some decent food. The only reason I gave them any stars was that they do a nice job with the atmosphere and craft beers. If you don't like craft beers, don't go because that's all they have. My preference is a beer that I've had before, I don't get they whole sport of craft beers....too many to choose from.Now the food, we started with the chicken tortilla soup....fair at best. Then the main course was their Sat. night special, ribs. I have to say the were the worse I've ever had. Almost reminded me of the rib meat on the Mcrib sandwich at McDonald's. The Mac and cheese side was just as bad. The menu is all sandwiches with a nightly special. Maybe the burger would of been the way to go.I can't believe all the Yelpers that said the food was good.
Great Local Pub! Very Friendly, Solid Food Very good Burgers!
Their ribs made me feel like I had died and gone to sweet bbq heaven! They also had rare beers that made my beer-snob boyfriend very pleased. Would go there again in a heartbeat!

My boyfriend and I came here when it was the closest place near us after a morning full of Munzee-ing. (Look it up) Anyway, everything about this place was good! We didn't know what to expect, as from the outside of the building, it doesn't look like much; Really, it's not. It's kinda cramped, but the atmosphere and decor make up for a lot of it.They have a good selection of beverages, and even though the food menu was limited, everything that we received on it was great.The service was top-notch, but with a place that small, you really can't screw it up!My one suggestion to the owners would be to fix the light in the bathroom. It's on a motion sensor, and while doing my business and while washing my hands it turned off. The first time it happened I almost shat myself...but thankfully I was in the right place to do it.
Went here because of the good ratings on yelp. Never again. Service was fine, food-terrible. Terrible terrible terrible!!

I used to live down the street from the Gammon Coach House, and love it like my own boozy little child. The food selection is amazing, especially rib nights on Saturdays and the sweet potato tater tots. The menu covers everything from fish and chips to pulled chicken to monster salads.But what really got me hooked was the beer selection. I signed up for their text notification club, and get a text whenever a new beer is tapped. Most of my visits were because of those texts. Their beer selection is mix of local mainstay (3 Floyds, Revolution, Two Brothers) and some from the outer reaches of the galaxy (Portland, generally). There is a variety of sizes, so you don't have to break the bank to try something new.There are a few downsides. The inside is kind of cramped and dark. There is a good amount of seating, but if you're waiting for a table on a busy night, there's nowhere to stand that's out of the way. I always had to do the shuffle dance with incoming guests. This also means the wait can get kind of long, but a good beer is an easy remedy. Downsides, yes. Deal-breakers, not on Â your life.I'll put it this way- when my down-the-street lease was up, I almost didn't move purely because of the Gammon Coach House.

This is a solid 4 for the beverage menu.** I haven't tried the food and from what I understand, it's pretty standard bar fare. Â I don't think you should go there to eat, though - I think you should go there to enjoy fantastic beverages. Â Because nobody should drink bad beer, IMO.Belly up to the bar or, if it's nice outside, go and sit at one of the tables on the little patio. Â This is not a large place - it might be kind of crowded. Â Either way, you will find a fairly random, and yet fantastic, assortment of beers. Â It's not exactly what one would expect for the looks of the place or the location. Â Keep in mind, at least from yesterday to today, the beer menu on the website is only a portion of what they had in last night. Â It seems like a place to go to see what is new and interesting, which is a good thing in my book. Â I mean who else has bottles of the Game of Thrones beer?I also like that you can get a sample size, a slightly larger size or a regular-sized pour of beer. Â I like to try all the things so it's nice to be able to try a lot of different tastes without being stuck with something I don't like.Decent service and the bartender was both funny and had really good recommendations. Â A definite bonus, though the service outside on the patio might have been a little odd, though not terrible.If this place wasn't so far away, I could see it being a pretty regular hangout.

UPDATE: the cook now uses a subtle bell when orders are up. They added hat/coat/purse hooks at your bar seats that are very convenient. Also, beers are now served in 8, 11.5 and 14 oz glasses of your choice, unless it is a strong ale.I was in the Gammon Coach House the first day it opened. Â They offer craft beer & comfort food. Â I go to a bar for craft beer on tap. Â I have plenty of bottles at home (many I have brewed myself).This place is a circa 1886 building behind a large Victorian mansion at the corner of Wilson and Batavia Ave. Â Walking in, there is a vestibule to keep the winter cold out that pushes into the room. Â The small 6-seat bar is 2 steps from the door. To the right is a nook of 2 bar height tables; to the left there are 3 bar height tables. The bar only seats 6. Â There are 24 seats in this room and a back room that seats about 24. Â GCH also has seating for 30 on a patio. Â There is 1 TV for all to see Â in the front room, and 1 in the back room. Â There is sports on TV, no sound, with music playing (they put the Sox on at my request). Â My favorite seat at any pub is at the corner or short side of the bar. Â This place only has a straight bar, the short side has a garbage can and a stack of glasses and servers work from that end. Â They could use a bigger bar, but space is limited.The room has a lot of wood. The floor has a wood look, the north wall looks to be the original wood plank wall with single pane grid windows, The ceiling is wood plank. Â It feels warm and cozy. The only problem is there is an opening to the kitchen with bright lights from the kitchen shining into this warm room, the cooks radio can be heard, and the cooks repeated yelling "burger up". Â They need a better method to notify food is ready, and doors to block off the kitchen's intrusion into the bar atmosphere.OK, Brad is the beer tender. He is very knowledgeable regarding craft beer and seems to be able to discuss any brewery in the country. I later learned he is a brew master. Â They have 12 taps, but 2-4 are wasted on tasteless beers. They do have a very nice selection of brews in the remaining 8 taps. Â Beers are sold in the standard 11.5 oz glass for around $4.80. Â Now, the usual 14 oz glasses limit me to 2 beers to be legal to drive. Â You could enjoy a variety 3 of these ales at a relaxed pace, and drive under the limit. They have a minimalist, but satisfying menu of build your own burger, build your own thin crust pizza, chill, wings and things. Â I tried a burger and it was satisfying, Â I ordered medium and it was medium, not bloody. Fries are good too. not too skinny, not to fat; slightly crispy on the outside with patatoey flavor inside.Over all, the place is great! Â Great beer, good food ,knowledgeable beer tender, friendly crowd and it is only 4 blocks from my house.

We love Gammon Coach House. The owners and servers are always wonderful, and they are so good about being flexible with making drinks and letting you try things. They have lots of interesting beers on tap and great mixed drinks as well. We usually just go there for drinks on the weekend but this past weekend we went on a Saturday afternoon and got ribs. They were delicious! And as always, the service was wonderful.The place doesn't look like much from the outside but I promise you'll be happy and pleasantly surprised if you try it out! We've become somewhat regulars ourselves. :)

What a cool place! Â It's kind of hard to find... tucked behind an old Victorian home in downtown Batavia. Â You'll definitely want to keep your favorite map app open if you haven't been here. Â The place itself is small. Â There's a small bar area with seating for about 20 people, then another room in back with room for another 30. Â The place is super quaint and has really good, positive energy.The main attraction here is the beer. Â They have 12 highly unusual taps running, stuff I have not seen since the Wheaton Ale Fest. Â All super wonderful brews, and they serve small, medium, and large (a full pint) sizes of beer. Â This is a cool option if you want to taste everything they are featuring. Â They also had a really impressive list of bottled beer, stuff you don't see every day. The bartenders and waitstaff are super cool and love to talk about the choices.Foodwise, the menu is pretty limited but what they have looked great. Â I ended up having a hankering for grilled cheese. Â I did mine with cheddar, tomato, and bacon. Â Sure, it's a cholesterol bomb, but every once in a while it's fun to splurge. Â After we ordered my GF was shocked I hadn't checked Yelp reviews yet. Â Of course, when she dares me I'm going to have to check. Â Sure enough, some other Yelpers tipped that we should have gotten the sweet potato tots instead of the regular ones. Â Next time, although for what it's worth the regular ones were awesome.Overall, a super cool place. Â I will definitely be coming back here for beer in the future.
Not sure what the other reviews rave about but the food was awful. The beer selection is great but overpriced and that goes for the food as well. Will not return.

Wife & I ate here tonight. The fries ARE better than the sweet potato tots. Â Beer cheese & pretzel was good, would have appreciated a little thicker cheese (corn starch!) so less sloppy. Â Tap beers excellent & accurately described. Â Sandwiches meh. Â No smoke to the brisket, cut too thick, and not as tender as it should have been. Â Vegiburger less impressive than Burger King. Â No subtly in any of the food. Â Small space, big crowd, wait for good weather to enjoy a good beer on the porch is my recommendation.
You really can't go wrong coming here. Great food, service, charming cozy atmosphere and a great selection of beers.
Food is pretty good but I think its a little over priced for what it is. Craft beer list is solid. Not a lot of seating.

What the Gammon Coach House lacks in size, it more than makes up for in food, beer, and service. Â My husband stumbled onto this place (thanks, Yelp), in an attempt to find a decent Friday fish fry (thank you, Lent). Â He decided that we should give it a try solely based on 1.) finding it decently reviewed on Yelp and 2.) the photos of the food on their website. Â I can't stress how small this place is, but then again, when you're called "coach house," I guess you can't expect much bigger than a shoebox. Â The atmosphere is quite charming, very pub-like. Â There are a few tables in the front & a small separate dining area in the back as well as a bar with a handful of barstools. Â The beer menu is extensive, filled with interesting sounding craft beers, and the food menu is simple and straightforward. Â I appreciate that. Â The fish fry was excellent, and what's more, I was able to order tater tots instead of fries (oooooh yes). Â For $11, I got 3 fat pieces of battered cod, and mound of tater tots, and a heap of pretty tasty cole slaw. Â I'm not a huge fan of slaw, especially when it's mayo-based, but this stuff was fresh and pretty tasty. Â The service was a bit slow, but it was a Friday night, and there were only 2 servers. Â I had to ask twice for a glass of water, but only once for a refill on the hot water for my Numi organic tea (yum). Â Overall, my dining companion and I were quite satisfied with our experience at Gammon Coach House, so much so that we are already deciding when we'll come here again.This is most certainly a great little gem, tucked away in downtown Batavia.

Sent here by the guys at All Spoked Up, our group of 4 bicyclists were ready for a few brewskis after a day of trail riding. A short bike ride up a somewhat daunting hill later, we hit the Coach House, grabbed a seat in the outdoor patio, and ordered a Trim job, Wild Man, MoM, and a Mexican (guess you had to be there, the server had us laughing). Ordered a few appetizers - I'd recommend the calzones, they were like pizza donuts. I love pizza donuts. Even after a hot day of bike riding.We didn't stay for a full meal as we still had some riding to do, but I'm thankful for the recommendation, glad we stopped in, and will defo be back to the Coach House next time I'm on the trail.

I have been back to the Gammon House the past two Saturdays. Last week I had the sheep shagger, loved it! The ham and cheese sandwich is the best on the menu. You can add all kind of wonderful ingredients to the sandwich to make it even better.We went yesterday for dinner and I had the pulled pork. It was not that good. I like places with small menus because it gives me peace of mind that everything on the menu is kick a$$. It might have been sitting to long Â who knows? I am still a fan of the place and every once and a while you have an off night. I will return for the ham and cheese. Thanks Gammon!

This place has gone from being my "favorite bar in Batavia" to my favorite bar, period. There's not much to say that hasn't already been said - they've had over 500 different taps rotate in a little over a year, the menu specials for food are some of the best in town (especially the half-off burgers and brisket sandos), and you're bound to have an interesting conversation with someone here, even if you show up on your own as I often do. I spent the past ten years living in the city and couldn't be happier to have this place within walking (more like stumbling) distance of my home in Batavia.

I hate to leave a bad review but my husband and I went here for lunch today and we were very disappointed with the food. We ordered the pretzels and queso for an appetizer and they came out cold and dry. I ordered a BLT with tator tots as my meal and I could only get through half the sandwich and a small handfull of tator tots before I had to stop eating...the bread on the sandwich tasted like it had been soaked in oil and much like the appetizer, it all came out cold. The tator tots tasted like they had been cooked hours prior as well. I'm not usually one to complain but when I'm laying in bed feeling incredibly ill from a BLT and some tator tots, I felt the need to say something.

They have an amazing selection of draft craft beer, that changes frequently as well as quality pub food. Â If you are a beer connoisseur in Chicagoland and looking for more then traditional selection of Goose Island and Two Brothers, this is definitely a place to visit. Â You will be pleasantly surprised.

I've been to Gammon Coach House fives times now and am a fan.Parking -- there's plenty of room to park on either side of Wilson St. that runs alongside Gammon Coach House.Lay-Out -- it's a little smaller inside, but not wall-to-wall people. Â When it's warmer outside, you can also enjoy a pint on their patio. Â There's a backroom with additional seating as well. Â Some people are turned off by it not having a huge open floor plan, but that's how the building was made. Â Back in the 90s, it used to be a sports card shop, so they've done a pretty job opening it up as much as the building would allow them to.Food -- I can only speak to the pizzas and once I had their fish. Â The pizzas are good, with a crispy crust and the right amount of cheese. Â The fish was good as well.Beer -- the main reason I go is their selection of craft beers. Â I'm a huge fan of Three Floyds, Two Brothers, as well as some southern California IPAs such as Stone that they have. Â Great stuff.Service -- Service has been attentive and friendly in my visits there. Â One server seemed a little frazzled on a busy night (perhaps they were shorthanded or something), but otherwise, I've never had a problem. Â They could do a better job wearing some sort of T-shirt or something to identify themselves. Â Sometimes you can't tell if they're an employee or not.Prices -- Are a little steep for Batavia, at least for the craft beers. Â I can't recall prices on the food though.Bathrooms -- were clean and functioning. Â No graffiti, cracked mirrors or King Size Snickers bars in the toilets that management hadn't taken care of yet. Woo hoo!TVs -- they have some by the bar, but this really isn't a sports bar. Â If you're looking for something like Buffalo Wild Wings, you got the wrong place.
Went for the fish fry. It was awful,it was not haddock, but cod. The batter was worse.I felt like I was eating an egg Â roll . What happened to this place?
I live down the road form the Coach House. Great bar, great beer and dogs are welcome on the patio.

A really neat place for lunch. Â Beer selection is awesome. Â It's one of those places where you listen to people discussing beer like it's their life. Â We eat good food and laugh at them. Â A little drafty in the winter, but it is a coach house. Need to add Heinz ketchup!

This is a great neighborhood bar/restaurant with quality pub grub and GREAT craft beer. I am a huge craft beer fan and this place constantly surprises me with the amount of off-the-beaten-path selections that they have available.Service is pretty good, typical enough for this type of venue. The servers are friendly and seem to know many of the regular patrons. It is a casual environment and a great place to bring a group. The pulled pork sandwich, the wings and the burgers are all very good. Pizzas are good too.Again, the highlight for the Coach House is definitely its consistently good craft beer list. So if you're looking for a great brew in the western suburbs, give this place a try.

Great burger! They made it just the way I wanted, no complaint. The sweet potato tots were new to me but they were pretty good. I'm pretty picky when it comes to burgers and I will definitely come back. It would probably feel better if the waitresses didn't call me 'sweetie' or 'hon'.

My wife and I sat on the patio the other night. Â Very small place with limited seating indoors and out. I would not cone here in a group larger than four. Overall our experience was great. Â The food was tasty but the best was there chili. It had a slight "kick" but it was great. Â The patty melt was excellent too.

Oh my yes, GCH is still too good to be true in Batavia.Stopped in to see if the coach would turn into a pumpkin but midnight never came my friends. Â Enjoyed a Ska Nut Brown Ale with a bowl of chicken tortilla soup so hearty you'd a thought it was a stew. Â Great flavor and a ton of crunchy strips made this my favorite tortilla......wait.for.it..........ever!Oh my and the grilled cheese sammy on Texas toast with parmesan crust is a thing to behold. Â It makes me wonder why anyone would make them any other way?

I think me and my guys from work finally found our post work watering hole. We loved this place.-Quaint, comforting, relaxed atmosphere.-Great bartender (white collarded shirt, black vest, tiny glasses. I trust anyone dressed this way).-Fantastic beer selection. Anyone who likes to branch out and try new brews will love GCH. They pride theirselves on their beer rotation, so you won't find the same beers very often. And you can order a sample size (probably about 8oz) for like $2. Can't beat that!-Out of about 9 beers on tap, they only have one spout for Bud Lite.-Tuesdays they have a hotdog wrapped in bacon and then deep fried.-Tom (classy bartender) makes his Bloody Mary's with buffalo sauce and horseradish.And there's a wig shop next door called Wig City. As if things couldn't have gotten better.

The food is AMAZING! The beer selection is FANTASIC! The dining area is AWFUL! Seriously their BBQ is to die for and their sauce is mouthwatering. But the facility is dark and cramped inside with only one large party table. The outdoor seating is more comfortable.

So this is a newer establishment that definitely fills a much needed niche for the area: Â quality beer. Â I've been here a number of times since they first opened but always fairly late to meet up with friends for a beer or 2. Â The draft list has been 90% different on each visit. Â While I have had 80% of the beers previously that they had offered (I am a beer nerd), most I have never seen on tap. Â While most would not be considered trending ultra-hot beer nerd brews, it is always a fantastic, well though out lineup of difficult to find beers. Â Their bottle list I think could step up a notch in their offerings. Â They could also benefit by offering a couple high-end large format beers on the menu (last visit they did have Goose Island Kind Edward and Bourbon County Coffee Stout which is a good step in the right direction).My last visit I was there for dinner which was an interesting change of pace for seeing how they operate as a restaurant. Â The place is pretty small and littered with vintage farmhouse tables and chairs which can be a tight fit but definitely cozy to sit at. Â When the evening gets later and the drinking crowd comes out, these tables are quite a hindrance. Â The scene during dinner was definitely all families dining with their adult "children".The food is comfort food and quite good. Â The chips and salsa are homemade and were devoured instantly. Â The grill cheese was more than your average offering with cheese that was also slapped to the outside and charred = delicious. Â The patty melt was advertised to include grilled onions which werent delivered, it was non-the-less great. Â I paired it with Greenbush's Retribution which is an offering you won't find elsewhere and a perfect match.The odd: all beers are offered in 2 or 3 different sizes (with large being a pint glass) with prices like 4.35 and 5.15 which its nice to see them conscientious on their offering price, its a bit of a head scratcher in the bar world.This is a place I will continue to frequent often.

Just like Robb C, I hadn't heard of this place until I saw it on Yelp! Â Add to that, that it took us 2 spins around the block to find it and you have all the conditions of a hidden gem.My wife and I headed here on a date night without our son so we could enjoy some adult time. Â Really glad we did. Â The extensive beer selection also rotates micro/custom brews and if you sign up for their text message service you'll get notification when new ones are coming in or when special brews are going to make their appearance.We started with the mini-calzones appetizer and they were pretty good. Â Only complaint was that the red sauce that comes with it was cold and could have been warmed a little.I had a burger with pepper jack, bacon and a fried egg. Â It was made to order (medium rare). Â You get your choice of fries, tots or sweet potato tots. Â Had never seen sweet tater tots before and they were fantastic!!My wife had the longhorn grilled cheese which they use a Parmesan cheese coating on the outside. Â She really liked it a lot and also had the sweet tater tots.We left with full tummies and ready for the rest of the evening. Â Yes, the knock on the Gammon Coach House might be their limited menu, difficult location and small size but as I've said before in other reviews, if you can do a few things and do them excellently, that's a win versus doing a million things half-baked.Our service was excellent by the way.

My boyfriend & I were told about this little hidden treasure by a bartender at Tap House in St. Charles a few weeks back. We finally had the opportunity to stop in this evening for a beer. Too bad we ate before arriving, the menu looks yummy. We will definitely be back!!!We met Tom (very nice guy) & a couple others, seems very friendly & that's what we are looking for!!!Congrats on a good thing!! We will tell others for sure!!Stacy & Wayne

First time here had the ribs ( Sat night special) - I'd recommend these.Last time I came was for the Fri night fish - bad idea. Batter was super heavy and the fish was way overcooked.Service and beer selection was first rate both times - I may return the give the food (not the fish) another try

Grand plans every Friday night to go to a new place never happen because we always end up here. And with lots of good reasons. Wells the man behind the bar is genuine, knowledgeable and nice. The food is no frills good, go with a burger, they are really great. Best beer selection around. I had them make me a patty melt with a hot dog instead of ground beef. It can't be explained, just enjoyed.

I'm glad to see a beer-centric place pop up in Batavia! The couple of times I have been there, the tap list has been interesting, and is what keeps drawing me back.The biggest fault of the Gammon Coach House is the service. Its hit or miss, and has been mostly miss for me. Many times the server will dissapear for quite awhile while our beer glasses sit empty, or at one point after ordering our beer from our waitress, we saw it sitting on the end of the bar for at least 10 min. before it finally found its way to us. I don't think I can take any friends here since the service is embarrassing.The food isn't bad - but I wish they would expand their menu. The grilled cheese has been quite good the number of times I've tried it (and the order was correct). The pulled pork is nothing to write home about - but again I'd like to see a bit more variety on the menu.UPDATE 1-3-14: I've visited Gammon a number of times since my initial review and things have gotten much better there. The beer selection has been wonderful each time, and I think the service has improved quite a bit as well. The food menu is fairly stagnant still - its mostly basic bar food, I'd like some more non-greasy/fried items to go with such good beer. I've given them 4 stars up from my initial 2.

still a great place for a craft beer & good unique bar food - service & atmosphere mediocre, feels like they either don't care or don't understand what a difference the right service makes. Â  Lunchtime review

Sad to say I've completely flip-flopped on my previous review. Â This place was great the first time I went there. Â Since then, it's going downhill. Â First and foremost, I can't agree with their prices at all. Â I understand craft beers are specialty for them, but that doesn't make it okay to gouge every single person on every single drink in the bar. Â Furthermore, the service is getting worse. Â When I first went this place was fairly new, but now it seems like they're getting comfortable and lax in their efforts. Â But worst of all, I was there one night when a mentally challenged individual came in. Â One of the tables started harassing and belittling the individual. Â When another table attempted to defend the mentally challenged man, the staff asked that table to leave. Â They asked the table defending the mentally challenged man to leave. Â Why? Â Because in the words of the staff member "The other table tips better."Unbelievable.

I wanted to like this place, I really did. I went for drinks and dessert with friends. We got there at 7 pm, which I felt was not unreasonably late at night. However, they were out of all their desserts already! The service was poor and the staff took smoke breaks at the corner of the building so their smoke kept wafting onto the patio where we were sitting.

I really wanted to like this place. we just moved here from out of state. Â I was disappointed with the service. Â We walked in and someone said, "sit wherever". We were handed menus a few minutes later and the waitress quickly took our order. It is hard to distingush the staff because they wear street clothes. We recieved our salads with our entrees vs. before which I thought was odd, the waitress thought it was normal. Â I had the meatloaf, it was really tender but covered in a really thick glob of brown gravy. Â My husband has food allergies and had a hard time finding wheat free options on the menu. Â Nobody asked us how our meal was, even when I asked for a doggie bag for 3/4 of my meal. Â They really need to fix service issues and improve their menu.
Friendly service & great beer selection

Have just gone for drinks, and craft beer selection is great. 11 uncommon draft beers on tap and 35 bottle beers with some rare 22 oz bombers. Food menus looks like regular pub fare with sandwiches, burgers and pizza. Will be back.

Server was friendly with a pleasant demeanor. Â She tells things how they are which is what I prefer instead of a script. Â The beer list gives you plenty to choose from. Â The atmosphere is very quaint but not stuffy. Â The food is simple and delicious. Â The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is because we were told the fries were fresh cut and they were anything but. Â Will definitely be back though....

This place is tough to find unless you know where you are going. I am not sure why they have a Batavia Ave. address, when it is really more on Wilson Street behind a building that is on the corner of 31 (Batavia Ave) and Wilson. Â That said, this was a fun, small local place that was worth the adventure of trying to find the place. Good beer and good food. Our server, Matt, was very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. Good burgers, sweet tater tots, and a good beer. It has a quaint, relaxed atmosphere which is much needed in an area loaded with chain restaurants. Keep up the nice work fellas!!

Wow, I must have been there on a bad night considering all the other positive comments listed here. I felt the place was claustrophobic, limited menu and crappy service. We sat there for 30 MINUTES and the waitress kept walking by and avoiding my frantic wave for service. At least the bartender Â (owner maybe?) came by and took our beer order. So we drank our beer and left.If you're craving an extensive beer menu, skip this place and try Geneva Ale House instead.

I'm a self proclaimed beer snob and rightfully so. Â I've lived in the Pacific NW for quite some time and was exposed to some of the best craft beer in the country. Â Now I'm lucky enough to live in the Great Lakes region where we have equally as good craft brews just not quite as many options. Â BUT thanks to The Gammon Coach House I can experience all my favorites and try some new ones without having to leave my hometown of Batavia. Â It's true good to be true but yes...Batavia finally has a pub worth raving about. Â GCH is a nice spot to enjoy high quality craft brew with a solid pub menu. Â They just opened so I think they are still working out some kinks but overall they're on the right track. Â I've visited GCH about 5 times now and continue to enjoy the experience. Â The food menu is a bit limited but the if you're in the mood for a quality burger or flat bread pizza then you'll be fine. Â The burgers are better here than at the rival Geneva Ale House! Â They also have sweet potato tater tots which are way better than their cousin the sweet potato fries. Â They serve 10 beers on tap (sometimes they may be out of one or two of the hot sellers) and a host of bottles. Â They could probably expand the bottle selection a bit but I prefer draft beer so I don't really mind. Â They have two LCD TV's where you'll find a prime time football or baseball game on but watching sports isn't the main attraction here. Â Save that for Buffalo Wild Wings. Â Their patio is pretty big but with only a handful of nice days left in the year you better enjoy it while it lasts. Â The service is pretty good but it's getting better. Â The two girls behind the bar, Melmo and Nora, are great.The one think I'd like to see is some drink options for kids. Â Maybe some apple juice, lemonade, milk and a plastic cup option. Â I'm not suggesting they go over board with a full kids menu option or anything but it would be nice to have an alternative to glassware and the orange juice and water they serve to kids today. Â I'll be watching to see if they change this up. Â If they don't then I'll have to assume they're intentionally not catering to kids which would be sad because Batavia is a family oriented town. Â I'd hate to have to limit my business because I couldn't have my 6 year old join me for a burger and some tater tots!I really hope they continue with the quality beer and food selection I've seen so far. Â If they do then there's no doubt GCH will be a big success for Batavia and the surrounding Fox Valley area!
Gammon Coach House Rocks!

I really wanted to like this place. It's so cute, and Batavia could use another good restaurant. However, I think they have some kinks to work out...We visited on a Friday night to try the fish. We sat outside on the cute little patio out front. So far so good. The menu is not extensive, but we were just there to try the fish, so it didn't really matter. I decided to try the baked cod instead of the traditional fried variety, as I was trying to be good. The waitress came by to take our drink orders and explained that did not have baked cod that night - instead there was a tilapia dish with mushroom polenta. Ok, no big deal. I decide to go with the fried fish. One of my companions tried to order a non-alcoholic beer, which they do not have. Oops. I asked for a kids menu for my four year old, and the waitress explained that they don't have one. She said most kids just order the pizza or hot dog from the regular menu. We decided on the macaroni and cheese for him (side order - $4). I hate paying for macaroni and cheese since it's so cheap to make at home, especially when doesn't come with anything else, but I digress...The food came out fairly quickly, and everything was nice and hot. The fish itself was good, but the batter was super thick, and reminded us of a corn dog. The fries were good, but the coleslaw looked like it was made quite a while ago. It was starting to brown, and the carrots on top looked dry. I asked the waitress (very nicely) if there was any fresh coleslaw, and she told me it's a vinegar coleslaw and not a creamy one, and that it had been refrigerated (basically telling me I was wrong to think there was anything wrong with it). Um, ok. She said she could bring me another one, but at that point I just decided to skip it altogether. At the end of our meal, we all had piles of breading on our plates and no one had touched the coleslaw.One final experience that sort of capped off the evening. I believe there are apartments or offices of some sort above the restaurant. While we were sitting on the patio, someone came out of a door that opens right onto the patio with a bag of garbage. I'm pretty sure they worked/lived there, and weren't a restaurant employee, but it's still kind of gross to have someone carry garbage through a restaurant. Even if it is outside.Perhaps it will do well as a bar, what with the beer selection, but we probably won't go back for a meal.

Love Love Love this place! Â Great location, cool inside (north woodsish), awesome staff, GREAT BEER and tasty food! Â This is the type of restaurant the Batavia area needs and I hope it stays around for awhile. Â My wife and I visit this place at least 3 or 4 times a month, either just to grab some beers or enjoy some food. Â They change their beer menu weekly and always are getting something new in. Â Food is great, recommend sweet potato tots, chips and salsa or pulled pork. Â I hope the rest of the downtown Batavia restaurants take a note from this place....we need interesting food, great drinks and just a good all around atmosphere. Â Try it if you haven't yet!

Great beer selection on tap and good food to boot! Â Hidden gem off the beaten path and glad to see it. Â Great selection of finger foods that go great with their selection of every changing micro brews. Â Can be a bit crowded but that's understandable.

I was am so happy to have been introduced to GCH. Their beer menu is fantastic, and even better you can order your drafts in 3 different sizes, perfect if you want to taste a few different drafts without getting hammered. I have never eaten a full meal here, only tried a few appetizers and queso, and was very pleased with how good it was! They have a late night menu after the kitchen closes, which is great for me cause drinking always makes me hungry. The bartenders are great, have really only had the same to guys ever behind the bar because I tend to go on the same nights, and they are knowledgable of the beer and very friendly and fun. Â Go to gammons, its fantastic.

Food very good, especially the sweet potato tater tots! Â Service was great and super friendly. Â Really great beer selection as well, and great that they have sizes so you can try different beers without committing to a pint.

I agree with the previous reviews! The one thing really I did not love was staring into the kitchen sink, the bright kitchen lights and the normal conversation coming from the kitchen. Â I definitely will return at least once but if the kitchen situation remains the same it may be a deal breaker.

Whenever I have a craving for non-deep dish pizza, Jet's is the place I go! Try their 8 corner pizza, the crust is thick and out of this world and the pizza is cheesy and piping hot. I love the pepperoni pizza and they give a delicious marinara sauce on the side for extra dipping. The way I judge pizza is not only what it tastes like when I get it, but if it is still delicious the day after even when it is cold- Jet's pizza is just as good the day after :) YUM!Try checking online/mail for the free cheesy bread coupons. I love getting the cheesy bread too (I will admit it is really oily though, so you might have to grab napkins to pat the grease off). On the plus side, it is super soft and perfectly seasoned.

We ordered from here just once, for delivery, and it was fine. I was pulled in by the "bold fold" pizza option during my quest for NY pizza (which was ultimately fulfilled by Little Pops Pizza in Naperville) and sadly the crust is just too thick at Jet's to be a true foldable delight. However, the pizza is good, and inexpensive, and they deliver. The wings are aiiiight, too. All in all, an A-OK experience.

Jet's Pizza is consistently great. Different from the norm, I love the deep dish with the turbo crust. I've ordered pick up and delivery from this location many times and have never had a bad experience.
Open till 11 and won't pick up their phone, thanks Lou Malnalti'sWTG LOUS...................Missed the mark
I love the 8 corners pizza. It tastes amazing and you will love if you like a thicker crust. The staff is friendly and the food is quick
Jets pizza gives me raging boners.Pizza is legit and the truth. Any other pizza is weak and a joke. If you don't eat or don't like jets, you must suck at life all together.Jets, FTW bitches.

I'm a fan of Jet's Pizza. Â It's been great every time I've had it.I used them to cater a birthday party at DuPage Children's Museum. Â They knocked it out of the park.The driver showed up a couple minutes early. Â Our party was downstairs by the cafeteria, which was quite a walk. Â He was super friendly even though he had to make 3 trips(sorry!).The pizza was great as expected, everybody enjoyed it. Â The item I was concerned about was the party sized chef salad. Â But it was fresh and crunchy all the way through. Â No nasty wilted lettuce or questionable toppings. Â They also included a full bottle of Italian dressing, a full bottle of ranch dressing, plus a huge bag full of all sorts of crazy dressings(1000 island, Catalina and some fat free varieties). Â On top of stocking us with dressing for the foreseeable future, they also gave us 4 free 2 liters "for doing business with us."They really gave me great service, freebie or not, I'll always go back.

Ordered Jet's based on the Yelp reviews and wasn't disappointed. The pan pizza is not typical Chicago but really good. I ordered a small and it is six pieces, plenty for dinner and a leftover meal (for one). I especially like that it's a rectangle because the corners are awesome! Also ordered the Jet's Bread which was great and could be a meal itself. Best of all was the price - absolutely got my money's worth. I will be ordering again!

We have not been able to find a good pizza place since moving, and I had just about gave up hope, until I found Jets. I am definitely a big fan!We ordered a large deep dish pizza with Jet's Turbo Crust and it was amazing!! The veggies were fresh and not soggy. I really have nothing bad to say about Jets. The delivery guys are nice too, and the one time I had to call the store, the staff was very friendly! Even their bread sticks are great! We have definitely found our new pizza place!
The shift for the best pizza is more quality toppings and LESS dough. Thin is in! Not a favorite.
I work next door these guys have great delivery service friendy staff and there Â pizza is always hot and fresh the location is a bit hidden but place is always clean

We are so delighted to have a location of Jet's close to downtown Naperville!The Eight Corner Deep Dish is the pizza you MUST get. Be sure to add the Turbo crust (free -- garlic + butter + parmesan; they also have other options like Cajun and Poppyseed).This Deep Dish is two little square pizzas, and if you are a crust monster this is the one for you! I want to write love sonnets to it. I don't understand how in the 10-12 minutes it takes from me placing my order to the pizza being ready that the crust gets so beautifully brown, almost caramelized around the bottom edges.Unlike the Hand Tossed [which we ordered by mistake once, and was okay], the Deep Dish doesn't really have a top edge; it's all about that glorious crunchy bottom crust.Also, this is different from Chicago style Deep Dish (which makes me very happy, as I don't like the concept of having sloppy sauce on the top of my pizza with nothing securing it to everything else). The closest analogs are Buddy's and Shield's from Detroit.Regarding this particular location, we were served by a very polite young lady, and the pizza was made quickly, though we dropped in and ordered at the counter.In case you couldn't tell, I heartily approve of this place. I will have to resist the temptation to order every night. When you need your pizza fix, zoom up Ogden and try Jet's, because it's hip to be square.

We tried the new location and had a large square Hawaiian, with added mushrooms, and plain crust. Â Total was $16.80, and it was disappointing compared to the Route 59 location. Â Pizza was salty, and on dried out side, particularly the mushrooms. Â Will try again due strong convenience factor, and knowing they can probably do better. Â The new location is located across the street from Walgreens.
Good pizza with good prices. They delivered to my Hampton hotel on or occasion, and to my table at he world of beers on another.

I love jets pizza! this last time i ordered the 2slice combo and the pizza seemed to have been sitting around for awhile. could explain how I had it delivered and it was at my place 15 min later. I will be back tho bc every other time is great!

HOW...these reviews are correct. Â We get our pet food at the place next door and are always looking at this place.We got the thin crust....it was so good! Â Everything was fresh. Â The place was spotless and the staff are pros. Â Go get ya some. Â You will love it.

Jet's is what you'd expect from a cheap pizza place. Â I've tried the deep dish (nice texture to the crust but bland and very greasy pizza) Jet's bread (again bland and greasy) and the New York style (bland, bad crust, not enough sauce or cheese and absolutely not a New York style pizza). Â If you have kids to feed and want cheap, filling pizza and don't care about their health then I'd recommend Jet's.

Fond memories of home, regrettably lost in translation. I really miss Detroit style pizza. Seeing locations in the Chicago area was like "yeeessss", until I tried to order some. The online ordering system is an awful joke and beyond frustrating cause it doesn't work for our condo location. And calling was very much the same experience. I tried to order a year ago and had the same problems. They couldn't complete an order with ingredients on only half. Â Who ever is in charge of this company should take their head out of the sand to see what's happening on a local level, maybe even set standards for staff hiring/training/ordering software/and website improvements before expanding any further. I literally ordered a pizza on an app, from a competitor in less time than it took to wright this. I still like the Jets from back home, sadly this is not the same.

Taking note from other yelpers, we ordered the Eight Corner Deep Dish pizza with Turbo Crust. I'm a sucker for flavored crust; Hungry Howies and I go wayyyyy back!So to say the least, I was excited when I found out you could order flavored crusts. Super awesome. Â How I would describe this pizza? Well, it would have tasted a lot better if I had a killer hangover because this baby was ultra greasy. We're talking 'need multiple napkins while eating' greasy. Since I was not nursing a bad hangover, and thus didn't need that amount of grease, the pizza was a little over-the-top for me. Flavor wise, it was a decent pizza, no complaints there. I can certainly see why people would love the Eight Corner Deep Dish; the crust, aside from the grease, is crispy and golden brown.That being said, this is now my go-to pizza option for those lazy, got wayyyy too drunk last night, need grease NOW food! Besides, when you're totally hung from overdoing the hooch, who even cares how you look when you're eating?

Yummmmm this was perfect for the hangover I had today. I ordered a large deep dish Super Special (pepperoni, ham, mushroom, pepper, onion, olive, and tomato). My husband and I both loved the corner pieces the best. Then I figured out that you can order an 8 corner pizza...d'oh. I do have to say that the pizza reminded me a lot of Pizza Hut's dough...definitely a better sauce though, and more cheese.
Love the 8 Corner Pizza with Turbo crust (butter, parmesan and garlic) The Boneless wings are good but expensive.

Great taste and I could eat this every day, but I'm moderately sensitive to MSG, there must be a lot of this in their pizza and garlic bread that I became sensitive immediately. Â Too bad, I can't Â physically afford to eat here again. Â I'll check back again if things have changes since this place is addicting.

I usually hate "pan" pizza.. thick doughy pizza with not enough sauce and cheese on it. Â When my kids school had a fundraiser here I was not pleased to hear that their 'za is the pan style. Â I was pleasantly surprised by how delicious their product is! Â  I'm not sure why other places can't make pan pizza taste like this, but if they did I'd be a fan for sure. Â Something about this pie- it's still crispy on the bottom and the crust has a nice consistency that the sauce and cheese work great with. Â I also really appreciate how much these guys do for our school. Â Definitely worth a try if you get burned out on the thin crust and deep dish that is prevalent everywhere in the Naperville area.

HOLY COW. ORDER THIS PIZZA NOW.I only order the 8 corner pizza with the Turbo Crust. It is INCREDIBLE.One time, I ordered and they forgot my diet coke, I said "no worries" and asked them to just deduct it from my bill (I paid via credit card) and the guy was apologizing profusely and went back to the store and brought me my diet coke!!!!! Â Talk about service!!! :)It's amazing. Order it!I only gave it 4 stars because I wish they had other things to order from there- but that has NOTHING to do with their quality. :)

I love JETS! Â Pizza is good, JETS bread is awesome, and great salads. Â Great prices. Â Their ranch dressing is homemade and is delicious!!My only complaint is I can't figure out how to use a coupon when ordering online.Check this place out!

Jet's has been an amazing find for us! Â We had it for the first time at our friend's house over a year ago and have ordered pizza from this location several times. Â We've only ordered the square deep dish pizza and the cheesy bread. Â I must say I think it's the best pizza in the area. Â I love the crust (it's similar to Pizza Hut's crust)! Â Also, you can't beat the price. Â We even ordered this pizza for our son's birthday party a few months back and the manager was more than willing to work with us to ensure everything was exactly how we wanted it and delivered the pizza on time!
I am fan ! The service is great, they help you out with the coupons which you receive in the email. Good Service, Good Pizza !
Pan w garlic crust was yummy!!!

Just had Jets at my brother in laws house and loved it. Â A real Chicago style at a very affordable price and they make a great product. Â Their cheese sticks were GREAT and I will be a loyal customer from now on. Â It is well worth a try!!!!!
Just tried jets for the first time and the pizza is to die for. Love it love it!!! Kinda like a cross between Little Graders meet Papa Johns. Yum Yum!!!

The first time I had Jet's was back when I lived in Michigan and I LOVE LOVE LOVE them. I can't even begin to describe how happy I was when i found out they have traveled across the lake to my home town. It is definitely not Chicago pizza but it is still delicious. It is all the things you love about pizza, crispy crust and TONS of cheese. LOVE IT!
Great delivery service - on time and friendly.
Good pizza, terrible service

Love, love, love their pizza!! Their deep dish 8-corner pizza is to die for!! Â So delicious! I've also tried their garden salad. It was one of the freshest salads I've ever had. Yummm!The employees are so kind and friendly, always a pleasant experience.
awesome pizza........awesomer salads.........pretty good prices...but not cheap.

I would give this place a 6 star if I could!It was ABSOLUTELY amazing, and they didn't like when they said everything was organic and freshly made (they even said they don't have a microwave in the back!)This place used the be a food truck before it became a restaurant, and frankly I am glad it wasn't a truck that I had to find and I know exactly where it will be the next time that I want to eat here.The inside of the restaurant is cute! Nice and trendy. I came here for a quick lunch and the service was great, and quick. I really want to come back with a group of friends to eat and have some beer. I noticed there was a selection of craft beer there that I want to try!The gringo was a fried taco and it was super flavorful, and the aioli sauce on the shrimp taco and the veggie taco was fresh and flavorful.
