Terrible service. Food was mediocre the fried rice was mushy and the portions are tiny for their prices.
So far the best Thai we have tried so far. We love the gluten free pad Thai. We call our order in on the train ride home and voila! Dinner is ready!

We decided to get Thai tonight and found th Thai Medallion by Naperville train station and thought we'd try it. Why did it take us so long to find this place? The chicken satay was excellent with a perfect peanut sauce. The pad thai was what we've been looking for! The scallops Panama sauce was out of this world! Truly an unexpected gem!

Been here a few times now, but the last time was awful to the point that I may never come back again. Every other time I came the food was fresh and had lots of flavor. The last time was very bland, greasy and tasteless. This is a hard location to own a restaurant and I wish a good one would stay there, but to start serving bad food is not a good idea. They may have just had a bad night or the chef called in sick, but I am not about to waste my time and hard earned money on bad food.

Met my husband off the train in Naperville and saw this restaurant near the station and decided to give it a try. We love Thai food and have to say this is some of the best we have had in years! Â From start to finish, everything was fantastic. Fresh ingredients and fresh flavors.We love to cook and appreciate great tasting food. This won me over. Â Will be our "go to" from now on.

I am a self proclaimed foodie. This place rocks! I had the red curry w chicken. I would also suggest trying green curry and ask them to spice it up. I am going back tonight for more. Nice ambiance so hope they will get more traffic inside the restaurant.
Red curry was excellent! Green curry was good. Glass-noodle-dish was alright.Try their 'Thai Medallion Roti' for dessert, simply awesome.

11-2-13 Just got back from dinner. What a wonderful experience.We had egg rolls, Tom yum soup, and pad thai. Everything was excellent , the food was hot, and the service was great, We will defiantly Â going back and soon.Love this placeTheNapervilleFoodDude

I had an unplanned great date with my daughter ant the Thai Medallion. The food is great as well as their service. You might have to call for directions, but is well worth your effort. I've visited over 300 Thai restaurants in my life and I place the Thai Medallion in my top 10%.

Just went here last night for the first time. Â We've tried all of the local Thai restaurants within about a 15 minute drive of Naperville and this one ranks up there among the best. Â Portions were very good, service was excellent, everything was very fresh and the food tasted outstanding!Our favorites that we ordered were probably the fresh spring rolls, the Tom Yum soup (easily served 4 of us as an appetizer), and the Mussaman Curry ... which is really outstanding! Â The only thing to be aware of is that medium is pretty spicy here compared to some other local Thai restaurants. Â We ordered the Tom Yum medium and they added fresh chili's to our soup which was excellent. Â I love the extra spice, but it was a little too much heat for some people at our table, so you may want to keep that in mind when ordering - depending on your preference.We will definitely be back and ordering lots of carry out!Unless you're travelling on METRA, this one is a little off the beaten path (directly next to the south side of the Naperville METRA station), but definitely worth it.

We decided to try takeout here since it's super convenient to the Naperville Metra station, and we noticed it was now open. My wife and I shared the Tom Kha soup and Basil Fried rice. Both were solid, and the fried rice had a nice assortment of fresh veggies. Would definitely order from them again. If there was any downside, my Thai iced tea could've used a higher tea to milk ratio, but otherwise very happy.

Met my husband here as he got off the train. Â Very good pad thai with excellent shrimp. Spring rolls were tasty. Lad nar was our least favorite because the beef quality wasn't as good as the shrimp. Thai iced tea was good. Their original dessert was quite nice. You won't find it anywhere else. Â  We will be back!

The food here was okay. Â We arrived around 11:45 and it wasn't open yet even though it should have opened at 11:30 so we walked around and came back. Â The Tom Yum soup was okay - I like it spicer and less sweet. The shrimp in the soup were very good though. We had drunken noodles with chicken and the noodles were good but the chicken wasn't the best.

One of the best Thai restaurants in the area. Although hidden from any busy street and a bit hard to find (It is on the South side of the train station). The atmosphere is cozy and modern. The food was full of flavor and there are many great dishes to choose from...my favorites the night we went were the spring rolls and the pad Thai.

Mmmmmmm...the green papaya salad was the best I have ever had. Â We also split an order of spring rolls (quite good)and an nice big bowl of Tom Kha soup (lots of veggies and a well-balanced broth). Â We also had a mixed seafood dish (wish I could remember what it was called) that had a nice not-too-heavy sauce. Â Overall it was an excellent meal. The service was very attentive. They spiced up the dishes I asked them to and that was nice because some places don't.I have just found my new regular Thai place and it's not too far from home, Yay!

I'm a Thai snob and this place was perfect. Â Clean design, friendly staff, well priced, and fantastic food! Â We ate the coconut soup and the Penang curry, both were seasoned perfectly with a wonderful balance of sweet and spicy. Â I look forward to a return soon.

We ordered the pepper steak and green curry. Both seem to be underseasoned - lacking in fish sauce for the curry and some salt on the pepper steak.The vegetables on the pepper steak are fresh and still crunchy which is good. The steak are also tender.The green curry on the other hand seem to be watered-down. The sauce is not as thick as I expected. Also, it lacked the spiciness of Thai food. Maybe a little bit of Thai chilis would be nice.There is just one server so the service wasnt as good.
Absolutely delicious Pad Thai and Pad See Ewe. Â Nice friendly service. Â Wines by the glass were also good.

We were very happy with the food and service, on a Sunday evening. Â The place had only 3 or 4 parties, but it didn't feel deserted. Â The food is different from what you find at most Thai restaurants there days. Â It is more interesting and very nicely but gently spiced. Â They ask you how spicy you want it. Â There is quite a variety of appetizers, soups, salads. Â But the house specials are the really outstanding items - dishes I haven't seen at other area Thai places. Â The food is moderately expensive, but their top quality justifies the price. Â The main dishes are $12 to $18 each, and are adequate, though not huge, for a normal appetite, especially if you add an appetizer, which you should, since they are really outstanding. Â For example, we ordered spring roles which you'd think are pedestrian, but not at this place. Â The spring rolls are delicious works of art, on a tangy sauce, like top quality sushi rolls, and you get two large rolls cut into bit seize treats.

So let me begun by saying I'm a Thai food snob. I've had Thai food all over. I've tried every Thai restaurant in Naperville area. This restaurant has become my favorite. It is super authentic just like the Thai food we had in Bangkok and elsewhere in Thailand. It is better than any Thai restaurant I've found in downtown Chicago and I lived there for over 10 years before moving to Naperville. One recommended dish out of the ordinary is the Kua Kling with Chicken. Very very spicy but excellent. Give this place a try next time you have a taste for real Thai food.
One of the better Thai places in Naperville. Prices are a little higher than neighboring Thai restaurants, but they offer a lot of coupons.

I Â went to Â pick Â up my friend Â at a train station. We saw this place right by, so we decide to check it out. Not bad at all for me, There are some uncommon Thai dish in the menu which is great. We end up with typical Thai appetizer Carb Rangoon and Â chicken satay. And for entrees I have their southern Thai special "Kua Kling "and my friend had Â a shrimp Pad Thai. I was amaze by the spice in my dish. . I tasted Pad Thai, it was tasty. Nothing missing in this place. . Oh the roti dessert is the best too.
Great Thai, great service, nice local feeling with Sam at the helm!!!Love the Thom Yum soup!!Chicken salad very tasty, a nice change from my fave of noodle dishes.

Visiting from out of town and our friends know we like food so the suggested we try it.I had some egg rolls, crab rangoon, larb kai, and chicken garlic & pepper.The food was fantastic!If you don't like your food super spicy, order Â  it 1 or 2 (on a scale of 1-5)I ordered mine 4 on the spicy scale and it lived up to its rating.The service was equal to the food (excellent).If I could change one thing, it would be the seating.Every chair at our table was "butt sprung" and it felt like you were going to fall right through the seat.I still highly recommend it but the condition of the chairs is something they need to address.

I have been looking for Thai food in the Wheaton area and this place was on my list. I wanted to try a little bit of everything so I ordered quite a bit of food for me and my sister.We started with potstickers, spring rolls and some crab ragoons. The ragoons were the best out of the three. They were cooked perfectly and came with an amazing sauce.We also ordered the pad Thai with tofu and the massamun curry with chicken. The pad Thai was good, but nothing special. The curry though was amazing. Wonderful spices and the chicken was juicy and had absorbed the flavor of the curry.I would definitely come back here and would order the curry and ragoons for sure. The prices were also extremely reasonable.

Just tried this place for the first time today. It was really good. We had the ground chicken basil leaves which was flavorful and delicious. I had a side of lettuce that I ate with it. Basil fried rice yummy! Chicken satay delicious. And green chicken curry which my SO had. Everything was great! Can't wait to come back and try out some other stuff.

5 stars for customer service and food! Â Nice friendly man welcomed me & gave me chicken& rice soup to start.I ordered the pad see ew but when it came out I realized it was not the noodle I wanted. Â My fault totally! Â I ordered incorrectly but was willing to eat it because it looked super delicious anyway! Â But the gentleman wanted to make me happy & ordered pad won sen- the glass noodles instead.I was so apologetic but he didn't make me feel bad at all. Â So soooo sweet!!And the food spot on delicious!!!

I was in the area and decided to stop in. I'm so glad I did!As I walk in, I was greeted right away and told I could sit anywhere I'd like. They have about 8 tables. He followed me and served my water right away. The menu is already on the table. Seems as if they go their paper to go menus all around.I got the lunch special which comes with appetizer and soup.The soup was good, chicken and rice. The appetizer was served with my meal; vegetable spring rolls. The rolls were a bit bland.The main course was to rave about! The pad Thai was delish!! So flavorful! I upgraded to shrimp for $3 and received only 3 shrimps. That was a bit disappointing, but it is what it is. Everything is made fresh. As soon as I placed my order, I heard the kitchen fire up!Will be back when I am in the area.

When I saw many positive reviews for Somsri I felt that it deserved a try. Â This is the best Thai food in the Chicagoland area. Â Here is why:Whenever we arrive Sam, the manager/owner greets us right away and allows us to sit where comfortable and gives us water.The food comes quickly, like within 10-15 minutes of arrival and is always nice and hot. Â The food is amazingly fresh tasting and looks great! Â Their iced coffee is amazing as well, super flavorful and is mixed with coconut milk.The weekdays have various specials that go on. Â Lunch hour deals are great as you are able to get your entree, an appetizer, and bowl of soup for under $10.I love this location, the restaurant, and the people that work here. Â Greatest Thai restaurant around!

Great Thai restaurant. Owner brought out chicken and rice soup as soon as we arrived. Ordered the calamari. It's different than others as it has a breading like onion rings. Very good and tasted fresh. Also ordered a chicken cashew dish with pineapple that was great. Had an iced Thai coffee to go. A bit sweet for me ( I think it had sweetened condensed milkIn it) but really good. I can't wait to go back when we come to visit again.

Really really REALLY delicious! Â We love somsri! Â The appetizer combo is really wonderful and the dipping sauces are perfect. Â They make wonderful Pad thai and Pad See Ewe. Â We almost always do carry out instead of dine-in because there is little to no ambiance in there. Â It's quite small and not very romantic...BYOB which is nice, but again it doesn't feel like a nice date night out sort of restaurant. Â TAKE OUT for sure is the way to go and you'll be in heaven in your own kitchen with your favorite wine or beer. Â YUM.

The pad woon sen level 4 was awesome!! I would certainly come back here for a Thai fix.Heat levels for extra spice are 1-5. 4 was spicy enough to get your attention and it didn't diminish the taste one bit!

When a restaurant is good that's one thing to go back.But when a restaurant keeps getting better and better then you feel like an idiot that you don't go there more often.Especially that when you went the first time you got it so wrong. Been back a couple times since my first review here and I couldn't be more impressed with the food. The portions are not only large but the food is beyond fresh and flavorful. You can do Thai right and sometimes it can go wrong. Fortunately I was the one wrong with my first review because the food here could not be any more right on value and taste. Easily the best Thai restaurant on both aspects in the western suburbs.Will add more later. I got it so wrong on the ground chicken with spicy basil leaves. And the Tom Kha soup is not only done exceptionally well, but with all really good soups, it also has its own personal distinct taste per recipe from chef. Though an extra spring roll or two is always thrown in is a nice touch aside from that spring rolls are probably the only item not up to snuff on the whole menu that I have tried so far. But spring rolls can be like fortune cookies at other Asian restaurants. I will update on what else was ordered. But in the mean time Delicious food getting cold and there is no excuse for that.

The food here is delicious. I have tried several of their curries and noodle dishes, and they have all been excellent. I especially love the curry that comes with the Rama delight noodles. You really can't go wrong with any dish here. Even their crab rangoons are delicious. The price is super affordable for the amount of food you get as well.The service here is fantastic; the owner (not sure if there are multiple) is extremely friendly! They are a great neighborhood restaurant, albeit a little limited in the seating they offer. They offer take-out.

Last night was my 2nd time dining at Somsri. I wasn't 100% sure of the wonderful gentleman's name (the owner) but thought I remembered his name as Sam.My husband and I walked in and immediately Sam greeted us with a warm welcome. What blew us out of the water was he REMEMBERED both of our names!! It may not seem like a big deal, but it completely made our 2nd experience even more amazing than our 1st.Panang Noodles with a spicy level of 4 (from 1-5) was the perfect amount of spice, veggies and noodles with lots of flavor. My husband ordered the Mussamun Curry which was also delicious. Our bite size Crab Rangoon was a pleasant surprise!We are already looking forward to our 3rd visit to Somsri!Thank you, Mr. Sam & Somsri family!

My Panang Curry was acceptable but the Cashew chicken was dismal. Â Old nuts and served cold. We had to send it back. Â The circuses are 0 stars. The silverware was not properly cleaned, the restroom looked worse than a truck stop. Would not return for free food.Not sure what other folks have eaten for Thai food but I am rarely so disappointed with the ratings that this place received.It is a shame we live two blocks away. Â Gnarly Knots and Gionarios Deli are the only places in town worth repeat business. Very sad for two foodies.

Great Thai food! It's a clean spot across the Metra station to grab a bite of Thai. Â Lunch specials include the $6.99 Szechwan that I got. Â Included were TWO egg rolls and a cup of soup.I will definitely return to try more.
This is our go to place! The crab Rangoon and pot stickers are so good! Extremely friendly staff.
Ordered crab rangoon ($5.99 for 9), panang curry ($9.99), and massamun curry ($9.99). The curries were too sweet for me unfortunately. Fast service. No paper towels in either bathrooms.
Best Thai food around! The red curry is always delicious. Very nice people, reasonably priced... can't say anything negative about this place! You keep doing you Somsri!
I haven't been here yet, accidentally reviewed and yelp wont let me delete.

Excellent quality, price, portions in a little restaurant. Â Better to do carry out if you have a large party (more than 5 people). Small dining area with 5 four tops and 2 two tops. Don't ask for extra spicy if you can't handle Thai chili peppers. I ordered a medium spicy 4 (scale of 1-10)....it feels more like a 7 in a normal restaurant. Â It was spicy but goooood! Â  Must order the Thai Iced Tea and Thai Iced Coffee! Â We will be back
Sam is the MAN! Awesome food and great service. So glad it's so close.... A A++++++++++ must
Outstanding food! Â Love the Panang noodles, Pad Thai noodles and shaumi. We have been going there for years. Â Owner is so personable. Â BYOB!!!!!!! Â  You must try it out!

Good Thai food! Â My favorite is the pad woon sen. Â I've tried a couple curries as well. Â I've only taken food for take out, and the service is fast and prices are standard. Â They aren't reinventing any wheels but they are perfect if you need a quick Thai fix.
Best Thai food I have had in the US so far. Small but clean place, food is excellent. Great place for take-out! I received complimentary dumplings - very tasty.
Awesome food, great egg rolls strongly recommended try the fried rice special, with chicken it was the tits!

Great family owned restaurant. The food here is plentiful and flavorful. You get great tasting food, good portion size for a decent Â price. I recommend the Pagang curry, pad thai, spicy basil chicken.

I love the food here. I love the owner and the appreciation he shows everyone when they come in. I've never been disappointed in the food and have eaten there or taken it to go many times.I took off one star because the place is usually cold in the winter and the chairs really need to be replaced. As a take out place, you won't find better. As an dine in place, well, I hope he thrives and can update the dining room.

Quick, good value, great flavor, very generous portions.We were running errands in the Burbs and starving. Wanted something quick that wasn't awful fast food, and we figure our options were limited outside the city.We drove by this place and figured it was worth trying. So pleasantly surprised! Very friendly guy at the counter. Ordered chicken basil fried rice and schechuan chicken at "3" level spicy to go. Couldn't believe how much Â food came! Chicken dish came w white rice, and the fried rice was so loaded w veggies and chicken it looked like another entree itself. We also got veggie egg rolls- not sure if it was thrown in or part of the meal, but we had way more food than we expected.Lots of flavor, good amount of spice. All said and done we have enough for dinner, too, and it only cost $19 for everything. Was very impressed.

The service was wonderful and I love the big cushy dining chairs. My pad see ew was a bit above average compared to other places I've eaten but still not the best I've had. It could use a little more sauce.
There food is great! I've tried a few Thai restaurants and by far this is my favorite.

Full disclosure, this place ended up being our second choice for dinner after the top choice was closed.It's small, only a couple of tables, with all your Thai food standards. Pad Kee Mao and Mussaman Curry were good options.This is not my favorite Thai place in the area (that would be Tusk in Batavia, followed by Le Siam in Naperville), but this is a serviceable choice in Winfield for your Thai food needs.

My favorite Thai place in the area! :) The food is exceptional and so is the service. Everything I've had from here is amazing. The convenient location is especially a plus. If they offer the sticky rice with the mango be sure to take them up on it! You won't regret it.
So good! I can't get enough of the Tom Kha soup!Everything is delicious- must TRY!

Love this place! Â My wife and I stumbled across this wonderful gem by pure luck. Â We brought a couple of friends here on our second visit and they have now become regulars here as well. Â The food is delicious and tastes authentic and home made. Â The service is phenomenal. Â Its a small place with big character. I 100â„… recommend Somsri for great food, great service , and an overall awesome experience. Â I get the Pad See Eew by the way, and its one of the best I've had.
The food at this place is not only phenomenal but the service is even better. Sam is always super nice and attentive to the customers needs. We love this place!

The worst Thai food I have tried in Illinois. We hadd the appetizer combo, Tom Kha soup and two entrees. Appetizers were all deep fried, white rice over cooked, entrees didn't have fresh vegetables. Overall quality was much lower than other Than restaurants.

This place is phenomenal, I love ordering from here! Sam the owner is very great at what he does. He's very generous and friendly. The food here is great, I always get the sesame chicken with rice. It's way better than a lot of restaurants I've ordered sesame chicken from. It doesn't take long for them to give you your food. Also if you order a certain dollar amount worth of food, you will get a free appetizer. I've gotten crab Rangoon and egg roles for free. A very wonderful business, and I'll continue to order from here.

A friend of mine recommended this place to me so I decided to give it a try. So glad I did! I ordered cashew chicken and tom kha soup, both delicious! So nice when the food is exactly what you wanted. You will not be disappointed!

I love this place! Â It has good food with reasonable prices and great service. Â I have been going here for the last year and half, and Sam and his staff are a big part of the reason I keep coming back.Some of my favorites include their pad Thai, beef salad, cashew chicken with fried rice noodles, won ton soup and spicy basil scallops. Â I do also like his crab rangoons, as they are lite and refreshing, not your average greasy and heavy version.

Great little Thai joint in downtown Winfield. We love the Spicy Chicken with Basil Leaves and the Pad Ni Mao. They'll make any dish as spicy or mild as you like, 1 to 5. If you dine in you can BYOB. The lunch specials are great, they include soup and an egg roll.

Crab Rangoon, chicken panang curry, and chicken pad thai are my favorite dishes from here. The owner is great, so friendly and welcoming!! The food is delicious every time and great size portions. Love this place!! If your craving some delicious Thai, I recommend somsri! Best Thai food in town :)

I've only had the red and panang currys (miltiple times) but they are really good and a decent amount as well. Â I have to try the rest of the menu eventually but its difficult as the curry is so good. Â Heat level requests up to 5 and 4 is a real burn and Im a hot food fan. Â BYOB and there happens to be a liquor store just around the corner. Â Super friendly service, always a pleasure to dine in or take out. Â Im not a fan of the egg rolls but thats no reason to pass this place up.

If you don't like small places where your table might be up against a stranger's, this place isn't for you. But it's one of the top Thai food I've found in the west burbs.The Panang curry chicken is my favorite -- yummy sauce.

Don't be fooled by the lackluster dÃ©cor of this place, or the location in a strip mall by the train, the food is excellent. Â I came in for dinner before I was going to a meeting nearby and ordered the egg rolls and some beef thai fried rice. Â I had no idea that the egg rolls would come 8 to an order and be so large!! Â It was enough for 4 people! Â The fried rice was also a huge serving and the flavor was great, beef was tender. Â The owner made fun of me that I ordered so much food and couldn't finish, but I was not used to this kind of value - for $15, I would expect so much less in quantity.I don't live in the area, but if I am around, I would definitely come back! Â And, now I have the leftovers to look forward to for dinner tonight!

Love this place for carry out. The owner is super friendly and always generously throws in an appetizer of some sort with the order. My favorites so far are the shrimp cigars, Tom Yum soup, pad Thai, and crab Rangoon.The only reason I didn't give this place five stars is that the dining area is small, and they don't serve alcohol. Great local Thai place!
My favorite Thai place EVER. Crab rangoon, egg rolls, and pad Thai are all amazing. LOVE LOVE. we drive past 5 Thai places over 10 miles to get to this place. Just wish they were closer!

Love this place... Decided to try it after I heard people recommending it on a local Facebook group...now I am hooked - love the pad thai - anytime my 3year old wants to see my husband get off the train, I am game because it is a great excuse to get take out dinner at Somsri.
Friendly service and very quick. I loved the pad Thai, some of the best flavor around the suburbs. The unfortunate thing was that both my husband and I had upset stomachs later.

What a great find!I had known about Somsri for quite a while, and being a frequent Thai diner (Thipi in GE, Pad Thai Etc. in Wheaton), I knew that Somsri warranted a try, because variety is the spice of life.I can't say anything about the actual restaurant because my roommate (mom) picked up my order at about 815 on a Thursday night. It took 10 minutes from call to pickup. Very fast!I ordered Tom Yum Pork (a small bowl for 4.99) and the Pad Thai Chicken (8.99). The bowl of soup is a very good size. Same with the Pad Thai dish!As for the soup, very yummy. Not the best tom yum I've ever had, but certainly better than other ones I've had. Lots of fresh veggies, and surprisingly, lots of pork! A lot of Thai places skimp on protein, but not here!The Pad Thai chicken was excellent as well. Plenty of veggies and chicken! Seasoned well too; not sure what type of seasoning they used, but it was good enough that I licked the to go pan it came in. On the savory to sweet scale, I would say it was more towards the sweet side. Not too sweet, but very good.Somsri is very good, and it's fairly priced. It's nice to have another Thai option in the area. My favorite Thai of all time remains Thara Thai in Champaign, Illinois, but Somsri has a chance to become my favorite in the suburbs.One of the easiest barometers to use while judging a restaurant is if I will return. Would you like to know my answer? Contract Arnold Schwarzenegger for the answer.

I was impressed! Yelping around looking for a new Thai place near my work. Came across Somsri so I called, placed an order for the Thai fried rice with chicken lunch special for only $5.99. Guy was very nice. Order was ready when I arrived. They included two complimentary fried spring rolls and a small soup. The rice was good! I was definitely full and satisfied and will be having them for lunch more regularly! Idk if I'd ever dine in as this place is not really close to home and my lunch is only 30min. It's very small and BYOB which is always cool.
Great place! Friendly, family owned. Small room, but the food and service was outstanding and deserves 5+ stars!!
I love that place. Food is excellent and generous. I really recommend it . Best Thai food I had so far.

This was my second outside meal while in the hospital for the birth of my daughter. The food was awesome! Many of the other reviews have mentioned the large portions, they were correct. I got an order of panang curry with chicken. The spice level was just right, and it came with plenty of peppers and pea pods along with the meat. It's a bit of a hole in the wall, but its clean and wall decorated. Also, it's BYOB, which is great.

Seafood Delight is good. A little too sweet but good flavors and generous seafood. Pad Thai is very good with rich flavor and good consistency. Peanut sauce could use some kick. Egg rolls and spring rolls are very good. I would recommend ordering for pickup because the place is tiny and a bit divey. The service is friendly and warm.

LOVE THIS PLACE!Honestly, I didn't know about this place until Yelp. Â I use to go to another place for Thai Food, but I'm so glad I found this restaurant. Â I've being going here for almost 2 years and I love it. Â The food is delicious. Â The Seafood Pad Thai has a hearty portion of seafood in it. Â The same goes for the Beef Pad See Ew - good amount of beef. Â  I always have leftovers for the next day.The owner is great too. Â Very polite, and you can tell he really cares about his customers.

This place is owned by a friendly guy named Sam. He always greets my family and makes recommendations on what to get. He cooks the food per our requests and has catered a couple of our parties.Place itself is nothing fancy, but the food is delicious. We usually get the Pad See Ew, Tom yum soup, basil chicken, and the seafood platter (can't think of the name). Basil chicken is my favorite one. The curry dish is also good and he asks how spicy you like it so he customizes it to your preference.Great place and I highly recommend.

Decent Thai for the suburbs.Seemed very oily. The chicken satay is very good. The crab Rangoon are tiny but tasty. Most of the dishes I have ordered have been slightly better than average. Not bad at all.Place is very small and not very comfortable. I recommend carryout!

Can't say enough about this place. Everything we've ordered takeout has been phenomenal. The red curry with chicken is incredibly delicious. Everyone I recommend it to gets hooked on it. We also like the spicy Mongolian with chicken. If you like spicy go for it on a three out of five scale and you'll be feeling the heartburn. My husband eats very hot habanero salsa and hasn't ventured higher than three out of five level spicy for that meal. The mango sticky rice is also quite delicious and we enjoy getting the free egg rolls whenever we order two or more meals.

Delicious food, very prompt service. I walked in several times over the past few weeks for takeout on my way home from a late night at work, and my order was done within 5-7 minutes every time and the food was delicious. There are real vegetables in the dishes and the chicken actually looks like chicken, unlike a lot of other hole-in-the-wall type places. Prices are very reasonable too, especially for the amount of food you get. Will absolutely be back here.
Best takeout Thai! Not much for dining in, but it was fantastic take out!

I never bother to review, but I am so happy to have a good Thai place in town.Always fresh.Always delicious.Quick prep for last minute take out orders.I find myself going a few times a month and always happy when I get the "oops, out of fresh things to cook nights" have to order Somsri.I hope Somsri sticks around for quite some time.
Perfect! Very polite, and the food is delicious. We get take out here all the time. Our favorite are Rama Noodle and Masaman Curry. Highly recommend.

Somsri is amazing! Â Our favorite place for Thai food, period! Â Sam who owns and works there is such a great person and the food is always cooked perfectly.They used to be in downtown Downers Grove and we went there all the time. Â They are so good, that we have followed them out to the newer location in Winfield.Our favorites are the Tom Ka soup and Chicken Yellow Curry.They're a great small business that deserves all the great reviews they've been getting!

Excellent. Sweet, charming and engaging owner on site and server. Went with parents and everyone loved their meal. Greg price too.Had Pad See Eiw, beef rice and fried egg rolls.Perfect local Thai "go to" joint. Take away too....

Just had this place for the first time, and it was great!! The serving sizes are generous and the taste is outstanding. This time was the first time coming here, and when we came to pick it up they gave us free crab Rangoon, egg rolls!! Clearly this owner knows how to run a business since I'll be going back.
Great BYOB Thai restaurant!

Some of the best Thai food I have ever had. Get the Panang noodle. Their sauce is homemade and has so much depth and richness. The appetizer sampler is also delicious and crab rangoon is so crispy, creamy and delicate. HILGHLY RECOMMEND this place if you live in the area!

It pains me to write this. It really does. I love supporting my local Winfield businesses. However, Somsri was a HUGE disappointment. I ordered the Panang Noodles. Simple enough, right?Strike #1-- it came with rice, no noodles. WTF?!Strike #2-- some of the chicken was undercooked. I ended up microwaving it.Strike #3-- the vegetables were undercooked. It seemed like they just threw them in the sauce without cooking them. Yuck.Since I am not a total monster, the plus side of my experience was that the curry sauce was tasty, the owner/cook guy was friendly, and it was pretty inexpensive. Sadly though, that will not be enough for me to give this place another shot. Total bummer, as I was really looking forward to some good Thai food close to home. Epic fail.Sadness!

I have never walked out of a place before in disgust of the service. Â Growing up in Chicago and being part Thai allowed me sample Thai food from subpar to great. Â However, with no real competition in the suburb, even a below mediocrity establishment can make business.

This is one of my favorite Thai places. Everything we've ordered has been delicious and fresh. Â Their lunch menu is an incredible value. Â They have some fun posts on their Facebook page - Like them!
Fast service, they often throw in an extra appetizer for free. Great spicy red curry!

Great for take out any day of the week! Â I haven't eaten inside, but every time I take out the employees are friendly. Â The food is always great. Â I have had the Pad Thai, potstickers, yellow curry, and crab rangoons and have yet to be disappointed. Â As others have said, they customize the level of spice to your preference on the curry dishes, which is awesome.

Yum, good storefront Thai. I don't need a fancy atmosphere to enjoy the food. The kids liked it too. the owner was a really nice guy who stayed to chat a while.Pad Kee Mao, Pad Thai and soup were all really good. We went back for carryout and it was a good experience as well.Nice that you can take a bottle of wine or beer with you.

Pleasantly surprised by the authenticity of the food. Ambiance was VERY deceiving Â and the time we went it was slow service and they had a space heater so we ate with our coats on!!! Â To sum it up: I would go back for the great food BUT they need improvement on the ambiance to make it look more appealing to the public. If this place would put some effort in redecorating,slap on a fresh coat of paint and have a regular staff on board for Â better customer service this hole in a wall mom and pop restaurant can tripple their business!

The most delicious Thai in the area! Â Everything tastes fresh, light, and flavorful. Â The ginger dish is delicate and full of ginger, the soups are amazingly light and satisfying. It worth it to explore the menu, even when you have a favorite. Definitely worth supporting this local business!
Best Thai food! Whenever I return to the area, this is the first place I go. I usually order the panang noodles, which is always delicious. Everything I have tried there has been good though.

I went here last Saturday evening for the first time and am planning to return tonight. I ordered the chicken satay and beef pad thai. Yum yum.More accurately, I would say that it's 4.5 stars.The food was outstanding and the owners/servers are friendly. It's small. The parking is plentiful. Also, if one were daring enough to make a trek from the Emerald City, Chicago, this restaurant is within SUPER easy walking distance of the Winfield Metra (UP-West Line) stop. Just cross under the tracks.I found that there was simply not enough servers on to meet the demands of this place, hence, less than five stars.The bathrooms were OK, which helps the overall impression that I got.On a side note, it appears that Somsri takes up at least part of the space that the now (and fortunately) defunct Winfield House restaurant utilized many years ago.I highly recommend Somsri.For those of you unfamiliar with Winfield, it's just west of Wheaton, along the Roosevelt Road (Illinois Route 38) corridor. Â Somsri is just south of the tracks.

My family is big on Thai food and this place tops all the places we've been too. I didn't even know about this place until I looked on Yelp trying to find another place that would be as good as the one we used to go to before it closed down.I can't say anything about the restaurant because my sister and her husband picked up the food. But the food was awesome. The only thing I would recommend to others is unless you want your food EXTREMELY spicy, order everything mild. We ordered medium spicy but it was slightly too spicy. Maybe due to the holiday season, we also received a appetizer combination platter on the house.I would definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone.
Delicious garlic and pepper beef and tofu pad thai. Friendly atmosphere. Will definitely return.

I've tried this place twice and was impressed both times. Â I went in for carryout so I didn't eat there in the Â restaurant. Â It did look clean and comfortable. Â Another thing I noticed...it had wonderful air conditioning. Â I've been to so many restaurants like this in the past and a lot of the time, they are stuffy and hot. Â Not so here.The owner was there and was very friendly and inviting.Now for the food...I had the Green Chicken Curry. Â It was wonderful. Â This has always been my favorite Thai dish and I tend to judge Thai restaurants by this dish. Â This dish was the real deal. Â Just the right amount of veggies, chicken, coconut milk, and curry. Â I loved it.I will definitely come back here regularly in the future and highly recommend it!

My mom always gets the cucumber salad, and it's definitely the best one I've ever had. With vegetables like cucumbers, you can tell when they've been sitting around-at Somsri they are always fresh.I typically get the chicken satay appetizer and pad see eiw and it is consistently delicious.After living in the city for four years I have high expectations for my Thai food, hence only four out of five stars. But: Somsri has yet to disappoint! I'd highly suggest coming here. Best place for Thai food in the western suburbs.

LOVE THIS PLACE! Â Very simple dining room. Â Sam (owner) could not be more friendly and appreciative of Â your patronage. I now go there once a week JUST for the tom yum soup! Best I have ever tasted!!! Other dishes are very good and fresh too.Very fast service unless they get too many orders at once, then it gets slow since there are only two people (owner & cook) working in the place.

We live in a near by suburb and are big Thai food fans...we looked at Yelp and decided to give them a try...all I can say is it was awesome Thai food. We dined in on a Saturday night and the place was crowded and we got the last table..The place is a byob so if you want alcohol bring it along...we got a few appetizers pot stickers and chicken satay both excellent...I am a Pad Sew Ei fan and it was some of the best I ever had, it was Â loaded with meat, veggies, noodles..we also had Pad Thai and Curry which were also excellent...very reasonable prices...This is now out Thai place I am glad we gave them a try....

I hate to do this, but....yuck. The fact that this place has positive reviews proves that 'wurbanites are completely desperate for Thai food. The Pad See Ew was inedible and even the rice was horrible. I took one bite of wanton soup and tossed the rest. It's kind of weird, because the food looked OK.The owner was super friendly though and the meal was ready on time. Also, they give you free egg rolls, which we couldn't eat, but it's the thought that counts. Right? If you have no other Thai experience to compare it to, you may (and I stress may) be able to enjoy eating here, but probably not.

Somsri has become my goto spot for those times when I don't feel like cooking. Whether eating in or taking out the food is always quickly prepared and well presented. The dishes are consistently prepared the same so you know what to expect. The tofu pad thai is a family favorite. I have enjoyed eating my way thru the curries and have yet to be disappointed. Sam always greets us as if we are his most important customers. There is always a surprise in the carryout bag. . . Spring roll or crab rangoon. Sam's place may not be the place for those seeking an elegant, well appointed dining room. It might not be the place for those seeking the ultimate thai experience. But for this small town girl, Somsri is a pleasant friendly place to enjoy some asian flavors presented with grace and style.

Prices: cheap, cheap lunch specials!Ambiance: meh. Thumbs down.Service: greatFood: tried Basil chicken & Panang curry. Lunch specials came with soup & app. Chicken soup with rice- mediocre, veggies were raw, not that tasty. Eggrolls: mini and forgettable. Basil chicken - great sauce, fresh veg (red bell, jalapeÃ±o, onion and mushrooms all fresh except for straw mushrooms maybe?) was supposed to be ground, but came sliced. Made to order heat was about right. Panang curry: really great flavor. Fresh veg: pea pods, red pepper, onion. Chicken was cooked perfectly. Awesome broth.

I've been really missing a local Thai place since moving to Winfield from Chicago a few years ago and so I was SO SUPER EXCITED to see signs in the windows that a Thai restaurant would be opening soon. Â Tonight I called and placed our first order. Â My husband actually picked up the food, so I can not comment on the interior - but I will tell you that the man who took the order via telephone was very kind and polite and expressed his appreciation. Â When my husband picked up the food he asked that we let him know how it was and how he was doing, and he threw in an order of crab rangoon. Â As someone who is BIG on customer service I really thought it was great that he so sincerely wanted feedback. Â Well I'm so glad to say that it was FABULOUS. Â Glad because we now have more delicious ethnic food in Winfield, and glad because I can give great feedback to someone so lovely.I dove into the crab rangoon first, which was done really, really well. Â Instead of the oversized "too much wonton too little crab/cream", these were bite sized pieces with a delicious crab/creme filling that was really exceptional. Â Their sweet and sour was also great and didn't have that artificial sweetness like so many others. Â Really delicious.We also ordered the Panang Curry with Chicken and Pad Thai with Tofu. Â The Panang was mouth watering and had a beautiful color and consistency and the spices were just right. Â The chicken was great and we both loved the dish. Â Pad Thai is one of those things I'll always order first from a Thai place I've never been to. Â Its such a staple that if it isn't right I just won't go back. Â Fortunately, it was perfect. Â I always like a little lime wedge with mine, but it didn't come with one. Â Oh well, not a big deal at all. Â I'm not even sure that's a "standard" thing, anyway. We also had the spring rolls. Â These were your basic spring rolls, and they were very nice.All in all I think Somsri is an amazing addition to our little local cuisine scene and we are really lucky to have them here. Â We'll absolutely be back. Â Can't wait! Delicious!

I love this place for their delicious dishes like pad Thai, beef salad, wonton soup, and chicken cashew. Â  Â It's BYOB and the owner Sam is very nice and friendly. The restaurant uses fresh good quality ingredients. Â Yum!

First time trying this "hidden gem" in Winfield. Excellent friendly service. Clean environment. Superb Thai food. Recommend the steamed shumai and the spicy szechwan was delicious. Can't wait to return. Delish!

Our new local place, so happy. Â We had the pad thai (not much veggies - so ask for more veggies if you like it that way, also ask for more spice if you like spice), cashew chicken (just perfect for my hubby), and tom yum( loved it!).The owner was working (memorial day), told us they had been open for six months. Â The place is directly across from CDH.
I live in Carol Stream but am willing to drive 10 minutes each way for this place. WORLDS better than my local thai restaurant. SO good!
The owner is really a great guy. I think the food is good and quickly prepared. Â I am really happy that Winfield has Thai - it has quickly become my go-to place to grab a meal.

I love this place and the Thom Kha soup spic 4 out of 5 with extra cilantro starts it off great and Sam always puts in the extra cilantro or extra basil and lunch specials are great with soup and appetizers and if you get there early like 11 or so you can get in and out for a great meal!!!

The best!! We eat Thai all the time, and we wanted to try a place close to our house. This was by far the best Thai we have eaten ever! That's a big deal for regular Thai food people. We will be back regularly. Very clean and fresh food we came in a half hour before closing and they welcomed us happily. Great!!!

Amazing Thai food in a cute little dining area! Â Went there for a Mother's Day eve dinner, so it was a little hectic with the heavy flow of takeout orders and dining room business. Â Make sure you order one spice level lower than what you would like. Â My family enjoyed Panang Noodle, Pad Cashew, Tilapia Triple Delight and Sesame Chicken. Everyone had leftovers from the generous portions:)

I just had to update my review after trying the Gluten Free crust on my latest visit. So glad I took the risk and did. The crust was very good, especially for being GF. I was afraid that the crust would ruin the pizza, but I was pleasantly surprised that it was delicious. If you are looking for a good pizza, with a good GF crust, look no further than Raimondo's!!

I love pizza. Pizza is my go to and I would eat it 7 days a week if it wouldn't cause obesity. But this pizza is GARBAGE. It is in no way shape or form a good pizza place. Only nice thing about this place is that they have a bar. But it makes sense because Raimondos needs to liquor up people for them to want to eat this food.SKIP IT! It's TRASH.

Family Italian -When you order the pizza they make it from scratch so it takes a little longer, but worth the wait! GREAT beer selection. Appetizers rule, try the artichoke flatbread, amazing.Bring the kids or make it a date night. If your lucky enough to be there on a night when Mike is IN THE HOUSE strike up a conversation.It is genuine Italian from start to finsh. ENJOY

Great beer selection, great pizza and italian beef. Their pizza of the month is always unique and delicious. For the person that's complaining of the long wait for pizza.....it's worth it, enjoy a good beer that's not miller light and have some patience.The owner is a great guy that will talk beer knowledge with you all day long which I loved. They have limited beers that you'll never see at another restaurant.....support the small businesse owner...this guy is my hero and the service is great....if you go during dinner time in the subarbs then your expectations should be set accordingly (stop your whining) about the wait.
LOVE THIS PLACE! Extremely unique & you have the all around experience here. The Italian nachos were great & the large beer selection. Will be back!

Excellent Service and delicious food. Just hosted a grand opening for my daughters nail salon adjacent to Raimondos. Â I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for good pizzas and the best wings in the fox valley area! Â  The owners are down to earth people! Â  It's our new favorite place to meet up with family and friends! Â Try them today!Had a few friends try the wings and this is how they describe them: Â wings are thebomb.com!

BEST GLUTEN FREE PIZZA IN THE AREA!!! I have tried many Pizza places trying to find the best GF Pizza, and I found it here at Raimundo's. The crust is delicious and I think the cheese they use is of great quality as you can tell in the taste. The GF wings they have are also very tasty and not spicy at all. They only have the Hot n Spicy flavor and I was a little worried about trying them at first, but I'm glad I did. They were tender and packed with taste, without making my mouth feel like it was on fire. I also really like the fact that every time I call to place an order, the person answering the phone is friendly and isn't trying to rush you off the phone. Great place to grab a quick bite to eat, for a drink and appetizers, and also for a family dinner.

First time we ordered from here the pizza was amazing. On to the 3rd time we have ordered, 3 of the 18" pizzas. Their concept of extra cheese is lacking. Definitely not $96 including tip worthy pizza. We will definitely be searching elsewhere for delivery pizza due to lack of consistency of quality.

Disappointed.This is a place that my husband and I really wanted to like. We went the first time and our experience was pretty bad. Well, so we gave it a second chance and it wasn't much better. It takes a while to get the pizza and it states on the menu that their "homemade pies" take 25-30 minutes to make.SERVICE:Not the greatest. Maybe they're understaffed like so many of the reviews say, but hire some people! There are tons of unemployed Americans that need jobs. Whatever. It took a few minutes for us to be seated both times, even though there were booth open and not a ton of families there at the time. I asked for tips on drinks, but the waitress told me she doesn't drink beer. Ok, but my question was on the cider. Ok, I'm not going to ding her for not drinking alcohol. She never offered us another round, nor brought us water. After finishing our drinks during the appetizer, she never was really around for longer than a second to even think about bringing us anything.My husband said that he would give the service 3 stars, but I disagree..closer to 1-2.FOOD:Garlic bread:We ordered the garlic bread as an appetizer. We received it maybe 15 minutes after ordering it. For what it was, it should've taken 10 minutes. It was overdone and burnt **the second pic is of the garlic bread they brought out second". It was literally rock hard. Also, no garlic. The second basket brought was better and not hard, but still just like glorified toast. It was like an italian beef roll cut in quarters and toasted, then with butter on it. No fresh garlic, and not even the crappy garlic powder that some restaurants use for their garlic bread. Pretty disappointed.Pizza:Good, but nothing to write home about. I like the texture of the braided crust, but there's really nothing else that is greater than average. About 2-3 pieces of nickel sized sausage per piece of our sausage and garlic pizza. Average pizza, that's what I would call it.Drinks:They have a good selection beer/cider/wine list. For that, I give them a star. Unfortunately, the average bar has a good selection.It takes a significant amount of time to order, wait for food, and then wait for the bill after finishing food. The service isn't the greatest. I wish we would've had a better time, either time, but we won't be back. With so many other pizza places in the area, we won't be back.
One of the few places to get pizza by the slice. I like to have them cook it for an extra 3 minutes or else it is too flimsy. Portions are a good size

Great pizza. Terrible service. Looking at you Lauren L Ticket #79255 (in case anyone researches or cares).This is my first review only because this was way outside of the norm of service you receive anywhere and management, as well as potential patrons, need to be aware and have some expectations set if you are lucky to have our server.We were in town for a family reunion. This place had solid reviews both in ratings and quantity. It was not very busy, maybe two other tables, and we were greeted by a sweet girl directing us to our table.And that's when it went downhill. How you may ask when we just walked in? It started with our server beginning to take our drink orders and abruptly saying she will be back when someone yelled at her from the oven. This set the tempo as our server brought everything over with the cold hand of indifference including her robotic, insincere, and minimal conversational tone.For the record, we ordered a few drinks and a bottle of wine, Valley of the Moon, from their reserve menu along with several pizzas and some gelato for our daughter. EVERYTHING was GREAT.Disappointing we had to get her attention to get anything. You know...as in pretending we were waving down a plane to rescue us at one point. She was not engaging. No refills on beer or coke offered. Our bottle of wine was brought over, sans cork, already open with two glasses. She was never in any hurry. Making eye contact was difficult and when it did happen it provided the opposite reaction from what we needed. I walked over to the bar and register, where she was hiding from giving any additional discretionary effort, and I begin speaking to my 8yr old daughter about dessert. We eventually ordered there, with her, because why would we not want someone to ask us if we needed dessert as is the almost knee jerk reaction tradition of any server. Kudos for being different. She did not look up. I finally asked what the gelato flavors were where she recited. We choose and walked back.Her engagement was reminiscent of a 160 character restriction on Twitter. She only thanked us while we were walking out, which obviously was facetious and muscle memory.We tipped 20% because who knows what day she had. I hope it gets better. For me, if I lived here I would never return because of the very negative, memorable experience we had.Again great pizza! But maybe you need a buffet because we could have fumbled around serving and smiling at our table ourselves...or hire nicer robots.
Their home made sauce is delicious! Great beer selection, & a nice glass of port rounds out a lovely lunch.We only visit Chicago once a year but make sure we grab a bite here before we leave.
Service was pretty good. However the crust was a bit soggy Â and the sauce a little dry

This is a great place for beer and pizza and their Italian dinners and sandwiches are also top notch. What sets this place apart is the fine selection of European beers. Mike knows his stuff and will take the time to explain the various choices and discuss your taste preferences to make an appropriate recommendation to try. I have not been disappointed yet. Also save room and try the Belgium Ale Cherry Bomb for desert. Who would have thought that beer and ice cream could go together so well?
Excellent Pizza. Great friendly staff..make you feel like family. The Godfather pizza is awesome. Not skimpy on ingredients! Yes, I would take my Mother there too.
Great unique beer selection, friendly staff, and great food!
Good food. The price for two small pizzas was $41.00.We felt it was a little over priced. The delivery service though was on point.Maybe they should offer coupons to help with the prices.

Best pizza in the area, hands down. Â The veggie pizza is delicious (add pepperoncini). They always have a fun, special pizza of month. Â The staff is amazing. Â Plan on spending some time there because it's worth enjoying the atmosphere and meeting the staff. Â Most importantly, the beer list is always top notch. Â If you have any questions or are curious to try new beers, ask the staff. Everyone is very much "in the know". Â Great place for a family pizza night!

I can't say enough great things about this place. We had reservations next door at the Turf Room and it was SO busy there, we couldn't even get a drink while we waited.No one gave us the time of day. :(SO, we wandered into Raimondos and never regretted our decision not only to get a drink but stay there and eat.We were warmly greeted by the owner Mike and his descriptions of the food and beer were beyond words. It felt like we came home to "moms house" and we were immediately amongst friends and Â family.The beers were refreshing and delightful. Mike described each beer like a sommelier describes wine. So passionate!The food was to die for! We plan to return home again to "moms house" (aka Raimondos) SOON!What a great experience! I highly recommend this place.

I have to tell you the lower ratings are concerning What is wrong with people? :) We are long time fans of raimondos and from reading yelp reviews, it would seem one must either love it or hate it. I guess we go in the love category. I have had 2 parties here, both in the range of 30 guests, and I have dined her on several occasions. Maybe others prefer pizza made ahead? I just don't get it. To make a pizza this good it takes time!! It is not sitting in a box on a hot plate or under a burner. Â Put your phones away and spend some quality time with your guest while waiting! Talk, enjoy a drink, laugh a little! Enjoy the ambiance!

Great pizza and great conversation with the owner Mike. He certainly takes his pizza and beer serious but really prided himself on how he relates to his guests. I'm a pizza snob so when I said it was good it is certainly worth eating.

Great service. My girlfriend and I decided to build our own pizza and the waitress matched the price to a pizza that had almost the same ingredients. All of such made the bill decently less expensive. All the employees are really friendly.

We continue to love this place and updated menu only makes it better!Try the spinach and artichoke flatbread - it's got an extra zip that makes it awesome!!The pizzas are great and I love the new pasta choices.Looking for dessert? Try their homemade options!And yes, the beer selection is great! They have successfully converted me from a wine only drinker.But honestly - it's all about the people. Whether it's Mike or his mom or his dad - they care about you as a customer and Â a person. And of course Ryan, Kelsey and all the wait staff are great people. Eric and the crew make great food and Andy and the behind the scenes crew really do an awesome job. Sometimes it takes longer than if you went to a fast food place but hey, that's ok, because I love anyplace where I can relax, have a great meal , and chat with people who treat you like family.

Upon entering Raimondo's, you immediately note the decor. Did someone actually envisage a vintage 1950's pizza joint with a modern day spin? The floor plan is open with plenty of classic booths. It's simple, inviting and it works. The view at the end of the bar allows you to continually scan the entire operation. I liked the environment, not so much the pizza.Basically the yelp reviews are telltale with a very clear point; if you serve "Craft Beers" & "Signature Pizza" you must be "Kick-Ass-Good"! NFW!Again, the beer selection and Â Customer Service dominate each review. A description of "Taste" is brief and secondary in thought. Agree, management and staff will kill you with "Kindness"!However, what about the taste? Â BLAND. "Ach-N-Lou's" Pizza Pub in Aurora smokes this place. By severe contrast, "Emil's" pizza found in Woodman's freezer case will inspire your taste buds.Our 16" Thin Crust...Sausage, Mushroom, Onion & Black Olive arrived cool to the touch with a spongy crust. Not OK, let it be known this is the first time in a while I did not scorch the roof of my mouth! Â A pathetic presentation equaled in taste.I'm sorry, if your looking for a classic tavern style pizza, look elsewhere. But if your pizza taste buds crave the "Hand Crafted Italian Beef and Giardiniera", The" B-L-T"or the "Bacon Cheeseburger" SIGNATURE PIZZA PIE...hey, this is your place.For me, the above is best served on fresh bread as a sandwich, not pizza.C'mon people

Great pizza place! Â So nice to be able to eat gluten free pizza that doesn't taste like cardboard. They have many gluten free options, including non-pizza items, that are very good. Staff is friendly. Decent-sized bar. My husband really enjoys the beer selection. Â Food can take a little longer than other places to come out, so keep that in mind. Â It's worth the wait, but maybe not if you go in their starving hungry!
Visited from out of town and had a great meal. Â Place was open late, service was great, coke was good, pizza and cheese bread was good.
I love going here when I am in the area. The staff is so friendly, the beer is great, and overall it's very chill. I have only had pizza and gelato from here.

Okay Yelp??? 4.5 Stars???(One side note before I get into this, since I've been in restaurants most of my life, I'm going to say that they were understaffed and there was a major issue that they just didn't mention to anybody, so take this as you will)We sat down and the restaurant wasn't even half full, we then proceeded to wait and wait and wait and wait for pizza. I have never in my life got up before I received the food, but in this case I had to get it to go and left... I understand pizza can take a while, but wow... The only thing that I ate while I was there was the garlic bread, not my cup of tea and when we did finally eat the pizza, I was even less impressed.My other gripe is that our server kept taking her order pad and despite the fact that she has an apron with multiple pockets, stuck it in the back of her pants by her underwear. Frankly, I don't want your hands touching anything that's touched your butt, if they are going to touch my food.

Best pizza in the western burbs for sure. Owner is friendly and went out of his way to make my order complete. You have to stop by for even a slice when passing by. The sauce is great and all the ingredients are fresh. Make it a goal to stop I promise you won't be disappointed.

Sadly disappointed.First time there is was really good. Â One of the owners greeted and sat us - told us a bit about the family owned restaurant and fresh ingredients and specialities - and the food was really good. The marinara was really good and the meatballs were awesome. Â We went back a few more times and thought that we found a nice spot we would be coming to for years.So...why the 2 stars? Â Well, we went back about a month ago and had really bad and slow service. We sat a long time and waited for the server to come and greet us at the table. Then it took a very long time for each phase of the meal and we actually got the feeling we were more of a bother to the server than anything. He didn't seem to really care to do his job one bit. We chalked it up as a one off and that maybe he was having a bad day. Â But... We went back again last night and had a very similar experience. Â Eventually that same waiter came over, but only to tell us that our waitress is coming soon. She did, and we order a very simple meal: 2 unsweetened iced teas, a meatball sandwich, and the bruschetta. It took 10 minutes for her to bring us the very watered down iced tea (might as well just drink water). Then it took another 47 minutes to get our food. Yes, I timed it after the iced teas took so long. Â 47 minutes for a meatball sandwich and bruschetta! Â Unfriendly, blah attitudes to with that awful service too. Â To add insult to injury, my wife got sick that night and I felt like complete crap too.Could it be us? Â Did we do something to piss them off? Â Why the crappy service? Â We are not demanding people and always treat people in restaurants nicely regardless of how they are because 1) we are respectful; 2) we don't want spit and boogers in our food. Plus, we always tip - even when the service is not deserving. So, it seems to me that it's just how this place operates. Regardless, the service is so bad that we will just go elsewhere.Oh yah, 2 stars. Well, the 3 non stars are for the last 2 servers and experience, plus the decline in food and getting sick. The 2 stars given are because I know the owner is a good guy and we had a nice experience with him our first few visits. Too bad his servers don't have the same attitude with customer service as he does.
Excellent service, phenomenal food. The specialty pizzas are great, and such an awesome beer selection! Super friendly staff, family-owned and it feels like it, in a good way.

What's good about this place is the food, especially the pizza, and the beer selection. The problem with Raimondo's is actually getting the pizza and the beer. You see, the service is non-existent.My significant other and I stopped in today at 5 pm. Â We were greeted immediately by a polite waitress who advised our server would be by shortly. After waiting 15 minutes without another visit from their staff, we left.My advice? Â If you're looking for a slice of Raimondo's deliciousness, arrange for carry out instead.
Completely terrible service, due to that I did not order a single item from the menu.

Overpriced and the pizza was pretty mediocre (I got the Godfather pizza). Ordered the pizza for pickup, was told it would be 20 minutes. I ended up having to wait an additional 25 minutes for the pizza to be ready. Not only that but they put meat on my wife's half of the pizza. She doesn't eat meat so naturally this was a bit of an issue. We were told we could have a small credit on a future bill (we have no idea how much this credit will be fore and are not even sure we want to return).

The service was so slow. It took 7 minutes to wait to get a table but no one else was waiting - they just couldn't bother to wait on us. When we complained about how long the pizza took - after 37 minutes with no one coming to check on us or refill our drinks - they said it was because everything was handmade. Are they making the dough from scratch that moment??? You can get a deep dish pizza from scratch and have it to your table sooner. Some employees said 20-25 minutes to get a pizza; another said 30. No matter what, it took 45 minutes with almost no other customers for us to get a pizza. The frustrating part is, the waiter just kept making excuses about being shorthanded - but 7 people working when it is not busy is not shorthanded - it is inefficiency. My husband worked at a pizza place for years and said that their timing was extraordinary.

Finally! A great neighborhood pizza place on the west side. We love their pizza and everything we've tasted so far. We willKeep coming back for more!The owners are very friendly and always make great conversation. Beer selection is great and we really enjoy it every time!

It's ok. I guess for that area it's the best around for what it has to offer. Service was slow but she was doing what she could. What's odd is the wife and I felt sick after leaving there not sure if it's what we ate or not. To sum it up The restaurant itself is nice the food ahh...And prices are on the higher side. I don't believe I would go back.

I'd like to add more stars.... But the service is not pleasant and 50 minutes for a dine in pizza is toooooo long. Â I mentioned to the waitress the diet pop was off went over like a turd in a punch bowl. Overheard the manager telling people they were short on staff... Too bad or discount my check for bad or slow service. I like the pizza but the service stinks.

C'mon people! This is Chicagoland! While not offensive, this pizza certainly wasn't very good. We went here based on the great Yelp reviews and this was the first time that I felt that Yelp let us down. Although it was a friendly place and we had a good server our pizza was just so mediocre.
Sweet Pizza, great beer, good people. The owners are nice as hell. I'll be back every time I'm back in Chicago.Highly recommend the "Godfather slice"

I wish I could give .5 stars...because this is more like a 2.5.So this may fall into what I call the "Hangover Effect". I saw rave reviews and had high hopes. (This happened with that movie The Hangover - people said it was the most hilarious movie ever made of all time EVER...I saw It. Â I laughed once. I believe I may have laughed at least double that, had it not been so, so hyped.)Anyway - I was intrigued with Italian Nachos. Whaaat? turns out, it was sauce and cheese over nacho chips with Italian beef sprinkled on top (for $2 more bucks).Overall it was a little disappointing.We got the "original crust" ala supremo. So...and maybe those of you in North Aurora had once experienced the nectar of Gods that was Franks Pizza - and if so, please know that this is where I was - Franks was our favorite. But this was not Franks. Boo. The crust was bland. It was crusty on the outside and warm and pillowy on the inside, but it lacked depth beyond that. The sauce was under seasoned. actually, the whole pizza seemed under seasoned. I mean, it wasn't the worst pizza by any stretch of the imagination - but it didn't blow any socks off either. Also - when the menu said "ask for dipping sauce" with the crust style - we did and we thought it would be garlic butter sauce...and it wasn't. just bland marinara. Lesson learned.The service was extraordinarily friendly. There was one young guy in there running the whole of front of house- Â the bar and all the tables and the running of food. It wasn't that busy but that kid was working his tail off.We heard the beer selection was awesome, but we weren't drinking and frankly, I am not a beer person but maybe that would change things...the Italian beef that had been sprinkled on our nachos was good and I would consider returning to try the beef on its own...but probably not the pizza.

I have lunch here twice a week. I eat during off hour's but everything's been great and fresh. They are located in a strip mall, please don't let that scare you away! I've never had their pizza, but I've had all of their sandwiches and pastas to feel comfortable enough to judge! Italian beef, meatball sub, and Italian chicken sandwich have all been four stars!! The sandwiches have always been fresh and full of flavor!! With this knowledge I don't see why the pizza wouldn't follow. If I'm wrong please let me know, I believe they're on point!

Very good pasta dishes and the wings are to die for. Â I do like their selection of beer is very comprehensive. Â Overall in house service is pretty good and attentive.Ordered delivery one time and it was kind of slow....and we are only about 5 minutes away. Â I picked it up the next time, it was very good quality pizza.My favorite are the pasta dishes....very good portions for $12....usually can only eat half of the servings.

My husband and I just moved into the area, so the first thing we wanted to do was try out some new places. So, using the excuse that I still didn't have my kitchen organized enough to cook, we headed out to try Raimondo's.First of all, the thing that got us here is that they have a pretty nice beer selection. While I wish a little more was on draft, the bottled selection was diverse and exciting. Even better, their staff really seems to have a passion for it and took to suggesting beers for us based on what we had already ordered.We ordered a double dough with giardiniera and sausage. The pizza was really delish! The toppings were clearly very fresh and sauce was fantastic. Normally left over pizza is just something I need to get through, but I was super excited to come home the next night and heat it up again. It really was a well made delicious pizza. I'm excited to try more combinations of toppings as they definitely give you a TON of choices.One of the owner's came over and asked how everything was and mentioned that he didn't think he'd seen us in there before (they clearly know their customers). We told him we just moved in and he insisted we have some gelato on the house. It was such a nice gesture. He also asked where we were at and let us know that they deliver as well, which is great! Its a nice atmosphere, so I'd definitely like to dine in and enjoy the beer selection most of the time, but having the delivery option is always good too.If you are in the area and in the mood for some homemade fresh pizza, don't pass this place up! I know we will definitely be back.

If you want some tasty Italian food, accompanied by a huge (sophisticated) beer selection, while being killed with kindness from the wait staff and owner, this place is for you. My personal favorite is the spaghetti with sausage and my kids love the ravioli. The garlic bread that comes with your pasta dish is also a nice combo of butter and garlicky goodness. I also recommend that you try the Italian Nachos appetizer, an interesting combo of tortilla chips, marinara sauce, hamburger and cheese. As alluded to earlier, on most occasions the owner visits our table and is genuinely interested in us and likes to talk "craft brews," which I also enjoy. Pay them a visit soon!

I can't believe I haven't already written this. My wife went to Raimondo's with a friend a while ago and told me I should check it out because they have a pretty interesting beer selection and the beer guy there (Mike) is pretty enthusiastic about it.Well, she was right and it's one of my favorite places now. The beer selection is excellent (especially for trying stuff you may not be able to get in the stores), the pizza is fantastic, the pastas and sandwiches are great, and even the gelato is good.Beyond all of that, though, is the atmosphere. There are people enjoying beers at the bar, older folks, younger folks, and lots of families when we go. My 2-year-old son asks me about Susie and Ryan and Mike a lot - he loves the attention they give him (and the pizza, of course).There are beer tasting events, charitable events, and other cool community things all the time. I had my first beer from Solemn Oath there, for example. Also, after their St. Baldrick's event, most of the staff was shaved bald! That's some commitment.Overall, I miss the old-fashioned pizza joints from the past. (Charlotte's, Shakey's, etc.) There's a personality to them that's not manufactured by some marketing focus group. Raimondo's has that warmth and personality. It's just a nice place with great food and excellent people.

Good customer service. Sub par food. I ordered buffalo wings and pizza. The pizza was ok. The thin crust was not crisp and they were very stingy with the toppings. It tasted okay, but not great.The buffalo wings were terrible. The skin was rubbery and the sauce was tasteless. When I returned them the owner explained to me that they're supposed to be that way!!? He explained that they do not make them themselves. They also bake them because they don't have a fryer. He buys this brand because they are gluten free (no breading). While I appreciate that the business has gluten free options I am not gluten sensitive and wanted crispy tasty buffalo wings, not baked chicken with gross sauce. He did however refund my money without question or argument which I appreciated.We went here another time before for a very fun st bald ricks event and it was great. Good beer and cider selection.

Stopped in tonight and had great service and great pizza. Â We went thin crust versus the double-dough. Â I'm a d-d fan but with my son and wife, they are primarily thin.Sausage was good on the pizza and service was fast, pleasant and accurate.Can't wait to stop back to try other items on the menu. Â Welcome BACK you guys. Â I've lived in North Aurora since '98 and missed you when you left.

Pizza = Awesome (Both Double Dough and Thin Crust)Pasta = Awesome (You get at least 2 servings with one order)Atmosphere = Family oriented, sincere and very, very nice neighborhood joint. Â I leave here on a Friday night feeling better than when I came in and that's only after having one beer.Large Groups = No problem. Â They have a private room in the back with a door so you don't have to deal with the noise from the restaurant. Â My book club meets here every month (15 people) and we get the best service.

First visit to Raimando's tonight. Â Saw all the good reviews and thought we'd try it out. Â Pizza was very good for the price. Â Their thin crust was almost New York style in a way. Â Good sauce and good overall taste. Â Definitely would go back.

Went there with the family tonight. Â This was a first visit. Â I had driven by it many times and kept saying I need to try this place. Â Well I shouldn't have waited. Â Great food, great service, and great prices about sum it up.We started off with the cheesy garlic bread appetizer. Â Real garlic, lots of cheese and what must be a homemade marinara sauce to dip it in. Â Next was a medium half sausage half mushroom original pizza. Â The mushrooms where fresh and tasty and the sausage was out of this world. Â Same great sauce as the appetizer.Don't remember the servers name, but attentive would be an understatement. Â He kept the drinks filled, made sure we had everything we needed and could not have done a better job.The decor is modern and comfortable. Â Everything is clean. Â Plenty of parking.Add in a couple of soft drinks and we were out the door for $26 + tip.We will be back!
One of the best pizzas I have had (Godfathers)!! Â The spaghetti and meat sauce was outstanding. If I ever come back to Aurora, I would definitely eat here.

We go here a couple times a month. Â Pizza slices are easy to get and good. Â The meatball sandwich is great. Â Never seems to busy (which is nice). Â Great place for the family or just to get some gelato.

Finally got around to trying Raimondo's today for lunch. Wasn't sure if this was just a sit down place or if it was a order at the counter place. I was happy when I arrived today that I can order at the counter and get Pizza by the slice. Raimondo's saved me from the nasty pizza hut express down the street. The pizza here is home made and taste great. The people here are friendly and accommodating. The restaurant was also very clean and much nicer then my other lunch alternatives. Â Because I went during work hours I didn't get to try any of the beers but they also have a great beer selection with many different selections. Looking forward to coming back and trying one of the sandwitches or Itialian dishes.

The service is good and the owner makes a point to remember us and the kids. My wife and I are both gluten free. The pizza is really good considering our situation and is, in our opinion, the best GF pizza in the area.
Best pizza, Best Beer, awesome owner and staff!!!!!!!!!! My favorite place to go eat!!!!!
