I love their bar. Amazing selection of microbrews and foreign beers. The service is great, too. The only reason they're getting a 4-Star Rating is because I'm really picky about my pizza. I'm not a fan of the food, but to be fair, ALL of my friends are. Great place!

They really understand customer service. Â We placed a delivery order with them and Murphy's law kicked in. Â Everything that could go wrong did, they were proactive and Â they went above and beyond to make us happy. We didn't ask for anything.Their food is great, but as with most restaurants it is better when you eat in!

Ordered pizza for delivery. Crust was gross - soggy and undercooked. They were generous with the toppings, but the crust was too flimsy to withstand them. The order was also wrong - girl I spoke too on the phone didn't seem to understand the concept of ordering toppings on half of the pizza. Not worth the time, money or calories.

It is great to have such a delicious go-to spot for reasonably priced lunch or dinner. The food is 5 star quality. I especially love the ravioli and bruschetta!The service however, is hit or miss. I am hoping this is simply due to the newness of the business. Three out of 5 times we have had great service. The other two times were awful - one resulting in us walking out after being seated for 10 minutes without being acknowledged (this was on an extremely busy evening but nonetheless not an excuse)!I will continue to be a customer because of the times we have had a wonderful experience, along with the delicious food. I will try to stick to weekdays or lunch hours if dining in though.

I really don't know why it has taken so long for me to review this place, but this is the best combination of pizza and beer I have ever had the pleasure of indulging in... and I do indulge here quite often. Â The pizza and lasagna rank as some of the best in the area. Â I've had other foods here, but those are the best. Â The beer selection is fantastic with a focus on imported and craft beers. Â My wife and I are pretty regular customers, and we are on a first name basis with most of the staff.A few things I will point out. Â The service is good, but at times a bit slow. Â That's not a problem for most people. Â I've always felt that the atmosphere is one that invites you to stay, drink, and have a good time. Â However, some times we are in a hurry and still want to eat in. Â There's an easy solution. Â Just call your order in on your way out the door, and you'll have a quicker meal.
The italian beef was very tasty, only problem is I ordered a combo! Oh and I didnt get the pickle I was promised either. Â Good beer selection and friendly staff.

Uhm hello. I love this place.Nicest service ever from a place where I'm not a regular.Pizza was damn good, maybe not as authentic as the love of my life (v&v paesano..mmmm) but very good.I love how there's a bar here. Also, they offer a selection of craft beers that is ever changing.My bf and I came in on a Friday night-- we ordered wings (which I can't eat, tear) and a supreme pizza (half veggie) and were immediately told our wait time. That like never happens. Â The owner (can't for the life of me remember his name) came over and chatted us up, talked about the history of Raimondo's (previously located on 31 from 1989-01), and his status as a craft brew aficianado. Â I honestly don't recall what they had on tap-- I'm strictly wine/vodka for the most part, but you could tell he was very passionate about his beer..and his business.According to my bf, the wings were excellent, and as I mentioned before-- the pizza (and wine) were great. Â The service bumped this pace up to 5 stars for me, it was so accomodating and genuine, no fake niceness here!!
Great pizza! Best crust I've found in a long time. Sandwiches are okay but amazing beer selection

I'm always on the run so it's nice to have a place to stop in and get good food fast. Â My husband gets Italian beef sandwiches and pizza-by-the-slice from Raimondo's several times a week. Â Their pizzas are really good and they offer pies all day long (either made to order or by-the-slice.)I also really appreciate the hospitality they offer here. Â Michael is very friendly and accommodating and always makes my husband and I feel very welcome.In addition to good food and gelato, they also have a unique variety of wine and beer, Â and both are priced very reasonably.

The food here is okay, parking is easy, the noise level is fine, and it's nice that the tv in the bar area shows things besides sports. Â We've had a bunch of things from their menu but nothing food-wise really stood out to us other than the delicious marinara sauce for dipping their bread sticks. Â The service from host and wait staff is pretty good.
We ordered a Sombrero pizza and it wasgreat! Â The service was also fantastic. Thanks!!

Probably the most friendly and sociable staff I've ever witnessed. Not to mention the actual customers dining there, it is literally like being on the set of Cheers, everyone wants to chit chat and converse, share stories and just shoot the breeze. The food, OUTSTANDING!! Ordered a large thin crust with sausage, black olives and mushrooms ..just so so so good!I tried their on-tap Oktoberfest by Bells brewing, and it was fantastic. The owner, Mike, then insisted that I try the Sam Adams Pumpkin Ale, claiming he was a big fan of it. Tried it, loved it! Buying a case asap as a matter of fact.But back to the point ... Raimondo's is an excellent place to get phenomenal food, and be surrounded and served by the greatest staff in Chicagoland, and friendliest people you can imagine. It's almost as if all the nicest people in the area just flock to this place to eat and watch the game and drink great beer. That's another thing ..their beer selection is out of this world!! You don't often find a place that offers the really rare and hard to find brews, you usually have to go deep into Chicago for that, and its usually $8+ per draft/bottle there! This is not your typical sports bar by any means ;)Reasonable prices, amazing food, great staff, wonderful and friendly atmosphere, fast service and a top notch beer selection. Yeah, I'll be back :D-Ryan

So nice to see a "family owner/operator" establishment like we did years ago. Whether it's seeing the "dad" blending his homemade sauces, or "mom" being there & ready to help in any capacity it's truly nice to see their level of care. As a lot of these comments make mention of the owner Michael being knowledgable as he is in not only their homemade menu, but his knowledge of the extensive craft beer menu which he takes allot of pride in & should really helps to narrow down what exactly most likely you'd want. I'd say keep it up, but in a family type establishment such as this, I'm quite confident the actions in which they display are genuine, & they'll naturally keep it up what they're so good at doing...

With the abundance of pizza places in this area, you have to be really, really good to stand out. This place was just.. good.We actually went here based on the huge amount of 5 star ratings, and I wasn't as impressed as the reviews indicated. We ordered 3... yes 3, different pizzas, and all were... OK. Â One veggie pizza, one custom (bacon, sausage, pepperoni), and the "Godfather" (italian beef & giardiniera). I myself wasn't a fan of the "original" crust.. just too doughy for me.. if I return I'd definitely go with the thin crust. Â I could only finish 2 pieces of pizza, and it was mainly because of the dough... not the toppings.Of the 3 (I tried all), the custom one was actually my favorite. The bacon was delicious, crisp and flavorful, and the "secret blend" sausage is quite good.Our server was decent, he knew a lot about the beer selections. One suggestion to the owners; provide a daily list of beers on a piece of paper or whatever so we don't have to stand up from our table and try to read the chalkboard every time we order a beer.The cheesy garlic bread appetizer we ordered was embarrassingly small. It's just bread and cheese, and at that price point, it simply needs to be a larger portion.While we never spoke to the owner personally, he was making his rounds around the place and seemed nice and personable. We did make a reservation and was pleasantly surprised when we arrived that there was a table with a large "Reserved" sign on it with my name on the check. Bonus points for that.I'm sure eventually we'll try this place again (my wife loves pizza), and I'll definitely go with the thin crust next time and probably order my own custom pizza. Â Maybe that will make the difference. Good pizza, good service, and as Yelp indicates with a 3-star review, "A-OK".

They have a very diverse beer selection and the owner Mike is a true beer expert. Â  Their monthly specialty pizzas are unique and generally exceptional. Â They also have multiple efforts to help charitable causes which is just another reason to support an awesome local business. Â Check out their beer tasting sessions as a way to sample many unique beers, learn a lot about these unique brews, Â have some great pizza and hang out with some great people.

This is a "great good place"! Â It has a friendly atmospehere and very yummy pizza. Â They have a really great beer list with some unique beers you wont normally find other places. Â The owner - Michael - is a real gentleman and a truly nice person. Â My wife and i have been in here about 5 times now and each time he says hello and we chat. Â Most recently we sat at the bar and he helped us choose some new beers which were very enjoyable. Â This is a place you should defnitely check out. Â It doesnt try to be flashy but is very sincere in its service and its food. Â You won't find a nice bunch of people either.

This restaurant is simply Frantastic!!! Â The food is just divine. The "Godfather" pizza is out of this world. The ingredients of it just melt in your mouth and makes you longing for more. Besides the wonderful owner (Michael), the wine, gelato just complete the whole thing. What a great find in North Aurora. Graci!

First off, I want to say this place is one of the few pizza places that makes gluten free pizza, and it is expensive, but better than eating sand, because almost everywhere else that offers gluten free pizza crusts are all the frozen- pre packaged type. Â They are gritty and taste horrible. Â This gluten-free is the best I have had from a pizza joint (but still not as good as the store bought SCAR crusts, Pastorelli's sauce, and some Sargento Mozzerella). Â Problem is this, unless you are eating here, don't order it for take-out. Â They are notorious for telling you a time over the phone and then making it very early. Â It has happened three times (that I know of) in the last 4 purchases. Â Once the owner even laughed about it like it was funny that my pizza had been sitting on top of the oven for 20+ minutes. Â Honestly, don't understand why if you say on the phone 45 mins you would make it 20 mins early, but that is their deal. Â I will not buy from here any more because it has happened multiple times already. Â PS. Â Don't believe Mike (the owners son), the first time this happened he was very apologetic and gave me a song and dace about they are a family business, give us another chance, yada, yada... then the last time, he acted like I was ridiculous for requiring that the pizza be made closer to the time specified time then 20 minutes and stated that I should take my business elsewhere because I was obviously too picky for them to make happy. Â LOL! Â Seriously, I cannot make this up. Â Requiring a pizza establishment to make a pizza and it still be hot and edible when I pick it up, was too much to ask.

Their Pizza is the BEST!!!!!! Â When you order sausage and mushroom pizza it is overloaded to the tilt with sausage and mushroom, the way it should be done. Â Seriously the best pizza place in North Aurora, and possible contender for the Fox Valley Area. Â The chicken ceasar salad was HUGE, and tasty. Â Great selection of beer, and the manager Â or owner always comes by to see how everything is. Â I would say skip the Turf Room (which is right next to this place) and grab a pizza instead.

We use to get their pizza at their old location years ago in North Aurora across from A&W. we were really bummed when they went out of business. Now their back and better than ever! Â Awesome pizza and great selection of micro brewed beers. This is a must try!!!!!!!! Â It just may end up being your favorite pizza place too! Â It's definitely our families again. Â Great food, Great service, great atmosphere, what more could you ask for?

Went in there last night picked up a pizza to go. Â These guys know what their doing. Â The dining room was full and the staff was very pleasant. Â Hopefully we can attract more quality businesses like Raimondos and fill some of these vacant strip malls in North Aurora.

Just had their pizza of the month. Â A Ruben pizza its even better than the Sombrero which was my favorite pizza anywhere!!!We usually stop in at Raimondo's a couple times a month to get my Pizza fix. Eight times out of ten we get their Sombrero Pizza the best Taco Pizza anywhere but had to try the Reuben pie which I didn't have for over ten years while they were gone.It was better than I remembered and instead of just St Pattys day they offer it all of March it is probably the BEST pizza I have ever ate. Stop by this month and try it you wont be disappointed .The owners here really care about their customers after you've been there once the'll remember you forever too!!!!

I'm so happy to stumble on this place after my favourite pizza place closed. Â The pizza is delicious. Â The crust, although thin, isn't too hard and has a good flavour. Â I love the sauce and the unique pies. Â Definitely get an order of the garlic bread, which is simple but very garlic-y.Another big reason to come here? Â Pretty good beer selection. Â They have a good variety of beers and seem to regularly change what they have. Â I usually feel like I have to go to Geneva Alehouse to find good brews, but this place always pleases.

Had these guys deliver a gluten free pizza. I don't have to eat gluten free, I just chose to when I can. I have to say the pizza was excellent! The gelato was amazing as well. I will definitely be going to check them out for a sit down meal!

Rueben pizza for St. Patty's day-genius-and delicious. This is probably the most gourmet pizza joint of the main 3 near this corner. The owner is very engaging & easy to talk to. Yummy pastas from momma's old world recipes. Looking forward to trying the Cheeseburger pizza next. See ya soon

Went with a group the other night. Awesome family business. Had excellent service, great food and met a great family. Since there was a large group we tried both crusts. Tough choice, they were both good. Loved the pistachio gelato. Others had chocolate and it was gone instantly! Will definately go back.

Hands down, the best pizza place in the Fox Valley. It's nearly gourmet - and the only reason I say nearly is because it's fresh and fabulous without being pretentious. Here's a better way to explain it: When you walk in, it smells like the first really great pizza place you visited when you were a kid. The owner and his team are friendly and helpful - it's a family-run business and you can tell. Don't forget to try the gelato - pistachio or double chocolate - both are out of this world. If you love Gario's pizza but it's too far to drive so you settle for Eddie's or Charlie Fox's, try Raimondo's - you will never go anywhere else again.

first time trying the pizza and I must report that i have had store bought/frozen pizza that tasted better!!!!!!!! Â very generic crust, tasteless, soft and spongy. Â jp p's review from 11/2/2013 pretty much sums it all up! Â seems like the beer is the reason for the 4.5 star rating! Â if you looking for good pizza, you won't find it here.
Great service , Definitely try the Godfather pizza if you like spicy food! Also the beers on tap are a must try!! Â Highly recommended :)

Love their pizza, especially the thin crust. The beer list is the best in North Aurora. Â They have lots of craft beers, with a list that is constantly rotating. Family friendly, my kids crayon drawings are hanging on the wall. I get to come back later after the kids are in bed for some tasty brews, guided by Mike, who knows how to pick out just the right beer for you. Try this place out!

Changing my review. Â I have been here a couple of times with friends. The pizza is really good. I love their specialty pizza. They have a great beer selection. The service is one of the best in the area. It's a very warm and friendly environment. The staff makes eye contact and are very genuine. If you're Â lucky enough to meet one of the owners you'll feel good about giving them your business. I'm glad I gave them a second chance or else I would be missing out on a great place.

Great beer selection and the owner is always more than willing to help you choose something you'll love. Plus their pizza is probably the best in the area. Â Just wish they had a bigger bar and more TVs.

This place is unbelievable! Friends told us to go and we kept putting it off...that's our loss! Great beer, amazing pizza and the crust?? To die for. We had so much fun the first night that we came back the next night. And we'll be here at least once a week. It's small and intimate but the service is personable and the food is amazing. Take time for the gelato. And add some cherry beer to make it a float. You'll thank me.
Great food at good prices. Cheesy garlic bread and pizza are awesome. Great eclectic beer selection. The owner is engaging and cares.

Discovered this restaurant throughbeermenus.com. Â The pizza is great. Â I love thin crust pizza the thinner the better and they will make the crust as thin as possible to order. Â They carry a variety of craft beers that changes often and Michael always provides great beer suggestions. Â The staff and owners are fantastic. Â Customers are treated like family, whether you are a regular or a newby, and everyone appears to be genuinly happy that you are there.
We ordered take out on a lazy Saturday and the Cheeseburger pizza was very good and the service even better.
Great gluten free pizza. Free ingredients. Cold craft beers and a warm atmosphere. My family and I will become regulars at Raimondo's Pizza & Pub.
Nice to have a local joint that can make good pizza. Courteous staff and quick delivery.

Great local pizza! It is all homemade and the specials are always delicious. Â They keep a good selection of beers to complement the food. The family that runs the restaurant provides good service. Â It''s overshadowed by the fine dining at the turf room, but it fits the niche for the local diners who are loyal

Vita Bella has become a staple in our family....with a catch.I'm traditionally a sausage and cheese kinda girl so that's what I get on the regular. We've dined in and taken out and had delivery.Our delivery service is always excellent. But our dine in service hasn't been the best experience. I've taken my cousin there a couple of times because she really likes eating at places so the last time we went was kind of the deciding factor that we won't dine there anymore.There's one lady who has kind of been standoffish to me whenever I've been there. She is pleasant enough to take your order and she's always been correct with our orders, just not the most friendly.Now on to the pizza. Oh em gee. The thin crust is my favorite. The sauce is delicious, a little on the sweeter side and there is always plenty of cheese and the crust is always crispy to perfection. It's even great cold. That's a real complement for me, for pizza, because I don't normally like left over cold pizza. I can't remember the last time I had their deep dish pizza but I don't know if I'd want to try it again knowing how good the thin crust pizza is!Also if you want a healthier option...their fried zucchini sticks are good dipped in ranch dressing as well! ;)

We like this place, it's a great place to go & eat and get to go! got a14" thin crust w/ mushrooms,sausage & Xtra cheese. They have a good pizza sauce it could use more garlic,oregano to liven it up but not bad. I need to try a calzone next time. Like all the other pizza places here in Illinois they cut it in squares & strips... my guess is in this state of Illinois you don't know what pizza pie means... it's a PIE! It should be cut in 8 - 12 triangular slices, not 20 little odd shaped squares. ...sorry took off on a rant.Great tasting pizza here dine in or take out.

Never judge a book by its' cover. Â It's a small establishment, BUT with a cozy layout. Â I came here for the first time to celebrate the end of my son's travel soccer season. Â While parked outside, I became a little skeptical. Â Once we entered, I felt as if I was in someone's kitchen. Â The salads were excellent! Â The appetizers were amazing! Â And the pizzas (thin crust) were outstanding! Â I need to return so that I may experience their other dishes/entrees. Â The staff did a great job handling our party of 30. Â They would constantly check on refills and inquire if we needed anything.

We have eaten in and carried out several times and the best way to describe the pizza at vita Bella is inconsistent. Sometimes it is cooked perfect and other times it is undercooked. It is undercooked more often than not for carry out. When we first moved to the area we went more often but with not knowing if we will get good or below average pizza, we have stopped going as much. The thin crust pizza is pretty good when it's done right but it isn't each time.

Not a good delivery experience. The photos speak for themselves. I don't know what training the pizza maker and pizza cutter received, but they need more training. The pizza was whole inch smaller than what we ordered, the half was more like a third, the ingredients were thrown on and the pieces were so different in size it almost seemed intentional. My four year old niece could've made and cutted a neater pizza.

We order all of the time and most of their food is outstanding. Â I tried a meatball sandwich tonight for the first time and it was the worst meatball sandwich I ever had. Â No taste whatsoever. Â Took two bites and threw it out.

Ordered a large order and was told it would be ready between 6 and 615. When we got here they said they made a mistake and it was not ready but would be in about 30 minutes. Â Mistakes happen though we do have 15 people waiting at our house for food . We decided to sit in dining room and wait and order drinks/appetizers to pass the time. Secretly I thought they should buy us the drink for mistake lol. Imagine our surprise when the young lady told us we couldn't sit in dining room it was against their policy if you are waiting for a carry out. Â She did say she could talk to a manager but I was already speechless and declined. This is our first visit here and last. Â Can't comment on food because we are still waiting .....

AdamManager takes care of BUSINESs! Â Had minor issue with a new change in their policy adding paper under pizza for couple days he was toCredit my act when I called nobody knew ...got himOn phone he backed it up and took care of business and treated me with respect calmed situation...not to mention food always tastes ahhh mazing! Â Love good customer service that is the utmost important great job ADAM! Â Lexi put him right on when I started to get a little edgy!

What do you get when you bring 16 Italians to Vita Bella?A 4 star review - yay we're fans!I came here last week with my family to celebrate my grandparents' 58th anniversary. The food was delicious, wine was flowing, and chatter was in the air. On to the yummy deets.I enjoyed...Calamari: crispy, lightly breaded, with marinara sauce and a lemon slice. Hit the spot!Antipasti salad: great combination of Italian flavor - Mortadella, Cappicola, Genoa salami, cheese, tomatoes, pepperoncini peppers, olives all tossed in their house Italian dressing.Italian bread: Standard, but yummy nonetheless.Pinot Noir: I mean, I had 3 glasses so it's a win in my book!White Pizza: My favorite! Loved this non traditional 'za. Olive oil (instead of standard pizza sauce), fresh garlic, ricotta cheese and tomatoes.Pepperoni Pizza: Classically delish. Pepperoni, mushrooms, onion and green pepper. Thin crust what what!Walnut Gorgonzola Salad: A MUST TRY! I love this salad. Green apple slices, walnuts, avocado, cranberries and crumbled gorgonzola tossed with mixed greens and topped with pomegranate dressing. Such a fresh and fabulous combo!The only reason Vita Bella didn't get 5 stars from me is due to the service. I'll give them the benefit of the doubt because we had a large group and its possible our waitress was training someone, but it was less than ideal.We were missing silverware and plates so we had to wait a while before diving into our intriguing apps. When our waitress did come by she was so quick to pop in we couldn't event get a word in to request another drink! Slightly frustrating.Everyone has their days though, and my whole group really enjoyed the food and family atmosphere. I'll be back!

Unfortunately since my 5 star review at the beginning of the year, its been down hill. Â With the last three orders, the pizza has been barely cut and on the last order, the cheese and toppings had slid off the pizza in the box. Â I called about it and they said they would give me a $15.00 credit. Â I just called tonight to order a pizza. Â Guess what - there is no $15.00 credit on file. Â And now they say they have no record of me ever ordering from there, even though I've had the same phone number for almost 15 years now. Â Ridiculous. Â With all the pizza places out there, I will easily go somewhere else. Â BEWARE of this place. Â It used to be so good but clearly its gone down hill.

Little disappointed this night. Ordered thin crust pizza and breaded mushroom and got the free fried dough. Â The pizza was under cooked crust was soggy, cheese was just melted on the top and pizza was just like warm after waiting 45 minutes. Fried mushrooms also were under cooked as the mushrooms were soggy on the out side and really soggy almost the batter inside was not cooked. Â  The really bad part was we finally collected the 12 tabs to get the 50% off . Â I guess this time we got what we paid for. Hope the kitchen manager takes his time during the busy rush or you' ll will be getting more lousy reviews. Â We will try again only because we have been satisfied in the past

When my girl moved out to Plainfield - I abandoned hope of any good Italian food in her neighborhood. Call me a snobby city guy - but Plainfield is not synonymous with Italian cuisine.The first time she took Â me to Vita Bella - I was impressed: good beef - mellow atmosphere. The service was very good. They didn't honor the coupon they sent in the mail - but they gave her another one for our next visit.The second time we went - the food was still very good. The service was cosi-cosi. She brought the bread - but not the oil. I was trying to remember if they had oil the first time. I can't understand bread without oil - but whatever.Then we had them cater our Labor Day event. We got a tub of mostaccioli. We got a tub full of beef. We got a tub full of chicken. We got a tub full of salad. We got a tub full of garlic bread and one full of Italian bread.(I am kind of tubby so that all worked for me - well maybe not the salad.)Did I mention the healthy helping of giardiniera and a pan of sweet peppers?I not only got enough food to feed a small army (or me and four of my buddies) but the quality of the food was pretty stellar. We have all been to a party or an event catered in this style - this was the best one I have ever been to. This food was amazing. People were commenting on it as they shoveled it in. I over ordered - but have no trouble dining on left-overs of this food.Here's the punch line. The price was so reasonable that I Â felt like I was getting the deal of the year. I truly feel I got the best value for my hard earned dollar and will be back time and time again.I am still not sold on Plainfield - but my girl is there so I'll be spending more and more time there. Good thing to know there is a good Italian beef waiting for me when I do.

Vita Bella has great pizza but it's nothing to write home about. Their online ordering is crazy convenient and we use it more than we should. The pizza and other items are good and consistent which is key for the independents. The times we have been into the restaurant the staff has been nice, inviting and patient so props to the management. I do wish they had a quality that set them apart from all the other pizza places around, but if you want a good pie stop in, it'll satisfy you.
Poorly managed. Phoned in an order and was told a half hour. Got there and sat for another half hour!!! Â Get it together!!!

Third time ordering from here. Â First two times the pizza was good and delivery was prompt. Â Third time the online ordering system did not put my order through and I had to call an hour-and-thirty minutes later. Â Pizza arrived thirty minutes later, undercooked, with one half of the pizza's cheese completely on the other half. Â The three dollar discount didn't exactly make up for it.

Thin crust pizza is delicious! Our favorite pizza place in the area. Good value and we always get coupons in the mail. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The restaurant is always clean and tidy.
Live this place! We typically order for delivery and the food always comes hot and delicious and usually within an hour.
The pizza was good the first time then the second time they went down I will definitely come back and see if they had any improvements. the staff was great. I will definitely return to this.
Love Vita Bella's pizza! We've also catered fried chicken and beef sandwiches for a party, excellent food. Just about everything on the menu is good and reasonably priced. Yum!

Yeah I just wanted to take a moment to say how excellent this restaurant is. Â It's my go to ordering place. Â I barely have to interact with a human. Â From online ordering to signing their phone for a tip, it's a misanthrope's dream!
The spaghetti is wonderful. Served with toasty garlic bread. Very nice staff. Ordered to go and it was ready in just a few minutes.

I don't understand the praise reviews. This place was horrible. We got seated then ordered a glass of wine and a beer and placed an order for stuffed mushrooms. After the first bite, I told my boyfriends I think they're brought I , or pre-made days in advance since they had absolutely no flavor. When my boyfriend was eating his stuffed mushroom, he almost choked on a BIG piece of plastic. I had known something was off with just the taste, that proved it. Our server, however; Angela, was sweet, attentive, and very professional. She made sure our concerns were addressed, and handled professionally. She is too god for this restaurant that obviously cares little about there quality of food. When a manager on duty came over to discuss the poor quality of the "appetizer", he apologized and took them off the bill (rightfully so). We ordered prior to the mushrooms a beef sandwich and a pepperoni pizza with mushrooms and sausage that was "homemade" and when that arrived, the disappointment continued with the worst pizza I've ever had, and a flavorless beef sandwich that I had ordered got and received otherwise. Horrible food. The server was nice and efficient, but food is. It worth trying. Go elsewhere! I'm giving two stars for service.

I love Vita Bella!!!! Best pizza in town! And they have some delicious homemade appetizers. Breadsticks are to die for. They have some good weekday specials if you plan on dining in! And there's always coupons out there... Consistently good service, too. Fridays and Saturdays are always slammed, order during the week! Two thumbs up!
We get delivery at least once a week! The pizza is delicious as well as the Penne Alla Vita Bell. My sister loves the chicken fingers and fries as well.

First and last time we will be ordering from here. It started with the employee taking the order. After repeating our order several times, somebody else got on the phone and said, "sorry she was new and I'll finish for her". That I fully understand, that's the only way a new employee can learn. But I think after trying the phones, the same employee must have rolled out our pizza, made our pizza, and then cut our pizza. Â The 12" we ordered was closer to 10", I can't even explain the way they cut it. Pie cut shouldn't be that difficult, and it was the most awkwardly cut pie I have ever seen!!! Â 2 slices were about 2 inches wide at the crust and the others around 6-7 inches. The crust was horrible, black Â stuff all over the bottom from a dirty oven I assume, and very soggy. Â I ordered sausage and pepperoni, and actually counted only 1 sausage and 3 pepperoni on one of my slices. Paid $30 after tip for something I didn't even want to finish and just ended up throwing out.

Yum! First off, what's not to love about kids making their own pizza AND it's FREE on Monday and Tuesday! Super kid friendly.Very friendly, attentive staff.My Hubby and I tried the lasagna and tortellini ala vodka - both super good and I hate to admit it but the lasagna is better than mine. Â Needless to say, we'll be back.

I use to love this place but they have slacked the past few months. The pizza is just ok recently... sometimes undercooked pizza. They still have great customer service very pleasant staff. Generous reward program. Â Chicken parm is good, ribs also good.I Â ordered double dough for a kids party and that was good.

Everything I have ordered from here is awesome. Â The shells and cheese is fantastic...especially if you add chicken. Â Nice rewards program if you order from there frequently. Â I've gotten a couple free dinners already.

Long time take out customer. Decided to try the sit down restaurant.. Think I will stick to take out.. Service in the restaurant was extremely slow. Our waitress was very inattentive.. Ordered 3 sandwiches, took over 45 minutes to be served..

I have never actually eaten at vitas but their carryout is awesome! I have now had 3 pizzas from vita bellas. All were delicious. I decided to try their pan pizza and homemade tortellini with vodka cream.. pan pizza was amazing however be warned it is thick and heavy. If your not into that their thin crust is also good. I love their dough for the pizza! The tortellini was amazing. The vodka cream sauce has a kick but it pairs well with their tortellini.

I've had the pizza several times, and it's ok. I prefer little Italian just a little bit farther north on 59. This place, however is a really nice Italian spot for the people of plainfield to try a variety of cuisines at reasonable price. Now I'm a true blooded italian, I make and jar my own red sauce, make my own wine, ect... and I appreciate their pasta. I had the pasta with clams and white sauce and I really liked it even though it was a bit too oily. The calamari was pretty decent, and they have good little breadsticks... nice spot for plainfield for sure!!

We have recently moved out to Bolingbrook and thought we would try this place! Â I gotta tell you, its the BEST thin crust pizza I have had. Â ALong with the best suace! Â I am very picky about my pizza, but Â this ticks all the boxes. Â They have 1/2 price bottles of wine on Wednesday, which is my favorite night to go. Â I also recommend the bruschetta. Â They have the regular italian fare, but trust me, don't pass on the pizza. Â Good staff and if you go, it will become one of your standards!

Solid four star place with really good thin crust pizza at a decent price. Use the coupons they offer as we got an 18 inch two topping and 12 inch cheese for $27.11. It is easily enough to feed 5-6 people.The quality is definetly there as well as the sauce flavor is spot on. On a Friday night the take out window was packed as well as the dining room.The staff were in a furry and not friendly on person or on the phone so I docked then one star. Whichever, be short with me but deliver good food at a fair price. Will be back again.
Quite possibly one of the best thin crust pizzas I've had. Veggies are fresh, no canned mushrooms (ThankGod). They have huge chocolate chip cookies!!Their shrimp pasta is to die for!
I have not gone to the place myself and eaten there but I have had Pizza for delivery from Vita Bella and it was amazing. I highly recommend the all meat pizza. The pork ribs are pretty good too.
We love their food, but delivery was quite confusing. They have different pricing by location and more importantly the people who answer the phones have no clue about menu pricing. Train your people

Delivery was estimated at one hour. Â It only took 45 minutes. Â I like it.Pizza was very good. Â The perfect amount of cheese accompanied by generous amounts of toppings (in this case, sausage and roasted red pepper). Â Since the pizza is satisfying, I really want to try the walnut gorgonzola salad now!Employee who took my order was very friendly and courteous on the phone. Â There are always coupons out in the mail, like those clipper things, so keep an eye out.

I'm not sure why others are so high on this place. Tried this place a couple times, and wasn't remotely impressed. The sauce was bland, and the pizza was greasy. I would try several other joints before stopping by this place. (Peroni's?)
We order almost every week. Â Thin crust pizza is the best I've ever had. Â Highly recommend

Great place to have a party! We celebrated a 25th anniversary here with 22 people. Â The manager, John, was excellent to work with for planning the surprise party. Â The 2 servers were very attentive and very quick to fill all of our requests.The food was delicious and plentiful. We had the bruschetta, Caesar salad, meatballs, sausage and peppers, mostaccioli, and dough nuggets.This is our favorite pizza place in Plainfield!

WORST pizzeria ever!!!! They do not deserve a star. They will never get your order correct!!!! Â  Â  Unfortunately this is one of the only places close to me. However, it is not an exaggeration when I say every other order in the last year has been WRONG!! Â The pizza will have completely different ingredients than what I ordered. The worst part is it's not even switched with someone else just plain made wrong, put in the oven with nobody noticing, cut with still nobody noticing, and delivered with still nobody noticing. Â  At this point I'll be driving to Little Cesar's on 135th from now on. Â I refuse to pay a dime for another wrong order.

We found this place just a few months ago and fallen in love with it. We have ordered takeout, dined in and catered from them and every time the food is hot and fantastic.We'll start with the pizza. We have only had the thin crust, but it is great. Good amount of cheese, sauce and toppings. It has become one of our favorites in the area.If you dine in, Mon and Tues kids eat free. They also let your kids create their own pizza at the table which my kids love to do. Service is great too. They also carry some craft beers.Catering, was awesome. Everyone kept asking us where we got the food. I would not hesitate to cater from Vita Bella, you won't be disappointed.

I can't remember the last time I had pizza this incredible. Â Heck -- I can't remember the last time I described food as "incredible", but this is definitely it! Â The pizza tastes very fresh, and the flavors of every ingredient and topping are very pronounced.The thin crust is really paper thin. Â They use a special kind of pizza tray to keep the crust crispy -- but just make sure that you ask for it to be crispy if that's your style. Â Also if you prefer squares or triangle shaped slices make sure to specify that when ordering as well.I've tried a variety of dishes here and so far have not been disappointed. Â Their baby back ribs are also among the best I've had -- which surprised me coming from an Italian restaurant.

We have visited Vita Bella twice in the last month or so. Both times were very good. Â The first time we went, there was no one in the parking lot and we thought it was closed. Â After we were seated, several other diners came in as well.First time we tried an appetizer, the waitress recommended the homemade bread sticks, they were tossed in garlic butter and grated Romano cheese. Â We also were served warm bread after we ordered the breadsticks, CARB OVERLOAD! Â We also tried a caesar salad, it was good and a decent size side salad.We have tried the* thin crust meat classic- it is VERY meaty* thin crust cheese - lots of cheese and good leftover* thin crust make your own with spinach, sausage, black olives and mushrooms - had a good amount of sausage, not too much.Overall, the food was really good and we will be back. Â Glad to have found another pizza joint.

Usually love the pizza but the service is terrible. Ordered two, simple large pizzas on a Sunday night. Sat around for an hour waiting for the delivery and called wondering where my food was. Excuses were made. Apparently one pizza was taken out for delivery and the other was completely forgotten about. Cancelled the order and received one pizza a full 90 minutes after delivery was placed. Denied it and ordered from another pizza place, apologizing to my hungry family and company we had over. Will never order again.

love the new online ordering site and process.....makes it easier to get dinner for the family quickly and monitor when it will arrive. Â The food has always been fresh and the value for the money is high

We love our pizza. In fact, we probably order from here about twice a month, if not more. It's the best place we've come across in Plainfield. The "Works" no bacon, no ground beef, add spinach and broccoli, double dough is the way to go! Add some ranch, and you have yourself a masterpiece. ;)

Wow! I was so surprised and impressed!!! I will definitely be back. The walnut Gorgonzola salad with apples and avocado feeds four and is just over $7. Â The chicken limone and chicken Marsala were cooked to perfection. Both tender but too much oil to my liking. My husband did not think there was too much oil. They are right up there with deserving a 5 star but not quite. It was a Friday night at only 430pm. We were the only ones in the restaurant. When word gets out about the good food, Â more professional servers, and a few tweeks they will be a 5 star in no time. Oh yeah- lose the plastic table covers. Your building is too nice for those. Â The wine was good, but my glass had spots. Just sayin!

We probably hit this place at least once a week. Consistent good pizza regardless of crust thickness. One of the few places I like stuffed crust pizza from. Excellent sauce and generous toppings. We have tried a few of their appetizers and have been pleased -- breadsticks are delish, and fried dough is good (but sweet enough that we save it for dessert).

I loooooove this place!! They never disappoint. We recently did catering with them and everyone loved their food!! Great!!Prices are very reasonable and food is delicious! Definitely recommending to everyone that needs catering done right and affordable, this is the place to get it from.Pizza is always hot, delicious and always cooked to perfection.

Excellent thin crust pizza, espeically their Italian Beef and Hot Giardinara pizza. Usually order 2-3 times a month depending on how often I am working in the Plainfield area. The sandwiches aren't so great, so I normally stick to the thin crust pizza. Also, their menu and website both indicate they deliver to Naperville, but when I called to place an order for delivery, they advised they only delivered to certain areas of Naperville, which is fine, but that should be specified on their menu and website.

I am a big fan of Vita Bella, Â we have been enjoying pizza and sandwiches for years. Consistently good thin crust, Vita Bella Beefs are a gut busting splurge....what's not to like about beef and cheese served on toasted garlic bread rolls...On top of the food, I am also a fan because of the way Vita Bella supports the community. I served on a few volunteer boards, school and church, and every time we reached out for help from the community, Vita Bella was more than generous.

I order pizza from here once a month or so. The pizza is top notch 5 out of 5 stars easy. I even brought left overs into work and co workers said it was damn good pizza. Delivery is always fast and reliable too, even on a Saturday Night.The only reason I give it 4 stars is because of their appetizers. Their calamari was not good and didn't care for the bread sticks. The calamari looked like portillos onion rings and was soggy in the box that they delivered it in. It was hard to believe that the appetizers items were not that good, when their pizza is amazing. I will have to give them a try in the restaurant sometime and see if it is different.I will keep ordering PIzza from them.. will have to try other things in restaurant.
Fantastic pizza! Â Always consistent service. Â I have been ordering pizza for several years and it is the best in the area.

Online ordering has a very good feature where you can see that the food is being prepped and/or on its way for delivery, so that's a nice bonus! I NEVER do delivery but today I decided I would for a change. The estimated delivery time was 59-69 minutes, and the pizza arrived in 63. That's spot on!I went with the white pizza (but swapped out roasted peppers for ricotta) and am yet again amazed with the caliber of their product. I'm normally not a thin crust guy but had to give it a shot, and they've masted thin, double dough, pan, and stuffed!I ate a lot of bad pizza in this town before coming across this slice of heaven (pun intended) and every crap pizza from anywhere else made it worthwhile!Next up, Caprese salad. The mozzarella was great, the balsamic dressing good, and greens seemed fresh. Tomatoes were a little mushy but I'm really nitpicking to even bring that up.

This is a great place for lunch. They've got pizza by the slice if you're in a hurry. Â If you want a calzone or a pizza, plan on a 20 minute wait since they're made to order. Â They are definitely worth the wait!!

Pizza is very good and breadsticks are great!! But as mentioned in a previous post, delivery service is poor. If the pizza wasn't as good as it was I wouldn't have given them three stars. I tried to contact a manager to tell him about how I was upset with my service but I never heard back. If ordering from them, I HIGHLY recommend picking up from them yourself.

The new restaurant location is very nice. They some big booths making the place cozy. The pizza here is excellent! I highly recommend sausage on thin crust. The sausage pieces are huge & taste great. Prices are reasonable here as well.

What a change from Vito and Nicks. The decor is cozy, however the place was way too bright. However that is the only negative comment about the place. Actually that is the only thing that kept it from 5 stars. The pizza and salad were delicious. We will certainly be back.
Our go to pizza place and take out home style pasta . Love their thin crust and Chicken Marsala.

Today I ordered vita bellas "vita bella sub" and a Caesar salad. Â I was not impressed at all. Â With all of the great things I have heard about them, I was extremely disappointed. Â The sandwich came toasted, which normally wouldn't be a problem but I was expecting, and hoping for, a normal sub sandwich. Â The variety of meat on the sandwich was nothing to write home about either. Â Not very flavorful and way too salty. Â The Caesar salad was large for the price but basically a bowl of romaine and like 4 croutons. Â Another lacking dish. Â Im a big fan of pizza places that have a variety of food and do a great job on all of them, but at vita bella it just seems like another restaurant that has way too much on their menu and does a sub-par job of making it.
We have tried them a few times now , love the thin crust pizza & white pizza only wish they would tone the garlic down a bit ! Overall good value and good service.

The family and I just had dinner and had a great experience. Â Cara the waitress was fantastic. Our dinner wasn't ready but the kids was ready, and she asked if we wanted it brought out. Very considerate. Food was good. Plan on going back.
If you like lots of children screaming like Chuckie Cheese go there on Monday when kids eat free. Was also expensive. Never again!!
Expensive, bad pizza, bad service. Thin crust pizza was not crisp, sauce was indifferent and I couldn't taste the toppings under the rubbery cheese. There are many better pizza places around here.
My wife loves to order their fetchino alfredo and their pizza is pretty good. Â Although I am not a fan of their Chicago style pizza the rest makes up for it.
Great pizza. Â Great value with a coupon. Â Service was wonderful. Â Good spot for kids. Â Will definitely be back.

Pizza was okay, crust was a tad on the cardboard side but I did think the pasta sauce and sausage they used were great. Â The free zucchini sticks were gross. Â Service was lacking. Â I didn't even get eye contact from the two girls working the desk. Â I even went out of my way to be extra nice to them, just to see if they'd indulge me. Â No dice. Â No enjoy your food, have a good night, or plan thank you. Â After paying, I just walked out feeling strange as if I smelled or something. Â Better go freshen up.
Consistently good pizza at both locations. Has coupons on every menu.

The beer selection is always awesome, but you need to come here for the food!I always look to the off menu items...the specials. Â Sometimes they'll last a week, a month...or a few days. Â I recommend getting the special soup and the special entree/sandwich. Â What you'll find is properly made, well balanced meals by a respected chef. Â My recommendation is to come for a number of soups, and a number of specials in order to get a feel for his cooking, his execution of proper technique and his interpretations of flavors on food (ie: choice of homemade buns, flavor in homemade sausage/protein). Â Really, where else in the area are you going to find a properly made demi-glace! Â I mean, really! Â Come in...and give it a good chance

Never againThey're deceitful liars.There was a special on a table tent for bourbon. $5-$10 on higher end bourbons.We ordered four $5 bourbon on the rocks, one draft beer and a N/A beer. The bill was $50.When questioned, the manager explains there's an extra charge for ice. And a significant one at that.I was mad, but embarrassed in front of my guests and just signed the bill.Don't go. They'll find a way to rip you off

Been wanting to stop here for awhile. They open at 4 which is fine but Im often seeking a beer and a bite at lunch and wished they opened for lunch. Loved the place. Great beer selection! Uncommon choices! Food was good , service was better. I even managed to strike up a conversation w/ two total strangers while watching the Cubs WS game. That is not easy to do these days.Karen was the bartender, very friendly and helpful. Smiling often. Good lady! Place had a good vibe. It was clean, tables spread out giving a feeling of roominess and it did get crowded when the game started. Washrooms were clean. I only had time for an appetizer. Had the 3 sliders. Tasty, well prepared and left me wanting more. I will return another day & you should too!

They had a decent amount of beers to choose from, I'd say above average selection. There were both drafts and bottles available and well organized on their respective menus.Not being packed on a Friday night, I was glad to easily get a seat. The bar had a really great seat to table height ratio; short women rejoice. I asked the barmaid for her favorite food choices, as I usually do for new places. Some just give me what everyone else likes, some actually tell me their personal favorites. She listed too many and I just settled on pizza. They have a huge window for half priced pizzas on Fridays; 4-10 PM. Which I also found out its for dining in only, unless you order a beer.I got my 14" pizza with mushrooms and bacon, as you have a choice from 12 or so toppings. Pay per topping. It was thin crust and pretty tasty. The only weird thing (to me) was they cut it in squares, which I'm not exactly a huge fan of doing.I would definitely return to this joint.
This place is awesome!!! Their cook in the back is awesome. The food is great. There are always 12 beers on tap. Â They have an awesome variety of beer and food. Â Come check it out!!!!

I usually love it here, great food and great spot for games, but my last experience here wasn't as great. We waited a while for a table, which was fine since this was a Cubs game night. We sat down, ordered our drinks. Drinks came before we ordered, waited 25 mins before getting our waiter to take our order, waited another 25 for our food , ok, but on top Of that from waiting in the first place. We were a table of 8 and one of us went to ask about our food, the owner told us about what time we ordered and what time we waited... like we didn't know? He came off and rude and made it sound like the waiting was out fault. I Love this place and wish the owner had a more understanding and compassion about customer service on a busy night.

This is a pub thats more about the food than the beer. Dont take that wrong ,they have a very nice beer and spirits menu but the food, Its a big notch above bar food. Chef has good vision. We shared dishes so we could try more. It just made us sure we'd come back to try what we hadnt tried on this visit. Price very reasonable. Portions generous. Pot roast sandwich....outstanding. Nacho's ....crazy good. Onion rings....very much worth up charge. Bar cost average for serving. We''ll be back. Menu changes and we want to check out what new chef has to offer.

I cant wait to try the food here! Everything looked and smelled so good. I pulled this place up on yelp and directed everyone here before the haunted house. I started to get really nervous when I could not find it. Its located at the end of strip mall.The service was amazing!!! Everyone was so friendly! I would love to come back here and hang out. Its not that far from my house. The prices are pretty good and they seem to always have at least 1 thing on special.The beer list is not exactly the biggest I have ever seen, but its decent. They have a decent bottle selection too. For the area, I think its one of the better bars for sure!

I've been disappointed in all of the previous restaurants that formerly took up residence here so I was in no hurry to try this place. Finally my neighbors who have always raved about the place talked us into going. We were there early evening on a Sunday. 4 families with kids ranging in ages from 4-10. Thank goodness for most of the night it was mostly just us because we are a loud bunch. Our server never batted an eye. She may have very well hated out guts (I've served before and I probably would've been annoyed with us!) but she was nothing but awesome. The food was pretty awesome too. I tried one of my neighbors jalapeÃ±o poppers and will definitely be ordering those next trip. We ordered the combo platter and everything on it was good! The mozzarella sticks were some of the best I ever had and the potato skins were a meal in them self! For dinner I had the pot roast sandwich with mashed potatoes and my husband had one of the spicy burgers. We both loved our choices. The kids all shared some pizza which was also great.All and all I'm sorry it took me so long to get to this place and I will definitely be back to try some more things I was eyeing on the menu!

Very good food and beer, priced affordable.Clean and friendly.We 1st tried this place with a Groupon and have been back a few more times.Great burgers and half priced pizza on Friday night.Good place to go for all ages.

12 Handles? More like 8 and 4 broken mugs. How is this place still standing. I understand the drink specials and everything that surrounds the bar food. But honestly it smells in here. Bad. Like a grandma with too many cats. How do people return for business? I mean I see the manager or whoever it is doing shots with regulars. But is that the only way people will come back?

Went there tonight, on a Saturday, perfect atmosphere, place is under new management and ownership, and they are definitely paying attention to detail, super clean, huge selection of craft and regular beers.I had the chicken wings and mozzarella sticks and chef Dean did not disappoint, Wonderful job on everything we had.The manager Casey, came by just enough to make sure we were happy, but not enough to be a pain in the ass. Matt the bartender was right on top of things even though it was a good crowd, kudos to him.I'd recommend everyone to give it a try and see the new awesomeness 12 Handles is passing out for yourselves,WILL definitely be back, keep up the good work guys.
Best lunch around!! Cannot wait to come back for dinner and drinks!! The wait staff and Casey are amazing!! Food is to die for! Chef Dean keep it coming :-)

We hit this place up after going to Statesville Haunted House. Holy crap, it was super loud. I'm all for bang-bang party mode, but for a sports bar you couldn't hear your neighbor. I talked to the waitress about it, but it's possible she couldn't hear me either. The beer selection was good, the food was not bad. I liked the fact that a lot of it seemed homemade (hand breaded stuffed mushrooms, real mashed potatoes.) But overall, the flavor wasn't there. If I were to come back, it would probably be to enjoy the beer selection enough where I would be shouting with glee over the loud music.
Love this place. Very cool open space inside. Service is very friendly. Have never felt pressured or out of place. Â Very mellow crowd who attends.Great for a few craft beers and an appetizer.

12 Handles is definitely one of my favorite bars to visit when I am in town. The atmosphere is solid but it can be a little noisy at times. There are plenty of TV's to watch if you come during a sports event. Plenty of beers to choose from including both bottled and on draft. The only reason I'm knocking a star off is because the quality of the pizza changed in the last few months. I used to be a regular when they would have their pizza specials because they were so delicious, but more recently they have become somewhat tasteless. Besides that, the staff are very friendly and attentive and the restaurant itself is very clean and inviting.

Great new place we tried a few weeks ago. Very clean and tons of TV's. Can't believe this place has been open a year and we just found it. Come fall we will be regulars watching college football on Saturdays for sure. We did try the pizza and outstanding.

This is a really good tap house. They had a wide variety of interesting beers, and the burger I got was fantastic (Revolution). It's a simple place with sports on TV, but it has a pleasant feel and the service was great. It reminds me of Embers in Lockport, but with better food and more variety in the beer choices. Their house amber ale is really good.

Great selection of beers!!! The wings are worth trying with a variety of sauces that are awesome! The pot roast sandwich is what I will return for next week! The Bartender Matt and Jessica are very nice and knowledgable too

Since new management took over the menu is outstanding. Â I have been through most of the food selections and have yet to find anything that has not been carefully prepared with quality ingredients. Their beer menu is extensive and changes frequently which keeps things interesting. The staff is very friendly and does a great job. This is a well above average gastro-pub that is quickly making a name for itself.
Worst wait staff ever! Good food, good beer selection, bad wait staff. Â My recommendation, sit at the bar.

Excellent Bourbon and Craft Beer Bar. I went there in Feb. 15 and I tried a couple of beer flights and craft bourbon. I did not had a full meal, only an appetizer, but it was very good. I'll be back for sure.

We were here on Christmas Eve and had a great experience. Â Service was excellent with knowledgeable, friendly server, good food (big portions), and great, clean restaurant. Â We plan to go back soon.

The family and I have been here several times (before the new owners and now after), and what a treat. Â The food is always a hit - good and flavorful. Â My husband and kids usually have a burger of some sort, and I always get the Greek salad. Â One of the best I've had, and no complaints at all with the burgers. Â We've also had the pizza - awesome. Â I've always encountered awesome, friendly waitstaff, and the new owner even came to our table to check on us and chat with us for a bit. Â We've been on 'big game nights' (as they have several tv's on the walls around the place), and we've always found the service and food is still top notch!! Â They have a great beer selection, and my husband and I have tried several different local beers that we might not have tried otherwise and we're always happy!! Â Great place, keep up the good work!!!
When the there on a Monday, beer selection was ok, food was straight up tasteless. We order a ruben & fish sandwich with fries two simple sandwiches that had no flavor.

Well folks we gave it a try, beer was great, great ambiance, our server was super nice, our food came out in a decent time frame... the 20 piece wings me and my husband shared were so so.. however today we are paying for it. Me & my husband both are sick and burping up chicken. Â Ewwwwwww! Â I think this is a great concept with a bad location as well.

The burgers are fantastic. Great size and cooked well. Fries are nothing spectacular and neither is the pizza. It's nice that they have so many handles but honestly didn't have a great selection. I'm noticing the trend that places are installing many handles for impression sake, but true craft beer lovers know the difference between many handles of average beer and that of quality. They had Californian Laguanitas, and 3 Sheep from Wisconsin. They also had beer from a nearby brewery in Lemont. Other than these, nothing else very interesting. They did have a nice Whiskey selection. We went on a Tuesday night and it was semi-noisy. I would go back for a quick lunch for the burger but unless I see advertisements for some more stately brews, the ambiance is not enough for me to go back.

We stumbled on this place last May so were probably some of the first people to visit. We've been back maybe a dozen more times as we live about 5 minutes from here. The hours are a little odd because they don't open until 4PM. The same people own the Southern Belle breakfast place right next to it.The food has always been consistent. The service has always been great with the exception of one server who gets confused pretty easily. The bartenders know what they're doing and are usually willing to give samples if there are any questions about certain taps. The beer selection started off really varied and interesting but has since devolved into a hop lovers paradise with not much in the way of lighter brews (pilsners, lagers, etc.). That's fine for me but my wife isn't a fan of bitter beer (her words) so she's hoping they come around.There are about 15 seats at the bar, maybe 6 hi-tops that seat 4 each and 8 or 9 low tables that can be pushed together for groups. 22 large screen TVs mean everybody gets a view if they want to see whatever sports game is showing. Restrooms are clean and large. Like every other place in Joliet and Crest Hill there are 4 or 5 gaming machines along one wall.The pizza here was a nice surprise as are the wings, stuffed jalepenos and mushrooms, and grinder sandwiches. all excellent. The burgers, wraps, salads,etc are all good. We haven't tried the pasta dishes.We'll probably be somewhat regulars as long as they can make it with those limited hours...

Oh wow , this place did not honor the trader magazine coupon, 15 for 30 on food and beverages , this manager was rude and obnoxious and even threatened to call the cops, my issue beverages did not exclude alcohol , this coupon on trade magazine did not exclude alcohol. On another note the bartender was treated like crap, the manager/owner demanded her to update the menu NOW with aggressive authority I felt bad for her, maybe get it together before you open your doors, if you treat your servers like that I knew customer service was going to be an issue, I should've left then. Beware of the trader magazine coupon it's false advertisement
This place is awesome. Â  A huge selection of good craft beers. Â  Good burgers. Â We'll be hitting this up more often.

Love this place! Good beer menu, full bar, well trained friendly staff and bar none THE BEST burgers anywhere. Lots of good stuff on the menu but I go back for the burgers. So good it's almost a crime to add condiments.
My wife and I have decided to make 12 Handles our "neighborhood bar". Great food and great service! Â Our favorite bartender Matt makes it easy to keep coming back.
Great food! Â Loved the grilled cheese with avocado, bacon & tomato. The clam chowder was the best ever! Â Great place for pub food!!

YeahDefinitely one of my favorite spots in the Joliet area. Â Good beer, food, and people... what more can you ask for?Drinks: come for the great beer and whiskey selection. Â 24 rotating mostly American microbrews and 100+ in bottles. Extensive collection of whiskey: at least 80 bottles of bourbon, rye, Scotch, Irish and the like. Tasty cocktails too if that's your thing.Food: the food is probably my favorite pub food in the area, but can lack consistency. The burgers are a generous 10oz with tons of choices for toppings. My favorites: Ring of Fire (spicy and delicious), Like a Rolling Stone (can't go wrong with bacon and a fried egg) and Revolution (cherry peppers, avocado and onion straws). Wings, apps and pizza are great too.People: staff is (mostly) great. Seen a few good and not so good ones come and go since the beginning, but overall I love these people. Especially the bartenders and manager/owner Nick.Overall: sit at the bar, ask for a sample or two and try a new craft brew, order some wings and a burger, and enjoy. 90% of the time, it works every time.
Under new management...and you can tell! Food was great, staff were great. Will definitely be back!
Great food and awesome atmosphere! Nice and friendly service.

The beer selection was very good. The service was very slow. I ordered a hamburger and it was terrible. It left a bad taste in my mouth until the next day. It had a burnt bitter taste. The fries were ok. For me the place is too open and it is loud inside even with very few people there on a Sunday night. Not going back. The beer selection didn't outweigh the service, atmosphere and food.
Awesome experience! Great burgers with quality meat ; fries most excellent. Â Brad, our server, offered beer samples and made the dining experience a delight. We will be back.

Great place went for the first time as moved closer to the area. Disappointed Â they did not have pizza. Went with my hubby and 2 girls and that is what the girls wanted but their oven was broken. No biggie ordered spinach artichoke Â dip instead and they loved it. Our waiter was awesome he was very apologetic and even offered Â us a free round of beers but we did not have room left. Loved the maple siracha wings. We will definitely visit this place again.

First time at 12 Handles this past Wednesday, and wondering why I haven't been here sooner!!!! Â Only 10 minutes away from home and great beer selection great food and most of all great service!!!! Already planning another visit!! Â Keep up the great work!!!

5 stars for BEER SELECTION ONLY!! Food was mediocre at best. I ordered the spicy garlic wings which were way too spicy and no garlic at all and the horseradish peppercorn wings. Good sauce but just doesn't pair well with chicken. My boyfriend ordered the pot roast sandwich and it was very dry.
Burgers were awesome and Maritza our server was great. She wasn't overwhelming but she came to check on us the right amount of times. We will be back!

Really enjoyed this place! Love the location & ambiance. Highly recommend the wings (all the flavors are great) and the pretzel log was awesome. Going back soon to try a burger. The flight was great to try sample different beer.

The food here is okay. Got a groupon for $10 for $20 worth of food. Now, when I went here in December of 2014 I was able to use the groupon on specials, then a couple weeks later into the new year, rules changed and I couldn't use the groupon on the friday special for half- priced pizza, which was very disappointing. If I don't have a groupon for this place I wouldn't go.

Great beer selection, actually the best in all of Joliet / Shorewood / Crest Hill area. Â Food OK, Â but this is a beer drinkers paradise. Over 120 different bottles and 24 rotating, Â harder to find drafts. Â Decent prices too, they always have a Groupon too.

Went here after buying a Groupon for 2 burgers and 2 beer flights. First off, it's located right next to Southern Belles in Crest Hill. Wish we would have known that as our GPS took a backwards way of getting there. Their beer selection was great. They could probably use a not more description for those of us that are not beer officiandos. The sample sizes were decent. The burgers were awesome. Good size, yummy bun and lots of options to deal with. The environment was straight up sports bar. There were probably 10 large screen tvs. Definitely would be an awesome place to watch Sunday afternoon football. To top it all off the service was great from start to finish.
Awesome Â wings. The best fresh Â jalapeÃ±o poppers around. Â Good service. Â We will be back especially Â for the $.50 wings on Sunday

We saw a Groupon and decided to check the place out. What a great find! Many beers to choose from (the flight of beer was great) and the burgers were good. We didn't have the wings but they looked like a good size and we will be ordering those the next time we go. The pricing of their menu and craft brews was very reasonable and not over priced. They have alot of TV 's and when we asked for a game on one of them they were quick to put it on for us. The owner was wonderful and took time to talk to us even though he was very busy helping out his staff due to a person calling off. We liked the fact he was right in there helping out, not afraid to work to try to make things easier for his staff. Can't wait to go back and bring some friends with us!

Actually have great food and brews, the first time I came, one of the waitresses was mediocre, but when I came to the bar itself the bartenders had good personality and made it fun. Overall a great experience overall, and not too crowded but not too empty. I'd definitely recommend trying them out as they are new and have very fair prices. Sam the bartender is awesome if you get her.

Loved this place. Went after getting the groupon for 2 burgers and 2 flights and love this place. All the menu items are great and the service is great also. We like going to try the different beers that they have for the season. Have gotten many different menu items and just cant pick a favorite they are all so yummy. You wont leave there hungry. We live a couple minutes away so its great to go watch a game or hang out. A must go to in my opinion!

Not bad a little pretenscious. Â Bartenders ugly .but more importantly not impressed with service. Its cool to be hip. But dont forget the customers. Â I am not gonna slander service.but cmon guys.not cool

Let me start off by saying awesome beer selection very friendly staff and overall good environment now for the bad I went there for the wings I like mine very spicy :^) I ordered 10 sweet habenero wings they were all sweet no spice so I told my waiter, she said she would make it right so she went to get a dipping cup of spicy sauce for my wings they really were not good and were still very sweet and I hated them but like I said awesome selection of beer and she was nice. I got over it and ended up having a good time Â The hawks were playing and they had it cranked up so loud you couldn't hear your friends sitting next to you but not a big deal for me cause I was watching the game but everybody else I was with hated it. I had a good time but it was a bit pricey I spent $50 on 4 craft drafts, 10 wings and a salad for my gf I will probably be back maybe alone at the bar for the beer but if your trying to save money and eat and drink I would go somewhere else, but I could see coming here alone after work to unwind, next time I will sit at the bar and see what's good hope this helps you make a decision I would say try it out if you're Into good craft draft.

It was just ok. It was my first time here and probably my last as it definitely is not worth the drive from Aurora. Cool interior but the food was just average. Thought the meals were overpriced for what you get. The grilled cheese for $10 was a total joke and maybe worth half that. Very small and something out of a cafeteria. The steak sandwich was tasty and better. The half price pizza is a good deal but they screwed up our order. The fries are mediocre. Drinks are fine. This place definitely needs some help in the kitchen as the meals are very inconsistent. Service was good at times but also not good at others. It too was inconsistent.

Is it possible to give negative stars ? Â One of those places that looks good and ends up sucking. I don't recommend. Beers are the only reason to go. Even that started to go off the deep end. My wiff got a frozen beer, then I got a frozen beer. Eat somewhere else. Burger was so overcooked I think it might have been cooked on New Years and stored in a freezer to be microwaved and served to me by an inept waitress. This place is in such a bad location that I don't believe any restaurant will survive for long. They all start off there with good intentions and eventually the owners find out they are losing there asses. Then comes the cutting corners part of the slide toward bankruptcy. We won't be going back.

I felt like I was in my grandma's kitchen. That being said, the food is made fresh we waited about 10 minutes for enchiladas de queso topped with fresh veggies and cheese, two tacos de rajas, and a torta de milanesa de pollo.Everything was very well made and served with pickled peppers and carrots. Two salsas were available both the green and red salsa were great. However, they also served a salsa with the chips that had pieces of roasted poblano peppers. Tasted amazing.Seating was a bit limited on a Saturday afternoon only because the place was packed with people. Definitely heading back if I'm ever in town.

Honest review: bad michael jackson bad lol taco bell places like these gives real mexican food a bad name.First off its dirty not like a dump where theres trash on it but u know what i mean like when u walk into a place like wtf is this. The service was bad sometimes if u speak english in a mexican restaurant they give u bad service they treat u different and they might talk bad about u in spanish but im mexican so i just laugh. I was there so i saw how they prepared it everything was premade so they just took it out of a bucket ,already cooked, put it in the Microwave to warm it up then just put it on the grill for a second. This is the type of places u come to when ur under the influence i wont come here again lolCarne asada: there lil tacos like the small tortillas and a lil meat. It was really bland it needed alot of seasoning. It wasnt heated well. It came with cilanrto and onions.The red salsa was really good tip if u dont like something put alot of hot sauce on it and itll make u like it trust me i do that quit oftenAl pastor: no piÃ±apple so how is that alpastor it needs that thats like having guacamole without avocados doesnt work the flavor of it was really bland nothing special
They moved! My heart stopped a little when I saw the other location closed down. They're now in West Chicago off of 59 in the same plaza as Aldi. Yum!!!

I had a bad experience about 3 years ago with the agua de Tamarindo. Â I was too afraid to order any food this time. Â My sister in law Imma order stake a la Mexicana with beans. Â She really seem to enjoyed her food our friend ordered tacos de Â carne asada with aguacate and cilantro he was very please and loved them. Â I only order a sangria no alcohol is a Mexican pop. Â I just played it safe. Â The waitress we had did not understand English so it was hard for my sister to communicate with her. Â I personally will not eat here so my friends did loved Â the food but not the service.

Tears rushed down my face as I took my first bite of the cornmeal doughs on my Cornudas plate. The shapes as well as the fine, starchy texture were so similar to well-cooked sticky rice dumplings (Zongzi) I loved growing up, yet they are made from completely different grains, indigenous to two different continents. I was finally convinced the Bering Straight Land Bridge really existed.Nostalgia and sentiment aside, what made the Cornudas the most delicious $6.50 plate I've ever had were the tender chunks of braised pork covered in a spicy chile sauce. Kudos to Johnny G. for yelping about it in 2009!

Uhm yeah, just go here if you are a wannabe hipster or you are a true hipster and appreciate truly authentic Mexican food.This place is a dive but in a good way. Â If you know Spanish it's a plus. Â West Chicago has a large and very nice I might add, Mexican population. Â This place is the real deal. Â If you are OK eating beef head and know what true Corundas are is you will drool over this place. Â Their Mexican sammies are top notch too and massive.It's in cute litte West Chicago. Â Hey hipsters...this is where the town you SHOULD invest your real estate money in. Â Metra train stops in downtown, and they have some unique and oh so affordable housing, not to mention some cool shops and restaurants. Â But I digress... This place serves up the type of food you find at authentic dives in towns outside of the resorts you visit in Mexico.The staff is friendly and tries to understand my broken Spanish. Â It's clean but don't expect ambience.If you don't go here I don't care but us that know true deals and authentic fare will keep this place going without you!

Great little place. Food is outstanding. Â Always crowded and always good. Â If you are looking for great decor, chatty wait staff and china tableware, this is not the place for you. Â If you are going to focus on the food and understand what Mexican food is outside the Taco Bell Drive Thru, then come on over to West Chicago for this place.

The food here was so small and horrible. They overcharge you for items and don't give you any service or reason to stay. The place is a filth hole and is one of the worse dumps I have seen yet. Chips were as stale as ever and the meat real tangy and tasteless.

Hole in the wall Mexican food. Â Seems to be ran by a husband and wife team. Â I love their small corn tortillas. Â The chips and salsa are stellar. Â I make it a point to stop here if I'm even remotely close. Â A buddy of mine swears by their cubano sandwich and that thing is massive!
