This place is one of the best we have made it a staple. The service can take a little bit if they are busy because one guy cooks it all so calling ahead can help make it speedier. The number 17 is a amazing as well as the ban mi, there spring rolls are very fresh and none of the dishes disappoint. The entire menu is delicious
I love this place! The food is great and the service is always top notch. I come here at least once a month.

I crave Vietnamese food ever since moving to Batavia from the city where there were plenty. This place is DELICIOUS and nailed that craving for me! My husband and I ordered take out and we got chicken pho, beef with vermicelli noodles and both the shrimp and vegetable spring rolls. The sauce the rolls came were so flavorful and all the ingredients were so fresh in all our dishes. The broth for the pho was amazing -- a good pho broth has so many unique flavors in it and this one was perfect!! The staff was so friendly and prices were very good. I am so happy this place made its way into our corner of the world and I can't wait to get take out from here again.

Vietnam Gate is a small Vietnamese and Chinese fast food place in a converted house that just opened this week. Go there for a lunchtime bowl of the street food style pho.I hadn't realized that it was fast food. My husband and I were initially a little disappointed when we walked in and saw the Chinese food on the hot line that did not look terribly enticing. But I have a big soft spot for Vietnamese food after living on it for a year so we took our chances. Good decision.The Vietnamese side of the menu is small -- egg rolls, spring rolls, chicken or beef pho (noodle soup), and pork banh mi (sandwich), pretty much rounds out the menu, just like street food in Hanoi or Saigon where a shop on the sidewalk or in a shack might have just two offerings.We both ordered spring rolls, with sides of peanut sauce. They were perfectly tasty and fresh.My husband ordered the beef pho -- a big bowl of glass noodles, strips of beef and broth. It was delicious and absolutely authentic, and not overly greasy. The beef was cooked a bit more than usual -- no pink -- which I personally like. The broth was flavorful. Toss in some Siracha and the greens, sprouts and jalapenos they give you on the side and you're good to go.I ordered the Vietnamese sandwich, a.k.a. banh mi. Pork generally freaks me out, but it was not overly fatty and was flavorful.Drinks are limited to soda or water. Bummer because a Vietnamese-style iced coffee would have been awesome.The service was also authentic, in that everything came out one at a time and it wasn't lightning fast. There's also little for ambiance. All the same, I'll go back for the yummy and authentic food, and maybe even try to convince them to brew some coffee.

Oh, my goodness. You have to visit Vietnam Gate. They don't have a huge menu, which is fine by me. They just serve great food.Other Yelpers have posted wonderful things about the pho, and they're right. I was sick last month and needed REAL comfort food - good, hot soup - and not that stuff in a can I keep 'just in case.' Miserable as I was, it was worth getting dressed and driving to Vietnam Gate, just for an order of the beef pho. So delicious, and I had enough for three big servings. The spring rolls are awesome, too. Huge, fresh, and delicious.Only one thing I wish was different, and that's the drive through situation. I'm never sure if they're aware a customer is waiting to place an order or not. But the place is still getting its bearings so I'm sure they'll hammer out any issues. I'm a fan, regardless.

My daughter had a Vball tournament today at Great Lakes and I dropped her off to ref and drove here to pick up dinner. I ordered the beef pho w meatballs and sliced beef and Vietnamese iced coffee. I drank the coffee right away. Yum! It was strong and sweet! I took the pho home. It was tasty! I would highly recommend this little gem!

Wonderful addition to the Aurora dining scene! My husband and I had lunch here recently, and it was just so good! Â We had spring rolls, and two of the rice vermicelli dishes. Â Everything was so exquisitely fresh. I've not had better any where. Â We will definitely go back!
This brand new place is authentic and delicious, atmosphere is quaint and very clean the Pho gets a thumbs up and the service 5 stars! It even has a drive through if your in a hurry...!

We tried this place today and had spring rolls, chicken and beef pho. It was great. The place is super clean and the girl who waited on us as sweet as you get. Try it and you will not regret it! They also have drive through which is cool.

We love this place! And when I say "we", I mean from 40-ish down to 11 years old. Very authentic..... The beef pho is, in my opinion, the best choice of pho-options. The spring rolls are excellent; full of large shrimp. The place is always impeccably clean. Friendly service. We've never tried any Chinese dishes. We've been too happy with the Vietnamese choices to stray. Location, signage and parking are not great, unfortunately. And it may be the one thing that hurts them. But, it's an amazing little place. And, we plan on going often and leaving happy!

This place is brand new, and unfortunately has very low traffic. Everything is new and shiny.I had the beef pho, its was excellent. Nothing really outstanding about it, but pretty good.For $11 a bowl they could spice it up some.Tell your friends, this business is new and nice. But with no customers, it wont stay here long.

We ordered food from Vietnam Gate twice in a week. One of them was a carry out, the other a sit down. They are a very clean place and service is gracious too, so good points for that ! Â Request - please keep up the cleanliness and good service - it's important for the long term success !The food is average. Their fried rice and lo mein are close to the American-Chinese versions, so were not a surprise, even though I was told they would be more of the Vietnamese style. I must say the dishes were low in soy sauce and MSG in general, so at least that was better.The pho was good, my first time eating pho, so can't compare at this point. However they charged extra for an extra request of some bean sprouts and I didn't think that was fair. Bean sprouts are cheap and a little bit extra, especially for a large group of people, should come free.The portions are okay, could do a little better on adding a little more to the lo mein dish especially because this is not some combo dish.This place has good prospects if they strike a rapport with their regulars. It's critical that they distinguish themselves from the typical Chinese fast food place (of which there are numerous in Aurora, at stone's throw from Vietnam Gate) ! It would be better for them to expand and popularize their Vietnamese menu and not the Chinese ones, because that's what going to make them different from the average fast food spot in that area.I am hopeful that this place will prosper given that they take at least some of the above comments in a constructive way. The folks running this place seem hard working and polite and I wish them success in this new venture !
Delicious and authentic vietnamese cuisine plus great customer service!!! Can't wait to go there again!!!

Wow! Â I have driven by this small restaurant everyday since they opened a month or two ago. We finally got a chance to try it. Everything was so fresh and so vibrant. Â The restaurant was spotless. Â The waitress was very sweet. Â We ordered one of the spring roll choices. Â It was very good. Â Large pieces of shrimp and vegetables. Â We ordered 4 different meals. Â The beef pho, the chicken pho, the sliced fillet mignon and one of the sandwiches. Everything was excellent. We had already inhaled all but some of each generous helping of pho before I realized I had forgotten to take pictures. Â We will absolutely go back. Â Please try this new Aurora dining experience.

We really enjoyed our lunch here. We tried the beef pho..chicken Â pho...pork sandwich...combo fried rice...spring rolls and egg rolls...everything Â was great and so fresh. Good quality ingredients. Â Very attentive staff and the place was sparkling clean. We will Â definitely be back!

I wanted to love the banh mi, but did not. The bread is where it all starts, and the quality of bread was lacking. No jalapeÃ±os implied or offered? That's my favorite part! Long stems left on the cilantro? No, thanks. I'll return, but only if there are a few tweaks made. I also might return to give the pho a chance. I like to root for the underdog, but I'm not sure if this place will make it.

Fantastic. The pho is great. Spring rolls and Vietnamese iced coffee, outstanding. Have been here several times and never disappointed. Great service, good prices. I will be back again and again. (I'd recommend a brighter sign in front. It's hard to see if you aren't looking for it).

Came in for the Pho on a chilly rainy day, with my husband. It was time for a little more variety in Aurora. The place is small but very clean. The server was very sweet and quickly delivered food. She tried to help my husband pronounce menu items, unsuccessfully:) The menu has a nice selection of Vietnamese items that you would expect for a small family owned business. We wanted to try a varied selection of items. The food was very fresh.. veggies, meats and herbs. My husband loved the pork spring roll and his noodle dish, which was huge with fresh toppings. I had a bahn mi beef sandwich...delicious tender spiced meat, crisp veggies, toasted roll... would have again in a heart beat at $5.50. The beef pho broth smelled so good, Chinese five spice I think. Came with a pile of fresh basil, cilantro, lime, and sprouts to add. The bowl was so large I took leftovers for lunch for $10 good deal. The parking lot is akward till you get to the back of the building. Drive through menu limited, but order take out from full menu you wont be disappointed.

Brand new street style Vietnamese Pho food. The restaurant is located in a recently renovated house. Â The renovation work is really nice and tastefully done. Seating is limited but still ample. The menu is low on choices but the quality is exceptional. Â  I had the Beef Pho and it was very delicious. Â The beef was tender, lean, and not over cooked. Â The meatballs had great texture and taste. Â The broth was delicious and not too salty. Â The dish came with fresh basil and bean sprouts. Â Overall the restaurant is very clean, the staff was friendly. Â Prices are on par with the quality of food. Â I paid around 10.50 for my lunch dish.

Just found this place. Â So happy to find Vietnamese food in my neighborhood. Â The menu was small and simple, 5 Vietnamese items and about 10 Chinese items. Â Ordered the beef pho, spring roll, and BBQ sandwich. Â The pho was very tasty and good portion size, wonderful broth and nice garnish plate of basil, bean sprouts, and peppers. Â The spring rolls were very good, the peanut sauce paired wonderfully. Â The sandwich was delicious, the baguette was perfect, wonderful pickle radish and carrot, just the right amount of pepper, and the BBQ pork was amazing. Â Definitely coming back :-).

Great new place that opened up recently and it's amazing! So happy to now have an authentic pho place near home instead of having to drive to the City. Very nice environment, friendly staff and super clean. I highly recommend this little hidden gem to everyone in the area :) You won't leave hungry or disappointed.

We've been Malorted!!A friend of mine is visiting the Chicago area from Philly for the first time and had a list of Chicago things to try. And somehow, Malort had made its way on there. If you don't know, Malort is a hometown liquor, Swedish in origin, made from wormwood and almost impossible to get outside of Chicago. So she (and my intrepid boyfriend) decided they had to try it. I called around and the Lantern was able to supply us, so we trekked down one night for a snootful.Now, I only had a tiny sip of theirs. Â Bu we had read things about "The Malort face" (due to its bitterness) and wanting more despite its awful taste. I can safely tell you that none of us wanted another round, and our kindly waitress commisserated with us about it afterward. (The Lantern must do a business in Malort, though, because you can by tshirts that say "I Got Malorted at The Lantern" -- it's right up on the wall over the bar!)As to the bar itself, this is a casual corner hangout: dark, wood walls, free popcorn machine, darts and other gaming, Cubs game on all the TVs (occasionally inspiring deafening roars from the crowd). I've lived in Naperville for years and have never once been here, but some of my neighbors love it, and it definitely provided in this instance! So whether you are looking for a hometown tipple or just a comfy dive bar, the Lantern is shining a beacon for you.

We've been coming for over a year and it's such a great place.Great foodGreat atmosphereCheap beer and good selectionGood music on jukeboxWaitstaff/bartenders are all great!(Cobb salad is delicious)Not to forget - chili, hawg wings, quesadillas, buffalo wings, burgers, grilled cheese.

Its very evident why your server Chris works the slow afternoon shift, as she completely lost herself when it got busy. Of course it was fairly busy during the late afternoon on St. Patricks Day. I met some friends there who had been there for about 20 minutes before I arrived. Chris came over with a round of beers and quickly disappeared without noticing that two people including myself had joined the table. I've been a server before so I always give people a break when it comes to crappy service. What we received wasnt just crappy service, but appalling how disrespectful and rude Chris was to us. After trying to flag her down multiple times for a drink, I finally went to the bar. I finally got Chris to stop at our table and I asked for a menu because I wanted food. She brought over a menu and stood there while I scanned it over. I had never been here before so I wasnt sure what I wanted. When I asked if she could give me a minute, she rudely threw her hands up in the air and grunted loudly. She came back a couple minutes later and I had decided that we were going to leave after being treated so poorly. She yells "REALLY" right in our faces and stomps away like a 12 year old. Mind you, Chris is 61 years old, as she proudly told us later in our interaction.Chris's attitude towards her guests rivals that of a server at Ed Debevics. She is rude, crass and has no respect. I wont even get into the screaming she engaged Â in when one of our friends asked what her problem was. She asked where we served so she could come over there and give us hell.I confronted the manager who came and apologized as Chris has an "off putting sense of humor". I'm sorry, but if you know your server is like this, you shouldnt continue her employment.We will NEVER return and will tell friends and family to do the same. There are so many other great spots in Downtown Naperville who actually treat their customers with respect.

If you're looking for a relaxed scene and some good laughs, this is the place for you. The $2.50 bud light pints is what brought me in, but the free popcorn has be coming back.The clientele is a little bit of everything, especially with NCC so close, but everyone is very nice.

"Where everybody knows your name..." The good 'ole Lantern. Such a staple in Naperville.I just love coming here - especially with large groups! As long as we get there by 8 we're always able to pull together huge long tables. Which is hard to do anywhere else dt nape on a weekend night.The Lantern has a super divey home-town feel which is most of its charm. This bar had all the essentials: friendly staff, cheap drinks, bar food, darts and free popcorn. Nothin fancy, just everything you need for a successful night out.Their food isn't gourmet bit it's damn good. I suggest the grilled cheese, Reuben or cheese curds! Contrary to popular belief they serve more than domestics beer! I've sipped on a handful of craft beers here and the Lantern may not advertise fancy beverages, but those bartenders know how to mix a good drink!
Always, friendly people at the Lantern. Food is good and the prices are fair. Check out the specials!
Nice friendly bar with great atmosphere.Pub grub good and well priced. Good variety Tap Beers. Will visit again.

I've been coming here since the late 70's and literally returned home after a 25 year absence. The place hasn't changed. Good bar fare, cold beer decent specials and service with an attitude. Like all downtown Naperville establishments the parking is risky at best adding stress... Hence why I didn't give it 5 stars. We had 4 drinks and 3 meals under $40. Can't beat that. Brings back great memories. Definitely will return.

Place use to be pretty good. Now they hire thugs to check your ID, and the crowd is a bunch of arrogant middle aged men (in naperville lmao). Staff is rude too, not the same people from a few years back. Avoid.

Been coming here my whole life. The food is what it is great bar food. The chili is excellent and the staff is fun. Chris who serves at lunch is an institution. During the week and at lunch it's a local place but accepting of anyone. Weekend nights its a good time.
First time in. Small menu, but everything ordered we really enjoyed. Cheese curds for an app, husband got bacon cheese burger, and I got the reuben. Good place to watch a game or have a few beers.

I dropped in here with colleagues for lunch. Â The mushroom and Swiss burger I had (with tator tots) was quite generous and good for $7.25. Â The place was quite crowded, maybe unusually so due to US Men's Olympic hockey being on TV. Â Overall, looked to be a great place to have a beer and watch sports as there are a ton of TV's also.

Unlimited popcorn is not something that's going to keep people coming back. Â Neither is basic beer specials (Bud or Miller), but somehow the Lantern has survived and thrived in downtown Naperville. Â That's probably due to the fact that it isn't as pretentious as some bars, and wannabes can talk about their favorite "dive" bar. Â Look, Napervillians, just because a bar doesn't have a martini list does NOT make it a dive bar.The Lantern was super crowded on the Monday before Christmas, which is the total opposite of what was happening at Features. Â The interior is dark, with large uncomfortable wooden booths. Â It isn't a dump or a dive, it's actually rather clean, but there just isn't anything going on here.Underwhelming. Â Crowded. Â Not a great hangout spot for large groups. Â They had some bar food specials, like sliders for $1. Â Meh.

The Lantern was where my friends and I chose to hangout when I was in college at North Central. Nothing too fancy but it gets the job done... Bar food, darts, beer, TVs, and free popcorn... Pretty much what everyone else has said. A divey-bar in the heart of Naperville.The only reason I don't give it a 5 is sometimes the bartenders don't seem to give a crap about you and act like they're doing you a favor. This isn't all of the time, however, so I usually look past this.

I didn't LOVE this place, I didn't hate it either... if you like a crowded bar full of 20-something year olds, this is it! Â Not being in that age bracket, I didn't care much for this place and just lucky to have a table to sit down at. Â It appears from other reviews too that this is just a crowded bar all the time.I came here on a Friday night just after 10pm on a pub crawl and the place was jumping for sure.This place is deep and narrow, and has a crowded bathroom. Â I didn't eat there and only had one domestic beer which I didn't even buy so I don't even know if this place was reasonable or not in price. Â Considering the location of this particular place, I get why it's the hot spot being right on the main intersection of downtown Naperville. Â If you're looking for the crowd...this is your place.

Had lunch here today with an old friend; lots of people watching the Bears game. Got a small table in the back so we could talk. Â Popcorn available, but didn't have any. Â My Lantern burger was very good and at $5.25 with a side, quite a deal. Â Onion rings and cole slaw good, too.

My boss has me come in a few times a month to grab burgers, and we have never been disappointed! Amazingly friendly and fun staff, I always walk out with a smile. The food is just as awesome as they are, and at a very fair price
Absolutely one of the best bars in town. Â The staff is outstanding. Â  Try it and you will see.

Be warned if you are from Wisconsin or have an ID that's vertical you are refused service. The bouncer Lee will refuse you even if you bring in 10 paying customers. Not a friendly environment right from the door.
Juke get shutdown by bartender if you don't play her Miley Cyrus crap.. Â Wings are good but seem to be getting smaller since last visit.Mixed crowd, Â  70's thru 20's
We like this place. It's got a decent bar and the atmosphere is laid back. The staff is always nice. Free popcorn and the normal beers on tap. 5 stars if this place had a roof or a patio.

The lantern is a real Tavern! Comfortable hometown atmosphere. Fun and unpretentious. Â They serve the best chili and burgers in Naperville!I have been going here since I was a kid, it is definitely one of my favorite places in downtown Naperville!

When ever I go to this bar, it is always so packed. The bar is a long narrow row which can make walking through very tough. That's the biggest issue here. I've had fun playing darts and all that but if I am going to go out in Naperville I don't think i would ever think to pick here. I must just be claustrophobic! Haha

This has always been my go to bar when I come back into town for either football Sunday's, Friday night outings or just day drinking this is my favorite spot in Downtown Naperville. Â  The service is great, Vicki and staff are so welcoming. Â I can be gone for months and they still know who I 'am (Although I'm not sure if that is a good or bad thing) when I come back...They have free chili during football Sunday and unlimited popcorn ALL DAY long!Plus...they make the best bear fights aroundddd! Â There's no other bar to go to in DT Naperville.

I bought 1 beer at the bar and opened up a tab on my card. They failed to inform me that there is a $10 dollar minimum. My group and I had to leave early so when it came time to close my tab, they told me I had to buy more to fill up the $10 minimum. I told them, they did not inform me of this policy when I opened the tab, nor are there any signs hanging with this policy. I tried talked to the manager. Talking to the manager was useless. I told the manager that no one informed me of this $10 policy when I opened my tab. All she said was "you have to pay the $10".The other bars in the area have ALWAYS told me their minimum when I open a tab, even the bad bars.This was the first and last time I will ever be at this bar. Do yourself a favor and go to any of the other bars. This places management and crew need major improvement.
This place is great! Great service, prices, and juke box. I come here with my friends all the time. Try the popcorn it's da bomb!

This place is what 'Merica (as GWB often referred to us as) is all about. Â Exceptionally friendly folks staffing a cozy and totally unpretentious joint that is well appointed with large screens featuring sporting events and serving cheap but high quality food. That is my interpretation of The Lantern's mission statement-and it is delivered Â all day, every day.I've been hanging out at the Lantern since before I was legally able, back when ID checking consisted of a bouncer making a split second determination as to whether or not you looked to be 21. Â Let's call it 1982. Â And, while I don't frequent the place, I never tire of popping in for a few beers and a Jalapeno Cheeseburger in the company of a few homeys. Â Last night, dinner for three and three beers each tallied a remarkable $57 BT (before tip). Â Talk about value...It's a much better place on summer weekdays, after college has adjourned for the year, because there is a pronounced dearth of elitist fraternity/sorority scumbags (to borrow a line from Rob Downey Jr in "Back to School" (filmed at my alma mater, btw)).You won't be dancing to Macklemore and scoping hotties here, but it is my suspicion that if you're Â a gen xer, like myself, you'll dig The Lantern.

Forget the last review. Upon discussion with friends and family who have lived in the Naperville area for a longer time than I have, I decided to get the Lantern another shot. Glad I did, since I must have gone on an off night. Every time since has been great service, the beer of the month is usually interesting, and Sunday Funday always starts here. Sorry I doubted you, Lantern.

The best place to come meet your next ex wife... or just have a drink.The burgers are great, the staff is awesome, and there are a ton of TVs so you can watch just about any team. I'm a Bruins fan and they still played the Bruins game even though they are a Blackhawks bar. The cheapest place to drink in DT Naperville, and they have a great selection of beers and spirits.
Good dive bar for the start or end of a night, grab a cold one and some bar food, it's all about chilling. Â Friendly staff and quality servic
Best bar to watch a Blackhawks game! Good prices beer, decent food for bar food. A lot of fun and a great staff. One of the better bars in Naperville

For some reason, I always think The Lantern is going to be better than it is. Â But it's not. Â You hope it's going to be a great dive bar. Â But it isn't. Â You hope it'll have some character, but it doesn't. Â Instead, what it is is just sad. Â The liquor selection is...blah. Â I don't expect microbrews and bottles of Pappy on the top shelf. Â However, I do expect to be able to get some form of decent bourbon. Â I do expect that the bartenders know how to make a few drinks. Â Instead, this place is the lowest common denominator. Â Cheap beers to get folks coming in. Â Just dive-y enough to pull in the "I'm not going to Bar Louie" crowd. Â One of those horrible computerized jukeboxes that holds nothing but current top 10 hits, so you're subjected to a wall of cheesy pop and new country, played just loud enough to make you strain to talk with your friends. Â It's not terrible by any means. Â But it's also not inspiring by any stretch.If the Lantern was a car, it would be a beige Chevy Malibu on a rental lot. Â If it was a band, it'd be The Offspring. Â If it was clothing, it'd be a sweater from JC Penney. Â If you want a cheap Bud Light or a Rum and Coke, this is your bar, I guess.

If you like a good drink and a fun atmosphere, this is your place. If you are claustrophobic and don't like crowds, this is NOT your place. This place packs them in for friends to meet and spend time to catch up. They have plenty of TVs and a great staff to keep it coming. The food is pretty good too!This bar sits in the middle of the trendy downtown Naperville area but it's not like the others. They aren't trying to compete with flashy crap. They are what they say they are..... A bar....A definite visit every time I fly home to Chicago!

Some of the best drink specials in town. Basic beer and drink selection, nothing stellar. Who cares about the free popcorn? Also, food isn't even worth talking about. Bartenders are not engaging at all to the younger crowd. Sorry, if you want good tips you have to at least be nice to us and make us feel welcome.

I've never been here to eat...except for when I go there during the late night hours and they have UNLIMITED POPCORN. That is the best.I think what gets me about this place is just how freaking full it is at all times. It bottle necks big time at the front, and then you are just up to your neck in bros, college kids, and former fraternity members. Once you get past that...I enjoy this place from time to time. It's laid back and you don't have to worry about a dress code (Blackfinn), a mega dance party (Bar Louie), thugs (Features), awful service (Jimmy's), or popped collars (Rizzo's).

Excellent food and great service no matter when you come. It's so cozy and they never have a problem with me sitting for as long as I want. I've occasionally been the jerk huddled in her booth with a laptop and several files and legal pads next to her. Oops.

It feels like home. (No, thanks, I am not an alcoholic.)Unlimited popcorn.Sick of standing around in a circle of 40 men/boys at Features wishing you were able to hit on one of those seven hot chicks? Go to the Lantern.

It's a great dive bar in the middle of the uptight and trendy part of Naperville. Like one reviewer said it has that Chicago bar feel and I don't see that as a negative. The crowd gets a little loud and rambunctious at times. Notice the Naperville squad is almost permanently parked outside during the weekend. But come on, isn't Saturday all right for a fight?Prices are standard for the area. The staff is always friendly and pretty chill. You may not be able to kick back and have a quiet evening here. No, you won't find deep political discussion among the patrons. Here the only conversation is between you, your friends and Mr. Daniels.The Lantern is everything you could want without the pretentious snobbery of some of the downtown bars. It's a decent neighborhood bar that will hopefully continue to outlast their competitors.
Divey locals during the day, college vibe at night, both drinking draft beers and shots. Games are on during the day and gets crowded at night. I recommend the free popcorn.
amazing burgers and wings. cheap beer. this place is awesome!
Not really much to say about this downtown Naperville classic. Â Good drink prices, better burgers, free popcorn. Â Stop in for a taste of nostalgia before the kids from NC get there.

We stopped in for a beer and a sandwich after just arriving in Illinois, having traveled most of the day. Â It was the middle of the afternoon, but they serve food all day. Â The bartender was great! Â She offered to split our cheeseburger and give us both a side, even though we wanted different sides. Â The food was good, my husband loved the bacon cheese fries. Â The patrons at the bar were friendly and we enjoyed chatting with them, along with the bartender. Â This was definitely a place where we could hang out if we lived in the area.
Warm cozy atmosphere. Great drinks, popcorn and darts!

The DJ got us fallin' in love again.....Okay, so this is not a bar where I would expect to be hearing Usher on the overhead--but still. Local flavor is just what the doctor ordered when you step inside and are in the mood for a beer. Inside is casual and cool, a place where you could have a total love affair with a pint and a belly full of laughs.And food...apparently they have some. This I'm not sure of, but even so. I met up with a friend and we sat in one of the wooden booths sipping cold ones and getting caught up. The bartenders are fun, there's ample seating...and there's sports playing on the many TV screens.You really can't complain about a bar like this in Naperville. In the sea of upscale eateries, frilly cocktails and Hooters--you can find yourself getting comfortable in the medium.The Lantern is the medium. And that is a-okay.Why do I feel like I should stand up at the bar and start an anthem inside because it stays busy and isn't filled with douche-baggery.Definitely a place that I would recommend, possibly stop by if needing a moment after work and a diet soda is not helping.

This bar really reminds me of the neighborhood bars in Chicago. Â It is pretty basic. Â A long bar with several booths along the opposite wall. Â And all the space between is for standing-room-only mingling area.Our waitress came by when we first arrived (about 10pm-ish) and got us the first round of drinks. Â After that, she was long gone and we had to venture through the bachelor parties and pub crawlers to get our drinks. Â It wasn't terrible though. Â The bartender got to us quickly and we were able to make the best of it.When we arrived at 10pm, the noise level was manageable. Â All the booths and bar stools were full. Â But not more than 30 minutes later, the place was packed. Â And you couldn't hear a word from across the table. Â Even if you shouted. Â It wasn't the music, it was the sheer volume of too many people in a tiny space all talking at the same time.Was this place horrible? Â No. Â It was fine. Â Will I return? Â Probably. Â It makes a great stop on a pub crawl or even a few pre-dinner drinks. Â However, I wouldn't go there for an entire evening.
Still a great bar...until 10pm.That's when the cockbag volume goes up.

I just wanted a good burger in downtown naperville! They are well priced, under $10/entree, always have some sort of specials, and have very friendly staff. I walked in, the place smelled like urine, but I got over it after I started to eat some free popcorn. I got cheese curds, definitely not as good as Wisconsin, but I expected that. The burger was pretty good! A bit greasy, but probably higher on the list than other restaurants in the area. I will go back, and recommend this place. I just hope it doesn't always smell like urine!

Hmmmmngh.Went here for lunch with my dad, and - well, I know it's a bar, and it must be a good one, but their food was just not very good. Dad enjoyed his wrap, but my BLT was mediocre and their soup was not so good. Also, the atmosphere/decor leaves a little something to be desired in the daylight.Like I said, though, I'm sure their bar scene is better. And the people working there were very friendly and likable, which is a definite plus.

Before 10 this is the closest thing to a Chicago corner Â bar in the Burbs. You know the ones with the awesome rusty OldStyle sign hanging by one chain link out front... (Blind Robin, Tumans, Etc.) After? well.... I won't complain I still love college bars! Staff is awesome! Â Check this place out for a warm up or cool down on a night out...

My brother (now out of state... Maybe this place scared him off finally) use to rant and rave about this place (wait, he is gone because of this place but he likes it? Â Maybe I should change what I am saying but I am too lazy)Anyways, now back to my review ;)I just don't get it... Â The place is a typical 'hole in the wall'... Â It can get really crowded and that popcorn machine... Â Yikes!People can be obnoxious here... Â Its loud... Â Just not fun for me! Â To many 21 year olds walking around with newly-minded drivers licenses trying to pick up every woman that walks in the door.The second star is for people watching!
The Lantern is exactly what it needs to be! Good drinks, yummy bar food, darts, and free popcorn! No frills, but it doesn't need them! So happy that it's open again; it's a Naperville legend.

What a great place to end our bar run at. The sounds of Metallica's One blasting out the jukebox and the entire bar singing "darkness imprisoning me..." Â Great times. The crowd here is laid back and the drinks are good. Drink prices are on par with other bars in the area and the drinks are mixed well. The staff here is friendly and let people have a good time. This bar can get loud at times but it is a bar not a church.I wouldn't go out of my war to go drink here but if you happen to be in downtown Naperville stop in for a drink.

This is one of my favorite bars downtown naperville, because it is usually low key, they have bar games, and it isn't trying to be a douchey club like some of the other bars in this area. The only issue is sometimes it gets too crowded in here and everyone seems to cluster around the front area, but that's not something the employees have too much control over so that's nitpicking. I usually have a good time here.

Awesome bar!This is a great place to unwind while watching all the "brahs" that are heading over to bar louie. Â Great atmosphere with a lovely laid back and throw a couple cold ones down feeling. Â Not sure if Naperville can handle this kind of pure American greatness, but I'm sure this place will be around for a very long while.During the week this place is not as busy , even into the night. Â The weekends do crowd up, but its the type of crowd you do not mind getting stuck with. Â Overall, excellent bar.

Note that my review is for those that are a little older, and look for chilled out people. Not all of us fit that profile so ignore if you can't relate.For those that can, you will understand. Everyone goes to a bar for different things... If you are going for college kids, or those people that thought they were cool in HS and forgot to grow up, perfect for you. I try to avoid this scene whenever possible. For me it was a bunch of amateurs that did not know how to hold their liquor. Not a great beer selection, and the bartenders were not well versed. Over 25? Look somewhere else.

Douchebag volume goes up at 10 PM? Â I think we were there far before then and it was already swarming with DBs....If you've just turned 21, you might enjoy this place - it's got plenty of frats/DBs trying desperately to score. Â I had to kiss my boy in front of a group of guys, and even then they didn't quite get the hint.The two stars is for the delicious beer I had, Goose Island's Nut Brown Ale. Â But other than that, this place was pretty terrible. Â $4.50 for a beer but $7.50 for a shitty glass of box/house/bad red wine? Â No dice.If you're from around here, I'm told this place was a hit growing up to hit at the end of the night. Â I'm sure it's just as packed as it was years back, and with a similar crowd. Â No way I'd return to this place. Â I'd rather go to Bar Louie.

I love the Lantern. Â Total dive bar that has great cheap food, free popcorn and a mediocre draft beer selection. Â  Service is usually pretty good and the place is good for groups and kids (Kids at least before 9:00pm, the even let kids go behind the bar to get a lollipop). Â Good burgers, Reubens and Italian Beef. Â Chili is good also.

I think this is one of these places where you have to be local to like it.We are not local so we were pretty amazed of the many people and families coming on a Sunday. The ambience is below standard, the rooms were musty (perhaps from the rain) and the air was thick. The service was average at best. I guess the more regular the better and faster service. Chairs uncomfortable and......Turns out the fried chicken and Holly the balloon lady are the two big draws.We of course had the fried chicken and also tried the burgers.The food is pretty plain and basic american fare (except from they apparently Â have an outstanding mexican night which we yet have to try). Chicken very greasy and nothing to write home about. In fact it didn't taste that wonderful so we didn't finish it.

Yes, I do come here for the food! Â Great burgers with plenty choices for sides. Â I think the Reuben is about as good at it gets. Â Grilled rye bread with plenty of meat, cheese, and a dab of kraut, horseradish and Russian dressing on the side, again with choice of side dish. Â The Cobb salad is almost enough to share with a grilled piece of chicken breast on top. Â The Buffalo wings are actually pretty dang good, but I like the sauce on the side. Â Sometimes as a special, they have deep fried pork cutlet sandwich that is very tasty. Â The tuna melt is nicely filled, and again the bread is grilled. Â On a cold night, I crave their chili and add cheese and onions.Prices are super reasonable for food. Â Nearly everything on the menu is under $6 and that INCLUDES the TAX!!!Super nice and accommodating staff from the manager on down. Â They love families with kids, (but not after 9pm). Â Great to come here for Bears games! Â People line up outside the door waiting to come in. Â Great atmosphere.An old, historic place that is good value and good food in "Up and Yupping" Naperville.

A long time staple for those people who have been living in Naperville. Â Beer is beer and booze is booze, but the difference is the crowd. Â Anyone and everyone has been to the Lantern and it is not pretentious or judgmental. Â I have seen wedding parties along side guys in hats and shorts. Â You want a place to come, have a beer, have some popcorn and listen to some music on a jukebox, this is your place.

This place is fun. Â The drinks seem a little pricier than they should be or need to be but drinks in Naperville in general seem to be pricey so that's that.There's a good amount of tables if you're with a group and want to sit. Â The bar is also quite large so you should be able to find a stool to sit at if you so desire.In the end, this place to me is like the Mike Fontenot of bars; it's not very big nor good looking but it doesn't matter, it gets the job done.

I went here last weekend and it was ok. The burger I ordered was great and the wait staff was really nice. However, after 10pm it is douchebag city. Â Whoever wrote the DB volume goes up after 10pm was spot on. Â Seriously annoying crowd at this time. I've never seen so many girls in clothes that look like crap on their beer bellies and guys who are too tan and hair is too gelled for my liking. I love "hole in the wall" bars but it felt more like a club atmosphere at that point.

It is better than going to some wine bar or high priced corporate bar like a Bar louie. You get to see the real locals of Naperville and it does have a young male crowd the times I went. They can get a bit rowdy, but it is a cheap drink place with decent food for a bar. It is bigger than it looks from the street and there is plety of room during the day for lunch. It has booth seating and that is pretty impressive for a dive

been to this bar plenty of times and loved each and every time. It's a great chill bar and good place to hang out and have reunions with friends you haven't seen in awhile. Not to mention, the popcorn machine is amazing and one of the best additions to a bar I have ever seen. Â Not much more to say that hasn't already been said below, other than it can get a little crowded and seats can be hard to find but overall a great dive bar. This is my go-to bar when I'm in the town of Naperville.

It's a dive bar on the strip. Naperville's very own and can be fun and it's very loud. Not complaining about it, I'm just explaining the place. It's been there for awhile and I'm sure it's not going anywhere for a while. A good place to start or end your binge drinking.

This is my idea of a great dive bar. Smokey (I don't smoke, but a bar should be smokey) loud, hot girls behind the bar, Guinness on tap.I always seem to run into or make a friend every time I walk in. Good bar food, no hassles.
Love this bar. Â Decent price on drinks, friendly staff. Â Only "dive" bar left in naperville that I am aware of. Â It is a pain finding a seat on a busy night.
Good service............nice people working there....................great food.Much of the clientele are regulars so it has a friendly, nehgborhood atmosphere.
It's a dump. Â Not even a dive bar, just a dump. Â Old decor, dirty, dingy, cramped and usually crowded. Â With all the other choices, why?

The Lantern is what Naperville used to be and still is for a lot of us. Â Yes, we like the new trendy bars and restaurants that have been imported from elsewhere. Â But, it's great to go to a place that has very good bar food, great (free) popcorn and sports on the tv. Â Prices are very low...Free chili on Sundays during NFL games. Â Burgers are excellent! Â And very inexpensive. Â Family friendly on College football Saturdays and NFL Sundays. Â When we ask the kids where they want to have lunch, hang out and watch games, they request the Lantern.
Always a great spot in dtown Naper

Another bar in Naperville that still hasn't lost its local feel...entirely. Â On Outside of Friday and Saturday night this place still has the old town local feel complete with free popcorn & darts! Â On the weekends they really pack it in but it still has a different feel from the Features and Jimmy's in Naperville. Â Cougars are a plenty at this place and its a fun place to spend any night of the week.
When I moved to Naperville from Chicago, I was afraid I was going to miss a good dive neighborhood bar until I found the Lantern. Loud, smokey and a great mix of people. Â Good bar menu as well!

They ran out of green beer before 11pm in St. Patrick's Day! Â Nice small bar without a lot of room and it gets pretty smokey. Â Club Mamalu, next door, is actually pretty sweet in comparison to The Lantern.
Very smokey, noisy dive bar - but excellent food, my mother loves the soup and the sandwiches.
Cheap food!! Â And its actually yummy! Â Excellent cheeseburgers and fries. Â The chili on Sunday is free during bears games, and is really tasty. Â Its a great neighborhood hang out bar.

Good old fashion neighborhood bar in the middle of downtown Naperville. Â  A little smokey, but it's bar; what do you expect... Â Free popcorn. Darts. Cold beer. Â Good location. Â Friendly service. Â GoldenTee

On a recent weekday, I dined at Braconi's and had a pleasant experience. Though it was late afternoon, I was surprised that I was the only diner. I was seated in a booth near a window with the shutters closed. It was a nice private spot.The pizza I ordered was a thin crust with black olive, pepperoni, and onion. Based on my pizza and the numerous other pizza pictures on Yelp, Braconi's does a great job with visual presentation. My pizza was very photogenic! They layered a generous amount of black olives all over the pizza. The balance of pepperoni, onion, cheese, and sauce was to my liking as well. The crust was crispy on the ends and the pizza itself held together well enough that you could eat the end pieces without utensils and not have a mess. I thoroughly enjoyed it and what made the experience even better was they offered a Yelp check-in deal! It was 15% off a purchase of $20 or more. I'd definitely return.

Hands down the BEST pizza I've ever had. Granted, I am gluten free, so I can't speak to the regular crust. But as a GF person knows, it's hard to find a crust that doesn't taste like cardboard. This crust is a thin crust but thick in flavor. They also layer their toppings for maximum flavor. The only thing I would change about this place is the price, it's a little expensive for a GF pizza, so that only means I can't have it as often as I'd like.One last call out, I've only ever ordered to-go. But their staff is always really friendly!

Pizza. pasta. salad. Â dessert. Â You can get anything you want here. Â Their cooks are amazing, They literally can make anything you want Â They have this chicken pasta dish that is rediculous Not available all the time, but ask for it. Â I forget the name. Â  I think they call it chefs special. Â  It is the best location. Â  Atmosphere. Â Great servers, Â The owners are literally the best in the world. But I love Braconis. They have buffet also. Â  I think only weekdays lunch. , Call, but their ingredients are the best. they have so much stuff!

We have ordered twice through GrubHub. Make sure you specify that you do not have a Gluten Allergy if you don't. Otherwise this place will send you salad when soup has Gluten in it. Â They will tell you that GrubHub should contact you about the change when you call to complain about getting salad that you cannot digest because of a rare stomach condition. Â Their attitude was "Oh Well'.....I thought the customer is always right? Â When does a restaurant decide for the customer and then pass it off to GrubHub to deal with? Â GrubHub isn't there making changes. Â The Upcharge on GF Pasta brings a Chicken Oreganato Dinner to $17....the food isn't that great for that price.

Never judge a book by it's cover, which from the outside looks like pizza to go. Â Inside, Braconi's has an expansive seating area in the back. Â The seating looks new and kinda no frills, but that's okay because the food has plenty of "frills". Â We came for pizza, and ordered seven cheese lasagna and eggplant parm. My better half says it is the best cheese lasagna she has had. Â The eggplant was a solid offering. Â The red sauce was on the sweet side which I love. Service was superior.First time here in the shopping center with Fresh Thyme. Â Five star food and service deserves five stars. Â Will we ever try the pizza? Â Hmmm.
I love their gluten-free pizza! I get it delivered regularly. It is thin and crispy, just the way I like it.

The food here is actually not too bad, but the service just keeps getting worse and worse. Â I waited for 10 minutes to be seated before turning around and walking out. Â It's too bad, I think that their spaghetti and meatballs are the best in the area, but the clueless teenage servers are killing this business. It's OK to make me wait while you deal with taking an order from a table. Â It's not OK to make me wait while you BS with your buddy in the kitchen. Â These kids don't care about customers. Â I doubt I will ever return here, it's just not worth it.

This is my first review of Braconi's, although I am there almost every week with a dance crew from across the street and every time I am there, at best it's "ok" Â Well today was not 5 star.. I came in with 3 little girls, they all ordered off the kids menu. I ordered a half & half pizza, I waited 30 minutes for it and when it came it was wrong and so she had them re-make it, which took ANOTHER 25-30 minutes. They didn't take anything off my bill for this. A friend of mine joined us late and she was getting buttered noodles to go. The waitress adds her noodles to my bill so we had to have a really awkward conversation about giving me my $5 back. Then I leave and take the girls back to dance and she waits 15 minutes for a kids buttered noodles.Terrible

As I type this, I am waiting for your delivery man to knock on our door...Really enjoy the food at this restaurant, ingredients are fresh, service is always friendly and quick.My favorite pizza is a good old Shrimp and Mushroom pizza (try it!)... Braconi's is the only place in Naperville that I have found which puts on huge chunks of fresh shrimp and not a bunch of mini canned shrimp!I have only tried their thin crust pizza, I have not tried the stuffed. Pasta here was also very good, in fact everything we have tried has been great here.We found this place one night buying Christmas tree's at the lot next door and glad we came in for a nice warm meal!hurry up delivery man.... I am hungry! ....

I've driven past this place for a while now and was always curious. I found really great reviews on here and a coupon code so decided to give it a shot.We ordered the fried ravioli as an appetizer. They were good but 8 half moon ravioli for $8 isn't really worth it. The marinara sauce was decent.For pizza, we ordered the signature with sausage and basil. We ordered it well done on a wheat crust. Pizza was very good but I'd like to try regular crust or even stuffed next time.UPDATE: I visited Braconis again, and I need to recommend the chopped salad. The amount of add-ins and dressing is perfect.We also tried the regular crust but ask for the pizza well done so it ended up tasting close to the wheat. The amount of toppings is perfect and it's priced great.Overall, I would come back for the pizza and use my coupon. Service is great too!

Braconi's was another GrubHub find. Despite all my lousy experiences with GH, I decided I'll give Braconi's a try, as I wanted to try something new.I placed my order at 5:50 with a promised delivery time of 6:45 PM - 6:55 PM. Seeing as how it's a Friday night, it's cold, and the Blackhawks are on, I didn't anticipate my food being here in that time frame. I'm understanding when it comes to delivery, as long as it's not over 90 minutes when I live less than 2 miles away.I was craving a Margherita style pizza, so I decided to try a small Bruschetta pizza, which is has chopped fresh tomatoes, fresh basil, olive oil and fresh garlic. They make you choose an additional topping (for an extra charge, of course), so I went with extra basil. I figured this was the closest thing to a Margherita pizza.My doorbell rang at 6:40 (!!). After signing for my order, and wishing the driver a good night, I opened the box. I was very pleased to see TONS of basil on my pizza. I didn't even grab a plate, I picked up a piece right then and there to sample. Oh my. The pizza was GOOD. I mean, wow. The basil was fresh, the cheese was neither sparse nor was it copious. The tomatoes were subtle in flavor, letting the basil be the star of this show. There was a hint of fresh garlic, which was a nice surprise. I l-o-v-e garlic, but I was afraid it would overtake the other ingredients. This was not the case.I am so glad I gave Braconi's a chance. My order was perfect, delivery was quicker than expected, the quality of the ingredients exceeded my expectations, and the driver was the kindest soul ever. I can't wait to order from here again and try some of their other menu items.
Best pizza in town. Had delivery and could only have one slice before it was destroyed. Lovely customer service as well. A must try.
The service was awful. I believe service and the quality of food go hand and hand. I how can Â you enjoy your food with bad service. So disappointed in this place.

Came on a Saturday night-no lines, no wait ... were we the only ones here!? We got the pepperoni stuffed pizza, technically I saw pepperoni but we didn't taste it. This pizza rivaled that pizza joint that starts with a G and u can never spell. Definitely coming back :-) and yelp has a 15% off coupon. Yup, helps me walk in the door!

My boyfriend and I stayed at a hotel close by and ordered from here. The food is absolutely exceptional! Fantastic! We ordered a medium pepperoni and sausage which was so so good. We could not stop enjoying the cheese and the sauce.We also ordered some chicken tenders and fries and they were way beyond our expectations.It's a little pricier than we thought but we definitely got our money's worth!Whenever we come back, we'll definitely try this place again!Highly recommend it to anybody who's nearby!

Nice little place close to home for me. Â Great food and the owner seems like a really down to earth guy and cares. Â The only reason I can't give 5 stars is it is steep in pricing on pizza. Â Good pizza...just a little on the high $$$ side. Â Keep up the good work!

I went for the lunch buffet on a Wednesday. It was $9. I was seated right away, and my drink order was taken within minutes. Quality and taste of food are really good. They had 6 different salads, 4 different pizzas(including deep-dish), 2 other pastas, and an assortment of desserts. For the price, It was worth it. The best part about my experience, was the customer service, It seemed like a family owned business. Everyone was very caring and friendly. Would definitely recommend it for lunch.
The best pizza around period. This pizza is delicous, and in my opinion, the best pizza I have ever had.
We've eaten here many times, especially the lunch buffet is a must! They are the only pizza place I know of that offers a BLT pizza which is amazing!

Our group of 13 stopped in there for lunch around 12:30 on a Sunday and we were the only people there. I thought to myself that this was probably not a good sign, and after finishing eating nearly 2 hours later, I see why. Even though we were the only customers there, the service was kinda slow. The food was decent but nothing really stood out. If you order pizza, be prepared to wait(nearly 40 min). The prices weren't bad and they fid accept the Yelp coupon for checking in.
Best pizza in north Naperville! Â Thin crust is crispy, cheese is plentiful, and we love their sauce! Â Always friendly service too

Braconi's was my mom's favorite restaurant. Â On one of our last visits together we got delivery from there & pigged out. Â It was a good time! Â When my mom passed away shortly after that in 2007, we had a dinner here after her funeral.The staff were really great to me. Â The banquet room was already occupied so they let our family have several tables in the dining room and I just had everybody order their own meals from the menu since money was tight. Â The workers all remembered my mom & told me some good stories about when they had seen her come in. Â One included how she was "dancing" in her wheelchair to the music & enjoyed a drink in the bar.I also spent some time in the bar during the dinner. Â It seemed like the right thing to do to have some drinks in her honor.I received great service in both the restaurant & bar and was touched that everyone seemed to remember my mom who passed from this earth too soon. Â While I was still in town after her funeral, a friend of mine & I got delivery from Braconi's one last time. Â It was bittersweet since she wasn't there, but the food was very good & it was soothing to eat it one more time.I would definitely recommend Braconi's to anyone planning a trip to Naperville. Â And I would also suggest using their banquet services if you are local. Â Top notch service. Â Thank you, Braconi's.

Went here for a funeral lunch Last week.The first thing wrong was they sat a table of 5 or 6 in the middle of the room that We were all going to be sitting in . NOT COOL!!! Then they put the pasta and salas in another Ã¡rea seat from Where We were sitting.I went to go get salad and the bowl was almost empty and so were the dressings .I waited another 15 min before they finally brought out the galllon Â Store bought ranch.OK ITS NOT LIKE THEY DIDNT KNOW WE WERE COMING.Then they Had a pizza buffet.Half the people didnt even know it was there untill We saw regular customers going up there.TOTALLY NOT PREPARED.U Â think the servers would of let everone know Where the food was.The pizza was ok.And the pasta sauce not so much.THE best thing i Had was the fried dough balls.Dont think os go back.

This is by far my favorite place to order pizza from. The family that owns it is really friendly and I like that it's not a chain restaurant! I would highly recommend the deep dish pizza (the crust is amazing)- if you're going the pizza route and if you're not quite feeling in the pizza mood- the chicken oreganato!

Some of the best pizza you can get in the pizza capital of the world! My favorite is the stuffed Italian sausage pizza but the pan and thin crust are also top notch. The chicken parm and braconis salad are great choices as well. My two sons are addicted to the garlic bread. The weekday lunch buffet is a great deal but is not a reflection always of how good the pizza is as sometimes the food sits on the buffet too long. Well worth stopping in to grab some great pizza.

We love Braconis! The lunch buffet is one of our favorite spots. Anyone I bring is always skeptical but leaves wanting to know when we are returning. The lady who gives back rubs is a staple during lunch and always remembers who you are. We order delivery from there randomly and have only had a couple of issues. Mainly the issue has been with a female delivery driver. However the manager is fantastic and will always take care of you if there are any problems. He definitely takes a "will fix it so tell us please" attitude. We would highly recommend to everyone! We have also seen groups use the big room for parties. Looks like a great venue for a gathering!

Waited 15-20 min for our drinks(2 ice teas) ordered a salad which was supposed to come out before our pizza...it didn't, it came out after the pizza we waited 45 min for on a Wednesday evening...oh and they never gave us silverware to eat the salad with. I tried to flag down our waitress to get refills as well as some forks but she never looked up while walking around. I finally had to stand in her path to get her attention, she blamed the bus boys for not refilling our drinks or giving us silverware...how about checking in on customers once or twice? They took the salad off our bill but got all pissy when I told them I wanted it wrapped to go. I explained the situation to the manager and they ended up throwing in sooner over cooked mozz sticks...not again.

We have ordered a few times from here. Their portion sizes are nice, not too much, not to little, just right.The steak sandwich is awesome!The eggplant Â parm has a lot of noodles and cheese on top.The Bruschetta Pasta is excellent.The fried ravioli is yummy and cheesy.The fries are like double fried or something because they are extra crispy, I like them.The Potato Skins are delish!The chocolate cake is mediocre.I order from GrubHub and their delivery is fast. I ordered at 5:30pm with an estimated delivery of 6:50pm, It was delivered hot at my doorstep at 6:05pm (on a Wednesday).We will continue to order from here.

Ordered delivery. Threw the food away next day. Ordered chicken orgenato; it was swimming in oil and very little chicken. My boyfriend could barely eat it. Should've been labeled pasta with chicken and oil. Not marketed as a chicken dish. My baked mostaccioli came with no cheese. The salads were subpar. The bread was good. We won't be ordering here again.
Had the chicken parm sandwich to go and it was really good with marinara sauce on the side.The fries were just ok

This place seems rundown and outdated but the staff is friendly and the food is presented with pride. It's an out-of-the-way place at an out-of-the-way location for tourists like us; our dining counterparts seemed to be mostly aging locals. This is exactly what I look for when traveling. We were prompted to stop here by a Yelp discount deal.The stuffed pizza was as fantastic back home in Wisconsin as it was when served to us in Naperville the night before. The sauce boasts a deep tomato flavor and while a notch on the sweet side, contrasts well with the Italian sausage on the pizza. The crust is flaky yet substantial. We left full and satisfied, with a ton of leftovers. Good call, I'd say.
They have a gluten-free menu and even after I asked all the required questions, I was still contaminated with gluten. Â I would not recommend this for other people with Celiac Disease.

Really good pizza cooked just the way I like it. Gini the lady at the counter was really sweet to me and we chatted a bit while I waited for the pizza. I also had some tiramisu and took them both back to my hotel. Â Pizza very very good. Â Flavorful sauce. nicely seasoned, not too sweet. Â Tasty toppings (and they were generous with them) that were also just how I like my Pepperoni and Italian Sausage to taste. Â They were covered in a thick cheese blanket that was very good too. Â Pizza was a 5 star pie, no doubt about it Â The tiramisu was OK, not bad, but far from the best I've ever had, but it was fresh, so 3 stars for that. Â Gini was so nice that she bumped them back up to a 5 star review again. Â Definitely go.

Good food, worst service I've ever experienced. Â We sat for an hour and a half at our table with a single soda. No refills, no appetizers, no entree salads. I eventually had to chase down the server to ask for refills and got an annoyed look for my trouble. Our food finally came, followed by our appetizers 10 minutes later, and then I had to ask for the salad that came with the meal. A person in our party talked to the Â owner about the extremely poor service and the owner blew him off. Â Absolutely ridiculous experience at this place.

The WORST for delivery. Gave them address and credit card number and they told us 25 minutes for delivery. Over an hour later and after we called them they tell us they thought it was for carry out. And we have them our address why? Then 20 minutes later on the phone with them they finally agree to actually send us our pizza. That we paid for. No free pizza. No discount. Horrible customer service. Do NOT order from this place. EVER.

This is one of the best pizza places I've ever experienced. They have the best flaky, butter crust that just melts in your mouth. I've tried thin crust, deep dish and chicago style. All are amazing and will knock your socks off. Of course you will probably be in a food coma, but it's well worth it. They have a full menu but the pizza is where it's at. Their fried ravioli (cheese) appetizer is delicious, too. What tops it all off is that during the week they have a lunch buffet, and they also make killer margaritas. All around, probably my favorite pizza place to date. And I eat a lot of pizza! ;-)

This is BY FAR the best family owned pizza joint in Chicagoland! We ordered a stuffed pizza on Saturday to try something new and were beyond pleasantly surprised. My husband & I loved it so much that we went back 3 days later for another pizza.The crust is different - crispy yet soft in the middle, delicious. The sauce is something to really savor.I'd rank this stuffed pizza right up there with Gino's East & Giordano's.If you haven't been here yet, you really need to!And it's located across the parking lot from Binny's....it doesn't get more American than pizza & beer.

This is a review for Braconi's South.This is the first time I have ever ordered from Braconi South. My initial impression is that they care more about getting pizza's out the door than they care about the quality of the food.I ordered by phone for pick up a small, thin cheese pizza for my kids and a stuffed veggie pizza for my wife and I. The woman on the phone said it would be ready in 25 minutes. I thought to myself, "Gosh, that is rather quick for a stuffed pizza to be ready. Thin crust, okay, but stuffed, WOW! They must have a super high-speed efficient pizza oven." Sure enough, when I brought the pizzas back home both the thin cheese and stuffed pizza were undercooked. I am not sure how you undercook a thin cheese pizza but they figured it out. The dough on the stuffed was spongy and undercooked and you also tell that the dough on the thin cheese pizza was undercooked. Even the cheese on the thin pizza looked as if it never reached the bubbling point.I will say this, the taste was good once we finished cooking the pizza. I believe this location has been open for some time so I am not sure if anyone else has experienced the same issue as I did.Questions:Q: Will I go back?A. Not to this location. Maybe the location on Royal Saint George is better.Q. Was the staff friendlyA. No problems there. The women who took the order and the cashier (one in the same I believer) couldn't have been more friendly.Q. Did I call and complain?A. No, I would rather post my comments publicly like everyone else these days.Q. Would I recommend?A. No. But if you do order be sure to tell them you want your pizza fully cooked.
Pretty cheap food. Kind of reminds me of a Pizza Hut buffet kind of food. I think there's better options in Naperville but if you want cheap and variety to fill the belly.

We weren't impressed at all and there wasn't anything that would make us go back. Nothing was horrible but it wasn't a great experience. No one was overly friendly and the kitchen was backed up with about a half full dining area. The pizza was pretty good. I had an antipasti salad which was just ok. The balsamic dressing was basically just vinegar. Â The bathrooms were clean but you could smell them as you walked by. It's liked they cleaned it with a urinal cube. Â Just not impressive and will move on to find our next favorite place.

We went to this place on a Monday and there was only 1 couple there and had to wait 10min for the server to come, seems to be the server had no idea we were there waiting.The food has no flavor, the bread was very cold. Not enough as an entree, the Mac and cheese was the boxed one. The pasta with clam has bits and pieces of clam .If you want to have Italian go somewhere else

Horrible service! Â Got our order wrong then blamed us for it and offered to charge us for the "right" order for a 50% charge?! Who does that?! Will NEVER order again and will tell EVERY ONE about this ridiculous experience! Â HORRIBLE customer service!
Their pastas are good. Their pizza is just OK. I like that they deliver :)I ate at the restaurant once and never will again. It looks very run down and dirty. Also, their service is very slow.
The owners are some of the nicest people. I love supporting a family owned business. Hands down the very best pizza in the area - thin crust and stuffed. Delicious and worth every penny!
We have been coming from here for quite some time. Â  Family run, Â excellent food, Â friendly staff. Â  The hours are great.
Still one of my favorite pizza places in Naperville! Braconi's is our go-to for carry-out. We even had our wedding rehearsal dinner here! The staff is fantastic.

We go here fairly frequently and have decent experiences but this last time was beyond sub-par...I ordered a small supreme pan pizza w/sausage and my girlfriend got the small signature pizza....we shared a basket of the garlic knots which were really good but then it took well over an hour for us to get our pizzas (my time is worth something and waiting that long for a terrible pizza is no consolation)...the restaurant was very quiet so it being busy was not an excuse (at least for dine-in's)....our waitress clearly knew something was up as she repeatedly came out and apologized and told us it should be just another 5 minutes (which after several times turned into 25 minutes)....after I walked in to check on what exactly was going on (and the bus boy knew something was up when I came in) they brought our pizza's out...I couldn't have been more disappointed and our waitress knew it...my pizza was extremely watery and had next to no sauce on it...she agreed, brought it back in and brought it out a few minutes later with a cup of refrigerator-temp marinara sauce and explained to me "I spoke to the cook and he said it's because of the veggies on there, they absorbed the sauce and made it watery...for your future reference, it's supposed to be like that"....are you serious?!?! That's verbatim, how is that a legitimate excuse? I respectfully agree to disagree, I won't share my true feelings on that statement or what exactly happened for fear of it being completely rejected and not informing people of what happened....truly, I'm disappointed and sad to say, most likely will not be back...sorry folks, enjoy the remainder of your Labor Day weekend.

Great food. Awesome Staff. Went there for the lunch buffet with co workers. I will be back next time I'm in the area.Eric our server was polite, funny, and genuine.It's also a great value for your money
Never been to the restaurant, but sure have order to-go a few times and every time everything has been greaat!!

I always get the Penne with Asparagus. The sauce is amazing, and is the same sauce that comes with the Mama Braconi's Special (my boyfriend's usual order). Not a big fan of the house salad that comes with (I think you can get soup instead)... always a little watery, and it's your basic iceberg lettuce salad. BUT that's not what I come here for, so I'm still a fan.We will have to try the pizza sometime.Service is always friendly and quick. We keep coming back for more!

We came back for another visit and had a Caprese salad, a thin Hawaiian pizza (Canadian bacon and pineapples), and a mushroom pan pizza. Â It was not over salted this time. Â I like coming here Â - we've found the pizzas are decent, and restaurant is laid back, comfortable, and convenient for us. Â They don't have the biggest menu, but if you're looking for a little pizza variety (note that we haven't really tried anything else), I'd recommend it.

My wife and I have been to Braconi's on Ogden a few times. Â It's a locally owned place that has been around for a while. Â The first thing you notice when you walk in is that it is a pizza place first and foremost. Â The carryout/delivery desk is right at the front. Â There is a very small bar area (2-3 seats). Â The rest of the dining room isn't anything special. Â the booths are VERY uncomfortable...ask for a table if possible.The waitstaff is always attentive and helps you when you need it. Â They always seem to be overstaffed, which isn't necessarily a bad thing.On to the food. Â As i mentioned...pizza is king here. Â It tastes awesome, comes out fast and is decently priced. Â The pasta dishes are also pretty good; we tried the chicken and veal parmigiana. Â Most dishes come w/ a side of angel hair, which are usually caked in oil/butter, but taste good.Aside from that, the other dishes are not very good... Â I ordered the grilled salmon dish; BIG mistake. Â Stay away from that. Â It sure isn't grilled; i think it was microwaved or baked. Â VERY and I mean VERY dry and it was kinda crusty. Â When we saw that and I took my first bite, I asked them to kindly take it back and have another one made. Â It came out the exact same. Â Quite disappointing (esp. being the most expensive item on the menu). Â We ordered the calamari for an appetizer. Â It was ok, nothing to write home about. Â The salads aren't that great either; small and use iceberg lettuce that is too 'light'...no mixed greens or spinach of any sort. Â I do want to say though that tiramisu was very tasty, surprised me. Â I would definitely order that again.So yes, this place has awesome pizza and good pasta. Â Aside from that though, it's not that great. Â Stick w/ pizza and it's a good place!

I feel like a creep because the main reason I love this place is the owner. Mama Braconi (?) always greets us and is super friendly. She even sat with me once while I was waiting for my husband. Granted she talked about her foot problems, but Â this just added to the magical experience that Â I was visiting my grandma, with the added bonus of a buffet! And, just like my grandma, she always asks if we've had enough to eat before we walk out.We have only been for the lunch buffet, and since I love having large amounts of food to choose from, I am usually a happy camper. The crust could be better, it tastes a little like saltines and I wish there was more to it. I would love having Lou's crust with Braconi's sauce. That would be a dream come true.Prices are decent and there is a lot of variety. The pastas and other chicken/fish/salad dishes are fine, may not be top specialty restaurant quality, but they are good for the price. They have a large variety of pies for dessert, and since I love pie so I much, I would have it instead of birthday cake growing up, this makes me joyful.I WISH that they would re-decorate! It has a horrible feeling of a 70's bowling alley lounge and is always dark, and not in the fancy mood-lighting kind of way. I think that would help a lot with bringing new customers in

If you are looking for a nice casual pizza place to bring the family Braconi's is the place for you. THe dinning room here is simple, comfortable and family friendly. The service here is always good also. The Pizza here is quite good as well. I really enjoy the whole wheat crust option. They also load it up with plenty of cheese. All and all a great place for Pizza.

I'm impressed!The best pizza I ever had! Nice restaurant, very good service, talk about the pizza, wow, cheese were good and they made it just perfect! And the price is pretty cheap too! Whole wheat crust available, which I ordered last time, very good, I will go back again for sure!

We like their stuffed pizza better than Lou Malnatis, Giordanos or Gino's East. Â Their sauce is really thick and good. Â A small fed 4 of us easily. Â We also ordered their cheesy, garlic bread for $3.95. Â It was basically a sub bun with butter, lots of garlic, cheese and some other spices. Â It is good but not anything to write home about. Â My daughter always gets their spaghetti and meatballs and seems to enjoy it. Â It can be a little loud but is a fun place to go with a group.

We order from Braconi's on a regular basis. Their prices are a little higher than other places in the area, but the quality is always much better than others. We like that the pizza tastes more homemade than other places, and the delivery is always faster than what they quote.

Outstanding Italian/American food for the price.They have a great Â marinera sauce that kids love. We have had several H.S.Football,Little League and Travel teams eat in the Pradel room and the kids loved it.The gravy (meat sauce) is almost as good as Mom made it.They catered my son's graduation and my daughters b-day and graduation.We also booked the Pradel room for her B-day one year.It was my sons first stop when he came in from college. Braconi also catered Thursday night Pata Patry's for the 2007 Naperville North Football Team.The Â lunch buffet is very good and quickly refilledThe price is great as well as the food.Very family oriented as well as family owned.The staff has always been great.

I frequent Braconi's pretty often for their pizza buffet at lunch. Â What a deal! Â For basically $10, they have several pizzas including stuffed. Â They always have a couple pasta dishes (lasagna, chicken tetrazzini, etc.), green salad, and pasta salad. Â All of the food is very good quality. Â You almost forget that you're eating a buffet. Â I particularly love the potato salad (with bacon!), the great brownies, and home made donuts that I would kill for. Â Did I mention that it's one of my favorite pizza crusts? Â The existence of this restaurant makes it very difficult to stick to my doomed attempt at eating healthier.

Braconi's was better than I expected!I have to admit that I did not expect much from a pizza joint in a suburban strip mall, but Braconi's was delicious. Â The group I visited with all ordered the lunch buffet. Â It consisted of an array of cold salads, several different types of pizza (including deep dish), broasted chicken, and pasta. Â The cold pasta salad was very good as was each piece of pizza I tried. Â Even the broasted chicken was moist and wonderful.Our server was absolutely excellent. Â I honestly have not received better service in years. Â Well done!

I am reviewing on two recent experiences within weeks apart. Â The first was a dinner with friends and the second was lunch with family. Â Place is nice inside, nothing special. It has a small bar and bar eating area. Â It has a typical dining area and a small separate party room. Â It has an open kitchen and things look fairly organized and clean.Lets start with the dinner experience. Â We had small pizza as an appetizer. Â Pizza was delicious. Â I would say some of the best in the Fox Valley area. Â Entrees were also delicious and the size was very large. Â We all had a take home meal. Price for 4 with 2 drinks each and a dessert to split $111 without tip. Â  So, 5 stars on the dinner. Â Had such a great time and food we came back for a follow up lunch 2 weeks later. Â Came for the $9 lunch buffet. Â Buffet is kind of on the smaller size, but they do a nice job to get a good variety out there. Â They had about 4 salads, 2 pasta dishes and about 4-5 different pizzas. Â Plus, 3 desserts to choose from. Â Buffet is from 11-2 and we got there around 12:25. Â Buffet was about 85% empty and pizza was looking pretty crispy from sitting out under the heat lamps.Salads were all almost empty. Â Pasta seemed fine, but it's pasta. Â It keeps well in a covered chafing dish. Â Here is were the problem starts. Â It starts with the waitress. Â I mentioned to her about the condition of the buffet and she responds that it opens at 11 and they don't want to waste food. Â I understand not wanting to waste food, but there is no excuse not to have any cheese,pepperoni or sausage pizza out there. Â No excuse to have empty or almost empty salad bowls.
