There was late night karaoke. It was nice! They had songs in English as well! Every song has lyrics to sing along! The music was a bit loud, so if this is not your taste be aware!The food was alright, nothing great to mention.i had tacos, but it was overpriced. The receipt had tip added to it already.

The staff is very friendly. The salsas they serve are made in house and are very good. I love their pickled jalapenos. The margarita is enormous. I got the torta cubana. It's a Mexican sandwich/torta filled with steak milanesa (or chicken), ham, egg, al pastor, chorizo, guacamole, cheese, lettuce, tomato and refried pinto beans. It sounds amazing. Unfortunately, it didn't quite live up to my expectations. The torta was soggy and falling apart. The steak milanesa was also soft and soggy. I think it could have use a bit more lettuce to give it some crunch. That said, it was tasty though.
Best Mexican food in the vicinity. Their chorizo is to die for. It's a bit pricey but for how delicious everything is, it's worth it!

First timer last night after discovering this restaurant through new a new marketing direct mail piece we received. Â So happy to find a home delivery alternative to pizza and chinese. Â On to the food...it was fresh, authentic, delish and delivered hot. Â Not your average Mexican food for sure. Â They also have a very user friendly on line ordering system. Â We will become regulars here!!!

If you are looking for this place... It's right behind Arby's on 75th and Woodward....This a very small restaurant, When my BF and I entered the place.....Three servers were looking at us.... No greeting ... No nothing.... It was quite annoyingly uncomfortable .... We just found an empty booth and sat down....I don't like this place already arghhhhh.... It's not like they're busy.... There's like 3 couples but more tables vacant...I mean, I know it's not THAT type of a restaurant but damn.... If you are busy I understand.... But don't just look at me when I walk in?!!!So yeah biotches ... I want you to have some customer service skills and at least be polite or be phony for crying out loud ... But freaking greet me.."Welcome to Los Arcos... Feel free to choose any booth you want"... Or choose whatever other lame greeting.... But something sheesh ....I don't even know our servers name....We ordered a modelo draft for my BF and a house margarita for me...Chips were good and free... I LOVE Â free...Guacamole was very fresh and full of avocado and not fillers..., for that.... They get the two stars ..,Our entrees took 15 minutes WTF...I ordered a taco dinner - al pastor, shrimp and steak... It's all meh....My BF ordered enchilada... It's also just meh..,Nothing extra ordinary at all...Super disappointed .... Â Good thing I had a Groupon.. Never again..

I'll start with the food. Came in on a Sunday around lunch time. The chips they give here are amazing! Got the "small"(which was anything but) guacamole and it was simply delicious. Â We ordered the fajitas los arcos and the pineapple stuffed thing. Both were incredible! The flavors, seasoning, heat, all well balanced. I was stuffed and wanted to keep eating.The service was great. Our waitress was polite and on top of everything.I wish this place was bigger. It has the potential to grow. I will definitely be back.
Best food in Downers. Love it. Order at least 3 times a month. Steak tacos are amazing!
Man, cmon man! This place is amaz-a-zing! Great salsa! Their steak is perfection! The food is reasonably priced & the staff is so sweet. They don't mess around here! Go asafp & enjoy!!!!!

It was a nice experience for me and my boy. I forgot he had no school last Friday. So I got him up, fed him and sent him out of door for the school bus. Then he was back one minute late and said "Mom, you forgot! I have no school!" Oops, so I agreed to go out for lunch wherever he chose as long as on my approved list.:)He picked tacos so we headed over as I had a $10 coupon fromrestaurant.com. The lobby was fine but nothing fancy. At least, I could see the soccer games on TV. And they do have WIFI available so my son was happy.The menu was quite extended. We got small guac and chips. My son picked his 3 tacos with Chicken, ground beef, and al pastor. My three tacos are chile relleno, beef cheek, and fish. He loved every single one he ordered. Also ate 70% of guac. I took one bit of pastor which was pretty good just a bit too sweet for me. I am pretty happy with my none-breaded fish taco which was the kind I like. Chile relleno was a small pepper for the taco tortilla which tasted great but no enough cheese stuffed in. The best one was beef cheek which was all lean meat and super tasty.The service was a bit on the slow side which didn't bother us. They only have one nice waitress for 7-8 tables while we were eating. We were watching TV or playing with the phone while waiting for the food. She did come back a few times to make sure we were doing OK.The price was reasonable for the meal. With the coupon, it was actually a pretty good deal. Based on my son, he liked everything here and wanted to come back soon.

Lunchtime order took 90 mins!!!Went there for lunch with a group of 9, arrived at 11:30AM.Server got appetizers and drinks quickly but took another 20 mins to take orders. 30 mins later a 10th person arrived, placed his order and received it within 10 mins while the rest of the group still waited. The rest of our orders finally arrived at 1PM, just in time to get wolfed down or boxed up.Food was decent but not worth the price nor the long wait.We should have taken the hint when other patrons got up and left, stating that they just couldn't wait any longer...There were apparently 2 cooks and 3 servers working at the time. If you need timely service, you'd best look elsewhere...

We've dined in a handful of times now, and I'd have to say they've become our go-to Mexican joint in our West 'burbs. Â Nary a bad experience, food has been above reproach just about each and every time. Â Great tacos, with original offerings like the "Los Arcos" style plates, sandwiches, and seafood specialties. "Los Arcos" fajitas are just about all I need to satiate my Mexican food appetite. Throw in some complimentary chips and salsas (plural, they serve at least three) and a couple President Margaritas and you're pretty much guaranteed a post-meal nap. Prices seem a tad above market, but the quality food typically quells any complaints. Service can get backed up with a large crowd, but they typically maintain their composure, uphold hospitality, and roll with the punches. Solid beer, margarita, and cocktail menus are icing on the cake. Groupon friendly too, so check the interweb before you stop by. Hard for me to complain about anything, outside of the volume on the jukebox and again, above average prices.
Ordered take out from here. Â Good tacos! Â I'm not a HUGE taco fan...but these were really good in my opinion. Â I am looking forward to trying more items on the menu.

Our waitress was extremely nice and the food was, as always, delicious.We tried the enchiladas and steak burrito. Both were delicious!A note, on Saturday nights they have a DJ and light show. Nothing too crazy though

My rating is actually 3.5 stars because it's more than "A-OK" but I'm not quite a fan just yet until I give them another try.I'm glad I read the previous Yelp reviews before dining here so that I was well aware that they were in the middle of remodeling. Otherwise, I would have wondered what the heck happened to this restaurant's wall and decor.The service was stellar. Our server was really nice, took time to explain some dishes on their menu and was quick to bring everything.We ordered Chicken Fajitas, three Carne Asada (steak) tacos, Jarritos grapefruit soda and Pico de Gallo. The chicken and steak were okay and just wasn't seasoned or salted enough to make the dish flavorful. What made my tacos decent enough though was adding the green salsa dip and pico de gallo. The downside was that almost half of my first taco had fatty steak pieces. I like that they don't skimp on the ingredients and as a result, my tacos were huge. The dishes came with complimentary tortilla chips and three types of salsa dips (mild, medium and hot). The chips, grapefruit soda and pico de gallo were excellent. Just a warning though, the jalapeno peppers in the pico de gallo are HOT. After a couple of small bites, I had to down almost half my soda and blow my nose. I would recommend ordering it and asking them to put just a little bit of jalapeno peppers.They have a $10Restaurant.comcertificate available, so you can use that if plan on ordering at least $15 worth of food.I can't fully say I'd recommend this restaurant yet. I have to try their other entrees to see if they are better than the steak tacos and chicken fajitas that we ordered.

I did not enjoy, the taste was below average for me. I purchased the groupon and was able to place my order directly through the app. I ordered the taco dinner, guacamole, and a side of rice. My tacos were good... Nothing that stood out. The rice was extremely salty, I do not believe that it normally taste this way, it was inedible for me. The guacamole was bland, I did add some salt to finish it off. Slightly overpriced... The three items came to $18.67 with tax. I doubt I'll return.

Well i came in for some fajota asked the waitress for Med. And they gave well done plus it was soo salty the rice seem old the knly good flavor was the beens the waitress only came twice to see how i was not interested to come back

I always order delivery. They always arrive on time. I was looking for a place with chicharron tacos and this is it! More meaty than fatty. I top it with cilantro and cheese. I love their salsas. I like their rice, puffy not over cooked, with some potato and carrots in the mix, but it's minimal so no worries if you're picky like I am and eat around it. I like the beans here as well.Can't say too much about the rest but definitely the only place in the area that I know that has those chicharron tacos.

Decent experience at Los Arcos. My veggie burrito was just OK. I also tasted the cheese enchiladas and they were also OK. The best part was probably the chips and the brown salsa.The problem we faced was the service was unacceptably slow. It's a relatively casual restaurant and we were easily there for 1.5 hours for a simple lunch. Getting the order in, waiting for the food, waiting for follow-ups like the check and so forth just took forever.

So where do I begin. I went to this place tonight because I had been there before and although things weren't perfect, I decided to give them another try. My first review was on 4.14.2015. After that visit, I went and purchased morerestaurant.comgift cards. Today makes the 3rd time I went there but .... I WILL NEVER BE GOING BACK.This is how the night went. Let me back up first. At the end of April, I went to this place and the food was good. The only issue I had was the waitress. She completely screwed up the order. I had to send it back, not once, but twice. In the end, it still wasn't right but I said forget it. Keep in mind, I ate the food, paid for the food and even left a tip. Again, things weren't perfect but I still wanted to come back. Hey, everyone has bad days.Well tonight I was there and ooooh boy. What a sour taste I have in my mouth. It started off okay. He informed me of the drink special as I couldn't decide what I wanted. I went with the margarita for $7. Most of the time waitress/waiter will ask if you want salt, sugar or nothing. He didn't ask me and I didn't think about it as I rushed to the ladies room. When I came back and saw my drink, I noticed it had salt. I don't put salt on any of my drinks. I flagged the waiter down and said I need a new glass with no salt. Okay, this was taken care of. cool.We place our food order. The waiter didn't write anything down but that's okay because at some places, they rely on their memory. However, in this case, memory failed him. My order was not correct, AGAIN. I asked him to fix it and he kept saying something about another taco. Me and m party was confused. I repeated what I wanted, AGAIN. He took my food back and not even 1 minute later, had another dish for me. Hmmm, i should have known it would go down hill from there.We ordered the taco dinner. On one of the dinners, the steak had A LOT of fatty parts which we set aside as we tried to eat. Then there was a very hard piece of meat that we couldn't tell what it was, so we set it aside again. She tried to continue to eat but found something else wrong. It was a burnt piece of something that we couldn't figure out. So needless to say, the meal was ruined, appetite lost with all the mystery and fatty parts.When the waiter came back to the table, we mentioned that we wanted to speak with a manager because this meal was not satisfactory. We even showed him our concerns or complaints. He said, sure, no problem, we will take care of it. We said, just charge us for what we ate, which was one taco, beans and rice. We weren't asking for the entire meal to be taken off, just the part we couldn't eat anymore. The manager, Arturo, if that's his real name, came to the table and asked what issue we had with the food. We begin to explain and show him the complaint. Now.. as a customer, it baffled me and offended me when he said " I was here before when you had a complaint about the meat". Ummm I never had a complaint about the meat the last time. The complaint from the previous visit was the waitress screwing up the entire order. So excuse me.. what are you insinuating. HOW RUDE!!!!!! At that point, I was ready to use some choice words because of his accusatory tone and words. I quit talking and let my partner finish. Im not a person to just let things slide when we are being wronged. Yes I was HIGHLY offended by his accusations. He then went on to say that, the hard Â brown part was cheese. Soooo you served me burnt cheese?? Â Arturo, the manager, stated, "We only have one grill." So you mean to tell me that you don't even clean your grill properly in between orders?? 1.. how is that our problem and I even asked him that. He said that is not our problem. 2.. what about people who have food allergies? So you are cooking seafood, pork, beef and chicken etc on the same grill and you JUST admitted, basically, that you don't clean your grill properly otherwise I wouldn't have had left over burnt cheese that should have been scraped from the grill. !I finally had enough with this guy and this place so I said, just bring me the bill. Why was I charged for 2 margaritas?? I only had one. So I said something about that. He was pissed and said, dont pay for anything. Wow.. cool.. I stormed out.
Place is pretty good been here twice. Have not tried everything on the menu but so far love the cuban sandwiches and love Â that they serve chips salsa free.

Las Arcos Mexican is as good as it gets. ALL their food is really good and their customer service is spectacular. Today I made an order for 3 steak tacos with only cilantro and cheese. This is my typical order. Last time they made a mistake on the order and put onions - Â I called them and was told they would remake it ASAP. I was short on time so I told them it was okay.Today Arturo (I think he is the manager) remembered what had happened(2 weeks after the other order) and made sure I wasn't charged for my order today. I went back to my office and to my surprise a few minutes later, the receptionist told me someone was here with my "order". I was confused given I already had my food but decided to go see what was up. Arturo was waiting in the lobby with another 3 tacos. He thought the cooks might have made the same mistake again and wanted to make sure I got my food correct. He went ABOVE AND BEYOND! The initial order was fine but I was very thankful nonetheless.I will continue going to this restaurant and recommend it to anyone that asks me.
The food is ok. Not impressed at all. I ordered a lengua burrito no tested at all. Tortilla chips was all burned. Floor was not clean. Services was good tho

The food is great for those looking for that authentic Mexican food taste. The service was courteous and friendly, although a little slow at times. It's a small dine-in area (about 10 tables), but almost every table was taken (which was a good sign since it was my first visit). If dining in, seat yourself at whatever available table you prefer and you will be greeted shortly. Complimentary chips and sauce (variety of 4) was fresh (not the store bought looking chips either) and very good. Ordered a lemonade and saw that each glass was being made fresh (from lemons, sugar, water and ice) and shaken well (like a martini) at the small bar area inside (no worries about High Fructose Corn Syrup with that!).Ordered the chicken tacos dinner (since my first visit wanted to try a "basic" soft flour shell) (3) that came with rice (which was very tasty by itself) and refried beans that were nicely presented in a small bowl made out of corn tortilla instead of plopped on the plate (food presentation is everything -sorry I didn't take a pic, next time 'cause there will be one.) The taste was as great as it looked/smelled! The chicken was flavorful and hearty portion of it in each taco.The location itself is kind of hidden and hard to find if you haven't been before (in small strip mall behind a Mobile and a Arby's), but once found it a small culinary hidden treasure.

Ignore some of the dumbass reviews here (who orders friggin' calamari at a Mexican place???). Â The food here is legit....service is decent...great taco selections and impressive tequila selection too.
It's the best mexican food in the area pretty up there with Los Galleos good price and service not to mention its in a good area way better than pepes. 10/10
Best tacos in Woodridge. Â I really like that the salsas are the right amount of spicy.

I have passed this place up so many times...shame on me, finally came in for lunch and I am so happy I did!!! Â Despite its diner like, close seating interior, the food is fresh and the margaritas are excellent! Â Lunch special (especially guac and rita) prices are par for the course, but the food is spot on and definitely worth it. Â  I guarantee I'm not passing this place up again!!!!

This is a great little spot!The staff is very friendly. The food is plentiful and delicious. The house margarita was just okay. Â Chips were hot and fresh. The salsas are tasty.Can't say I've ordered a lot of different items from their menu. I have had the gorditias and tacos. Both with chicken. The chicken is for the most part white meat. Very tender and not greasy like some places can be. The pork tacos are okay.The B/F likes the steak tacos. The meat is marinaded really well.I like that the rice has potato in it. I don't think I've had it like that b4 at a Mexican restaurant.It's nice that they have late night hours. Not to many suburban places do.My one complaint is I wish they had more seating.

Stay away!I never been so angry about a restaurant. I ordered for delivery via Grubhub, but two hours later I still had no food. Â (I live about a mile and half away). After I called their number, carefully enumerating my frustrations about not Â getting my order, I was promptly ... hung up on!About fifteen minutes later I did get a call from the delivery person who asked me in very broken English about where I lived. WTF? I ordered electronically -- they should have already had my exact address, clearly spelled out in print. Â Repeating myself multiple times, we both struggled to wade through a language barrier as thick as a greasy pool of rancid tortilla lard while I gave him directions to my house (seriously ... their delivery person doesn't have a GPS?) Â And, yes, I finally received my order after only two and a half hours. But I am angry with myself that I accepted the delivery.Oh ... and don't count on Grubhub to help you out. Â When I tried to complain via their purported 24-hour support, their little cartoon smiley characters simply told me "Hmmm ... we're not sure why your order hasn't arrived." and indicated "We're on it! We'll let you know what we find out as soon as we can." I haven't heard a word from them yet. Don't trust little smiley faces.

Chips were very good, had some kind of seasoning on them that was good. They brought out three types of salsa which were all very good. Margaritas were disappointing. They were weak. The place is small, service wasn't bad. We had the chicken fajitas which were good. Came with a good amount of chicken. The tortillas were corn tortillas, which had I known that, I would of requested flour instead.

Food is really good and the drink menu is very extensive. Cocktails galore. Salsas are very good too! From mild to hot and the pickled jalapeÃ±os seem to be home made! (Try the pickled jicama). You can also order online or download an app. I've had the fish tacos and arrachera! They are Â good! The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the servers (service) are kinda slow. And the waitress spilled soda all over me. It doesn't seem that there is a manager in, I should've gotten a complementary discount for the mess.
Great small Mexican restaurant. I got a steak burrito with was decent. My brother got a chicken burrito which I tried and it was way better than the steak. Will be getting the chicken next time.

For what I believe to be just ok Mexican food. I would definitely suggest an improvement in customer service!My food was ready quickly since I called in it, but I waited almost an additional 10 minutes as they rang up other customers, or fixed what I asssumed to be a glitch in the system, and guess what? I had absolutely no problem waiting. My problem came when I asked about an additional sauce and received no answer as if I hadn't asked the question. Ok, sometimes I speak a little softly, so I asked the young lady did she hear me? She looks at me and says "yes" oohokay Sooo, why didn't you acknowledge me? So I ask again, she says she gonna charge me. I reiterated to her that I just spent $40 on food, I'm asking for 1 additional sauce. I'm fine with a no,my issue is the additude that came with the no. It was uncalled for. Also, my sister called in the order, Â and had a drink. I had to ask them for the drink. If I handt asked Im doubtful I would have received it.In the end she gave me the sauce, but reiterated that it was just this time.After that service believe me.....there won't be a next time! (For me at least)P.s. If you don't care about the service, I really enjoyed the lengua taco, very tender! My sister loves this place and says when she eats in the service and food are very good, so it could be, she was just having a bad day....who knows?
Have the prices suddenly gone up? 10.95 for a burrito is pricey in my opinion! No rice or beans just the burrito #

Food and service were good overall but location and environment could use some work. The beef fajitas were only cooked with onions, no peppers or tomatoes like many other places. The rice was some of the best I've ever had.

Food is AMAZING!!! I seriously crave the Nachos with Chorizo at least once a week. Four stars because sometimes the waiting staff isn't that great (don't get refills, etc.)But all in all a great place to eat!

Food is terrific but not worth the terrible service. Our waiter paid literally no attention to us. We had to wait over an hour for our food and we only got it when we brought this to the attention of another server (our server basically took our order and never came back). We sat there and watched everyone around us being seated and served. People that were seated 30 minutes after us received their meals before us. Â Now I can speculate as to why we were treated so poorly, we were the only mixed family in the restaurant, BUT I'll give them the benefit of the doubt in that regard. Our food was good but they burnt our son's chicken nuggets and we had to wait about another 30 min for our check. When we got the check our server said he comped us for our sons fried ice cream (which he didn't). Needless to say we will not be going back.

As promised I returned 2 months later after the business owner responded to my review. Fair is fair and I knew a second chance comeback round was an order. This time I entered at 12:30 noon time today on Christmas Eve and was waited on by the same server from my previous experience. I can tell she remembered me but she did not let that get in her way making sure my dining experience was excellent. I ordered pretty much that exact same breakfast plate as the last time. It was absolutely delicious like I knew it would be.Of course you are wondering why I decided to go back. For starters I was convinced the taqueria suffered a moment of bad luck. I totally get that and I give people second chances before making a permanent descision. The server was on point with coffee refills, upselling desserts, checking in if I need more tortillas. She clearly was in winning me over mode. She conquered every aspect I questioned in my mind.Would I comeback for a third visit? Yes of course. Onward and Upward is the motto and the past is the past.Thank you Los Arcos for listening :)

This might be my new favorite place not just favorite Mexican place. Their guacamole is better than the places that do the table side service. I got two vegetarian tacos with corn tortillas. You have a choice between cilantro/onion or lettuce/tomato on your tacos. I recommend the cilantro because it goes good with the lime they give you. They do not need any salsa or hot sauce on them. I use to work with a guy from Mexico and he said that his mom use to make corn tortillas early in the morning and they would put butter on them and eat them throughout the day for snacks because they were so good. These corn tortillas taste as good as the ones this guy use to talk about.

The food here is phenomenal. I ordered the chorizo tacos and they were fantastic. Their salsas are also great. The staff here is always friendly and the service is top notch. Plus they almost always have soccer on the tvs. My favorite Mexican restaurant in the area. Definitely worth stopping in if you're ever in the area.

To sum it up, good food with zero atmosphere. We had guac, margaritas, various tacos, tostadas and frijoles. All good! Good candidate for carrying out. Call ahead after you get a menu the first time. Or look online.They have interesting taco choices like cecina and lomo. I had them both and found them tasty. The chips were also good if a little weak for scooping the guac.

My girlfriend and I have been here a couple times and our experience was normally good except tonight. Â Our dinners were over salted and our service was awful. Â Came by to drop off menus and left to chat at the bar. Â Took almost 10 mins before she took our drink order and that's because my girlfriend gestured for her to come by. Â Service was bad throughout. Â Surprisingly bad experience tonight. Â I'll probably come back and hope we get a different server and the food isn't over salted. On a positive note, Margaritas were tasty.

I tried to support a local business but it turned out to be a terrible experience. The customer service was awful and painfully slow. Â I had to ask for a menu. When we finally served it was not in the order that we arrived. The food was mediocre and no silverware was provided.If this is their normal performance. I don't see this place being open long.This is my first and last visit.I will not be returning. And what's up with all the televisions being programmed to speak in Spanish !!!

I've given this place so many chances, mainly because the food is sometimes good, not great, and sometimes I don't even eat it (I usually get my orders to-go). The last time I went there we ate there and I was in shock at how awful this waitress was. She was very unpleasant. My friend asked her for sour cream in her tacos but she didn't add it. The waitress came back to ask how everything was, my friend told her that she didn't receive her sour cream in her tacos and the waitress told her, "well, I told the chef to put it on them so it should be" and walked away. Seriously? Comes back with our checks and she was charged with the sour cream, my friend then asked why she was charged and the waitress said "like I said the chef said he put it on there" so rude! I'll take my business to Los Dos.

This is a great place to get Authentic mexican food , unlike PePes next door. Â I'm glad i found it because the tacos remind me of the tacos i used to have in mexico when i was little. The service is great and friendly. I will support this small restaurant as long as i can so i keep getting them good tacos, try the shrimp tacos! They are not shy of putting shrimp in their tacos!

Oh, Los Arcos. It pains me to write this, because a Mexican place that delivers is REALLY hard to find. The food is good. I'd probably give it four stars. But the service? Horrible! It took an hour and a half for them to deliver eight tacos and a side order of guac. 90 MINUTES. I called at the hour mark, and they said it was on its way. A half hour later, it arrived, with the delivery guy telling me he'd left fifteen minutes beforehand. It's not the quickest place in the world when we do pick-up, but this is beyond ridiculous. Adios, Los Arcos! You have lost a customer.

Authentic Mexican food hidden in a little strip mall. Other than the loud music inside and the wait for the food, there isn't much to complain about. Friendly service and delicious horchata. We definitely will return.
Just passing threw on my lunch break and had the best burrito of my life! The service was very good and extremely nice! Fair prices and very clean will be back again!

Husband and I went here for the first time yesterday. Friend of mine had gone and raved about the food, so we thought we'd give it a try. Â We were greeted and seated immediately, given menus and chips and three salsas. All delicious, but we liked the Verde (I think that was the medium heat) the best. Fantastic! Â Margaritas were huge and delicious - I had the Blue Pacific. The best ever guacamole and chips. We also had the nachos and planned on ordering enchiladas, but we were so full (we inhaled EVERY SINGLE BIT of the guac and nachos) we had to cancel our entrÃ©es. Our server, Arturo, was was very friendly and attentive. Â Excellent service - fantastic food in a nice, casual setting. We are definitely going back to experience more of their menu!

my wife just yelled upstairs " this soup is full of bones and they just threw a corn of a cob in the soup " wtf???you cant serve chicken soup with full thighs, wings WITH SKIN STILL ON, NOT EVEN BROWNED FIRSTetc in soup, people will choke on bones and they have to pick meat off bones to eat....who wants to eat soup like this with hands???...and full corn on cob wtf....whole tomatoesc'mon lets get serious folks.....you are asking for a lawsuit"!!!!......soup is to be eaten with a spoon!!!!...i dont care if you are mexican or polish, you call it soup, you better be able to eat with a spoon....disappointedjust wrong!!just went on my first visit, and must say impressed!, my buddy and i ate there then had a carryout for my dad and ordered large chicken soup and 2 el pastor pork tacos which were fantastic!! :))...dad love all too, the only thing was that i asked for escabeche ( the pickled veggies ), my dad really wanted these and they forgot or didnt want to give me any???...anyway except for that miss, i will be back and next time i will make them show me that they included in my order!...check your order folks before you leave!!!!!....we were there at !:30 ish today...feliz navidad

After so long living in the area today I ventured to this place and I have to ask myself why I waited so long. The food it's great, even though I was not impressed with their chips and salsas, Â but overall everything was great. The tacos were delicious the tortillas were soft (not like other that are stale and fall apart), meat was tender and with great flavor. It's not your tipical cheap taco stand but still is worth it. It was clean and the service was friendly.

Where do I start? So one of my favorites is a chimichanga. They Nailed it. So you get a cup of retried beans in a chip topped with cheese which is fantastic. Then you get a side of rice once again great. Then you have a giant crispy burrito topped off with cheese and a sour cream based sauce. As you cut in to the burrito you hear the crunch. Then you take a bit and your taste buds explode because it's simply amazing the flavor they pack into their food. Oh and everything else on the menu is awesome. Plus they have a fantastic liquor selection. Hands down best Mexican restaurant in the burbs.
Outstanding Mexican Food! Â  Best Ceviche I have ever had! Â  Â Wonderful guacamole! Â  Nice cold beer! Â  A wonderful experience!! Â A great variety of foods to please everyone!!

My lengthy order consisted of Guacamole, 2 Arcos Style Tacos, 1 Al Pastor Taco, side of sour cream, Large Jamica, and flan which totaled $23.XX.Pros - Tacos are filling and tasty, while the sour cream was a buck, at least it was a good size, Jamica was good.Cons - For some reason the guacamole tasted funny, but then I ate some chips without and maybe they were the funny taste culprit?, place is a little pricey without a coupon, they said if I ordered the Horchata (which I originally asked for) it would taste bad because they were low on it (at about 5 o'clock on a Sunday), and they forgot my flan (which I discovered before I left since places always mess up my order so I check before I leave.) Â O...almost forgot at a previous time I came in here and a lot of prices were higher than what their website said.All and all it has it ups and downs. Â I might some back, I might not. Â The tacos were pretty good.Edit: In response to the response...It's nice that you home make your Horchata, but you should make enough that you aren't going to run out before dinner starts. Â Also I know how to guide myself around the internet and make sure I look at the proper location. Â To insinuate that I just blindly went to the wrong spot is insulting. Â According to you your prices are "constantly updated" so is it possible that one time when you were raising your prices again you did it at the store before the website? Â And just how often are you raising your prices that you need to constantly update the web page? Â I was on the rail as to whether I would be back or not, but you helped me make my decision, so thanks for that.

Ordered food to-go on a weekday night. I really like enchiladas and I was so happy to hear they made enchiladas a la plancha...because those are usually more authentic or in my eyes "how my mom makes them".Well I ordered them cheese and wow did I get cheese....so much cheese inside and too much cheese on top. It was basically a plate of melted cheese. With maybe some tortilla and enchilada sauce somewhere in between the cheese. It really didn't matter because there was something odd smelling about the food that I only bothered to dig some of the enchilada out before I realized.."I'm not eating this".Let me tell you that I don't think I ever not ate a Mexican dish before. :-(The other dish we ordered, bistec a la Mexicana was not good either. It was so spicy that you could not enjoy it because your eyes were burning and your nose was so runny. What a major dissappointment!

We love this place...it feels like a little "Baja Mexican" cafe and the food is always great. The manager always greats us, and recognizes us after weeks of not being in! Sometimes there is a bit of a language barrier with a server, but they always figure it out! Guacamole is exceptional!

Our new favorite place. The food is very tasty and the price is right. The wait staff is knowledgeable and friendly. Throw on a groupon and you're in for an excellent meal at an affordable price. Even without a groupon, the lunch and dinner specials are great.
Delicious the plate presentation was wonderful. Â Tropical guacamole was very refreshing!

Los Arcos prepared & delivered a late-night taco bar for my wedding several weeks back. Â They were great to work with & were very efficient when delivering. Â The tacos were excellent and everyone was excited! Â We even had leftovers to take home. Â Great value for the $!

Me & my boyfriend went and here last night and I really enjoyed it. Once we pullled up we wasn't too sure if we wanted to go in, because it looked so small. But you surely can't judge a book by it's cover. The waitress we had was new so she was kinda confused on alot of things and had to ask for help but she was a very sweet lady. The chips and salsa you get is really good four different flavors (one is very hot, make sure you have water handy). Dinner was good I had the mix fajitas plate (steak,chicken and shrimp) and it was really good. Chicken being my favorite. We also had drinks too can't remember the name but I know it was the drinks titled "for him" and "for her" they were a pretty decent size and were only about 8 bucks. I would for sure suggest people kick this place out.
Chimichanga's are to die for, especially with ground beef. They are so large, it feeds two people.

Probably the best Mexican food I've ever had. Â They have an extensive menu here with truly authentic, traditional Mexican dishes. Â Everything's made right. Â You know it's good when the service staff, cooks, and patrons are Mexican too!The restaurant itself needs a little help with the renovations - but it's all about the food, and they nailed it here. Â You can call in an order ahead of time for pickup, or take a seat and stay awhile.Haven't tried the drink specials since I've mostly come here for lunch, but I cannot recommend this place enough. Â Don't even think about going back to Burrito Loco, Pepe's, or Taco Bell once you've tried the food here.

2-21-15 Â 3:30 pmThis is my second review on this great little restaurant. Actually this is really not a review, but a complement to the owner of this restaurant. My wife and I just got home from eating at your wonderful little restaurant. The two gentlemen who were the servers this afternoon are excellent they work well together and are very attentive to your customers. My compliments to the cooks in your kitchen, also are very hard-working and turn out some of the most tasty food I have ever eaten. The portions of food that come to the table are very plentiful and reasonably priced. Your menu, what can I say but it's huge and each item looks better than the next. The chips and salsa that comes to the table, free of charge are the best I have eaten at any Mexican restaurant.This afternoon my wife and I tried the ceviche Cancun, oh my God it was wonderful !!The fish tacos, the best I've ever had, and the fajitas Los Arcos which are to die for and the portion was so big I brought half of it home. Also had your margaritas they too are awesome ......... "they are so good LOL they will kick your butt"To the owners of Los Arcos my compliments to you on having one of finest little restaurants, I have ever eaten in and a staff that is very attentive to your customers. Please do not change anything about your restaurant because everything about it is five stars.Review by~The Naperville Food Dude ~

I'm new to the area so I was really looking forward to eating here per the ratings. Me and my Girlfriend walked in and were definitely excited, but disappointed overall. Here is what I liked and didn't like.Pros:-Chips and salsa were delicious and fresh-Nicely decorated-Friendly Staff-Draft Dos XX SpecialCons-Waitress wasn't to familiar with the menu (maybe she was new) and seemed to have a lot of trouble with the overall order and service. A lot of confusion-Only got 1 water for me and my GF-Took over 10 min to get our draft beer and Margarita-Had to ask for silver wear when it should have already been available for us-The corn tortillas in my tacos were under cooked-The steak also tasted funny and dry.Overall my experience was fair and may give it another chance. But for now, wish it could have been better . So that's why I give it only 2 stars.

Los Arcos is a place that my boyfriend and I turn to when we are craving Mexican food. The food is flavorful and delicious. I seriously cannot get enough of their chile relleno tacos. I took one bite, and I was immediately smitten. It is so good, it's the only thing I ever end up ordering from there. I'm sure many of their other items are fantastic but I can't seem to get enough of their chile relleno tacos. Go try them! ANYWAYS...let's talk about service. Service has always seemed to be an issue, in pretty much every single instance we have picked up from there. Everytime we do pick up, our food is never ready by the time we get there to pick it up. I'd get there to pick up the food, and every single time I was asked to take a seat and wait at least 15 minutes for them to cook the food. Doesn't that defeat the purpose of pickup?...Furthermore, delivery seems to be slow. I live 5 minutes away from Los Arcos. We ordered delivery online one night and the confirmation email stated our food would be delivered by 6:30. Our food did not arrive until 7:15. We were a little irritated by it, since we were so frickin hungry. But all was forgiven after we ate our food lol. I had my chile relleno tacos and my boyfriend had a steak burrito dinner.Overall, would I recommend going to Los Arcos? Sure. At least in terms of food. They have an extensive menu. There's something for everyone. If you don't like one thing, there's many other things you can try. But to be honest, if it weren't for those damn chile relleno tacos I'm clearly obsessed with, I don't think I would keep coming back since service does not seem to be a strong point of theirs...

This is officially my favorite spot that's close to home. Â Everything about this place is awesome! Â I'm REALLY picky about mexican food and this place has the best authentic mexican food I've had outside of the city. Â Not only do they have delicious food ( I've tried multiple dishes, all so yummy) but their drinks are AMAZING & HUGE! My girlfriends and I stopped in on a Saturday night for a few drinks and to our surprise they dimmed the lights and had a dj and disco ball! Â That just made it so much better. Â We had a blast! Last night ( Friday) my husband and I went on a double date here and again we had so much fun. This time they had karaoke. We didn't participate but it was fun to watch. This place is not fancy, Â but I like that because it's comfortable and relaxed. The best part.... the prices! I'm talking, way low prices for way good food and drinks AND they are really generous with their liquor. The drinks are pretty strong. There is an adorable bald man( maybe the owner or manager) who is so incredibly nice. He goes out of his way to make sure you are happy & makes the BEST sangria I ever had in my life. That is not an exaggeration. So, after 2 Sangrias and 2 Mango Margaritas rimmed with chili powder... I am writing this review the next morning because I seriously cannot wait to go back. Â Maybe today just for some hangover food haha. Â Oh, and I also have to add in here that we have ordered here for delivery and the food tastes just as good at home as it does at the restaurant. So on nights where we just feel like staying in... this will still be our go to spot. We are so glad we found this place. We will definitely be back again & again!

Went there on a Sunday for lunch on a recommendation from a friend. What a tiny gem in a strip mall. The guacamole was outstanding. The waitress was very friendly. We had the fajita served in a hollowed pineapple with onions green pepper and grilled pineapple it was amazing. And don't get me started on the margaritas. A huge berry margarita with fresh blueberries and blackberries floating in it. That alone is worth the trip. Great food, great drinks, great service.

The best chili relleno I have had in a long time. Twice I have ordered take out so I never had the chips and salsa. My daughter and I decided to stop for dinner and we were delighted by the chips and salsa. My daughter had the taco dinner and I my usual. The beans and rice are delicious. The waiter though was a little slow but he was nice. Â The guy at the register when I ordered take out was very friendly and helpful. He was not there when we dined in. Â I definitely will be back.

This is was first time here. The restaurant is very clean. The food was pretty good. I think I will order the al pastor next time as the steak was just ok. The rice and beans were bland, but not terribly so. My only real complaint was that there were two giant chunks of fat in my tacos that were inedible and i spit them out. I will be back, but will try other things. Great prices on decent food. I will update when I go back.

What a nice find in an unassuming strip mall on 75th St! Â If you blink you might miss Los Arcos (it's located behind the Mobil on 75th and Woodward. Â Overall opinion: exceptional food, OK service, but kind of a poor space for a restaurant.Let me start with the food, which I would actually give 5 stars. Â To start, they have a full bar and a really nice selection of tequilas. Â The waitress was pretty familiar with all the tequila, and had several recommendations. Â After drinks we decided to start with chips and gaucamole. Â Gauc comes in 2 sizes- small and large. Â The small is enormous, there must be 2 or 3 avocados in the small. Â It's not made tableside, but it's incredibly fresh. Â Only knock was that there was a little too much cilantro. Â Otherwise it was outstanding. Â Chips are also served with a trio of salsas (mild, medium, and hot). Â All were excellent.For dinner I had their special skirt steak with chorizo and cheese (Arrachera Los Arcos), and my girlfriend had the chicken taco salad. Â The skirt steak was outstanding. Â I asked for it cooked medium, and it came out perfectly. Â It's smothered in chorizo (very spicy) and cojito cheese. Â It's served with rice and beans, and tortillas. Â This was an excellent dish. Â My girlfriend loved her taco salad- what stood out to her was that the chicken and beans were in the bottom of the bowl, while the lettuce and tomato were on top, keeping it from getting soggy. Â Overall, the salad was really good too.Biggest drawback to the place is that there's no ambiance. Â It's a big room, and you can see out through the windows. Â We were here on a Saturday night and it was freezing out. Â Every time the door opened, we got hit with a blast of cold air. Â Fortunately I found out they do delivery in addition to carry-out, so you're in luck if you don't want to eat here. Â Overall pretty happy, I'd come back to eat when it's warmer out, or I'd get it delivered.

I eat lunch at Los Arcos two to three times a week. Â It's close to my work.I've eaten Mexican food many places across the country, from Texas to Southern California and even in Mexico itself. Â Los Arcos has some of the best steak tacos and carne asada I've ever had! Â Anything else I've ever had there has been excellent, too, but I almost always default to the steak tacos or carne asada. Â Other dishes of note: char-broiled chicken, chorizo tacos. Â A lot of people like their Al Pastor and fish tacos, too, but they're not my favorite.Their chips are usually nice and fresh, and their salsa verde is fantastic! Â The guacamole is pretty good, too!The staff is very friendly (Sharon, Carmen, Annuncio). Â The service is a bit slow at times, especially if it's in the middle of the lunch rush, but the quality of the food more than makes up for that.My one very minor complaint is that sometimes we have to wait a long time for chips and salsa. Â I feel like that should be something that they bring to the table when they bring the menus. Â Also, sometimes I have to wait a while for my water--bad news when I'm chowing down on the chips and salsa!All this talk of food! Â I'm starving now! Â Off to Los Arcos!

I found this restaurant through groupon for for $8 off a $20 meal, but this was only good for dinner. Â We were going for lunch so groupon was a no go. Â The menus was confusing. Â Lunch combos did not include the pictured tacos.I thought the food was decent once we got passed the confusing menu. Â I ended up with the combo taco and my wife had the steak tacos (the name escapes me). Â We couldn't get enough of the curly fries with my combo (replacement for beans and rice). Â Once again the shells were not home made. Â Good would have much better and I would definitely rate it higher if it had more than the store brand flour shells, which were double stacked because they fall apart so easily.I will make a trek back to Chicago soon to antique taco. Â They make their own shells. Â It makes a huge difference! Â To sum it up, I like this place but would suggest that they start making their own shells. Â I would frequent this place more often once this happens. Â Also would suggest making the menu more straight forward so to attract and retain more customers so they don't feel like it's bait and trap. Â If you want the tacos pictured than you have to order 3 or 4 of the same taco. Ada first time customer I would have like to try different tacos pictured and not have to order 7 tacos to try a fish and a steak taco. Â Just a suggestion. Â The taco pastor is $1.50 on tues and Wednesday's which is a great deal for a good taco.

My husband and I decided to check out Los Arcos after we saw their Groupon ($11.99 for $20 worth of food). I'm always on the hunt for good Mexican food and am tired of fighting with Pepe's about whether they'll honor my coupons (they once told me I couldn't use one because it was marked "Not valid on major holidays" and it happened to be SWEETEST DAY. COME ON).We ventured to Los Arcos on a frigid Wednesday night. Based on how well the online menu was designed, I was expecting the place to be a little more upscale, but no biggie. Some of the best food I've had has come from run-down strip-mall joints.Since we had $20 to spend, we ordered the nachos appetizer, chile relleno plate and two tacos (chile relleno for my Â husband and pastor for me based on Yelp recommendations). The nachos arrived quickly and were delicious. I could almost hear the chips sighing under the weight of all the toppings. Since my husband is a vegetarian, the waitress offered to substitute avocados for meat on the nachos, even though that wasn't listed as a choice on the menu. We really appreciated that. We topped the nachos with the homemade hot sauces that were brought to our table. I love hot things, and the homemade red hot sauce had my scalp prickling - yowza!Next up were our tacos and the chile relleno. The pastor taco was delicious and the pork was just slightly crunchy - thanks for the recommendation, Yelpers! My husband scarfed down his chile relleno taco also, so that must have been good (he didn't offer me a bite because he was too busy wolfing it down). We were full by the time we got to the chile relleno plate, so we took most of it home. The few bites I managed to eat were tasty, though. My only gripe is that the rice on our platter seemed to have been sitting around for quite a while as it was quite clumpy.Los Arcos is nothing fancy, but the food is solid and we'll definitely be back!
T

Watch your bill. We ordered a taco dinner, we were asked if we wanted lettuce and tomato, we said yes. Â They were added as extras on the bill. Â On a previous visit I was offered more tortillas to finish my meal only to find $1.20 extra on the bill. It's not a lot of money but it is not standard practice to charge and also not to mention the extra fees when taking the order. Otherwise the staff provides good service and the meals are good. Â In any taco, lettuce, tomato and onion are part of a the taco otherwise you would just call it a tortilla and a filling.

The food was excellent. so were the margaritas. On that alone I would have given it 5 stars.However-There was karaoke the night we went and it was really, really awkward at first. It didn't really get much better as the night went on.Our server was great at first, but after we had our food it took awhile to get a second drink. It took even longer to get the check.When we eventually got our check, the specials were not priced correctly. We ended up having to send our check back a total of three times. SO frustrating when you just want to leave.I would probably give this place another try. I'm going to chalk it up to an off day.

Not impressed at all. Â Our family is vegetarian and we ordered takeout without meat and only vegi's. Â  When we got home to eat, all of our dishes had a few small pieces of unidentifiable meat in them. Â Apparently they use the same grill without caring to keep the vegetarian dishes meat free. Â Pretty much ruined our evening. Â If you are vegetarian, you need to avoid this place. Â I'm not going back!

They advertise $1 Al Pastor Tacos &$1 Horchata (rice water). Â I stopped in to try two and they were so good. They had lil chunks of pineapple and the meat was delicious. Â I was impressed from moment i walked in and observed how they cooked the al pastor meat. Â The best places cook it like a gyro and stack the meat from bottom to top on machine and slice the outside fresh per order.The waitress Carmen was friendly and attractive and brought over chips and 3 different salsas as soon as I got there. Â I was also impressed when she brought over a lil fruit cup filled with chopped watermelon & grapes for free.Check out picture I uploaded, Â I'll be going there again today! Â This is best Mexican food I've tried around here besides Los Dos & El Burrito Mexicano.

As I have said before, I don't think restaurant reviews that are over a year old are very useful so here is an update.Same 5 star service and food as before (see my previous reviews). Â Today we had the veal medallion special and the pork chops (with bell peppers). Â The veal amounted to veal picatta. Â It was very good. Â When we ordered the pork chops we asked for "no pink". Â The two largish boneless chops were cooked perfectly. Â No pink but still some moisture. Â That's hard to do. Â Empty plates were removed promptly. Â Our server (didn't get her name) checked from time to time if everything was OK. Â It was. Â With the bread, salad and sides of pasta we were too stuffed for dessert.Note to the owners: A double espresso should only be about 2 oz. of liquid.I saw one Yelp reviewer that said something like if you want better Italian you would have to go to Naperville or Chicago. Â As a L.O.N.G time resident of the Naperville area, I can tell you that LDV Plainfield is better than any Italian you will find in Naperville. Â And that includes Rosebud and the two Francesca franchises.Again I'm repeating myself but if we lived closer we would be regulars. Â What would really be the cat's meow would be if LDV opened a place in Naperville.

Disappointing does not even describe our experience.For lack of better words, nothing was "Authentic Italian" or "Di Casa"(house-made, freshly made). From the tacky Italian American ambiance, to the inexperienced staff, and ending with food that one may say is just edible. I have every right to express my feelings in this manner due to the fact, that I am 100% percent Italian on both sides, My father from Palermo, Sicily, and my mother's side a mix of Northern and Southern Italy (Roma e Puglia) raised speaking, reading, writing the language, knowing the culture from North to South Of Italy, understanding the importance of my culture and it's authentic cuisine, not to be confused with "Italian American" which should be non-existent.I recently moved to the Chicago-Plainfield area from the Bronx, NYC (Little Italy). Â In hopes to find food close to home, I started to explore my local restaurants, naturally beginning with my own cultural.To make this less lengthy- let's just get into the food. To start with the menu, which was all in Italian made me believe I might of found a hidden gem. Until I stumbled upon a few spelling and grammatical errors in the wording of the menu. This lead me to believe the person who created the menu must of not been Italian and/or used Google translate incorrectly(insulted). Pizza was no better than buying a frozen RedBarron pizza to pass it off as "flatbread". Calamari way over cooked and mushy, the ravioli were watery, overcooked and metallic tasting (this happens when product isn't fresh and frozen, store bought). Now the bruschetta, one of the staple delicacies to any true italian, a perfect mix of everything secret to us, tomatoes, basil, garlic, bread, olive oil. I always ask myself "how can you mess up such a delicate yet simple dish!" well folks the answers is simple, they messed it up. The bruschetta was so cold you might as well of used the tomatoes as ice cubes, continuing with the tomatoes which were the wrong kind of tomatoes used(again probably due to lack of knowledge of true authentic Italian food), even my wife who isn't Italian quickly pointed out that the bruschetta was not authentic before I could even utter a word.Needless to say I wont mention much more, you get my drift. If your looking for an edible meal and its a short shot of a drive for you, go ahead and see for yourself, God bless you. I for one will never recommend this establishment to anyone as authentic Italian food.

The Chef cannot be trusted. If you have allergies or limitations-do not come here. I almost ate a dish that could've made me sick as I was told it didn't include what I was allergic to. The chef made something I couldn't eat anyway and the waitress caught it before I ate it. Chef knew about it and said nothing. I could've gotten VERY VERY sick. I'm not one for lying and deceitful chefs, therefore, I will NOT be returning.

Ok so went for my birthday dinner. We were first people there when it opened. Didn't get greeted by waitress for at least ten minutes. Â The waitress was not that friendly. Â They gave us three pieces of bread for three people. Â We had to ask for more. Â The food was delish! Â Had eggplant Parmesan. So damn good. Â Anyway. I gave them only three stars because my party told them it was my birthday and they said and did nothing. No dessert . No happy birthday Nothing! Â Barolo's gives you a dessert. Anyway, the waitstaff left me unhappy but the food made up for that part. Â People like to celebrate their events. This restaurant should keep that in mind and at least say thank you for choosing to celebrate here.

Went there for the first time with my wife had an early dinner. The ambience in the restaurant is very romantic. Our waitress and bus boys were extremely prompt. The food was excellent strongly recommend the tiramisu. This is definitely going to become our spot.

Great place for dinner. We have been here about four times. Every time it's been consistently good. Super friendly and attentive staff, which says a lot right there. Fresh food, great pasta and fish, and a good wine selection. We will be back.

Had dinner here and loved it!! The atmosphere and service rivaled downtown Chicago favorites. Great menu, wonderful pasta selection and the Turtle Cheesecake, over the top! I had the pleasure to speak with Danny, one of the owners who is a wonderful host. I highly recommend you try this hidden suburban gem! Bravo!
Hidden Treasure tucked away in Plainfield! The food was amazing! Fresh ingredients. Nice and cozy ambiance. Server was attentive and informative. We will certainly be back!

Loved it. Â Great food and great service. Reasonably priced food. The calamari was excellent. The salad was tasty.But my bottle of miller lite, priced at 4.50 was a bit pricey considering all the craft brews on tap at other places.We will go back for the food, but stop somewhere lest for a nightcap.

I really do love this place so much. I have nothing but nice things to say. Every time when I come here it's five stars even when trying a new entree. Out of the lemon chicken, chicken parm, and chicken visuvio, the chicken vusuvio is my new favorite!Bread is delicious, make sure to try out their special garlic olive oil at the bar! People hog it... it's that good.I love their simple yet tasty salad.As always, the staff is so kind and welcoming as they remember regulars and such. It's hard to believe this place only has a 3 1/2 star rating. Trust me, try this place, you will not regret it!

Food is amazing! Anything I've tried had been excellent! Good wine selection and great bar. But the service is horrible!!! We waited 15 minutes from being seated to being greeted by a server. Then another 10 min for the pop to arrive at our table. Food came out in good time and was delicious as always. But then another twenty min after we had finished our food and had the table cleared then the server finally came to the table and asked if we wanted a dessert. No just the check to then wait 10 more minutes for it to come. Â Come for the food but expect to be there a while.

Went here Saturday night with a party of 9 and with the exception of one thing it was a wonderful dining experience. THe room was of average size and tables spaced Â in a fashion where you did not get a crowded in feeling yet the restaurant was packed to the gills, bar area included. Menu choices were varied and price point apropos. Other than chicken items or pasta items the other entrees were in the low to mid 20.00 dollar range. On the website and menu they state that all food is cooked to order and be prepared for a little wait once food is ordered because of that. We did wait longer than normal but nothing that is an issue, especially when the food that comes out of that kitchen is so fresh and tasty. Even the house salad was over the top good and that is a basic garden salad. THey had at least three choices of veal on the menu which is something not typical in a suburban restaurant..THE personnel are very knowledgeable and they are vigilant in their duties Â  all the busboys were constantly refilling water glasses Â  removing dirty plates Â  replacing Â utensils etc. Dinnerware and glassware was sparking clean. Our waitress was very helpful without being intrusive and catered to our every needs Â  Â also commenting on what is especially good on the menu. One of her recommendations that we took was the tiramisu. She stated it is made daily in house and that it was very good Â  So I ordered it and it was the very best Â tiramisu that I have ever Â had in my life Â  a very very fresh tasty rendition of that Italian classic desert.SO why only 4 stars and not 5 you ask? Â  Â Well we had reservations for 5pm Â  a party of 9 and my wife and I arrived at 445. At that time the Â restaurant was empty and we could see the big table set up that was designated for our party, all setup Â  water glasses even filled etc Â The hostess refused to Â seat us until the entire party was on site Â Even after I advised here that we all live in Plainfield and that everyone was on their way Â confirming that we would all be there, she would not seat us Â  Â I found that to be extremely annoying and not customer Â friendly at all . My experience took a nose dive at that point., however once seated and all of the above kicked into play the reminder of the night was pleasant....Definitely a fine place to have dinner and well worth returning too....

Great food, with large portions, but the staff was in a rush to close and took my friends butter knife as she was still eating her bread ..lol Â and then came back and took the cream for coffee off the table while we all still on our first cup. Not the way to get us to come back no matter how good the food is.
This place is pretty good. I have never had a bad meal and the staff is very friendly and accommodating. Good job!

Had very strange service. Really the only nice way to put it. The bussers were really lacking good etiquette. Pulled a plate from our table with food still on it without asking if we were finished and carried said plate throughout the restaurant looking for more to clear, while we had dirty empty plates left on our table. When asking to have a meal boxed up, another busser proceeded to take a plate of pasta and pour it onto a plate of salmon right at the table before taking it to the kitchen to box it up. The restaurant really seemed understaffed and not very well trained. Â On the other hand, the food was very good with large portions. The tiramisu is great!Really subpar service for the quality and price of the restaurant.

Was our favorite place to eat in Lemont (never disappointed) but when we moved near the Plainfield area we tried La Dolce on Rt 59. Have been there 3 times in 2 years. The first time was not the same quality as Lemont, then went with a large group from work this past February and it was great. The 3rd time was last night for our anniversary and it was not good. We always get the strip steak with pasta and salad. We order medium rare in which it was only in the middle and overcooked on the ends and the sauce tasted bitter. Salad was good! But for $83 we didn't go there for a salad. So it's a hit or miss. Sorry La Dolce but you are not living up to Â your reputation you had in Lemont. Our server was excellent so we left her a good tip because it wasn't her fault, shes not the owner or cook. Won't be going back.

The food was excellent. Â Haven't had linguine and clams like that since I ate at Slicker Sams. Â Service was just as good and attentive as the food. Â Ambience is great and it made for a great dining experience.

I've been to this restaurant no less than 8 times. Â There are almost no other restaurants in the area where you can get any type of food of this quality, especially the fish. Â Think about that for a minute. Â You are in Plainfield that has a total of 3 real restaurants - Sovereign and Capri Sogno being the other two. Â I had the walleye pike last night and it was phenomenal. Â I challenge anyone to name another restaurant in the area, aside from the two other I mentioned, where you can get actual seafood that is properly prepared. Â That's right, you can't. Â Plainfield is lucky to have this restaurant and if you are in the mood for higher-end Italian food and you aren't up for going to Naperville or Chicago, this is a good place to go.

Ate here with friends last night. I enjoyed the service and the food. The bruschetta appetizer was fresh and very tasty. The wine was very nice. A Chardonnay I have never tasted. Should look up the name! When I ordered the veal scaloppine piccata I asked to have the tomato removed from the recipe. They made it the traditional way and it was excellent, but expensive.The tiramisu was overly swimming in marscapone and low on cake. Seemed out of balance. My friends and husband loved their dinners.My husband commented that this was the best Italian restaurant we have been to during our visits to the area.We will keep it in mind for our next trip.M

I went here with my family over Thanksgiving weekend, and we had a wonderful experience. We have a wide range of tastes in food - and there was something for everyone. The menu had a great variety of items, from traditional to a bit more creative, and each one looked and tasted good. The polenta appetizer was delicious. My 8-year-old niece - who is somewhat finicky - ate almost every bit of her food. LDV does have a Kid's Menu, and the hostess asked us if we needed one.My mother made reservations beforehand - which I recommend. The restaurant is relatively small, so there were only a couple of tables left. We appreciated the fact that they informed us that the table was near the kitchen - which didn't bother us. The restaurant is located in a strip mall, and the awnings do make it look a bit like an Applebees. Inside, however, it is decorated nicely and features photos of Italian cultural icons. As someone new to this area, I would be likely to bring a date here.The service was also impressive. Our server knew the menu and was very attentive. She never let our drinks go empty without asking if we needed refills. At the end of the meal, she and a food runner wrapped up our extra food without complaint. Everyone had enough left for lunch or dinner the next day.For a restaurant of this quality, the price was right. For a huge bowl of pasta, my dish cost $16. This included a tasty house salad - served to the table - and fresh bread. We did not drink any alcohol, but the wine list looked to be a good one.If your plan ahead and make reservations, this is a great choice!NOTE: This is strictly a DINNER restaurant, as they usually open at 4 p.m. Check the hours on the website.
Have been here 5-6 times, and not a bad meal yet.
Best little Italian secret in Plainfield!!!! Terrific food and service!!

Yummers! Would love to go again. Cute and typical Italian digs strewn with maybe Italian celeb pictures. Reasonable prices for a good quality of food. Great to go with anyone, but preferably a date - at least with someone that has staying potential, haha.

Went here with the wife tonight for date night. Â Very nice atmosphere and mellow music in the background that fits with the setting. Â  They mix the music up and not just play the rat pack. (Nothing against the pack but it can be overdone at Italian restaurants. )Now the food. Â Very nice for all the way out in Plainfield. Â  My wife's veal was very good and my orange ruffey (sp) was very very nice.That staff was great and I do believe we will return here again. Â A little pricey to bring the kids but very nice for a date night.

Went to La Dolce Vita Â last night to celebrate my grandson's birthday and once again another great dining experience. Â My family and I are regulars here as the food, and Â service are great. Â We love Taylor and even though she was not our waitress she came over to wish my grandson a Happy10th Birthday. Â Although Taylor and my grandson are dating, lol Â They came out with a delicious piece of complimentary Tirimasu (sp?)and sang happy birthday.In addition, even though it was not "Pork Chop Night" Â they went above and beyond and made it for me.Thanks LaDolce for another great evening!

We visited this restaurant several times before. Every time has a been a pleasant, delicious experience. THIS TIME, however, the service by our waitress, Taylor, was exceptionally marvelous. The occasion was our mother's 69th birthday, and it was delightful. Taylor not only handled her 'particular' order details down to the letter, but did so with a smile, going that extra mile to ensure Mom was happy. The caphper was when at the end of the meal, completely on her own without any requests from anyone at our table, brought over a candle-topped slice of Tiramisu and sang a birthday song for Mom. Color us impressed! Â Taylor, Kudos to you, you are an asset to the restaurant and a credit to the profession. You singlehandedly created some regular customers this evening!Oh yeah...the food is good, too!!

After reading several of the other reviews, I was quite excited to take my wife to a nice Italian restaurant and was looking forward to some excellent food. Unfortunately, that was not the case. When we first walked in, the place was extremely noisy, it was almost like being in a loud bar. The appetizer was not very tasty, in fact it was kind of burnt. When we received the main entrÃ©e, it was very bland, and somewhat watery. We had to ask our server on two different occasions to refill our drinks, and when one of the busboy came along to take our dirty plates, he placed the dirty plates he had already from other tables on to the plate on our table before he took it away. Quite frankly, I don't enjoy looking at leftover food from other people's plate put on my table before being taken away. On a positive note, the tiramisu was good! $85 later ($97 with tip) and we're out the door. If you're looking for a nice quiet restaurant with good food, I would advise you to go somewhere else. I only wish that somebody would have told me about this before we wasted our time at this restaurant. I really hate to sound negative, but my time is very limited with my Wife, and to say that I was disappointed would be an understatement.
Really good food, but the waitress did mess up our order. Â She apologized but did not give a credit towards the item she forgot to bring until it was too late.

There was a long wait to be seated because there aren't too many tables. I liked the house salad dressing. The spaghetti marinara sauce is terrible though. It tastes like pure basil. Overall not a big fan and the prices are high.

It was our second time at the restaurant as a group, and we really enjoyed it. The food - ranging from chicken dishes to pasta dishes - was good. The pineapple martini they had on special was phenomenal. Their desserts (especially the tiramisu) were delicious. Our server was attentive and prompt.So this all equals at least an A-Ok rating, right? Wrong. Because the minute we stepped into the bathroom before leaving, I wished I hadn't eaten there. Not only was it dingy and dirty, but there was urine and food crumbs all over the floor.Wow. Totally changed my mind. If you have a staff that doesn't care enough to keep the bathroom tidy, you probably have other problems too.I won't be back, which makes me sad because I enjoyed the food. :(
Love this place!!! Highly recommend. The food is excellent.

We had been to LDV once before and had a good experience, but we decided to go last night, and we walked in at 8:58 and the sign said they closed at 9pm so we figured we should be good to go. Â The hostess stood back at the bar looking at us and then at 9:01 see walks up surprised and said they are closed.... People still sitting in restaurant, people drinking and being served at the bar so seemed reasonable to still be served. Â If I owned a restaurant and 3 people walked in, and one of my employees turned them away, they would be fired on the spot. Â I reminded her we were waiting for several minutes and she was no apologetic in the least but. Â Not only did hey lose a customer last night, I will never go back. Â She just kept saying we are closed at 9pm. Â Oh well... Plenty of other better options out there.

I went here for dinner last night with my boyfriend's family (party of 9) and had a wonderful experience. The server was very friendly, our waters were constantly filled and dirty plates were cleared efficiently. The food was delicious as well. We had calamari as an appetizer which was cooked very well and the sauce complemented the dish very well. I also liked how they served the salad that comes with every meal. The salad was brought to the table family style and already dressed. Additionally, everyone in our party loved their food. My only complaint was how the food was "auctioned" when it was brought to the table. At a restaurant that fancy, I did not expect to have a runner standing at one end of our large party announcing what dish she was holding and then waiting for one of us to raise our hands. Overall, this was a great experience and I would definitely go back.
Food was great and service impeccable! Thank you for a wonderful dining experience! Will be back.

First batch of bread was cold. No substitutions for the pasta served with every entree. I would have preferred a veggie option being diabetic. Salad was OK but overdressed. Meal was not timed properly. We had very long waits between the courses. All the seafood was overcooked. One of the shrimp was not deveined. It grossed my husband and my daughter out to the point that they didn't want to finish their shrimp meals. The waitress talked to the manager and we waited over 20 min for the manager, Debbie. She did take it off the bill and gave us a dessert to take home. The best part of the meal was my daughters chicken breast. It was moist on the inside and crispy on the outside. I would only go back if I could order off of her kids menu! Terribly overpriced!

Have eaten here numerous times, most recently last Friday. Â Started with the Tomato & Fresh Mozzarella in Balsamic, which was extremely good. Â Then moved to an Outstanding Sausage and peppers dish! Â Also the side of spaghetti with meat sauce was delicious. Â The service was timely and never let a drink go dry. Â The entire wait staff was very friendly and willing to offer up their favorites as suggestions.Every time I've been here, I've thoroughly enjoyed my experience. Â  The only downside I have ever had is when I show up without a reservation and there's an hour wait. Â Otherwise, an outstanding dining experience

Food is relatively good. Â But the service is crazy slow! Â  Two simple plates of pasta... over 45 minutes before it got brought out???? Â Very very loud and the tables are so small! Â Limited cocktail menu, Â unless you're only looking for wine.

I visited the Plainfield location last night. The food was great but the service was ok. The restaurant is very noisy especially on a Friday. The server told us that the kitchen was behind and we should order everything first. The problem was we did not know what we wanted. My father asked for suggestions for wine and the server said white for chicken/fish and red for anything dark or red sauce. She was correct but should have given specific selections especially for the type of restaurant this is. Also, it is not the patrons fault if the kitchen is short staffed. The server was nice but seemed rushed throughout the night. Â I would like to try this restaurant during the week. I do feel it is worth trying again because there were many positives.

I noticed this had just opened a few days prior and decided to check it out. Â I had some concerns about it them working out the kinks since they had opened just 3 days ago. Â I was very pleasantly surprised. Â You would have thought they had been open for much longer. Â This restaurant has two other locations in Chicagoland. Â The decor is somewhat upscale Italian eatery, but still fairly casual. Â A nice ecletic mix of clientele. The service was very good. Â The waitress made us feel very welcome. Â The food was fabulous and the wine selection was very adequate. Â We chose to get the calamari appetizer. Â Most meals come with a salad that is shared. Â I got the chicken vesuvio and she got the chicken portabello. Â Both very good. Â Large portions. Â Price was a little on the high side as most entrees were in the $15 - $22 range, with some pasta dishes in the $12 range. Â Very happy and will be back.
Good service at the bar... With good selections of wine. I thoroughly enjoyed the spaghetti and meatballs! Would definitely recommend.
Waiting area is way too small and it's annoying that they don't take reservations food was good but a bit on the pricey side.

The food is good for the area; however, the overall dining experience was disappointing. The server was inattentive and slow, it took nearly 30 minutes for the salad course to arrive. Â When we asked about the desserts, her response was, "I don't know, I don't eat dessert." Â A good server can elevate or destroy an experience and unfortunately it was the latter.

Used to come here with the family. Â Two weeks ago, came on a Thursday night--not full inside, but chose to sit outside since it was a lovely evening. Â Service was slow--painfully so. Â After 45 minutes we cancelled our order that we never received. Â The manager's response was to "not charge us for it." Â Really? Â How nice of her.
