Â Still charged us for the apps and my son's meal, however. Â We brought his leftovers home and that was my dinner. Â GO TO CAPRI IN DOWNTOWN PLAINFIELD.

I have eaten here five or six times and can honestly say I have never had a bad meal. Â Tonight though, I saw a picture of the Pork Chop Milanese special on Facebook and had to give it a try. Â Wow, It was fantastic! Already looking forward to going back.

One of the best restaurants in Plainfield! Never had a bad meal here. You usually can't go wrong going with the daily specials. I've had the Whitefish special the last two times I've been there it's been excellent! The place is on the smaller side they should expand. They also need a street light for turning north on rte 59. The atmosphere is still good and the food won't disappoint.

Maybe it's because we got a bad...horrible first impression at the door, but I'll say I won't be going back. The blonde hostess' personality was atrocious. She didn't smile at us nor greet us...just asked how many and then argued with the poor other hostess about where we would be seated and how long our wait would be. Literally arguing. We sat in the small waiting area before they concluded on a wait time. After being a hostess for three years myself I can say that that is no way to act in front of guests, it's obvious she's related to one of the owners, that's why she gets away with it, she has no idea what she doing. The food wasn't bad, I'd say it was average. Maybe not even, I had a chicken dish while my mother had the pasta with clams. It was alright. The best part? The hostess didn't even say bye or thank you, leaving a bad reflection on the restaurant as a whole.
Wonderful wonderful wonderful...a must go! Great food, great service and great atmosphere.

Our visit was unpleasant from the moment we walked in the door. There were 3 hostesses (all young high school girls), one was chomping away on gum, one was Â sneaking bites of food from under the hostess stand and the other one was answering phones frantically with a bad attitude. While waiting for our table a server and host got into an argument in front of the whole restaurant about how they were seating her tables too close together Â All of this in front of customers waiting. Â We waited for 45 mins, got sat, waited over an hour for our food, it was average at best. Our server was inattentive, Â they seemed to be understaffed in the wait staff department and were way over priced. They could not split checks ( come to find out they hand write tickets and that was why, but who operates without technology?!), they were out of several selections of wines (on a Friday night, they had all week to stock up) and it was generally a poor experience and I will never be returning.

Had dinner there last night. Â 1st time patron. Â The restaurant looks great!!!! Â Small and intimate. Â Service was great! Â Had the cheese ravoli, my date had the chicken parm. Â Both were good. Â The tiramisu not so much, that's what knocked down the rating as it was the servers recommendation, coffee not so good either. Â Over all a great small local place!!! Â :)
Great atmosphere and service. Superb tilapia. Bread, salad and desserts were average. Soft drink was flat. Good experience 4 stars.

La Dolce Vita per Tutti in Plainfield is a very popular Italian restaurant, but it is not a very large place. Reservations are only available for large groups, so the rule of thumb is come early or expect to wait for a table. The food and drink at this venue are very good and I have never had an issue with any of the staff. I have been there three or four times, as of this writing, and would gladly go again.

Overpriced and mediocre food. Â The restaurant certainly has nice atmosphere, but that's where the positive feedback ends. Â Our server was distracted and inattentive, and didn't even bother to outline the daily specials when she brought our menus. Â We only noticed the specials on the chalkboard after we had placed our orders - too late. Â Prices for bottled wine were within reasonable limits, but I'm sorry, the main dishes are definitely not a good value. Â Calamari that was supposed to come with marinary sauce actually came with shrimp cocktail sauce - ??? Â Linguine with clams was a pile of muck that seemed to have a can of chopped clams dumped on top. Â Too big a portion, too expensive, and too many clams. Â The caesar salad was too heavy and, again, 'mucky' with too much dressing. Â Poor value for the money - won't be going back.
Been at this fine establishment at least four times. Wonderful food and service every time. A must to visit...

finally !! great food!! fantastic atmosphere...no more driving to the city for quality dining! a little small, but we like a cozy place to eat, pricing was as expected, but not bad at all. thumbs up, we will be back for sure.

This is our new favorite restaurant. Â The service was good, most items are under $20 so I don't know how the one review spend $220 for 6 people - it had to be a lot of liquor. Â We have been there multiple times and never had a single complaint. Â The beef ravioli (I order it with meat sauce rather than marinara) is excellent and plentiful ($14.95) and the Fetticini Alfredo is the best I have ever had.

I have been here a number of times now and it has stayed consistent. The service is great the decor and atmosphere are great. The food has always been delicious. My favorites are always the specials. I try to get there early enough to get the specials. Just a nice little place to get a great meal. The best Italian food I have found in this area.

I agree completely with the other reviewers. This place is fantastic from the atmosphere to service to the food. We've been four times and each time it's been as good as the last. It's about time Plainfield residents had a true fine dining establishment this close to home. There's a nice wine selection. The salads are great. The entrees are as well, but Â linguini with clams is my favorite. Â I highly recommend La Dolce Vita. Enjoy!

Date night with the wife just moved in the area and had a taste for Italian so here we are and so Happy we came.Thursday's are $5 martinis and my wife approved!The food portions are generous and so so tasty!Staff is awesome...wait did I say AWESOME ask for Sheila she actually made the evening great!
The food is always consistent and on point!The staff is great and always friendly!!Great outdoor seating area as well.

Had 6:00 reservations on a Friday night. We were seated right away, and the staff very was attentive but not bugging us as we were sort of himming and hawing on what to drink and an appetizer. Server Eric would timely look over waiting for his que.Ordered the calamari which was dry and overcooked...Not too bad, but I wished I had ordered the stand by bruschetta. I had the Salmone della Casa, and my friend had the Linguine con Frutti del Mare. We both thoroughly enjoyed our entree's.An added bonus to our dinner was a band that started up around 7:00 or 7:30. The best part was the band rocked, but the restaurant does a great job of keeping the sound form ruining your dining experience.I have eaten at several of the Francesca restaurants, and our dining experience here was very good and consistent throughout the group.

Very good family restaurant in a strip mall! I may have overlooked this place except my friend and her family frequent this spot and told me they were authentic. We came here to celebrate the coming of her new baby and it was a real delight. The service was 5-stars. We had a challenging group of family with us who were picky, asked lots of questions, and would have been considered "difficult" for any seasoned server. Our server took it all in stride, made suggestions, answered questions, and was upbeat, friendly, and kept our water and wine glasses full (minus Ms. Preggo's glass!)The food was excellent with most of the group ordering one of the fish entrees. It was all fresh, cooked just right, and tasty. My friend and I traveled to the Cinque Terre last year and agreed the style was similar to what we had in our quest for authentic Italian cuisine along the Mediterranean. Highly recommend!
Everything about this place is outstanding! The food was fresh, the environment was casual fancy, and the service was so welcoming.

I have been here several time's over the year's.Usually for lunch after a movie. Today was the same.Not much to choose from on the menu. I know their concept is to change the menu every two week's. Â Soup's are bland. I actually sent mine back.Cream of eggplant? Â The server recommended it. It was terrible. Had a Â capress. Salad as a entre. Very limited on the fresh mozzarella cheese. I had much better at other italian reasturant's Little pricey . Did love the young adorable, very attentive busboy.
Date night with the wife. Â Great food, excellent service, lighting was slightly too dim and caused my eyes to strain. Â Definitely recommend however.
Very, very good food. The best Italian resturant in the west suburbs, and I've been to quite a few. The hostess, and staff were extremely hospitable. Makes you feel like you're at home.
I took my family there tonight. The food was all very good.The service was Excellent. Our drink glasses were never empty. The staff was extremely attentive.
Never disappoints! Â Great people, great service, great food! Â The staff is always super accommodating and makes dinning with two small children a breeze.
Good authentic Italian food. The soup was nothing special, but the pasta I had was fresh & delicious. The fresh bread was a nice touch. Decent drink menu, with plenty of unique mixes.

Came here for dinner tonight with my son and my mom. My mom and I took advantage of the half-price bottles of wine on Wednesdays (which is a great deal)! We sat outside on their beautiful, secluded patio and were very comfortable! Warm, fresh bread was delivered to the table almost immediately and our server followed soon after. My mom and I ordered the salmon alla fresca and we just about licked our plates clean....sooo good! The service, food, wine, and atmosphere were all fabulous! We will definitely be back!!!

This Francesca location has generally great food and all their pasta dishes are cooked to perfection, no mushy pasta here, all cooked al dente. Â  Â Their bruschetta is the best anywhere! One standout at this location is the server assistant, Monica. Â She is outstanding, always greets customers with a smile, efficiently helps servers in all aspects and her attention to detail is perfection! Â  Although this is in a strip mall, the seating is more comfortable than the other Francesca location in Naperville, La Sorella.

We frequent this restaurant often and usually have a great experience. Last night, we brought out of country guests with us, bragging about the food and service. While the food was its usual great, it has been by far the worst service we ever received. Took more than an hour to receive our entrees and this is after we had to ask our server twice to check status. Where she promised it would be out in a minute (which turned into another 15 minutes) and then ended up blaming the new trainees in the kitchen. Meanwhile, all tables around us have been served. The bus girl however was one of the BEST we've ever experienced and we made sure she received a separate gratuity from us. I had another reservation for Father's Day tomorrow, but canceled it after last nights' experience.

We love coming to Francessca Passagio! Always great food and great service. All of our special occasions are held here! Tonight, we celebrated our 25th anniversary. The manager, Erin and the bartender Mikey B were amazing! Thank you!

Went there for dinner at 8 PM on a Tuesday night. Restaurant closes at 9 PM. We were completely rushed through our dinner which I did not appreciate. Our waitress was fantastic. The food was mediocre at best. Certainly nothing special as a matter of fact my dish was missing ingredients per its description on the menu. Â Thanks but not thanks!
Had dinner here last night..$5 lasagna and half price bottles of wine.Great food! Great price! Great service!We will be back for sure

Had dinner for 5, bill was 330$. EXTREMELY OVERPRICED. The waiter was very unprofessional and silly. Very bad service overall.They did not keep the waters full on the table, neglected for most of the meal. Messed up three out of five dishes. Servers were rude and combative.Caprese salad is just huge watery tasteless tomatoes, and uses cheap olive oil.Ingredients are cheap. The pastas don't come with nearly enough sauce.If you have no other option go here... But for the price you can go to a handful of MUCH better restaurants with SIGNIFICANTLY better service in the area.

The food is absolutely delicious and the prices are reasonable. My favorite side is the garlic spinach and you can never go wrong with one of the pasta or chicken dishes-all are great. Sides and salads are ala cart, but large enough to share. Wednesday is half price wine night, so be sure to have a bottle and save.

This is the south side Francesca's location...easy location & parking (compared to the downtown location.). I've eaten here several times and have enjoyed the food and the service. Â I eat gluten free Â and I appreciate that they have a great gf menu. Â Their gf pasta is a corn/rice combination.This location has outdoor seating (weather permitting). Â The portions are HUGE! Â Great food, great location!!!!

We had a great experience here tonight at a birthday party. Â The young staff are exceptionally trained. Â They are courteous, fun, and extremely efficient and knowledgable. Â The food was great and so was the wine. Â Excellent evening. Â So much so that I waited to see the charming manager before I left to express our gratitude. Â We'll be back. Thank you, Francesca's Passagio!
Very understaffed and bland, overpriced food. They also made several errors on our check.There are lots of nice restaurants in the area that I'd go to before I ever come back here.

Have been to this Francesca's many times over the years. Â Have also been to 6 other Francescas and find this the best from our standpoint. Â They came through once again on all cylinders when I arranged a surprise b-day dinner for my wife and a group of close friends. Â Surprise worked out perfectly, staff was great, service was top notch and the food was excellent as usual.Well Done folks at P! Â Thanks!!

My first time here. I was very well taken care of by Sharon Oleski, the assistant manager. Liked their calamari appetizer and then the main course of Mahi Mahi cooked Italian (Ok North Italian) style with Spinach. This was the lunch I tried. They do often have specials. Nice large place, which helps with large groups, plenty of parking nearby and if you like shopping before or after at many of the well known establishments and shopping strip malls (XL sized nearby)! Plan to go again and evaluate for consistency and other variety.

Excellent ExperienceMy wife and I celebrated our 14 year wedding anniversary at Francesca's Passaggio. Â Sheila was our server - what an amazing person. Â She knew the menu/wine list inside and out, recommended a fabulous meal and most importantly, made us feel special. Â Erin was the general manager, she stopped by the table to ensure everything was perfect. Â They ended the meal by bringing out an amazing dessert with "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate.To Erin and Sheila - thank you for making our night special. Â It's been a tough year, and you allowed us to forget all the bad and focus on the good.As for the food, it was amazing. Â We've been eating there for years and never had anything that wasn't excellent. Â Great job to the entire staff, keep up the great work!

I'm very disappointed. I understand that you will be asked to wait on a Saturday night without a reservation. Â I was told there would be a wait of 20-30 minutes for a party of two. While we waited, two separate parties of three came in without reservations and were told 30-35 or 40 minutes. Â Both parties were seated within fifteen minutes of their arrival. Â After waiting 50 minutes, a party of four came in, again without a reservation, and were told 20-25 minutes. Â They were seated five minutes later. Â When I asked the hostess she said it would be just another few minutes because they were waiting for a party of two to finish up and wanted to seat the bigger parties first. Â I'm very unhappy that we couldn't have been seated at one of those four seat tables. I'm also very unhappy that not once during our 50 minute wait, was anything said to us. We were not apologized to, we were not given an ETA. Â We decided to take our business elsewhere.

I am a hater of Italian food and especially pasta, but went here on a Saturday afternoon for my mother's birthday. I ordered the ravioli and split the chicken with my mom and it was deliciously moist and well prepared. I was pleasantly surprised! The staff is very attentive and personable. Overall, I would definitely come again. The decor inside is also very nice and clean.

Whether Â dining in or carry out fancesca's always delivers great food and great service. Â  One thing that I truly appreciate is that when getting carry out we more times than not order penne butura. Â Even if Â it's not on the menu they always make it for us as they did last Monday. Â  The champagne dressing on a salad Â is mine and my wife's all time favorites. Â  Â The only negative would be twice Â on a busy Friday they have had a hard time keeping the white wines cold. Â  But they ALWAYS ALWAYS make it right. Â  The wait staff is always friendly, personable and good. Â  We will be Â lifelong customers
This was very slow service and i did not enjoy how long the wait was. It was very unorganized.

My wife and I went here on a Friday night just to get away and enjoy one another's company. Needless to say we found a Gem!You walk into this place and are greeted with open arms. We did have a reservation but definitely didn't need one. Right when we sat down our water glasses where filled and we were told our specials by our amazing waitresses Shelia.Shelia is one of the best waitresses that we have ever had. She was funny, sarcastic and well just like my wife and I. She really took care of us and she always has regulars.The food was delicious and well priced. The menu is hand written because they change it once a month. We are definitely going back and requesting service.
Did not have good service. Â Waiter forgot my soup and then tried to charge me for it. Â Food was good

Tucked away behind a dying strip center in the Naperville badlands you will find this gem (more like a cz).I've had good experiences here but my last visit would make my malpractice rates skyrocket because someone needed to be euthanized after my visit.Made a reservation for my party arrived on time and had to wait 25 minutes so they could sit me in the corner of the rental room. Because we were in the dungeon no waiters would visit the table. My "rations" were never refilled and it took an hour to place my order.When I finally found a guard (busboy) he alerted the warden (manager) and we got the check and escaped the Naperville Alcatraz.I thought highly of this restaurant until they treated me like a prisoner. I was sentenced to two hours I'll never get back.

This is for my wife who recently visited Francesca's. She was with friends who had already selected the restaurant. Otherwise, admittedly, she would not go there. Â She does not like food that is heavily seasoned. So she asked if she could order the salmon plain. no seasoning and no wine sauce. She was told NO. Â Not the answer i would expect from a high end Italian restaurant. Hence the two stars. I am sure their food is very good. However, their unwillingness to work with a customer's needs pretty much puts them on my "Do Not Return" list.

Took my GF for her birthday here and we both enjoyed the food there. Service was prompt and the menu is priced fairly.The last time I came here for lunch we were a bit turned off by various "special menu" tricks, they do charge tax on the regular price and then pocket the difference... seems like an odd practice.
Love this place. Best bruschetta ever! Also, I've eaten everything on the menu and have never been disappointed!

When we lived close by, we would sometimes come by once per week. The food is always spot-on, and it's our favorite place to take guests when they're in town and we don't want to go far.The pizza is good, and there's always a rigatoni dish that hits the spot. The menu changes frequently, so unfortunately when you find something you like, it might be a while before you see it again. The mushroom risotto is a standout in my mind. The bar is pretty good too.Downsides: Sometimes the seating sucks. Time and again there are booths available and we get seated directly in front of the kitchen, where servers and bus boys wedge themselves against our table to get by. We love the cheesecake, but sometimes you can tell when it isn't fresh made, and it's always a damper on our meal.That in mind, it's our favorite Italian place.
The menu changes a lot but everything is always amazing. Â The pasta is so fresh. Their sauces ate too die for. Â One of our favorite date places.

Amazing is the only word for the food and the service! Â Our waitress was Sheila - highly recommend her for her demeanor and attentiveness.We had fabulous service as well from the extra wait staff. My husbands glass of water never went down more the one third and they were there filling the glass. Â Same for our bread and coffee.I had giant rigatoni with oxtail red sauce. Â WOWMy husband had the four cheese stuffed pasta with a sage/veal butter sauce. Delicious.This was our first time at this location and we are already talking about when we can go back and we are still just driving home.Yes it was that good.We also had dessert. Â The chocolate kava cake and pistachio cream puffs.Yummy!I would recommend a reservation.

This place used to be great, now it is just mediocre at best. Â The food used to be quality, now it is on par with Olive Garden. Â The service used to be amazing. Â Now your lucky if someone helps you within the first 30 minutes of going there. Â I would like to believe it was an isolated incident, but this has been the pattern the last 5 visits. Â There are better options than this place.

I was SO bummed with our experience there. We had reservations for a muggy Friday night, thankful to enjoy a relaxing dinner inside. Unfortunately, they had all the doors open to the patio, so our "inside" dinner turned muggy quickly. While the patio looked fun, we definitely won't return. The food selection was slim and overpriced, and the service was incredibly slow (with the exception of the busboys). We ordered a second round of drinks before our dinner came out...we received our dinner, ate it, had leftovers packaged, and several refills of water before our server came over - without drinks. What I ended up truly being thankful was a giftcard that covered all but $8 of our meal.

This was the special day when I was proposing the girl of my life..The staff helped me through the preparation and execution of plan. Â Every one contributed especially the Manager and the lady who served our table..They arranged the table with Roses and Petals.. Â my girlfriend was amazed with the way table was decorated. Â They had specially arranged for flowers as requested by me over the phone. Â I had planned few gifts for her they brought her every gift step by step and very finely.. after she accepted my proposal, every member of the team came to our table to wish us and give rose to my fiance.In the excitement we were not able to make any decision. Â so the lady kindly helped us through the menu served best dishes.Prices were just perfect too!!Served complimentary Champagne like cherry on the creamhighly recommended!!!The team made our day as memorable as it could get!!!Just added note: Â Other places I contacted were not so friendly and did not agree to help me as I was planning.

I have been patronizing both locations in Naperville since they opened. Â Service is always fantastic!Food has been mediocre for about a year now! Â  Not sure if they got a new cook, or changed their food standards. Â  I am sad that one of my favorite restaurants food has went down dramatically in taste/quality!

So happy to have found a Francesca;s restaurant that I'm not bummed about. Â Francesca's Passaggio serves excellent Italian food. Â My friends had suggested it for a small reunion dinner. I had pre-conceived notions based on my past experience with the Francesca's in other areas, (downtown Naperville, Chicago, etc..) Â Nope. Passaggio put me in my place. Â Appetizers, entrees and desserts were very, very good. Â Service was impeccable and attentive. Â I love that. Â We never had to ask for anything. They know how to do it here. Â I would suggest you take a chance on dishes that you may never have had before. Â Don't worry...they don't stray too far from traditional. Â You should try it out. Â  Â I look forward to returning!

I've only ever ordered food to carry out...butholy cow.it's always been ridiculously delicious. Â The food is always rich and flavorful...so if you try to take your time (which is hard because it's so amazing it's difficult not to eat it all at once!) Â you can usually get two meals out of a pasta dish.I've heard rumors that the salmon here is really good. Â I will be trying that next.ps I love the bread. Â and the side of cheese and olive oil!

The worste restaurant experience I have ever had. Â The waitress was combative and rude.. Â  I was served the wrong dish, she insisted it was correct. Â I said no I did not order anything with shrimp, she said "yes, honey you did". Â I know what I wanted, she wrote down what she thought I wanted. Â I did not want to ruin my families meal, so I kept the dish. Â When she returned to the table I said this is not what I wanted, she continued to call me hon, and honey, even though I asked her to stop. All I really need to hear is I'm sorry there was a mistake, but she was such a blasted bulldog, speaking loud and forcefull right in my face. I received a dish I clearly did not like, I did not want it, I did not like it and I had to deal with a Bulldog barking in my face. She had the balls to stop my husband on the way out and ask if we would be back. Â Hell No!

I have eaten at several of the Francesca restuarants in the Chicago area, we have two of them here in Naperville. Francesca's Passagio in only a mile or so away from my house so it is very convienient and much easier than dealing with the parking situation at the one in downtown Naperville. Â I have eaten here several times and never been unhappy with my meal. This Francesca's seems to always have more fish on their menu which is nice becuase I am a fan of good seafood and italian food. The menu is always evolving and Â has a few new items or specials as well as a few of their tried and true menu items that are always available. Service is always good. As with most every place in Naperville expect a small wait to be seated if you plan on showing up during peak weekend hours.

I've been eating at Francesca restaurants for about a decade. Â I have been going to this particular restaurant for about 6 years. Â They have been our "go to" special occasion/night out restaurant. Â All I can say is the francescas of the old days is long gone. The last 5 times I've been here have been subpar to downright awful. It seems as though when they purchased their other brands they moved their cooks and management to those restaurants and left Francescas to rot. Â This last visit was at about 5 on a Thursday. Â Three other tables were seated. Â First issue was our drink glasses were filthy with lipstick around the rims. We asked for new ones and the waiter brought back fresh drinks in another set of dirty lipstick stained glasses. Â The third time they were brought back the glasses were clean but one of the drinks was wrong?! I ordered the calamari for an appetizer which was clearly a mix of two batches. Some were cooked perfect while others were way over cooked. Â My salmon was also over cooked. Â It was also listed to be served with avocado, but instead came with an ice cream scoop of guacamole?! My wife's pasta came missing a fresh mozzarella topping and was bland. Â Bringing it to the waiters attention was futile. He was MIA most of the night and was very goofy and talked like a surfer/stoner. Â "Like cool man I'll get you some fresh glasses?!" Â There was no manager to be seen. Â We just threw up our hands and paid the bill. Â I sent corporate two emails to ask them what the heck is up with this place, but they never responded. Â It seems it's a culture that has trickled down from the top. Â We used to love this restaurant group, but no more. Â Never again will they get my money.
Had my daughters 40th birthday dinner there. first time at restaurant and we were very pleased. Thanks for adding to her special birthday Â  Â Joe c.

We tried this restaurant after a friend of ours held a party at the downtown Naperville location - the food there was excellent! We ate at the Passaggio on a Friday evening. I see what people have said in their other reviews - the place is loud, the tables are very close together and the ambience is plain.My biggest complaint is a big one: the food. We both had the lobster bisque - if was good, but with each bite it became less impressive. The menu was a bit unimpressive - I had a difficult time picking out something appealing. I chose a ravioli of sorts that was filled with lobster and crab with a cream sauce - it was so fishy tasting! I love lobster and crab and have never experienced a fishy taste from them! My husband pitied me and we switched entrees. Â His was a shrimp and scallop pasta with a "spicy marinara." The shrimp were tough (over-cooked) and the sauce had zero flavor - one step away from being canned tomatoes. He didn't care for either dish either, but wasn't as repulsed as I was.I really thought it was pretty bad and should have complained, but didn't feel comfortable doing so. Long story short, for one of our rare nights out with no kids, we paid $80 for a meal that we hated.

Very hit or miss food and overpriced. Almost $30 for an overcooked piece of Grouper is ridiculous. Their chef has obviously never been to Italy as they over load/over power their pasta dishes (and others) with way too much garlic instead of relying on the natural flavors of the ingredients. Very disappointing...used to go their quite a bit but never again.
The food is always excellent, a good wine selection, and the service is superb. Â One of our favorites! Â Have eaten here at least 30 times and have never been let down.

I had Valentine's Day dinner at Francesca's Passaggio a couple days ago. Â  I had never been there before and I was surprised how low rent this location is compared to the one on Jefferson. Â  The wait staff wore t-shirts and were very unpolished. Â  The bottle of pinot noir we ordered came with a twist cap. Â That's right. Â  A TWIST CAP! Â The food was ok, but Â this joint is tacky with a capital "T".If you want a good Italian meal, go to Â Maggiano's, Biaggis, Rosebuds, or the Francesca's in downtown Naperville. Â Hell, Olive Garden is better than this place.

My friend received an email yesterday from Francesca's about "National Lasagna Day" ( who knew?) and they had a Lasagna special for lunch and dinner for $5. We had reservations at Passaggio after 8pm and we called on the way over from the car to make sure they still had the special and did not run out. They said yes, special was still ON...10 minutes later, we arrived and guess what...?...they were out of lasagna. Total BUMMER, as this was the main reason we were going...to try the lasagna AND we even called to reconfirm. I had the rigatoni and friend had a chicken breast dish...rigatoni was very tasty, chicken dish was bland...but ordered for it's simplicity ( friend is a healthy eater so it was fine). The menu changes daily so if you like something, it may not be available the next time, so keep that in mind. I like the bread with the oil and fresh parm at the table. The room is a tad noisy and try for a booth instead of a table in the middle of the room.The lady who refilled the water and dropped off the bread was on her game and our glasses of vino and water were never empty. We appreciate that. Our server was friendly, prompt and had good suggestions on entrÃ©e selections considering they did not have enough lasagna prepared. The bonus of the evening is when our server told us Wednesday is half off bottles of wine! Chalk Hill Chardonnay half off...takes a $52 bottle of Vino and makes it totally affordable for a weeknight...We will be back on a Wednesday and hopefully will get to try out the lasagna in the near future.

I got a call the other evening from a friend who was headed to Francesca's to celebrate her birthday and asked me to meet them there. Â I was at work at the time, but once I heard "Francesca's", I put my equipment away and headed home to change. Â I haven't been out to dinner in a while and the food there is simply not to be missed.By the time I'd arrived, they'd already eaten but the birthday girl insisted I try the pork chops. Â It was smothered in mushrooms and some sort of (cran?)berry, and was simply delicious. Â The special attention our waiter gave to me after being a late arrival is almost expected at this point since they're always extremely accommodating and polite. Â THAT impresses me even more than their cuisine.The reason for the lacking star? Â Noise. Â Having a conversation is a bit challenging, but it's forgivable. Â You'll be too busy enjoying your dinner to talk, anyway.

Went to another one of these restaurants a few years back and loved it but this one was not as goodI ordered some lobster bisque and I think I only had this once before so I don't know how it is suppose to taste. However there was some shells while eating it and that was not very good. My wife ordered a caprice salad and that was good.We ordered a couple of drinks. I tried some jack Daniels drink and my wife got a mojito. My wife's mojito was disappointing. She got it here before and loved it. This time it didn't taste like it had any liquor in it and it was not very minty. My drink was too strong and all I tasted was the jack. However our waitress took my wife drink off the billFor the main entree I ordered a lobster filled pasta and my wife got a pizza. My wife's pizza was excellent. It tasted like I was eating saganaki. Â We weren't sure how good it would be with the lemon but it worked extremely well. My lobster pasta (can't remember what it was called) was good not great. I would not recommend it because of the price as it was nineteen dollars.The service was also excellent. They made sure our water was always full. That is always a plus in my book. She was very apologetic when my wife complained about her drink and they did take it off the bill, even though we didn't want them too. Our food and soup and salad came out at a good time. Brought us two loaves of bread which i forgot to mention were also really good.So in conclusion I might go back again but i wouldn't go anytime soon. Although the pizza, salad, and the service were really good the prices are a little expensive and the drinks really need some work. However it is still better than Olive Garden.

I will start this review saying that I am more of a fan of classic immigrant style Italian food rather than this "new" Italian that seems to be Francesca's style.Let's start with the decor- I was taken aback by the starkness and the confusion of the styles. In some ways it looks like they shopped at Dania or a similar store. Not that this is bad but I would prefer that the inside of an Italian restaurant be more warm and comforting rather than as cold as the decor is of this place.The night we visited the menu was heavy with meats and veals- there was only one pasta dish that was truly "vegetarian" in nature. On the plus side, our server said that any pasta dish could be prepared gluten free (which we found out later meant omitting the pasta).Our server was attentive and helpful but it seems as if there is a severe lack of waitstaff. Even though our waitress was nice and helpful she seemed worn out and overworked- it was a "worn out" vibe that seemed to be everywhere you looked.As another reviewer noted- the noise level is high and conversation is difficult. My guess is that the acoustics are poor and could use some help.The meals we were served were "OK" but not particularly memorable or well presented. To be honest- I was very disappointed in what we were served given the personal recommendations that I had been given.I like to linger with another cocktail or a shared dessert but I was more than ready to leave after our entree plates were cleared. We actually went somewhere else nearby for our after dinner cocktail.I just don't know what to make of this place- I guess it's much like the greater Naperville area; cultivating the perception that it is more than it really is and going for snob appeal rather than substance.

Where to start?This place was a wreck. Let me first start off by saying the food was pretty good, no issues there. I had the swordfish special with the calamari fritter appetizer accompanied by a pre-meal key lime pie martini. It was a matter of service that dropped this place in star rankings.Our server was a hopped up like an out of work Friday's junkie. This was supposed to be an attempt at mocking upscale Italian. It turned into a friendly get to know you bombardment, interrupted by sporadic fragmented daily specials.We asked for bread twice. It came after the third time. I was being playful and asked if it was still being baked.This was a birthday dinner for my mother. Our service was rushed. We were brought the wrong entrees. The restaurant was only half full at 8:30pm and we were being herded like cattle to finish.Here is the kicker, the bus woman came to remove crumbs from the table during the middle of dinner. As I thought that to be rude enough, she leaned over and pinned my hand to my wine glass with her breast. Normally I would not complain, but it was awkward, ignored, and just shocking.They were playing pop music in the bathrooms, there was not one Italian server, they had Ansel Adam's portraits on the walls. Make up your mind, and hire a respectful competent staff or drop your prices to compete with the Applebee's down the road.Happy B-Day mom.

I completely dogged my last review of Francesca's in Wicker Park and was determined to never visit again. A nice present of a gift card forced my hand and I'm so glad that I chose the Passagio this time! What an absolutely different experience.We made reservations for 7:30 on a Saturday night. It was packed on arrival and I was told they were running behind. We sat at the bar and waited, I was already having flashbacks to my crummy previous visit and regretting the second chance. Â Shortly there after, the front of the house manager stopped by and offered us a $10 giftcard towards drinks and said that someone would be out with a complementary appetizer to tide us over while we waited. Â Hmm, I thought, this is service. Â We received an entire plate of their bruschetta to enjoy over a couple glasses of wine. Â Things were looking up!We were seated by a very apologetic staff member and taken care of by a very sweet young man who had nothing but smiles and great recommendations. Â We did another appetizer, as if the bruschetta wasn't enough, but the selections were too intriguing to pass up another. Â We both ordered something from their pasta menu - I tried the gnocchi while my dining partner had some orchicetta with sausage, veggies, and tasty cheeses. Â Their menus change periodically throughout the season. Â We were stuffed! Â The bill was hardly intimidating and in fact, I still had money left on that $50 gift card afterwards.This trip was a breath of fresh air from my previous Francesca's visit. Â Thank you, Passagio, for redeeming this restaurant group and convincing me to come back again and again.

3 stars= A-OK and that's exactly what Francesca's Passagio was on my experience.My parents chose this restaurant for a father's day dinner and I defo enjoyed it but I don't know if it's anything that I would crave or go out of my way for.At the time I was a meat eater and I selected beef carpaccio for our appetizer and it was very delicious. I enjoyed it very much and there was a really great sized portion for $13 but I have to mention that it had a really excessive amount of capers... like maybe there was a kitchen accident with the caper jar? I also had a salad before our meal and I thought the salad was very lacking in size and ingredients but it was a pre meal thing so I got over it.I got a fish dish for dinner and it was good but I thought there was a bit too much oil on the plate as a whole. Then again, I'm also seeing a pattern with this at other Italian restaurants so maybe that's how everyone else likes it and I'm just not accustomed. I finished all of it and left no room for dessert, unfortunately.Though I did enjoy Francesca's, I would really have liked to see a more extensive menu and maybe some more risk taking options to choose from as everything seemed very run of the mill. Also, the decor really leaves something to be desired. It's like minimal cheap diner decor or along the thought process of "it's my first apartment and I know my lease is up in 8 months and I'm moving out but I'll buy some frames with black and white photos already in them and hang em". I think they did just enough to get by but should really reconsider investing some time and money in an interior decorator and lighting company. A little romance and mystery would easily bump this place up a star and a half.

Francesca establishments have done a superb job at positioning themselves as the premier casual Italian restaurant. They have locations all over the Chicagoland area.I dont dine in as often as I use to. Mainly because the group of servers are full of themselves at this location. Now, I primarily order to-go. The food is equally as good at home as it is in the restaurant.Most of their pasta dishes consist of simple recipes and simple ingridients. Yet, they're delicious. They blow olive garden and the like out of the water, and the prices are only 15-20% greater. Not too shabby. App's are great, salads are ok, and soups are good. Dessert is decent too. They make a variety of protien dishes, which are all typically good.This place is a must for anyone in Naperville, at least once.

This is my first time here and honestly I'm not impressed.I'll admit the risotto was yummy. That was the only good thing though. The hostess didn't even smile when she greeted us. She seemed annoyed and I could tell she hates her job. She knew there were five of us and seated us at a really small table. The whole time we were bumping elbos. The bussers where still clearing off our table while we were getting settled at the table. Our server how ever, I don't know his name because he never told us, don't know the portion sizes of the dinners and seemed like he wanted to leave an was very annoyed. I paid 10 dollars to eat one crab cake. I can go some where else and pay 10 dollars for a plate of three crab cakes. I'm not impressed. Back to the busser she was very rude. I was trying to have a conversation with my dining partner and she would shove her self in the way to get the crumbs off the table. She could have just waited till we left. Also the servers need to lower their voices when gossiping about costumers. I work at a restaurant myself and our staff is ten times better and the staff is well trained on our menu. I think management needs to step it up. Over all, the staff is rude, the food eh it's alright. I don't think ill be spending money here anytime soon. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

Passagio's has excellent food, excellent service and a wonderful atmosphere! Â You would never know you were in a strip mall! Â All Francesca restaurants are top notch! Â The food is never disappointing! Â They use fresh ingredients and are very pleasing to any foodie! Â Great cocktails and a very nice wine selection as well! Â They have a simple but delightful menu! Â Sundays they offer children eat free which is always a great family option! Â We have never been disappointed here! Â I just love going here! Â It is one of my absolute favorite restaurants!!
Fantastic bruschetta, good wine, good overall price, very good dinner special. Overall great restaurant.

I hadn't realized quite how nice this place was when I dragged my spouse, sister and 4-year-old nephew here. Â We were underdressed, but they were very nice about it and they had a kid's menu for the nephew (who didn't properly appreciate his excellent cheese pizza...oh well). Â It's in a strip mall at what seemed like the ends of the earth.The food was excellent and the service pretty good. Â It was awfully crowded (we were here for dinner). Â I had the risotto, which I found merely good, but my sister was captivated.Menu is handwritten and apparently changes every 2 weeks. Â A little pricey but worth it for really good Italian.

Francesca's is some of the best Italian eats in the burbs. Â This is not the original location and lacks some of the flare which is the only reason it missed the elusive 5th star.Their handwritten menu changes every two weeks. Â This way it's like a new restaurant every time you come. Â The pasta is fresh and oh so delicious. Â Try a little pizza for an appetizer you won't soon forget. Â They always have fish and meat offerings on the menu and their fish dishes are incredible.It is a rather small restaurant and it can get loud. Â So if you're looking for intimate go elsewhere, but if you seek awesome Italian food look no further.

First, I'll start by saying the Google Maps location is a little off. As of right now it shows the position of the restaurant as being at the corner of 75th street and Route 59... that's not actually the case. It's about 2 or 3 miles south of 75th street.Now on to the meal. My wife and I shared a caesar salad that was just the right amount for the two of us. If each person got their own salad it would be a little too much to eat before moving on to the entree. So keep that in mind.For my entree I had chicken that was covered with a red sauce (it had a fancy name that I don't remember). This wasn't your typical marinara sauce which was nice, and the presentation was very well done. I wasn't overly impressed with quality of the meal, but the uniqueness of the entrees available was rather refreshing. The selection available can be rather limiting though so make sure whomever you're going with also wants Italian because aside from the pizza options on the menu the other items are all very much pasta-centric, or (as in my case with the chicken) at least include a pasta on the side.Now if only they could get away from that handwritten menu. Some people see it as a nice personalized touch and adds to the ever-changing entrees, but I just find it to be a mess to read.

was brought there for a business lunch and had some wonderful chicken and potatoes in a yummy parmesan sauce. brought my wife back yesterday. she had the salmon. crispy on the outside, warm and moist in the inside. I had the ravioli suffer with lobster. and cold (garspacho) soup which was also yummy. fresh bread so hot you had to have to cool down before you tore it apart and a lovely apple thingy with ice cream for dessert. this is the kind of food you dream of getting but are usually disappointed. I'm going back--often and try more wonderful stuff. reasonably priced for what you get.

I was waiting for long lines, inexperienced hostesses, crowded and noisy dining floor, and delicious food. I got delicious food, expert hosts and waiters, and a joyful family lunch.This is now one of my top favorite Italian restaurants. So much easier than the overblown, overcrowded downtown Naperville location. Delectable, fresh dishes that orchestrate the nuances famous in Italian dishes, and such a variety of items on the menu! The pizza of the day on our visit was the pizza della foresta which featured wild mushrooms, a little too cheesy for real Italian pizza, but delectable on a thin, flatbread-crunchy-like crust. The rigatoni melanzana, chicken florentine, penne alla paesana...and the desserts... torta volcano and crema alla vaniglia...wow. Delectable from start to finish.All the busboys and waiters hustled and kept checking in with us even though the dining floor was buzzing. Excellent service and delicious food. A must! especially features much more personality and original Italian taste than nearby Biaggi's.
Wonderful service and wonderful food!
This is my favorite restaurant. Every meal I have eaten here has been delicious. Good service too. My favorite!

My husband and I have been to both this location and the downtown Naperville location and both have been outstanding!This evening, my husband had a chicken dish while I had one of the specials on the menu, a jalepeno and roasted red pepper pasta dish with a vodka cream sauce. We also shared a ceasar salad. Their salads are pretty large, so you can very easily split one with someone else.Service was good. Our waiter had several other tables but kept on top of it well.Overall, another great dining experience at Francesca's! I love that their menu changes (it's handwritten) which means there is always something new to try.

The handwritten menus are unique, however, it kind of makes them hard to read. Â Nice idea, but a little more organization would be nice - ie. don't squeeze in words that don't fit just anywhere. Â Maybe different colors for the name of the dishes vs the description might help. Â Its a quaint idea..The bread was more on the crusty side but was perfect with the entrees. Â The bruschetta with prosciutto was delicious. Â The cheese wasn't a big wad as it usually is, more of a fluffy creamy texture, and the tomatoes in it was marinated well. Â The calamari was well cooked, marinara sauce was good with large chunks in it which is the way I usually like it.I got the spaghetti with mussels - the sauce had a great flavor, almost on the salty side but not quite there. Â The mussels were a good size, not teeny like it is in some places. Â The bread was excellent with the sauce. Â Loved the amount of mussels the dish came with as well.The tiramisu was one of the best I've ever had. Â Loved the drizzles of chocolate around the plate.All in all, can't wait to return and see them again. Â The service was excellent, the atmosphere is nice, and most of the food was excellent. Â Not crazy creative, just a solid italian place with a few quirky touches.

I heart Francesca's.I think this is my 4th one... 5 stars all.Passaggio is modestly (cough) located in a crappy strip mall, right off crappy route 59, spittin' distance from crappy Plainfield.Once you enter the restaurant though...The decor is nice. The ambiance is simple, not snooty. The service was great... our waitress talked up how well the Francesca's owners run the place and treat her and other employees. And the food is outstanding!I had the lobster bisque with the crab chunks. Drool. Entree was the spinach ravioli in the heavenly sauce. Dessert was awesome tiramisu. So great.This is an easy 5 stars... so just go, will ya!frances-yum... yow, bill

Went with real high hopes and lots of folks saying how great it isGlorified banquet hall was the reality. Overdressed and underclothed teenage high school hostesses are the point of the chaotic service spear if you will. Waitress was sweet, but the rest of the team was clueless. Timing, drinks, bread all wrong, had to actually get up and get bread plates. Very loud space. but loved the singer in the bar., Limited menu. Nothing super interesting Pasta was fresh but everything else was.... mehh, OK. Went with five other adults and it was all okay.Fairly attractive space inside with a big private party room adjacent. Its a big hit with lots of locals, but I think its more of a meeting, socializing and wine thing than great food.Maybe it was an off night...Will give it another shot

Ok, now the Francesca's chain is one of my favorite italian restaurants. I've been to quite a few locations. The food is to die for. I just started working back in Naperville after being in Lombard for the last couple years. I had a craving for the Pollo alla salvia. Chicken prosciutto spinach mozzarella in a light tomato sauce with a side of pasta. I get back to work only to find no spinach or pasta. I called and they told me that pasta doesn't come with it for lunch. WTF?!?!? no pasta?!?! It would have been nice knowing that before I ordered it. I paid $13.99 for 2 pieces of chicken when for dinner it would cost $14.99. The food was still good as always but I was hoping to get 2 meals out of this instead of just 1. I don't know if I'll ever go back for lunch....

We came here with 10 friends for my birthday dinner, and it was just "OK". I had high expectations after hearing all the raves about the other locations, and they most definately were not met.While the decor is nice, our waitstaff attentive, and wine list respectable, the menu was very limited. I know they change the menu every two weeks, which is admirable. It just wasn't all that great at the time we were there.I had the pork chops, as I was not really in the mood for a heavy pasta dish (which is rare for me), and they were fine, nothing to rave about. Â The broth they were bathing in was amazing, though! However, the herbed polenta was basically soup. Grainy, bland soup. No thanks. I tried a number of other diner's dishes, and all were just okay. Portion size was HUGE! Â If you want good Italian, and better selection, go down the street to Biaggi's or better yet, Clara's the hidden gem of Woodridge.We won't be going back.

My disappointing evening began at a tiny table wedged in an overcrowded dining room. There was less than a foot between my table and the surrounding guests. The restaurant quickly filled up and the noise level sky rocketed. The noise combined with the T-shirts the wait staff wore clashed with the classy decor and I'm still not sure what "ambiance" the restaurant was going for: bar or fancy Italian restaurant?Now the food. We started out with the prosciutto which was served probably two minutes after we ordered it. The appetizer was as good as expected; the meat and the cheeses were fresh and delicious. We had barely finished the appetizer when our split plate arrived. We ordered the Rigatoni del Pastore. The pasta was barely cooked and the slices of Italian sausage were way too big and couldn't be broken up with a fork. When I managed to gnaw my way through a chewy, crunchy noodle, I got a face full of goat cheese. This dish drowned in enormous hunks of goat cheese that had no business being there. The goat cheese pasted my tongue and dominated any other possible positive flavors. What sauce I did end up tasting was bland and had a weird, goopy texture. The dessert managed to redeem the meal, however. We had the Profiteroles al Pistachio Gelato and since I hadn't really gotten my hopes up, I was pleasantly surprised. The gelato was amazing and worth the risk.Overall, I was displeased with my experience. Our waitress was excellent, that definitely needs to be mentioned. There was one woman who would not let me take more than a couple sips of my water before she refilled my glass. It got to be obnoxious. She filled my glass around 12 times, disrupting my conversation every single time. It also felt like they were trying to shove us out of the restaurant. There was no wait between any courses and the crowd forming in the bar area suggested they were only concerned with a quick turn around. I'm sure Francesca's other locations are fine, but this experience left a bad taste in my mouth in addition to the goat cheese I'm still trying to scrape off my tongue. Don't get your hopes up for this place, it's not worth the money or time.

since moving to Aurora over a year ago, we've probably had Francesca's at least 10 times, counting dine-in and carry-out. The food's pretty good, but nothing spectacular. The Caesar salad here is definitely not your typical Caesar and the first time I ate it, I was taken aback. Now, I've grown to like it, but I think they should rename it, as it's not what people expect when they order a Caesar salad.Like another reviewer said, the food is not very exciting and the variety of dishes is limited.The main reason for this review is because the last few times we got carry-out, our orders have been messed up: the Caesar salad comes with the dressing on the side in a little plastic container. Whoever packed the food forgot to include the dressing, so I basically paid about $6 or $7 for a bunch of lettuce with a few croutons. When I called to complain, all they offered was a free Caesar on a future order. So they basically just paid for my salad, but did nothing to recompenate for the aggravation. If I was the manager, I would have given 2 salads, or a free appetizer or something.On our last carry-out order, we ordered a pasta con Pollo, but received a pasta with mozzarella. I really should have checked my food before I brought it home, but....Everytime we've ever ordered carryout, they include a some cut bread with olive oil. That's something that we look forward to, but didn't receive any on a recent order.Here's another good one: my husband and I ate in Francesca's and both ordered filets. He ordered his Medium, with Bleu cheese crumbles. I ordered mine Medium-Well, with some other sauce, possibly Bearnaise..? anyway, when the steaks arrived, there was some mixup. Matt's steak was cooked Medium-Well, and mine was cooked Medium. Normally, this would be something that I could overlook, and we would have simply switched steaks. However, they had already put the different sauces on top. We hailed the waiter, and he took them away. When they were brought back to the table, it was clear that the kitchen staff simply took the sauces off the steaks and did a little switcheroo. I received Matt's steak with the correct sauce, and he received my original steak with his correct sauce. (I knew this was so b/c we each cut into our steaks distinctly differently). I thought that was incredibly tacky, but didn't say anything. The best thing was, the manager came over to apologize. but she had the gall to say that they had re-cooked everything, when they clearly just switched the steaks. Either the kitchen lied to her, or she lied to our faces. Either way, it was incredibly disappointing. They could have at least comped our drinks, or dessert, but they offered NOTHING for their mistake.Anyway, I've been getting very annoyed and frustrated at their lapse in service. I feel the need to inspect everthing in my bag to make sure I'm getting what I ordered.We'd probably just start eating elsewhere, but unfortunately there are no other decent Italian restaurants nearby.
This is our go to place - sit at the bar, bottle of wine, split an appetizer and an entree. Â Waitstaff if very nice, good wine and pasta. Â The rigatoni, sausage and vodka sauce is worth the trip.

Although the price deters me from eating at Francesca's more often, it is always a treat. I've only been to this location one time and it reminded me of a cafe because of the giant windows in front. Very open. The staff were friendly and helpful, and you could tell that because we were there for lunch, several of the customers dining beside us were regulars (always a good sign). Go for the pizzas at Francesca's. they're different every few weeks and delicious every time. A sure thing.

A monthly dining spot for us...On the positive:+ almost always great food+ friendly, prompt service+ very kid friendly+ great patio during the summer monthsFor the Chicago suburbs, this is a great family restaurant
Amazing service and food!

I've been to both Naperville locations of Francesca's and both are great. Â This location offers better ambiance (and abundant parking since it's not in the heart of Downtown Naperville). Â This location is not as loud as it's Downtown Naperville sister location, and tables aren't as close together. Â We recently ate here with friends. Â The food was great and everything that I've had here has been of high quality. Â On this visit, service was also good--unobtrusive yet attentive. Â The only downside to our last visit was that we had a somewhat cavalier water/bus boy that spilled water on some guide books our friends were lending us, and didn't offer an apology--came back and made a lame attempt of sopping some of his spillage up. Â That aside, I definitely recommend Francesca's Passaggio. Â Mangia!

Absolutely wonderful restaurant! Â We had a reservation and we were seated right away even though the restaurant was packed. Â Our server Danielle was SO great!! Â Everyone who helped provide service during our dinner was super friendly. Â We had the tomato caprese as an appetizer - huge, delicious tomatoes with fresh mozzarella and basil. Â YUM! Â Wine was wonderful, and our meals were fantastic! Â I ordered the gnocci pasta but was served rigatoni by mistake. Â They were so concerned about the error, and had my gnocci moments later. Â The manager even came over and apologized, and they comp'ed our dessert. Â All of the food was delicious and the service made this 5 stars for us! Â We will be back!!

My day is made after enjoying the lentels, spinach and goat cheese appetizer! Â Service is attentive and my water glass is never empty. Â  The succulent roasted chicken with that wine sauce is to die for. Â  Always the right choice!
conducted our business presentation in the private dinning area. very nice and comfortable. Â supportive staff. excellent food. Â highly recommend.

Oh man this is good stuff. I know it's a Chicago institution that's taken me forever to get to. Well worth the wait! I got an order of the Spinach Ravioli & the Pollo Arrosto alla Romano. Both were excellent entrees w/ big portions. They included a hot piping loaf of freshly baked bread. This location is easy to get to & tons of parking.

Horrible food and poor service. My husband and I have been there several times and are consistently disappointed. Recent visits have included a very fishy tasting salmon - did not seem fresh at all - however server couldn't have cared less when a comment was made. Tried again last night and ordered a supposedly handmade pasta dish with pesto - the pasta was literally swimming in a lake of oil. Absolutely discusting. While I have NEVER had a bad meal at their sister restaurant La Sorella in downtown Naperville, this location does not deliver nearly the same quality of food or service.

A warning to all vegeterians and vegans: I have been told by the waitstaff at this restaurant that ALL of the pasta sauces are made from a meat stock, including the marinara sauce. That news made me sad. First, I am a vegan myself, and I had eaten at Francesca's Passaggio on many occasions. I had always asked in the past whether there was any meat, dairy, or eggs in the vegan-looking pasta dishes that I ordered, and I was always told no. Now, I think that almost all of the dishes that I ate must have been vegan, because they used only wine or olive oil as a dressing, but I did have the marinara once or twice. So, there are some pasta dishes that vegans and vegetarians can order, and some of them are quite good. Look for the "cold sauce", which is available in the summer months. It is delicious.I feel that I should award the restaurant one star given that some of the waitstaff didn't know that none of the pasate sauces are vegetarian (seriously, get it together). However, I will ignore that issue and award the restaurant three stars for vegetarians and vegans. Why three? Some of the dishes are one or two stars, and some are four or even five. So, three stars.

Great food; appropriate portion size. Very attentive wait staff; our table was cleared without the evasiveness or interruption of our meal. Â The salmon pasta and Lemon chicken (I forgot the actual menu names) were great.

Been here numerous times. I've been to their other locations in downtown elmhurst, st. Charles and downtown Naperville and the food is great but are always very loud inside. Even though this one is in a strip mall off rt 59 I find it to be more intimate than the others. The best thing about this small chain is the food, good food reasonable prices. I like to get gift cards at Costco because for $80 you get $100 in gift cards for any of their locations, plus this one is right down the street Â from a Costco. I've always had pretty good service here as well. Good place for date, not over the top, not a dump, pretty safe place for food choices. I usually get one of their pastas I try to get the lobster raviolis when they are on the menu, or a rotisserie herb chicken. Every once in awhile I give into the urge and get their tiramisu it's pretty dam good. Â Their martinis are also very good I think I've sampled all most all of them. On warm summer nights their patio is a great choice. What I think I like most is there are typically no kids here, which is hard to say for many restaurants in Naperville/Plainfield area.

We decided to give Passaggio another try after a long hiatus. Â There were a few glitches in the food and our server. Â The food was pretty much as we expected, chain restaurant standard. Â The linguine bolognese was close to what it used to be but not quite. Â The grilled salmon was just OK. Â That dish had asparagus on it. Â The kitchen took the time to peel the stems. Â But then when the dish was served there was a large glop of avocado and tomato salad covering the top third of the asparagus. Â Which brings us to presentation. Â Since when is sprinkling parsley over the rim of every plate presentation? Â This just screams, Chain Restaurant! Â Our busser, Monica, remembered us from when we were regulars. Â Her service was excellent. Â Our server on the other hand... Â Silverware wasn't replaced and she seemed to be rushing us towards the end. Â She asked if we wanted dessert but didn't ask about coffee. Â Monica brought my espresso. Â Nice crema. Â Our server picked up the check presenter as she zipped past the table. Â Better to wait until the guest has left to pick it up.

Best Italian restaurant in Naperville, might be the best overall. Â Food and Service is top notch. Â The menu changes ever two weeks and the staff is happy to serve you in anyway. Â My only gripe with Francesca's is their selection of wines, or lack there of. Â To this day I haven't found a decent red wine while dinning here and I go once a week. Â Don't worry the food is well worth the trip. Â This quality of food and overall experience is very affordable. Â I'd also classify this restaurant as a best value too.

on my last visit i asked for an arugula salad and received a romaine salad. Â twice! Â with a few pieces of arugula in it. Â server knew order was wrong and offered to fix it (twice!) Â doesn't kitchen know what "arugula salad" means? Â  have been here about 5 times - all begrudgingly - going along with my dining partners - and have been disappointed almost every time ((#1 didn't have angel hair pasta, #2 private dining room was FREEZING, #3 could not get an arugula salad, #4 was just ok - just got a caprese salad - hard to mess that up Â #5 server was scattered and busy on the patio and it took forever to get our dessert and check)). Â have been to 2 other francesca restaurants (downtown naperville and chicago) and have had GREAT experiences. Â seems like this strip mall francesca's just doesn't really care about good food...
Good food. Menu was difficult to read. Â Great atmosphere. Â A good date restaurant Â  More selection of wine than beer
this is a great little place, very clean, the food is good, the service is excellent and the owners are as nice as they can be. i will be back!

Lily's is back open under new ownership. The place has been remodeled and is really nice. The menu has also been expanded.The hubs had a rueben, fries, and a salad. Everything was delicious and super fresh. I had the chilquiles Verdes which were awesome. I miss the fried rice from the old Lily. I'll live.Looking forward to coming again.

I went here on a whim after reading a review and I was not disappointed. This is a hidden gem in a out-of-the-way strip mall. I ordered my usual when I go to a new restaurant: eggs, bacon, toast. But I had the option of hash browns or toast and fruit. Getting a fruit cup is a gamble, but this one did not disappoint. I asked for crispy bacon and I got exactly that. The coffee is smooth and don't get me started on the orange juice. It was delicious. And all for a good price. I will definitely go here again and bring people with.
Great Place. Everybody enjoyed the food. Keep it up!

Preface: 4 stars is absouktely amazing.With limited lunch spots in lombard, this is my absolute favorite. Breakfast all day is exactly what i want my greasy spoon to have and the price was legitimate.Definitely coning back!

This hidden gem, with a one word entry; Eat disguises all the wonders inside. This small dinner can only serve maybe a total of 40 people, but the menu variety is big and everything we tried was 5 star. I had the Southern Benedict ; two eggs over biscuits and sausage smothered in their homemade country gravy. Even the fruit cup was filled with fresh and favorable fruits. The coffee was smooth and tasty. Fresh orange juice was delicious.My sister had the Mexican omelet filled with fresh veggies and tasty chorizo sausage; nothing greasy here, just filled with goodness.We will be back!
Had breakfast with friends here last week. Â The restaurant is very clean, fun dÃ©cor and the staff is very nice. Â I love the menu and can't wait to go back!
We had breakfast here. Nothing stood out as amazing, but food was a definitely better than average. Will probably come back

Yummy food for a good price. I got the eggs Benedict and my eggs were not runny but I didn't mind. Service was great, portions large for price. Diner style inside, had a nice dark wood stain theme going on.

Chiqulies was amazing!! My mom and I stopped after getting our nails done next door and were super impressed with our food. Large portions and delicious! Brought my husband home a cheeseburger and he said it was awesome. Fries were homemade and seasoned well. Kinda soft but he likes them that way. Definitely going back especially for the price!
Had breakfast and the food and service was good. After months of waiting you will find this little gem in Lombard.The owners are a great family and deserve the best.
Red velvet French toast is amazing. Omelet good too, but love the French toast. Very good breakfast place. Highly recommend.

A great little diner in Lombard with great prices. Good prices on hot chocolate and great breakfasts. A small sit down area run for a number of years at this location West of downtown Lombard. Â Great sandwiches. Lily is a friendly character.

Lily's Cafe is a great neighborhood diner where you get all your favorite fixin's served by Lily herself. Family atmosphere and friendly service. No grande lattes or anything fancy but the place to go for a solid breakfast. Lily will occasionally also include a lunch menu that consists of Asian food which is an added bonus, especially for the price point.

Lily's Cafe is a great little neighborhood joint with good food and good service. Nothing fancy-- just good, honest, traditional food. They are great for breakfast and give you a ton of food for a reasonable price.

I've been wanting to try this place out for quite some time so i finally got to try it out with my boyfriend and I have to say this place is delicious and the atmosphere is gorgeous.I ordered the key west burger friesBoyfriend ordered the cartel burger friesWe both really enjoyed the food and the service.The food came out pretty quick which was a plus for us since we were starving.I will be coming back.

The look and feel of Empire really sells itself. It's trendy, has a city-esque feel to it, and there's no denying the fabulous rooftop bar and seating. From the looks of things, this place really has it all together. Me personally? I still feel like they have some things to work out.I've been here twice now, once for lunch and once for a drink after work. We sat inside on the main level as the rooftop wasn't open during the day (too bad because it was beautiful out). The restaurant was pretty empty during the lunch hour. You would think this would help service be more attentive and on point, but it took a very long time for our group to be greeted by a server which kind of rubbed us the wrong way (bad first impression).We started with the poutine fries ($9) which were pretty good. Fried mozzarella chunks, cheddar, gravy, bacon, and sour cream all on top of french fries is a recipe for delicious. This app was a bit on the soggy side, but overall a tasty dish.I also had the BBQ brisket sandwich which had beer BBQ sauce, cheddar, and apple cabbage slaw on a pretzel bun roll ($14). I really liked this! I thought it was very flavorful. A bit overpriced, but delicious none the less.The second time I stopped by was to meet people for a drink after work and we sat up on the rooftop. It can get pretty crowded at Empire on a Friday night, so at 6:30 pm be prepared to wait for a seat upstairs. From what I can tell they offer valet parking and rumor has it there's a cover charge for late night on the weekends (no thanks).The opening of Empire was long awaited and I hope with time they will fully live up to my expectations. While you'll definitely find me on their roof top on a nice day, I can't say I'm going to be a regular here any time soon. For city prices downtown Naperville, I expect a higher level of service and attention.

The bar and restaurant is very nice inside and outside on the rooftop. The issue is the food. I ordered a burger well done (no pink) but the burger came out black and burnt. I've had burgers with no pink inside that were still juicy. My wife ordered a burger medium well (pink inside) but her burger was also burnt black.Great place for drinks and apps but the other food needs work.

Amazing! Â Beautiful new bar / restaurant downtown Naperville. Â It has an upscale feel to it.The rooftop bar is the best in town. Â When I arrived it was open, sunny and hot. Â Later in the day they closed the roof when it started to cool off.Very fun place. Â Lots of seating. Â Great drinks.Hint: Â try the "John Snow" drink

I loved the modern urban decor. Â  I went to seat upstairs by the transparent glass ceiling it was very nice to enjoy the sun on my back. Â My partner in crime was not happy to sit here because the sun shine was on his face, oh well. Â  I order the goat medium well. Â I loved it. Â At first I got scared for a minute because I thought the hamburger was saturated of oil but it was the honey that accompany the bacon and goat cheese. Â It was very delicious. Â  The only complain I have is that the servers do NOT have bus boys so I was so thirsty I had to waive the server to bring me water.This restaurant has a lot of potential but has to work on the customers that are eating on napkins, utensil, extra plates and serving wAter. Â One more thing the host lacks experience on the sitting arrangements because she asked us if we had our name on the list? Â  The restaurant was very much empty when we got there. Â  I think she was confused so am like we called and we were told no reservations needed.Over all I like my food, liked the ambiance I will be coming back.

I was downtown Naperville with a friend when we walked by Empire. While their cool sign outside immediately caught my attention, the rooftop bar caught my friends attention - and I'm glad it did!Neither of us had heard of Empire but with the sight of the rooftop bar we decided to head on up and check it out. Nobody talked to us when we walked in, while heading up, or once we got upstairs, but we found a couple of seats at the bar and snatched them up. The service at the bar was slow - I mean it was probably 15 minutes before anyone asked if we'd like a drink - but we were taking a while deciding on our order anyway so it was fine. Also the girl at the bar next to us definitely should have been cut off. She fell and couldn't get up. And it was a Tuesday around 9 pm...to say the least. So that got interesting. And nobody behind the bar seemed to notice or help.Anyway - the rooftop bar was a cool place to hang out and enjoy a drink. I didn't notice much of what they had aside from a nice sized list of draft beers. Hopefully I can return soon and try some food!

Tried out this new place in town. Â It was empty on a Sunday early dinner time. Â Our server never introduced himself upon greeting us which is a turn off for me, plus was not too attentive to us. Â My husband ordered a bbq brisket sandwich which he said was very dry. Â He didn't enjoy it much. Â I had the G.O.A.T. burger with spicy candied bacon, goat cheese and a honey drizzle. Â Very good! Â Both sandwiches were served on a pretzel roll with either chips or fries. Â After we were served our food, our waiter became more interactive with us so my opinion of him went up a notch. Â I'm not sure how I feel about this place just yet; I'm on the fence.

We stopped by here for opening night because the long line outside of the building intrigued me. Walking in, I knew I would probably be a frequent visitor to this place.The inside is very spacious and there is a stage on the main floor for entertainment, a huge bar, a small first floor patio, a second floor, a second floor bar, and a second floor rooftop patio with a touted retractable roof. *takes deep breath* This place has a lot of space, and it looks like it will be well used.I was impressed with the service, with it being the first evening for outside patrons. We were checked regularly while we sat at the bar. The bartenders make pretty great mixed drinks and don't water them down, which is always a plus. They have an extensive beer tap list and I was very excited that they had a few sour beers available.As far as the food, I can't give a full review because we only tried the freshly made donuts. They were absolutely wonderful-warm and soft and dusted with delicious sugar. They gave us more than enough and I think that the serving matches the 8 dollar price just fine. I only wished for a larger serving of donut dipping sauce.For now I'm giving Empire four stars, just because I haven't fully tried their food offerings. I think with the right dishes and a steady stream of good entertainment on the stage, this place will be worthy of visiting on the regular.

The menu is limited but good. Their selection of beer is extensive and well-chosen. The atmosphere on a Thursday night is comfortable. Easy going. That aside, this place gets 1 star because they charge for tasters. I go to places like this so I can try - and buy - new beverages. That said, I'm not about to spend $10 on a beer I don't know.So instead I'm enjoying a nice glass of water.

Honest review: (good not great better then five guys been here twice) be warned in the skybox on the roof if its hot outside u will be hot dont sit towards the sun u have been warned.
